stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां ह्य॑ग्ने॒ सद॒मित्स॑म॒न्यवो॑ दे॒वासो॑ दे॒वम॑र॒तिं न्ये॑रि॒र इति॒ क्रत्वा॑ न्येरि॒रे अम॑र्त्यं यजत॒ मर्त्ये॒ष्वा दे॒वमादे॑वं जनत॒ प्रचे॑तसं॒ विश्व॒मादे॑वं जनत॒ प्रचे॑तसम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ hy àgne sádam ít samanyávo devā́so devám aratíṃ nyeriré- íti krátvā nyeriré ámartyaṃ yajata mártyeṣv~ā́ devám ā́devaṃ janata prácetasaṃ víśvam ā́devaṃ janata prácetasam
stanzas.translation: , THEE Agni, have the Gods, ever of one accord, sent hither down, a God, appointed messenger, yea, with their wisdom sent thee down. The Immortal, O thou Holy One, mid mortal men, the God-devoted God, the wise, have they brought forth, brought forth the omnipresent God-devoted Sage.

translations.griffith: , THEE Agni, have the Gods, ever of one accord, sent hither down, a God, appointed messenger, yea, with their wisdom sent thee down. The Immortal, O thou Holy One, mid mortal men, the God-devoted God, the wise, have they brought forth, brought forth the omnipresent God-devoted Sage.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the gods concordantly have ever set to work as their divine steward; with this intention 1 they have set thee to work. They have generated 2 thee, O worshipful one 2, the immortal among the mortals, the wise, god-loving god; they have generated every wise, god-loving (Agni) 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: स भ्रात॑रं॒ वरु॑णमग्न॒ आ व॑वृत्स्व दे॒वाँ अच्छा॑ सुम॒ती य॒ज्ञव॑नसं॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ य॒ज्ञव॑नसम् ऋ॒तावा॑नमादि॒त्यं च॑र्षणी॒धृतं॒ राजा॑नं चर्षणी॒धृत॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá bhrā́taraṃ váruṇam agna ā́ vavr̥tsva devā́m̐ áchā sumatī́ yajñávanasaṃ jyéṣṭhaṃ yajñávanasam r̥tā́vānam ādityáṃ carṣaṇīdhŕ̥taṃ rā́jānaṃ carṣaṇīdhŕ̥tam
stanzas.translation: As such, O Agni, bring with favour to the Gods thy Brother Varuṇa who loveth sacrifice, True to the Law, the Âditya who supporteth men, the King, supporter of mankind.

translations.griffith: As such, O Agni, bring with favour to the Gods thy Brother Varuṇa who loveth sacrifice, True to the Law, the Âditya who supporteth men, the King, supporter of mankind.
translations.oldenberg: Do thou, [O Agni 1,] turn to brother Varuna, towards the gods 2 with thy kindness 3, to (Varuna) who accepts the sacrifice, to the eldest (god) who accepts the sacrifice, the righteous Âditya who supports the (human) tribes, the king who supports the (human) tribes.

stanzas.sanskrit: सखे॒ सखा॑यम॒भ्या व॑वृत्स्वा॒शुं न च॒क्रं रथ्ये॑व॒ रंह्या॒स्मभ्यं॑ दस्म॒ रंह्या॑ अग्ने॑ मृळी॒कं वरु॑णे॒ सचा॑ विदो म॒रुत्सु॑ वि॒श्वभा॑नुषु तो॒काय॑ तु॒जे शु॑शुचान॒ शं कृ॑ध्य॒स्मभ्यं॑ दस्म॒ शं कृ॑धि
stanzas.transliteration: sákhe sákhāyam abhy ā́ vavr̥tsva- -āśúṃ ná cakráṃ ráthyeva ráṃhyā- -asmábhyaṃ dasma ráṃhyā ágne mr̥ḷīkáṃ váruṇe sácā vido marútsu viśvábhānuṣu tokā́ya tujé śuśucāna śáṃ kr̥dhi- asmábhyaṃ dasma śáṃ kr̥dhi
stanzas.translation: Do thou, O Friend, turn hither him who is our Friend, swift as a wheel, like two car-steeds in rapid course, Wondrous! to us in rapid course. O Agni, find thou grace for us with Varuṇa, with Maruts who illumine all. Bless us, thou Radiant One, for seed and progeny, yea, bless us, O thou Wondrous God.

translations.griffith: Do thou, O Friend, turn hither him who is our Friend, swift as a wheel, like two car-steeds in rapid course, Wondrous! to us in rapid course. O Agni, find thou grace for us with Varuṇa, with Maruts who illumine all. Bless us, thou Radiant One, for seed and progeny, yea, bless us, O thou Wondrous God.
translations.oldenberg: O friend, turn to thy friend (Varuna), as a wheel of a chariot 1 rapidly (follows) the swift (horse), for our sake, O wonderful one, rapidly. O Agni, find mercy (for us) with Varuna, with the all-brilliant Maruts. Bless (us), O flaming one, that we may propagate ourselves, that we may press onward; bless us, O wonderful one!

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने॒ वरु॑णस्य वि॒द्वान्दे॒वस्य॒ हेळोऽव॑ यासिसीष्ठाः यजि॑ष्ठो॒ वह्नि॑तमः॒ शोशु॑चानो॒ विश्वा॒ द्वेषां॑सि॒ प्र मु॑मुग्ध्य॒स्मत्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ no agne váruṇasya vidvā́n devásya héḷó 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ yájiṣṭho váhnitamaḥ śóśucāno víśvā dvéṣāṃsi prá mumugdhy asmát
stanzas.translation: Do thou who knowest Varuṇa, O Agni, put far away from us the God's displeasure. Best Sacrificer, brightest One, refulgent remove thou far from us all those who hate us.

translations.griffith: Do thou who knowest Varuṇa, O Agni, put far away from us the God's displeasure. Best Sacrificer, brightest One, refulgent remove thou far from us all those who hate us.
translations.oldenberg: Mayst thou, O Agni, who knowest Varuna, deprecate for us the god's anger. Being the best sacrificer, the best carrier (of the gods), flaming, remove from us all hatred.

stanzas.sanskrit: स त्वं नो॑ अग्नेऽव॒मो भ॑वो॒ती नेदि॑ष्ठो अ॒स्या उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ अव॑ यक्ष्व नो॒ वरु॑णं॒ ररा॑णो वी॒हि मृ॑ळी॒कं सु॒हवो॑ न एधि
stanzas.transliteration: sá tváṃ no agne 'vamó bhavotī́ nédiṣṭho asyā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭau áva yakṣva no váruṇaṃ rárāṇo vīhí mr̥ḷīkáṃ suhávo na edhi
stanzas.translation: Be thou, O Agni, nearest us with succour, our closest Friend while now this Morn is breaking. Reconcile to us Varuṇa, be bounteous enjoy the gracious juice; be swift to hear us.

translations.griffith: Be thou, O Agni, nearest us with succour, our closest Friend while now this Morn is breaking. Reconcile to us Varuṇa, be bounteous enjoy the gracious juice; be swift to hear us.
translations.oldenberg: As such, O Agni, be for us the lowest  1 (god) with thy help, our nearest (friend) while this dawn shines forth. Being liberal (towards us), cause, by sacrificing, Varuna to go away from us. Love mercy; readily hear our call.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य श्रेष्ठा॑ सु॒भग॑स्य सं॒दृग्दे॒वस्य॑ चि॒त्रत॑मा॒ मर्त्ये॑षु शुचि॑ घृ॒तं न त॒प्तमघ्न्या॑याः स्पा॒र्हा दे॒वस्य॑ मं॒हने॑व धे॒नोः
stanzas.transliteration: asyá śréṣṭhā subhágasya saṃdŕ̥g devásya citrátamā mártyeṣu śúci ghr̥táṃ ná taptám ághnyāyāḥ- spārhā́ devásya maṃháneva dhenóḥ
stanzas.translation: Excellent is the glance, of brightest splendour, which the auspicious God bestows on mortals- The God's glance, longed-for even as the butter, pure, heated, of the cow, the milch-cow's bounty.

translations.griffith: Excellent is the glance, of brightest splendour, which the auspicious God bestows on mortals- The God's glance, longed-for even as the butter, pure, heated, of the cow, the milch-cow's bounty.
translations.oldenberg: His, the fortunate god's, appearance is excellent, and most brilliant among mortals. Like the bright, heated butter of the cow (the appearance) of the god is lovely, like the bountifulness of a milch-cow.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रिर॑स्य॒ ता प॑र॒मा स॑न्ति स॒त्या स्पा॒र्हा दे॒वस्य॒ जनि॑मान्य॒ग्नेः अ॒न॒न्ते अ॒न्तः परि॑वीत॒ आगा॒च्छुचिः॑ शु॒क्रो अ॒र्यो रोरु॑चानः
stanzas.transliteration: trír asya tā́ paramā́ santi satyā́ spārhā́ devásya jánimāny agnéḥ ananté antáḥ párivīta ā́gāt- -śúciḥ śukró aryó rórucānaḥ
stanzas.translation: Three are those births, the true, the most exalted, eagerly longed-for, of the God, of Agni. He came invested in the boundless region, pure, radiant, friendly, mightily resplendent.

translations.griffith: Three are those births, the true, the most exalted, eagerly longed-for, of the God, of Agni. He came invested in the boundless region, pure, radiant, friendly, mightily resplendent.
translations.oldenberg: Three 1 are those highest, true, and lovely births of this god Agni. Being enveloped in the infinite 2 he has come hither, the bright, brilliant, shining Aryan.

stanzas.sanskrit: स दू॒तो विश्वेद॒भि व॑ष्टि॒ सद्मा॒ होता॒ हिर॑ण्यरथो॒ रंसु॑जिह्वः रो॒हिद॑श्वो वपु॒ष्यो॑ वि॒भावा॒ सदा॑ र॒ण्वः पि॑तु॒मती॑व सं॒सत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá dūtó víśvéd abhí vaṣṭi sádmā hótā híraṇyaratho ráṃsujihvaḥ rohídaśvo vapuṣyò vibhā́vā sádā raṇváḥ pitumátīva saṃsát
stanzas.translation: This envoy joyeth in all seats of worship, borne on his golden car, sweet-tongued Invoker: Lovely to look on, with red steeds, effulgent, like a feast rich in food, joyous for ever.

translations.griffith: This envoy joyeth in all seats of worship, borne on his golden car, sweet-tongued Invoker: Lovely to look on, with red steeds, effulgent, like a feast rich in food, joyous for ever.
translations.oldenberg: He, the messenger, longs for all seats, the Hotri with the golden chariot, with the lovely tongue, with the red horses, of marvellous appearance, brilliant, always lovely like an assembly abundant in food.

stanzas.sanskrit: स चे॑तय॒न्मनु॑षो य॒ज्ञब॑न्धुः॒ प्र तं म॒ह्या र॑श॒नया॑ नयन्ति स क्षे॑त्यस्य॒ दुर्या॑सु॒ साध॑न्दे॒वो मर्त॑स्य सधनि॒त्वमा॑प
stanzas.transliteration: sá cetayan mánuṣo yajñábandhuḥ prá tám mahyā́ raśanáyā nayanti sá kṣety asya dúryāsu sā́dhan devó mártasya sadhanitvám āpa
stanzas.translation: Allied by worship, let him give man knowledge: by an extended cord they lead him onward. He stays, effectual in this mortal's dwelling, and the God wins a share in his possessions.

translations.griffith: Allied by worship, let him give man knowledge: by an extended cord they lead him onward. He stays, effectual in this mortal's dwelling, and the God wins a share in his possessions.
translations.oldenberg: He, the kinsman of sacrifice, has enlightened men 1. They lead him forward by a great rope 2. He dwells in his (the mortal's) dwelling, accomplishing (his task). The god has obtained the companionship of the mortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: स तू नो॑ अ॒ग्निर्न॑यतु प्रजा॒नन्नच्छा॒ रत्नं॑ दे॒वभ॑क्तं॒ यद॑स्य धि॒या यद्विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॒ अकृ॑ण्व॒न्द्यौष्पि॒ता ज॑नि॒ता स॒त्यमु॑क्षन्
stanzas.transliteration: sá tū́ no agnír nayatu prajānánn áchā rátnaṃ devábhaktaṃ yád asya dhiyā́ yád víśve amŕ̥tā ákr̥ṇvan dyaúṣ pitā́ janitā́ satyám ukṣan
stanzas.translation: Let Agni -for he knows the way- conduct us to all that he enjoys of God-sent riches, What all the Immortals have prepared with wisdom, Dyaus, Sire, Begetter, raining down true blessings.

translations.griffith: Let Agni -for he knows the way- conduct us to all that he enjoys of God-sent riches, What all the Immortals have prepared with wisdom, Dyaus, Sire, Begetter, raining down true blessings.
translations.oldenberg: May this Agni, the knowing one, lead us to the god-given treasure which belongs to him 1. That (treasure) which all the immortals have created by their thought, which Dyaus, the father, the begetter (has created): that real (treasure) they have besprinkled 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: स जा॑यत प्रथ॒मः प॒स्त्या॑सु म॒हो बु॒ध्ने रज॑सो अ॒स्य योनौ॑ अ॒पाद॑शी॒र्षा गु॒हमा॑नो॒ अन्ता॒योयु॑वानो वृष॒भस्य॑ नी॒ळे
stanzas.transliteration: sá jāyata prathamáḥ pastyā̀su mahó budhné rájaso asyá yónau apā́d aśīrṣā́ guhámāno ántā- -āyóyuvāno vr̥ṣabhásya nīḷé
stanzas.translation: In houses first he sprang into existence, at great heaven's base, and in this region's bosom; Footless and headless, both his ends concealing, in his Bull's lair drawing himself together.

translations.griffith: In houses first he sprang into existence, at great heaven's base, and in this region's bosom; Footless and headless, both his ends concealing, in his Bull's lair drawing himself together.
translations.oldenberg: He has been born in the dwellings as the first, at the bottom of the great (air) 1, in the womb of this air 2, footless, headless, hiding both his ends, drawing towards himself (his limbs?), in the nest of the bull 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र शर्ध॑ आर्त प्रथ॒मं वि॑प॒न्याँ ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॑ वृष॒भस्य॑ नी॒ळे स्पा॒र्हो युवा॑ वपु॒ष्यो॑ वि॒भावा॑ स॒प्त प्रि॒यासो॑ऽजनयन्त॒ वृष्णे॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá śárdha ārta prathamáṃ vipanyā́m̐ r̥tásya yónā vr̥ṣabhásya nīḷé spārhó yúvā vapuṣyò vibhā́vā saptá priyā́so (')janayanta vŕ̥ṣṇe
stanzas.translation: Wondrously first he rose aloft, defiant, in the Bull's lair, the homeof holy Order, Longed-for, young, beautiful, and far-resplendent: and sevendear frieuds sprang up unto the Mighty.

translations.griffith: Wondrously first he rose aloft, defiant, in the Bull's lair, the homeof holy Order, Longed-for, young, beautiful, and far-resplendent: and sevendear frieuds sprang up unto the Mighty.
translations.oldenberg: The host 1 came forth wonderfully at first, in the womb of Rita, in the nest of the bull 2, lovely and young, of marvellous appearance, and brilliant 3. Seven friends 4 were born for the bull.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॒मत्र॑ पि॒तरो॑ मनु॒ष्या॑ अ॒भि प्र से॑दुर्ऋ॒तमा॑शुषा॒णाः अश्म॑व्रजाः सु॒दुघा॑ व॒व्रे अ॒न्तरुदु॒स्रा आ॑जन्नु॒षसो॑ हुवा॒नाः
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam átra pitáro manuṣyā̀ḥ- abhí prá sedur r̥tám āśuṣāṇā́ḥ áśmavrajāḥ sudúghā vavré antár úd usrā́ ājann uṣáso huvānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Here did our human fathers take their places, fain to fulfil the sacred Law of worship. Forth drave they, with loud call, Dawn's teeming Milch-kine bid in the mountainstable, in the cavern.

translations.griffith: Here did our human fathers take their places, fain to fulfil the sacred Law of worship. Forth drave they, with loud call, Dawn's teeming Milch-kine bid in the mountainstable, in the cavern.
translations.oldenberg: Here our human fathers have sat down 1, aspiring after Rita 2. Invoking the dawns 3, they have driven out the milch-cows which dwelt in the rock-stable, in the prison.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते म॑र्मृजत ददृ॒वांसो॒ अद्रिं॒ तदे॑षाम॒न्ये अ॒भितो॒ वि वो॑चन् प॒श्वय॑न्त्रासो अ॒भि का॒रम॑र्चन्वि॒दन्त॒ ज्योति॑श्चकृ॒पन्त॑ धी॒भिः
stanzas.transliteration: té marmr̥jata dadr̥vā́ṃso ádriṃ tád eṣām anyé abhíto ví vocan paśváyantrāso abhí kārám arcan vidánta jyótiś cakr̥pánta dhībhíḥ
stanzas.translation: Splendid were they when they had rent the mountain: others, around, shall tell forth this their exploit. They sang their song, prepared to free the cattle: they found the light; with holy hymns they worshipped.

translations.griffith: Splendid were they when they had rent the mountain: others, around, shall tell forth this their exploit. They sang their song, prepared to free the cattle: they found the light; with holy hymns they worshipped.
translations.oldenberg: Having rent the rock they cleaned themselves. Others around told forth that (deed) of theirs. Taking … as an instrument (?) 1, they sang triumphantly 2. They found the light; they chanted their prayers.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते ग॑व्य॒ता मन॑सा दृ॒ध्रमु॒ब्धं गा ये॑मा॒नं परि॒ षन्त॒मद्रि॑म् दृ॒ळ्हं नरो॒ वच॑सा॒ दैव्ये॑न व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तमु॒शिजो॒ वि व॑व्रुः
stanzas.transliteration: té gavyatā́ mánasā dr̥dhrám ubdháṃ gā́ yemānám pári ṣántam ádrim dr̥ḷháṃ náro vácasā daívyena vrajáṃ gómantam uśíjo ví vavruḥ
stanzas.translation: Eager, with thought intent upon the booty, the men with their celestial speech threw open, The solid mountain firm, compact, enclosing, confining Cows, the stable full of cattle.

translations.griffith: Eager, with thought intent upon the booty, the men with their celestial speech threw open, The solid mountain firm, compact, enclosing, confining Cows, the stable full of cattle.
translations.oldenberg: Longing for the cows in their mind, those men, the Usigs 1, have opened with godly words the fast-holding, closed rock, which enclosed and encompassed the cows, the firm stable full of cows.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते म॑न्वत प्रथ॒मं नाम॑ धे॒नोस्त्रिः स॒प्त मा॒तुः प॑र॒माणि॑ विन्दन् तज्जा॑न॒तीर॒भ्य॑नूषत॒ व्रा आ॒विर्भु॑वदरु॒णीर्य॒शसा॒ गोः
stanzas.transliteration: té manvata prathamáṃ nā́ma dhenós tríḥ saptá mātúḥ paramā́ṇi vindan táj jānatī́r abhy ànūṣata vrā́ḥ- āvír bhuvad aruṇī́r yaśásā góḥ
stanzas.translation: The Milch-cow's earliest name they comprehended: they found the Mother's thrice-seven noblest titles. This the bands knew, and sent forth acclamation:with the Bull's sheen the Red One was apparent.

translations.griffith: The Milch-cow's earliest name they comprehended: they found the Mother's thrice-seven noblest titles. This the bands knew, and sent forth acclamation:with the Bull's sheen the Red One was apparent.
translations.oldenberg: They have devised the first name of the milch-cow; they have found the three times seven highest (names or essences) of the mother 1. The hosts 2, understanding this, acclaimed. The red one 3 became visible through the brilliant (milk?) 4 of the cow.

stanzas.sanskrit: नेश॒त्तमो॒ दुधि॑तं॒ रोच॑त॒ द्यौरुद्दे॒व्या उ॒षसो॑ भा॒नुर॑र्त आ सूर्यो॑ बृह॒तस्ति॑ष्ठ॒दज्राँ॑ ऋ॒जु मर्ते॑षु वृजि॒ना च॒ पश्य॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: néśat támo dúdhitaṃ rócata dyaúr úd devyā́ uṣáso bhānúr arta ā́ sū́ryo br̥hatás tiṣṭhad ájrām̐ r̥jú márteṣu vr̥jinā́ ca páśyan
stanzas.translation: The turbid darkness fled, the heaven was sp, endid! up rose the bright beam of celestial Morning. Sûrya ascended to the wide expanses, beholding deeds of men both good and evil.

translations.griffith: The turbid darkness fled, the heaven was sp, endid! up rose the bright beam of celestial Morning. Sûrya ascended to the wide expanses, beholding deeds of men both good and evil.
translations.oldenberg: The confused 1 darkness disappeared; the sky appeared in splendour; the shine of the goddess Dawn rose up. The Sun ascended to the wide plains, beholding right and wrong deeds among the mortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: आदित्प॒श्चा बु॑बुधा॒ना व्य॑ख्य॒न्नादिद्रत्नं॑ धारयन्त॒ द्युभ॑क्तम् विश्वे॒ विश्वा॑सु॒ दुर्या॑सु दे॒वा मित्र॑ धि॒ये व॑रुण स॒त्यम॑स्तु
stanzas.transliteration: ā́d ít paścā́ bubudhānā́ vy àkhyann ā́d íd rátnaṃ dhārayanta dyúbhaktam víśve víśvāsu dúryāsu devā́ḥ- mítra dhiyé varuṇa satyám astu
stanzas.translation: Then, afterwards they looked around, awakened, when first they held that Heaven allotted treasure. Now all the Gods abide in all their dwellings. Varuṇa, Mitra, be the prayer effective.

translations.griffith: Then, afterwards they looked around, awakened, when first they held that Heaven allotted treasure. Now all the Gods abide in all their dwellings. Varuṇa, Mitra, be the prayer effective.
translations.oldenberg: Then, afterwards, being awoke they looked around; then they took that treasure given by Heaven, all the gods in all the houses. O Mitra, may true (fulfilment) belong to (our) prayer, O Varuna!

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ वोचेय शुशुचा॒नम॒ग्निं होता॑रं वि॒श्वभ॑रसं॒ यजि॑ष्ठम् शुच्यूधो॑ अतृण॒न्न गवा॒मन्धो॒ न पू॒तं परि॑षिक्तमं॒शोः
stanzas.transliteration: áchā voceya śuśucānám agníṃ hótāraṃ viśvábharasaṃ yájiṣṭham śúcy ū́dho atr̥ṇan ná gávām ándho ná pūtám páriṣiktam aṃśóḥ
stanzas.translation: I will call hither brightly-beaming Agni, the Herald, all-supporting, best at worship. He hath disclosed, like the milch cows' pure udder, the Sorria's juice when cleansed and poured from beakers.

translations.griffith: I will call hither brightly-beaming Agni, the Herald, all-supporting, best at worship. He hath disclosed, like the milch cows' pure udder, the Sorria's juice when cleansed and poured from beakers.
translations.oldenberg: I will address flaming Agni, the Hotri, the supporter of everything 1, the best sacrificer. He has perforated, as it were, the pure udder of the cows, (and has made flow the milk) purified like the poured sap of the Soma shoots.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑षा॒मदि॑तिर्य॒ज्ञिया॑नां॒ विश्वे॑षा॒मति॑थि॒र्मानु॑षाणाम् अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वाना॒मव॑ आवृणा॒नः सु॑मृळी॒को भ॑वतु जा॒तवे॑दाः
stanzas.transliteration: víśveṣām áditir yajñíyānāṃ víśveṣām átithir mā́nuṣāṇām agnír devā́nām áva āvr̥ṇānáḥ sumr̥ḷīkó bhavatu jātávedāḥ
stanzas.translation: The freest God of all who should be worshipped, the guest who is received in all men's houses, Agni who hath secured the Gods' high favour,– may he be gracious, to us Jâtavedas.

translations.griffith: The freest God of all who should be worshipped, the guest who is received in all men's houses, Agni who hath secured the Gods' high favour,– may he be gracious, to us Jâtavedas.
translations.oldenberg: He, the Aditi (i. e. the freedom) of all the worshipful gods, the guest 1 of all men, Agni, choosing (for us) the protection of all gods—may he, Gâtavedas, be merciful.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो मर्त्ये॑ष्व॒मृत॑ ऋ॒तावा॑ दे॒वो दे॒वेष्व॑र॒तिर्नि॒धायि॑ होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठो म॒ह्ना शु॒चध्यै॑ ह॒व्यैर॒ग्निर्मनु॑ष ईर॒यध्यै॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó mártyeṣv amŕ̥ta r̥tā́vā devó devéṣv aratír nidhā́yi hótā yájiṣṭho mahnā́ śucádhyai havyaír agnír mánuṣa īrayádhyai
stanzas.translation: THE, Faithful One, Immortal among mortals, a God among the Gods, appointed envoy, Priest, best at worship, must shine forth in glory . Agni shall be raised high with man's oblations.

translations.griffith: THE, Faithful One, Immortal among mortals, a God among the Gods, appointed envoy, Priest, best at worship, must shine forth in glory . Agni shall be raised high with man's oblations.
translations.oldenberg: He who has been established as the steward among the mortals, the immortal, righteous one, and among the gods, being a god himself, the Hotri, the best sacrificer shall mightily flame 1; Agni shall rise up 1 with the offerings of Manus.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ह त्वं सू॑नो सहसो नो अ॒द्य जा॒तो जा॒ताँ उ॒भयाँ॑ अ॒न्तर॑ग्ने दू॒त ई॑यसे युयुजा॒न ऋ॑ष्व ऋजुमु॒ष्कान्वृष॑णः शु॒क्राँश्च॑
stanzas.transliteration: ihá tváṃ sūno sahaso no adyá jātó jātā́m̐ ubháyām̐ antár agne dūtá īyase yuyujāná r̥ṣva r̥jumuṣkā́n vŕ̥ṣaṇaḥ śukrā́ṃś ca
stanzas.translation: Born for us here this day, O Son of Vigour, between both races of born beings, Agni, Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy strong-muscled radiant stallions.

translations.griffith: Born for us here this day, O Son of Vigour, between both races of born beings, Agni, Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy strong-muscled radiant stallions.
translations.oldenberg: Here, O Agni, son of strength, thou goest for us to-day as a messenger, thou who art born, between the two races (of men and gods), having harnessed, O tall one, thy puissant, manly, brilliant (stallions) 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अत्या॑ वृध॒स्नू रोहि॑ता घृ॒तस्नू॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ मन्ये॒ मन॑सा॒ जवि॑ष्ठा अ॒न्तरी॑यसे अरु॒षा यु॑जा॒नो यु॒ष्माँश्च॑ दे॒वान्विश॒ आ च॒ मर्ता॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: átyā vr̥dhasnū́ róhitā ghr̥tásnū r̥tásya manye mánasā jáviṣṭhā antár īyase aruṣā́ yujānó yuṣmā́ṃś ca devā́n víśa ā́ ca mártān
stanzas.translation: I laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing, dropping oil, flectest through the thoualit of Order. Yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you Deities and mortal races.

translations.griffith: I laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing, dropping oil, flectest through the thoualit of Order. Yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you Deities and mortal races.
translations.oldenberg: Harnessing the two mighty, red steeds that swim in ghee—(the steeds) of Rita, I think, that are most swift with their mind 1, the ruddy ones, thou goest (as a messenger) between you, the gods, and the tribes of men 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रमे॑षा॒मिन्द्रा॒विष्णू॑ म॒रुतो॑ अ॒श्विनो॒त स्वश्वो॑ अग्ने सु॒रथः॑ सु॒राधा॒ एदु॑ वह सुह॒विषे॒ जना॑य
stanzas.transliteration: aryamáṇaṃ váruṇam mitrám eṣām índrāvíṣṇū marúto aśvínotá sváśvo agne suráthaḥ surā́dhāḥ- éd u vaha suhavíṣe jánāya
stanzas.translation: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra with Vishṇu, of the Gods, Maruts and Aṣvins- These, Agni, with good car and steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.

translations.griffith: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra with Vishṇu, of the Gods, Maruts and Aṣvins- These, Agni, with good car and steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.
translations.oldenberg: O Agni, with thy good horses, and thy good chariot, rich in bounties, bring hither from among them (the gods) 1 Aryaman, Varuna, and Mitra, Indra and Vishnu, the Maruts and the Asvins, to him who offers good oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: गोमाँ॑ अ॒ग्नेऽवि॑माँ अ॒श्वी य॒ज्ञो नृ॒वत्स॑खा॒ सद॒मिद॑प्रमृ॒ष्यः इळा॑वाँ ए॒षो अ॑सुर प्र॒जावा॑न्दी॒र्घो र॒यिः पृ॑थुबु॒ध्नः स॒भावा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: gómām̐ agné 'vimām̐ aśvī́ yajñó nr̥vátsakhā sádam íd apramr̥ṣyáḥ íḷāvām̐ eṣó asura prajā́vān dīrghó rayíḥ pr̥thubudhnáḥ sabhā́vān
stanzas.translation: Agni, be this our sacrifice eternal, with brave friends, rich in kine and sheep and horses, Rich, Asura! in sacred food and children, in full assembly, wealth broad-based and during.

translations.griffith: Agni, be this our sacrifice eternal, with brave friends, rich in kine and sheep and horses, Rich, Asura! in sacred food and children, in full assembly, wealth broad-based and during.
translations.oldenberg: This sacrifice, O Agni, is rich in cows 1, in sheep and horses, in manly friends; it is never to be despised; it is rich in nourishment, O wonderful lord 2, rich in offspring; it is long-lasting wealth, broad-based, with (brilliant) assemblies.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त॑ इ॒ध्मं ज॒भर॑त्सिष्विदा॒नो मू॒र्धानं॑ वा त॒तप॑ते त्वा॒या भुव॒स्तस्य॒ स्वत॑वाँः पा॒युर॑ग्ने॒ विश्व॑स्मात्सीमघाय॒त उ॑रुष्य
stanzas.transliteration: yás ta idhmáṃ jabhárat siṣvidānó mūrdhā́naṃ vā tatápate tvāyā́ bhúvas tásya svátavām̐ḥ pāyúr agne víśvasmāt sīm aghāyatá uruṣya
stanzas.translation: The man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant,– Agni, to him be a self-strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.

translations.griffith: The man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant,– Agni, to him be a self-strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Be a self-strong protector, O Agni, of the man who in the sweat of his brow brings fuel to thee 2, or heats his head desirous to worship thee. Deliver him from every harmful man.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ते॒ भरा॒दन्नि॑यते चि॒दन्नं॑ नि॒शिष॑न्म॒न्द्रमति॑थिमु॒दीर॑त् आ दे॑व॒युरि॒नध॑ते दुरो॒णे तस्मि॑न्र॒यिर्ध्रु॒वो अ॑स्तु॒ दास्वा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: yás te bhárād ánniyate cid ánnaṃ niśíṣan mandrám átithim udī́rat ā́ devayúr inádhate duroṇé tásmin rayír dhruvó astu dā́svān
stanzas.translation: Who brings thee food, though thou hast food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward, Who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling,to him be wealth secure and freely giving.

translations.griffith: Who brings thee food, though thou hast food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward, Who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling,to him be wealth secure and freely giving.
translations.oldenberg: The man who brings food to thee who art desirous of food, he who stirs up 1 the cheerful guest and rouses him, the godly man who kindles thee in his dwelling: to him may belong lasting and generous wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त्वा॑ दो॒षा य उ॒षसि॑ प्र॒शंसा॑त्प्रि॒यं वा॑ त्वा कृ॒णव॑ते ह॒विष्मा॑न् अश्वो॒ न स्वे दम॒ आ हे॒म्यावा॒न्तमंह॑सः पीपरो दा॒श्वांस॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yás tvā doṣā́ yá uṣási praśáṃsāt priyáṃ vā tvā kr̥ṇávate havíṣmān áśvo ná své dáma ā́ hemyā́vān tám áṃhasaḥ pīparo dāśvā́ṃsam
stanzas.translation: Whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning, and, with oblation, doth the thing thou lovest,– In his own home, even as a goId-girt courser, rescue him from distress, the bounteous giver.

translations.griffith: Whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning, and, with oblation, doth the thing thou lovest,– In his own home, even as a goId-girt courser, rescue him from distress, the bounteous giver.
translations.oldenberg: The sacrificer who praises thee in the evening and in the morning and gratifies thee; that liberal man thou shouldst bring across all distress, like a well-impelled horse 1, (dwelling) in his house.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्तुभ्य॑मग्ने अ॒मृता॑य॒ दाश॒द्दुव॒स्त्वे कृ॒णव॑ते य॒तस्रु॑क् न स रा॒या श॑शमा॒नो वि यो॑ष॒न्नैन॒मंहः॒ परि॑ वरदघा॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: yás túbhyam agne amŕ̥tāya dā́śad dúvas tvé kr̥ṇávate yatásruk ná sá rāyā́ śaśamānó ví yoṣat- naínam áṃhaḥ pári varad aghāyóḥ
stanzas.translation: Whoso brings gifts to thee Immortal, Agni, and doth thee service with uplifted ladle,– Let him not, sorely toiling, lose his riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him.

translations.griffith: Whoso brings gifts to thee Immortal, Agni, and doth thee service with uplifted ladle,– Let him not, sorely toiling, lose his riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him.
translations.oldenberg: The man who worships thee, the immortal one, O Agni, and who honours thee, holding the sacrificial ladle—may he, the toiling (sacrificer), not be deprived of wealth; may no distress that comes from a harmful (foe), surround him.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॒ त्वम॑ग्ने अध्व॒रं जुजो॑षो दे॒वो मर्त॑स्य॒ सुधि॑तं॒ ररा॑णः प्री॒तेद॑स॒द्धोत्रा॒ सा य॑वि॒ष्ठासा॑म॒ यस्य॑ विध॒तो वृ॒धासः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásya tvám agne adhvaráṃ jújoṣo devó mártasya súdhitaṃ rárāṇaḥ prītéd asad dhótrā sā́ yaviṣṭha- -ásāma yásya vidható vr̥dhā́saḥ
stanzas.translation: Whose well-wrought worship thou acceptest, Agni, thou God a mortal's gift, thou liberal Giver,– Dear be his sacrifice to thee, Most Youthful! and may we strengthen him when he adores thee.

translations.griffith: Whose well-wrought worship thou acceptest, Agni, thou God a mortal's gift, thou liberal Giver,– Dear be his sacrifice to thee, Most Youthful! and may we strengthen him when he adores thee.
translations.oldenberg: That mortal whose well-ordered sacrifice thou, as the god, acceptest, O Agni, as a liberal giver, may his worship 1 be welcome, O youngest god, (the Hotri's work performed) for a worshipper whose helpers we may be.

stanzas.sanskrit: चित्ति॒मचि॑त्तिं चिनव॒द्वि वि॒द्वान्पृ॒ष्ठेव॑ वी॒ता वृ॑जि॒ना च॒ मर्ता॑न् रा॒ये च॑ नः स्वप॒त्याय॑ देव॒ दितिं॑ च॒ रास्वादि॑तिमुरुष्य
stanzas.transliteration: cíttim ácittiṃ cinavad ví vidvā́n pr̥ṣṭhéva vītā́ vr̥jinā́ ca mártān rāyé ca naḥ svapatyā́ya deva dítiṃ ca rā́svā́ditim uruṣya
stanzas.translation: May he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men, like straight and crooked backs of horses. Lead us, O God, to wealth and noble offspring: keep penury afar and grant us plenty.

translations.griffith: May he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men, like straight and crooked backs of horses. Lead us, O God, to wealth and noble offspring: keep penury afar and grant us plenty.
translations.oldenberg: May he, the knowing one, distinguish wisdom and folly of mortals 1, like straight and crooked backs (of horses) 2. And for the sake of wealth and noble offspring, O god, grant us Diti and keep off Aditi 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒विं श॑शासुः क॒वयोऽद॑ब्धा निधा॒रय॑न्तो॒ दुर्या॑स्वा॒योः अत॒स्त्वं दृश्याँ॑ अग्न ए॒तान्प॒ड्भिः प॑श्ये॒रद्भु॑ताँ अ॒र्य एवैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kavíṃ śaśāsuḥ kaváyó 'dabdhāḥ- nidhāráyanto dúryāsv āyóḥ átas tváṃ dŕ̥śyām̐ agna etā́n paḍbhíḥ paśyer ádbhutām̐ aryá évaiḥ
stanzas.translation: This Sage the Sages, ne'er deceived, commanded, setting him down in dwellings of the living. Hence mayst thou, friendly God, with rapid footsteps behold the Gods, wonderful, fair to look on.

translations.griffith: This Sage the Sages, ne'er deceived, commanded, setting him down in dwellings of the living. Hence mayst thou, friendly God, with rapid footsteps behold the Gods, wonderful, fair to look on.
translations.oldenberg: The undeceived sages instructed the sage (Agni), setting him down in the dwellings of Âyu 1. Hence mayst thou behold, O Agni, with thy eyes 2 these beings visible and secret (that move) on the Arya's ways 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने वा॒घते॑ सु॒प्रणी॑तिः सु॒तसो॑माय विध॒ते य॑विष्ठ रत्नं॑ भर शशमा॒नाय॑ घृष्वे पृ॒थु श्च॒न्द्रमव॑से चर्षणि॒प्राः
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne vāgháte supráṇītiḥ sutásomāya vidhaté yaviṣṭha rátnam bhara śaśamānā́ya ghr̥ṣve pr̥thú ścandrám ávase carṣaṇiprā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Good guidance hast thou for the priest, O Agni, who, Youngest God! with outpoured Soma serves thee. Ruler of men, thou joyous God, bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.

translations.griffith: Good guidance hast thou for the priest, O Agni, who, Youngest God! with outpoured Soma serves thee. Ruler of men, thou joyous God, bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.
translations.oldenberg: Bring thou, O Agni, youngest (god), who art a good guide, a plentiful, brilliant treasure to the worshipper who presses Soma, who serves thee and toils, to help him, O brisk one, who fillest the dwellings of peoples.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॑ ह॒ यद्व॒यम॑ग्ने त्वा॒या प॒ड्भिर्हस्ते॑भिश्चकृ॒मा त॒नूभिः॑ रथं॒ न क्रन्तो॒ अप॑सा भु॒रिजो॑र्ऋ॒तं ये॑मुः सु॒ध्य॑ आशुषा॒णाः
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā ha yád vayám agne tvāyā́ paḍbhír hástebhiś cakr̥mā́ tanū́bhiḥ ráthaṃ ná kránto ápasā bhuríjor r̥táṃ yemuḥ sudhyà āśuṣāṇā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now all that we, thy faithful servants, Agni, have done with feet, with hands, and with our bodies, The wise, with toil, the holy rite have guided, as those who frame a car with manual cunning.

translations.griffith: Now all that we, thy faithful servants, Agni, have done with feet, with hands, and with our bodies, The wise, with toil, the holy rite have guided, as those who frame a car with manual cunning.
translations.oldenberg: 1 And whatsoever we have done, O Agni, out of devotion for thee, with our feet 2, with our hands, with our bodies: (in those deeds of ours) the wise have held up the Rita, aspiring after it, like those who manage a chariot by means of the two pole-arms (?) 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॑ मा॒तुरु॒षसः॑ स॒प्त विप्रा॒ जाये॑महि प्रथ॒मा वे॒धसो॒ नॄन् दि॒वस्पु॒त्रा अङ्गि॑रसो भवे॒माद्रिं॑ रुजेम ध॒निनं॑ शु॒चन्तः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā mātúr uṣásaḥ saptá víprāḥ- jā́yemahi prathamā́ vedháso nr̥̄́n divás putrā́ áṅgiraso bhavema- -ádriṃ rujema dhanínaṃ śucántaḥ
stanzas.translation: May we, seven sages first in rank, engender, from Dawn the Mother, men to be ordainers. May we, Angirases, be sons of Heaven, and, radiant, burst the wealth-containing mountain.

translations.griffith: May we, seven sages first in rank, engender, from Dawn the Mother, men to be ordainers. May we, Angirases, be sons of Heaven, and, radiant, burst the wealth-containing mountain.
translations.oldenberg: And may we be born from the Dawn, the mother, as the seven priests 1, as the first worshippers among men 2. May we be the Aṅgiras, the sons of Heaven. May we flaming break the rock which contains the prize of the contest 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ यथा॑ नः पि॒तरः॒ परा॑सः प्र॒त्नासो॑ अग्न ऋ॒तमा॑शुषा॒णाः शुचीद॑य॒न्दीधि॑तिमुक्थ॒शासः॒ क्षामा॑ भि॒न्दन्तो॑ अरु॒णीरप॑ व्रन्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā yáthā naḥ pitáraḥ párāsaḥ pratnā́so agna r̥tám āśuṣāṇā́ḥ śúcī́d ayan dī́dhitim ukthaśā́saḥ kṣā́mā bhindánto aruṇī́r ápa vran
stanzas.translation: As in the days of old our ancient Fathers, speeding the work of holy worship, Agni, Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent.

translations.griffith: As in the days of old our ancient Fathers, speeding the work of holy worship, Agni, Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent.
translations.oldenberg: And as our first, ancient fathers, O Agni, were aspiring after Rita 1—they attained to pure devotion 2, chanting their litanies. Cleaving the earth they disclosed the red (cows).

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒कर्मा॑णः सु॒रुचो॑ देव॒यन्तोऽयो॒ न दे॒वा जनि॑मा॒ धम॑न्तः शु॒चन्तो॑ अ॒ग्निं व॑वृ॒धन्त॒ इन्द्र॑मू॒र्वं गव्यं॑ परि॒षद॑न्तो अग्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: sukármāṇaḥ surúco devayántaḥ- -áyo ná devā́ jánimā dhámantaḥ śucánto agníṃ vavr̥dhánta índram ūrváṃ gávyam pariṣádanto agman
stanzas.translation: Gods, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their human generations. Enkindling Agni and exalting Indra, they came encompassing the stall of cattle.

translations.griffith: Gods, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their human generations. Enkindling Agni and exalting Indra, they came encompassing the stall of cattle.
translations.oldenberg: The pious men, well performing the acts (of worship), resplendent, melting 1 the generations of the gods 2 like ore 3, kindling Agni, strengthening Indra, went along 4, besieging the stall of cows.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यू॒थेव॑ क्षु॒मति॑ प॒श्वो अ॑ख्यद्दे॒वानां॒ यज्जनि॒मान्त्यु॑ग्र मर्ता॑नां चिदु॒र्वशी॑रकृप्रन्वृ॒धे चि॑द॒र्य उप॑रस्या॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yūthéva kṣumáti paśvó akhyad devā́nāṃ yáj jánimā́nty ugra mártānāṃ cid urváśīr akr̥pran vr̥dhé cid aryá úparasyāyóḥ
stanzas.translation: Strong One! he marked them-and the Gods before them-like herds of cattle in a foodful pasture. There they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals, to aid the True, the nearest One, the Living.

translations.griffith: Strong One! he marked them-and the Gods before them-like herds of cattle in a foodful pasture. There they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals, to aid the True, the nearest One, the Living.
translations.oldenberg: He looked (on the gods) as on herds of cattle 1 in a rich (pasture) 2, when the generations of the gods (were) near him, O mighty one 3. After (the generations) of the mortals the Urvasîs 4 have pined, for the growing strong of the Arya 5, of the nearer Âyu 6.

stanzas.sanskrit: अक॑र्म ते॒ स्वप॑सो अभूम ऋ॒तम॑वस्रन्नु॒षसो॑ विभा॒तीः अनू॑नम॒ग्निं पु॑रु॒धा सु॑श्च॒न्द्रं दे॒वस्य॒ मर्मृ॑जत॒श्चारु॒ चक्षुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ákarma te svápaso abhūma r̥tám avasrann uṣáso vibhātī́ḥ ánūnam agním purudhā́ suścandráṃ devásya mármr̥jataś cā́ru cákṣuḥ
stanzas.translation: We have worked for thee, we have laboured nobly-bright Dawns have shed their light upon our worship- Adding a beauty to the perfect Agni, and the God's beauteous eye that shines for ever.

translations.griffith: We have worked for thee, we have laboured nobly-bright Dawns have shed their light upon our worship- Adding a beauty to the perfect Agni, and the God's beauteous eye that shines for ever.
translations.oldenberg: We have done our work for thee; we have been good workers—the brilliant dawns have shone out Rita 1,—brightening 2 the perfect Agni who manifoldly shines with fine splendour, (brightening) the god's beautiful eye.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ता ते॑ अग्न उ॒चथा॑नि वे॒धोऽवो॑चाम क॒वये॒ ता जु॑षस्व उच्छो॑चस्व कृणु॒हि वस्य॑सो नो म॒हो रा॒यः पु॑रुवार॒ प्र य॑न्धि
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ te agna ucáthāni vedho -ávocāma kaváye tā́ juṣasva úc chocasva kr̥ṇuhí vásyaso no mahó rāyáḥ puruvāra prá yandhi
stanzas.translation: Agni, Disposer, we have sung these praises to thee the Wise: do thou accept them gladly. Blaze up on high and ever make us richer. Give us great wealth, O thou whose boons are many.

translations.griffith: Agni, Disposer, we have sung these praises to thee the Wise: do thou accept them gladly. Blaze up on high and ever make us richer. Give us great wealth, O thou whose boons are many.
translations.oldenberg: We have recited these hymns for thee, the sage, O Agni, worshipper (of the gods) 1; accept them! Blaze up; make us wealthier. Bestow great wealth on us, O bountiful one!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वो॒ राजा॑नमध्व॒रस्य॑ रु॒द्रं होता॑रं सत्य॒यजं॒ रोद॑स्योः अ॒ग्निं पु॒रा त॑नयि॒त्नोर॒चित्ता॒द्धिर॑ण्यरूप॒मव॑से कृणुध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vo rā́jānam adhvarásya rudráṃ hótāraṃ satyayájaṃ ródasyoḥ agním purā́ tanayitnór acíttād -híraṇyarūpam ávase kr̥ṇudhvam
stanzas.translation: WIN, to assist you, Rudra, Lord of worship, Priest of both worlds, effectual Sacrificer, Agni, invested with his golden colours, before the thunder strike and lay you senseless.

translations.griffith: WIN, to assist you, Rudra, Lord of worship, Priest of both worlds, effectual Sacrificer, Agni, invested with his golden colours, before the thunder strike and lay you senseless.
translations.oldenberg: Draw Rudra hither for your protection 1, the king of sacrifice, the truly sacrificing Hotri of the two worlds 2, the golden-coloured Agni, before the unseen thunderbolt (strikes you).

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं योनि॑श्चकृ॒मा यं व॒यं ते॑ जा॒येव॒ पत्य॑ उश॒ती सु॒वासाः॑ अ॒र्वा॒ची॒नः परि॑वीतो॒ नि षी॑दे॒मा उ॑ ते स्वपाक प्रती॒चीः
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ yóniś cakr̥mā́ yáṃ vayáṃ te jāyéva pátya uśatī́ suvā́sāḥ- arvācīnáḥ párivīto ní ṣīda- -imā́ u te svapāka pratīcī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: This shrine have we made ready for thy coming, as the fond dame attires her for her husband. Performer of good work, sit down before us, invested while these flames incline to meet thee.

translations.griffith: This shrine have we made ready for thy coming, as the fond dame attires her for her husband. Performer of good work, sit down before us, invested while these flames incline to meet thee.
translations.oldenberg: This is the home which we have prepared for thee as a well-dressed, loving wife (prepares the marriage-bed) for her husband 1. Directed hitherward, dressed (in offerings and prayers?) 2 sit down. These (sacrificial ladles or prayers?) are turned towards thee, O most skilful one 3!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒शृ॒ण्व॒ते अदृ॑पिताय॒ मन्म॑ नृ॒चक्ष॑से सुमृळी॒काय॑ वेधः दे॒वाय॑ श॒स्तिम॒मृता॑य शंस॒ ग्रावे॑व॒ सोता॑ मधु॒षुद्यमी॒ळे
stanzas.transliteration: āśr̥ṇvaté ádr̥pitāya mánma nr̥cákṣase sumr̥ḷīkā́ya vedhaḥ devā́ya śastím amŕ̥tāya śaṃsa grā́veva sótā madhuṣúd yám īḷé
stanzas.translation: A hymn, O Priest, to him who hears, the gentle, to him who looks on men, exceeding gracious, A song of praise sing to the God Immortal, whom the stone, presser of the sweet juice, worships.

translations.griffith: A hymn, O Priest, to him who hears, the gentle, to him who looks on men, exceeding gracious, A song of praise sing to the God Immortal, whom the stone, presser of the sweet juice, worships.
translations.oldenberg: To him who hears us, who is not proud, who beholds men, to the merciful, immortal god recite a prayer, O worshipper, a hymn—(to Agni) whom the presser (of Soma), the Madhu-presser, magnifies like the pressing-stone 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं चि॑न्नः॒ शम्या॑ अग्ने अ॒स्या ऋ॒तस्य॑ बोध्यृतचित्स्वा॒धीः क॒दा त॑ उ॒क्था स॑ध॒माद्या॑नि क॒दा भ॑वन्ति स॒ख्या गृ॒हे ते॑
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ cin naḥ śámyā agne asyā́ḥ- r̥tásya bodhy r̥tacit svādhī́ḥ kadā́ ta ukthā́ sadhamā́dyāni kadā́ bhavanti sakhyā́ gr̥hé te
stanzas.translation: Even as true knower of the Law, O Agni, to this our solemn rite he thou attentive. When shall thy songs of festival be sung thee? When is thy friendship shown within our dwelling?

translations.griffith: Even as true knower of the Law, O Agni, to this our solemn rite he thou attentive. When shall thy songs of festival be sung thee? When is thy friendship shown within our dwelling?
translations.oldenberg: Thou who art well-intentioned, give heed to this our toiling 1, to this Rita 2, O observer of Rita! When will our hymns share in thy rejoicings? When will our friendship dwell in thy house?

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था ह॒ तद्वरु॑णाय॒ त्वम॑ग्ने क॒था दि॒वे ग॑र्हसे॒ कन्न॒ आगः॑ क॒था मि॒त्राय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ पृथि॒व्यै ब्रवः॒ कद॑र्य॒म्णे कद्भगा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ ha tád váruṇāya tvám agne kathā́ divé garhase kán na ā́gaḥ kathā́ mitrā́ya mīḷhúṣe pr̥thivyaí brávaḥ kád aryamṇé kád bhágāya
stanzas.translation: Why this complaint to Varuṇa, O Agni? And why to Heaven? for what is our transgression? How wilt thou speak to Earth and bounteous Mitra? What wilt thou say to Aryaman and Bhaga?

translations.griffith: Why this complaint to Varuṇa, O Agni? And why to Heaven? for what is our transgression? How wilt thou speak to Earth and bounteous Mitra? What wilt thou say to Aryaman and Bhaga?
translations.oldenberg: How wilt thou, O Agni, before Varuna, and how wilt thou, and which sin of ours wilt thou blame before Dyaus? How wilt thou speak to bountiful Mitra, to the Earth? What (wilt thou say) to Aryaman, to Bhaga?

stanzas.sanskrit: कद्धिष्ण्या॑सु वृधसा॒नो अ॑ग्ने॒ कद्वाता॑य॒ प्रत॑वसे शुभं॒ये परि॑ज्मने॒ नास॑त्याय॒ क्षे ब्रवः॒ कद॑ग्ने रु॒द्राय॑ नृ॒घ्ने
stanzas.transliteration: kád dhíṣṇyāsu vr̥dhasānó agne kád vā́tāya prátavase śubhaṃyé párijmane nā́satyāya kṣé brávaḥ kád agne rudrā́ya nr̥ghné
stanzas.translation: What, when thou blazest on the lesser altars, what to the mighty Wind who comes tobless us, True, circumambient? what to Earth, O Agni, what wilt thou say to man-destroying Rudra?

translations.griffith: What, when thou blazest on the lesser altars, what to the mighty Wind who comes tobless us, True, circumambient? what to Earth, O Agni, what wilt thou say to man-destroying Rudra?
translations.oldenberg: What wilt thou say, O Agni, when thou hast grown strong on the Dhishnya altars 1? What to strong Vâta who goes forward in triumph 2? To the Nâsatya 3 who goes round the earth 4, to … 5? What, O Agni, to Rudra, the man-killer?

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था म॒हे पु॑ष्टिम्भ॒राय॑ पू॒ष्णे कद्रु॒द्राय॒ सुम॑खाय हवि॒र्दे कद्विष्ण॑व उरुगा॒याय॒ रेतो॒ ब्रवः॒ कद॑ग्ने॒ शर॑वे बृह॒त्यै
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ mahé puṣṭimbharā́ya pūṣṇé kád rudrā́ya súmakhāya havirdé kád víṣṇava urugāyā́ya réto brávaḥ kád agne śárave br̥hatyaí
stanzas.translation: How to great Pûshan who promotes our welfare,– to honoured Rudra what, who gives oblations? What sin of ours to the far-striding Vishṇu, what, Agni, wilt thou tell the Lofty Arrow.

translations.griffith: How to great Pûshan who promotes our welfare,– to honoured Rudra what, who gives oblations? What sin of ours to the far-striding Vishṇu, what, Agni, wilt thou tell the Lofty Arrow.
translations.oldenberg: How (wilt thou speak) to great Pûshan who brings prosperity? What (wilt thou say) to martial Rudra, the giver of offerings 1? What sin 2 wilt thou announce to wide-ruling Vishnu, what, O Agni, to the mighty weapon (of the gods)?

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था शर्धा॑य म॒रुता॑मृ॒ताय॑ क॒था सू॒रे बृ॑ह॒ते पृ॒च्छ्यमा॑नः प्रति॑ ब्र॒वोऽदि॑तये तु॒राय॒ साधा॑ दि॒वो जा॑तवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ śárdhāya marútām r̥tā́ya kathā́ sūré br̥haté pr̥chyámānaḥ práti bravó 'ditaye turā́ya sā́dhā divó jātavedaś cikitvā́n
stanzas.translation: What wilt thou tell the truthful band of Maruts, how answer the great Sun when thou art questioned? Before the Free, before the Swift, defend us: fulfil heaven's work, all-knowing Jâtavedas.

translations.griffith: What wilt thou tell the truthful band of Maruts, how answer the great Sun when thou art questioned? Before the Free, before the Swift, defend us: fulfil heaven's work, all-knowing Jâtavedas.
translations.oldenberg: How wilt thou answer, when thou art asked, to the righteous 1 host of the Maruts? How to the mighty Sun, to the quick Aditi 2? Accomplish thy work, O Gâtavedas, thou who knowest the Heaven!

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तेन॑ ऋ॒तं निय॑तमीळ॒ आ गोरा॒मा सचा॒ मधु॑मत्प॒क्वम॑ग्ने कृ॒ष्णा स॒ती रुश॑ता धा॒सिनै॒षा जाम॑र्येण॒ पय॑सा पीपाय
stanzas.transliteration: r̥téna r̥táṃ níyatam īḷa ā́ gór āmā́ sácā mádhumat pakvám agne kr̥ṣṇā́ satī́ rúśatā dhāsínaiṣā́ jā́maryeṇa páyasā pīpāya
stanzas.translation: I crave the cow's true gift arranged by Order: though raw, she hath the sweet ripe juice, O Agni. Though she is black of hue with milk she teemeth, nutritious, brightly shining, all-sustaining.

translations.griffith: I crave the cow's true gift arranged by Order: though raw, she hath the sweet ripe juice, O Agni. Though she is black of hue with milk she teemeth, nutritious, brightly shining, all-sustaining.
translations.oldenberg: I magnify 1 the Rita of the cow 2 ruled by Rita and also by the raw one 3, the honey-sweet, ripe (milk), O Agni. Though being black this (cow) swells of bright drink, of … 4 milk.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तेन॒ हि ष्मा॑ वृष॒भश्चि॑द॒क्तः पुमाँ॑ अ॒ग्निः पय॑सा पृ॒ष्ठ्ये॑न अस्प॑न्दमानो अचरद्वयो॒धा वृषा॑ शु॒क्रं दु॑दुहे॒ पृश्नि॒रूधः॑
stanzas.transliteration: r̥téna hí ṣmā vr̥ṣabháś cid aktáḥ púmām̐ agníḥ páyasā pr̥ṣṭhyèna áspandamāno acarad vayodhā́ḥ- vŕ̥ṣā śukráṃ duduhe pŕ̥śnir ū́dhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni the Bull, the manly, hath been sprinkled with oil upon his back, by Law eternal. He who gives vital power goes on unswerving. Pr̥iṣni the Bull hath milked the pure wiiite udder.

translations.griffith: Agni the Bull, the manly, hath been sprinkled with oil upon his back, by Law eternal. He who gives vital power goes on unswerving. Pr̥iṣni the Bull hath milked the pure wiiite udder.
translations.oldenberg: With Rita indeed, with the milk of the back 1, the bull has been anointed, Agni the man. Without trembling he moved on bestowing his vigour. The speckled bull has poured out his bright udder 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तेनाद्रिं॒ व्य॑सन्भि॒दन्तः॒ समङ्गि॑रसो नवन्त॒ गोभिः॑ शु॒नं नरः॒ परि॑ षदन्नु॒षास॑मा॒विः स्व॑रभवज्जा॒ते अ॒ग्नौ
stanzas.transliteration: r̥ténā́driṃ vy àsan bhidántaḥ sám áṅgiraso navanta góbhiḥ śunáṃ náraḥ pári ṣadann uṣā́sam āvíḥ svàr abhavaj jāté agnaú
stanzas.translation: By Law the Angirases cleft the rock asunder, and sang their hymns together with the cattle. Bringing great bliss the men encompassed Morning: light was apparent at the birth of Agni.

translations.griffith: By Law the Angirases cleft the rock asunder, and sang their hymns together with the cattle. Bringing great bliss the men encompassed Morning: light was apparent at the birth of Agni.
translations.oldenberg: 1 By the Rita the Aṅgiras have broken the rock and cleft it asunder; they have shouted together with the cows. Prosperously the men have surrounded 2 the Dawn. The Sun appeared when Agni (the fire) had been born 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तेन॑ दे॒वीर॒मृता॒ अमृ॑क्ता॒ अर्णो॑भि॒रापो॒ मधु॑मद्भिरग्ने वा॒जी न सर्गे॑षु प्रस्तुभा॒नः प्र सद॒मित्स्रवि॑तवे दधन्युः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥téna devī́r amŕ̥tā ámr̥ktāḥ- árṇobhir ā́po mádhumadbhir agne vājī́ ná sárgeṣu prastubhānáḥ prá sádam ít srávitave dadhanyuḥ
stanzas.translation: By Law the Immortal Goddesses the Waters, with meath-rich waves, O Agni, and uninjured, Like a strong courser lauded in his running, sped to flow onward swiftly and for ever.

translations.griffith: By Law the Immortal Goddesses the Waters, with meath-rich waves, O Agni, and uninjured, Like a strong courser lauded in his running, sped to flow onward swiftly and for ever.
translations.oldenberg: By the Rita the immortal, uninjured 1 goddesses, the Waters, O Agni, with their honey-sweet waves have sped forward 2 for ever to flow (along their course), like a racer incited by shouting when (the race-horses) are let loose.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा कस्य॑ य॒क्षं सद॒मिद्धु॒रो गा॒ मा वे॒शस्य॑ प्रमिन॒तो मापेः मा भ्रातु॑रग्ने॒ अनृ॑जोर्ऋ॒णं वे॒र्मा सख्यु॒र्दक्षं॑ रि॒पोर्भु॑जेम
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ kásya yakṣáṃ sádam íd dhuró gāḥ- mā́ veśásya praminató mā́péḥ mā́ bhrā́tur agne ánr̥jor r̥ṇáṃ ver mā́ sákhyur dákṣaṃ ripór bhujema
stanzas.translation: Go never to the feast of one who harms us, the treacherous neighbour or. unworthy kinsman. Punish us not for a false brother's trespass. Let us riot feel the might of friend or foeman.

translations.griffith: Go never to the feast of one who harms us, the treacherous neighbour or. unworthy kinsman. Punish us not for a false brother's trespass. Let us riot feel the might of friend or foeman.
translations.oldenberg: Go never on thy crooked way to the spirit (which avenges the guilt) of anybody 1, of a vassal who has trespassed, or of a friend. Require not (of us),a sinful brother's debt 2. May we not have to suffer under the spirit which avenges a friend's or a (hostile) deceiver's guilt 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: रक्षा॑ णो अग्ने॒ तव॒ रक्ष॑णेभी रारक्षा॒णः सु॑मख प्रीणा॒नः प्रति॑ ष्फुर॒ वि रु॑ज वी॒ड्वंहो॑ ज॒हि रक्षो॒ महि॑ चिद्वावृधा॒नम्
stanzas.transliteration: rákṣā ṇo agne táva rákṣaṇebhiḥ- rārakṣāṇáḥ sumakha prīṇānáḥ práti ṣphura ví ruja vīḍv áṃho jahí rákṣo máhi cid vāvr̥dhānám
stanzas.translation: O Agni, keep us safe with thy protection, loving us, honoured God! and ever guarding. Beat thou away, destory severe affliction slay e'en the demon when he waxes mighty.

translations.griffith: O Agni, keep us safe with thy protection, loving us, honoured God! and ever guarding. Beat thou away, destory severe affliction slay e'en the demon when he waxes mighty.
translations.oldenberg: Protect us, O Agni, with all thy protection, thou who art protected, O martial one 1, and art gladdened (by us). Sparkle forth, and destroy even strong evil! Slay the Rakshas even though it has grown large.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒भिर्भ॑व सु॒मना॑ अग्ने अ॒र्कैरि॒मान्त्स्पृ॑श॒ मन्म॑भिः शूर॒ वाजा॑न् उ॒त ब्रह्मा॑ण्यङ्गिरो जुषस्व॒ सं ते॑ श॒स्तिर्दे॒ववा॑ता जरेत
stanzas.transliteration: ebhír bhava sumánā agne arkaír imā́n spr̥śa mánmabhiḥ śūra vā́jān utá bráhmāṇy aṅgiro juṣasva sáṃ te śastír devávātā jareta
stanzas.translation: Through these our songs of praise be gracious, Agni; moved by ourprayers, O Hero, touch our viands. Accept, O Angiras, these our devotions, and let the praise which Gods desire address thee.

translations.griffith: Through these our songs of praise be gracious, Agni; moved by ourprayers, O Hero, touch our viands. Accept, O Angiras, these our devotions, and let the praise which Gods desire address thee.
translations.oldenberg: Be gracious, O Agni, through these our hymns. Touch, O hero, this wealth moved by our prayers. And accept, O Aṅgiras, our sacred words. May the praise, beloved by the gods, resound to thee 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ता विश्वा॑ वि॒दुषे॒ तुभ्यं॑ वेधो नी॒थान्य॑ग्ने नि॒ण्या वचां॑सि नि॒वच॑ना क॒वये॒ काव्या॒न्यशं॑सिषं म॒तिभि॒र्विप्र॑ उ॒क्थैः
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ víśvā vidúṣe túbhyaṃ vedho nīthā́ny agne niṇyā́ vácāṃsi nivácanā kaváye kā́vyāni- áśaṃsiṣam matíbhir vípra ukthaíḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee who knowest, Agni, thou Disposer, all these wise secret speeches have I uttered, Sung to thee, Sage, the charming words of wisdom, to thee, O Singer, with. my thoughts and Praises.

translations.griffith: To thee who knowest, Agni, thou Disposer, all these wise secret speeches have I uttered, Sung to thee, Sage, the charming words of wisdom, to thee, O Singer, with. my thoughts and Praises.
translations.oldenberg: I, the priest, have rehearsed to thee the omniscient one, O Agni, worshipper (of the gods), all these songs, these inmost words, these recitations and words of wisdom, to thee the wise one, with prayers and hymns.

stanzas.sanskrit: कृ॒णु॒ष्व पाजः॒ प्रसि॑तिं॒ न पृ॒थ्वीं या॒हि राजे॒वाम॑वाँ॒ इभे॑न तृ॒ष्वीमनु॒ प्रसि॑तिं द्रूणा॒नोऽस्ता॑सि॒ विध्य॑ र॒क्षस॒स्तपि॑ष्ठैः
stanzas.transliteration: kr̥ṇuṣvá pā́jaḥ prásitiṃ ná pr̥thvī́ṃ yāhí rā́jevā́mavām̐ íbhena tr̥ṣvī́m ánu prásitiṃ drūṇānó -ástāsi vídhya rakṣásas tápiṣṭhaiḥ
stanzas.translation: PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty King with his attendants. Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.

translations.griffith: PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty King with his attendants. Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.
translations.oldenberg: Produce thy stream of flames like a broad onslaught. Go forth impetuous like a king with his elephant 1; …  2 after thy greedy onslaught, thou art an archer; shoot the sorcerers with thy hottest (arrows).

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ भ्र॒मास॑ आशु॒या प॑त॒न्त्यनु॑ स्पृश धृष॒ता शोशु॑चानः तपूं॑ष्यग्ने जु॒ह्वा॑ पतं॒गानसं॑दितो॒ वि सृ॑ज॒ विष्व॑गु॒ल्काः
stanzas.transliteration: táva bhramā́sa āśuyā́ patanti- ánu spr̥śa dhr̥ṣatā́ śóśucānaḥ tápūṃṣy agne juhvā̀ pataṃgā́n ásaṃdito ví sr̥ja víṣvag ulkā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury. Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.

translations.griffith: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury. Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.
translations.oldenberg: Thy whirls fly quickly. Fiercely flaming touch (them). O Agni, (send forth) with the ladle 1 thy heat, thy winged (flames); send forth unfettered thy firebrands all around.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रति॒ स्पशो॒ वि सृ॑ज॒ तूर्णि॑तमो॒ भवा॑ पा॒युर्वि॒शो अ॒स्या अद॑ब्धः यो नो॑ दू॒रे अ॒घशं॑सो॒ यो अन्त्यग्ने॒ माकि॑ष्टे॒ व्यथि॒रा द॑धर्षीत्
stanzas.transliteration: práti spáśo ví sr̥ja tū́rṇitamo bhávā pāyúr viśó asyā́ ádabdhaḥ yó no dūré agháśaṃso yó ánti- ágne mā́kiṣ ṭe vyáthir ā́ dadharṣīt
stanzas.translation: Send thy spies forward, flectest in thy motion; be, ne'er deceived, the guardian of this people From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o'ercome us.

translations.griffith: Send thy spies forward, flectest in thy motion; be, ne'er deceived, the guardian of this people From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o'ercome us.
translations.oldenberg: Being the quickest, send forth thy spies against (all evildoers). Be an undeceivable guardian of this clan. He who attacks us with evil spells, far or near, may no such (foe) defy thy track.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद॑ग्ने तिष्ठ॒ प्रत्या त॑नुष्व॒ न्य१॒॑मित्राँ॑ ओषतात्तिग्महेते यो नो॒ अरा॑तिं समिधान च॒क्रे नी॒चा तं ध॑क्ष्यत॒सं न शुष्क॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: úd agne tiṣṭha práty ā́ tanuṣva ny àmítrām̐ oṣatāt tigmahete yó no árātiṃ samidhāna cakré nīcā́ táṃ dhakṣy atasáṃ ná śúṣkam
stanzas.translation: Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows. Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.

translations.griffith: Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows. Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.
translations.oldenberg: Rise up, O Agni! Spread out against (all foes)! Burn down the foes, O (god) with the sharp weapon! When kindled, O Agni, burn down like dry brushwood, the man who exercises malice against us.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्ध्वो भ॑व॒ प्रति॑ वि॒ध्याध्य॒स्मदा॒विष्कृ॑णुष्व॒ दैव्या॑न्यग्ने अव॑ स्थि॒रा त॑नुहि यातु॒जूनां॑ जा॒मिमजा॑मिं॒ प्र मृ॑णीहि॒ शत्रू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ūrdhvó bhava práti vidhyā́dhy asmád āvíṣ kr̥ṇuṣva daívyāny agne áva sthirā́ tanuhi yātujū́nāṃ jāmím ájāmim prá mr̥ṇīhi śátrūn
stanzas.translation: Rise, Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour. Slacken the strong bows of the demondriven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.

translations.griffith: Rise, Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour. Slacken the strong bows of the demondriven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.
translations.oldenberg: Stand upright, strike (the foes) away from us! Make manifest thy divine (powers), O Agni! Unbend the strong (bows) of those who incite demons (against us) 1. Crush all enemies, be they relations or strangers.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ते॑ जानाति सुम॒तिं य॑विष्ठ॒ य ईव॑ते॒ ब्रह्म॑णे गा॒तुमैर॑त् विश्वा॑न्यस्मै सु॒दिना॑नि रा॒यो द्यु॒म्नान्य॒र्यो वि दुरो॑ अ॒भि द्यौ॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: sá te jānāti sumatíṃ yaviṣṭha yá ī́vate bráhmaṇe gātúm aírat víśvāny asmai sudínāni rāyó dyumnā́ny aryó ví dúro abhí dyaut
stanzas.translation: Most Youthful God, he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion. All fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good man's portals.

translations.griffith: Most Youthful God, he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion. All fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good man's portals.
translations.oldenberg: He knows thy favour, O youngest one, who makes a way for a sacred speech like this. Mayst thou beam forth to his doors all auspicious days and the wealth and the splendour of the niggard.

stanzas.sanskrit: सेद॑ग्ने अस्तु सु॒भगः॑ सु॒दानु॒र्यस्त्वा॒ नित्ये॑न ह॒विषा॒ य उ॒क्थैः पिप्री॑षति॒ स्व आयु॑षि दुरो॒णे विश्वेद॑स्मै सु॒दिना॒ सास॑दि॒ष्टिः
stanzas.transliteration: séd agne astu subhágaḥ sudā́nur yás tvā nítyena havíṣā yá ukthaíḥ píprīṣati svá ā́yuṣi duroṇé víśvéd asmai sudínā sā́sad iṣṭíḥ
stanzas.translation: Blest, Agni, be the man, the liberal giver, who with his lauds and regular oblation Is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling. May all his days be bright: be this his longing.

translations.griffith: Blest, Agni, be the man, the liberal giver, who with his lauds and regular oblation Is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling. May all his days be bright: be this his longing.
translations.oldenberg: Let him, O Agni, be fortunate and blessed with good rain, who longs to gladden thee with constant offerings and hymns through his life in his house. May such longing ever bring auspicious days to him.

stanzas.sanskrit: अर्चा॑मि ते सुम॒तिं घोष्य॒र्वाक्सं ते॑ वा॒वाता॑ जरतामि॒यं गीः स्वश्वा॑स्त्वा सु॒रथा॑ मर्जयेमा॒स्मे क्ष॒त्राणि॑ धारये॒रनु॒ द्यून्
stanzas.transliteration: árcāmi te sumatíṃ ghóṣy arvā́k sáṃ te vāvā́tā jaratām iyáṃ gī́ḥ sváśvās tvā suráthā marjayema- -asmé kṣatrā́ṇi dhārayer ánu dyū́n
stanzas.translation: I praise thy gracious favour: sing in answer. May this my song sing like a loved one with thee. Lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee, and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.

translations.griffith: I praise thy gracious favour: sing in answer. May this my song sing like a loved one with thee. Lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee, and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.
translations.oldenberg: I praise thy favour; it resounded here. May this song (which is like) a favourite wife, awaken for thee 1. Let us brighten thee, being rich in horses and chariots. Mayst thou maintain our knightly power day by day.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ह त्वा॒ भूर्या च॑रे॒दुप॒ त्मन्दोषा॑वस्तर्दीदि॒वांस॒मनु॒ द्यून् क्रीळ॑न्तस्त्वा सु॒मन॑सः सपेमा॒भि द्यु॒म्ना त॑स्थि॒वांसो॒ जना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ihá tvā bhū́ry ā́ cared úpa tmán dóṣāvastar dīdivā́ṃsam ánu dyū́n krī́ḷantas tvā sumánasaḥ sapema- -abhí dyumnā́ tasthivā́ṃso jánānām
stanzas.translation: Here of free choice let each one serve thee richly, resplendent day by day at eve and morning. So may we honour thee, content and joyous, passing beyond the glories of the people.

translations.griffith: Here of free choice let each one serve thee richly, resplendent day by day at eve and morning. So may we honour thee, content and joyous, passing beyond the glories of the people.
translations.oldenberg: May (the worshipper) here frequently of his own accord approach thee, O (god) who shinest in darkness 1, resplendent day by day. Let us worship thee sporting and joyous, surpassing the splendour of (other) people.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त्वा॒ स्वश्वः॑ सुहिर॒ण्यो अ॑ग्न उप॒याति॒ वसु॑मता॒ रथे॑न तस्य॑ त्रा॒ता भ॑वसि॒ तस्य॒ सखा॒ यस्त॑ आति॒थ्यमा॑नु॒षग्जुजो॑षत्
stanzas.transliteration: yás tvā sváśvaḥ suhiraṇyó agne- upayā́ti vásumatā ráthena tásya trātā́ bhavasi tásya sákhā yás ta ātithyám ānuṣág jújoṣat
stanzas.translation: Whoso with good steeds and fine gold, O Agni, comes nigh thee on a car laden with trcasure, His Friend art thou, yea, thou art his Protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.

translations.griffith: Whoso with good steeds and fine gold, O Agni, comes nigh thee on a car laden with trcasure, His Friend art thou, yea, thou art his Protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.
translations.oldenberg: Whoever, rich in horses and rich in gold, approaches thee, O Agni, with his chariot full of wealth—thou art the protector and the friend of him who always delights in showing thee hospitality.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हो रु॑जामि ब॒न्धुता॒ वचो॑भि॒स्तन्मा॑ पि॒तुर्गोत॑मा॒दन्वि॑याय त्वं नो॑ अ॒स्य वच॑सश्चिकिद्धि॒ होत॑र्यविष्ठ सुक्रतो॒ दमू॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: mahó rujāmi bandhútā vácobhis tán mā pitúr gótamād ánv iyāya tváṃ no asyá vácasaś cikiddhi hótar yaviṣṭha sukrato dámūnāḥ
stanzas.translation: Through words and kinship I destroy the miglity: this power I have from Gotama my father. Mark thou this speech of ours, O thou Most Youthful, Friend of the House, exceeding wise, Invoker.

translations.griffith: Through words and kinship I destroy the miglity: this power I have from Gotama my father. Mark thou this speech of ours, O thou Most Youthful, Friend of the House, exceeding wise, Invoker.
translations.oldenberg: Through my kinship (with thee) I break down the great (foes) by my words 1. That (kinship) has come down to me from my father Gotama. Be thou attentive to this our word, O youngest, highly wise Hotri, as the friend of our house.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्व॑प्नजस्त॒रण॑यः सु॒शेवा॒ अत॑न्द्रासोऽवृ॒का अश्र॑मिष्ठाः ते पा॒यवः॑ स॒ध्र्य॑ञ्चो नि॒षद्याग्ने॒ तव॑ नः पान्त्वमूर
stanzas.transliteration: ásvapnajas taráṇayaḥ suśévāḥ- átandrāso 'vr̥kā́ áśramiṣṭhāḥ té pāyávaḥ sadhryàñco niṣádya- -ágne táva naḥ pāntv amūra
stanzas.translation: Knowing no slumber, speedy and propitious, alert and ever friendly, most unwearied, May thy protecting powers, unerring Agni, taking their places here, combined, preserve us.

translations.griffith: Knowing no slumber, speedy and propitious, alert and ever friendly, most unwearied, May thy protecting powers, unerring Agni, taking their places here, combined, preserve us.
translations.oldenberg: May those guardians of thine, infallible Agni, sitting down together protect us, the never sleeping, onward-pressing, kind, unwearied ones, who keep off the wolf, who never tire.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये पा॒यवो॑ मामते॒यं ते॑ अग्ने॒ पश्य॑न्तो अ॒न्धं दु॑रि॒तादर॑क्षन् र॒रक्ष॒ तान्त्सु॒कृतो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दा॒ दिप्स॑न्त॒ इद्रि॒पवो॒ नाह॑ देभुः
stanzas.transliteration: yé pāyávo māmateyáṃ te agne páśyanto andháṃ duritā́d árakṣan rarákṣa tā́n sukŕ̥to viśvávedāḥ- dípsanta íd ripávo nā́ha debhuḥ
stanzas.translation: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Mâmateya from affliction. Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious: the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief

translations.griffith: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Mâmateya from affliction. Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious: the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief
translations.oldenberg: 1 Thy guardians, O Agni, who seeing have saved the blind son of Mamatâ from distress—He the possessor of all wealth has saved them who have done good deeds. The impostors, though trying to deceive, could not deceive.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वया॑ व॒यं स॑ध॒न्य१॒॑स्त्वोता॒स्तव॒ प्रणी॑त्यश्याम॒ वाजा॑न् उ॒भा शंसा॑ सूदय सत्यतातेऽनुष्ठु॒या कृ॑णुह्यह्रयाण
stanzas.transliteration: tváyā vayáṃ sadhanyàs tvótās táva práṇīty aśyāma vā́jān ubhā́ śáṃsā sūdaya satyatāte -anuṣṭhuyā́ kr̥ṇuhy ahrayāṇa
stanzas.translation: Aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy, may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward. Fulfil the words of both, O Ever Truthful: straightway do this, thou God whom power emboldens.

translations.griffith: Aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy, may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward. Fulfil the words of both, O Ever Truthful: straightway do this, thou God whom power emboldens.
translations.oldenberg: In thy companionship we dwell, protected by thee. Under thy guidance let us acquire gain. Accomplish both praises 1, O (thou who art the) truth! Do so by thy present power, O fearless one!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒या ते॑ अग्ने स॒मिधा॑ विधेम॒ प्रति॒ स्तोमं॑ श॒स्यमा॑नं गृभाय दहा॒शसो॑ र॒क्षसः॑ पा॒ह्य१॒॑स्मान्द्रु॒हो नि॒दो मि॑त्रमहो अव॒द्यात्
stanzas.transliteration: ayā́ te agne samídhā vidhema práti stómaṃ śasyámānaṃ gr̥bhāya dáhāśáso rakṣásaḥ pāhy àsmā́n druhó nidó mitramaho avadyā́t
stanzas.translation: O Agni, with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour Destroy the cursing Raksasas: preserve us, O rich in friends, from guile and scorn and slander.

translations.griffith: O Agni, with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour Destroy the cursing Raksasas: preserve us, O rich in friends, from guile and scorn and slander.
translations.oldenberg: May we worship thee, O Agni, with this log of wood. Accept the hymn of praise which we recite. Burn down those who curse us, the sorcerers. Protect us, O (god) who art great like Mitra, from guile, from revilement, and from disgrace.

stanzas.sanskrit: वै॒श्वा॒न॒राय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ स॒जोषाः॑ क॒था दा॑शेमा॒ग्नये॑ बृ॒हद्भाः अनू॑नेन बृह॒ता व॒क्षथे॒नोप॑ स्तभायदुप॒मिन्न रोधः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vaiśvānarā́ya mīḷhúṣe sajóṣāḥ kathā́ dāśemāgnáye br̥hád bhā́ḥ ánūnena br̥hatā́ vakṣáthena- -úpa stabhāyad upamín ná ródhaḥ
stanzas.translation: How shall we give with one accord oblation to Agni, to Vaiṣvânara the Bounteous? Great light, with full high growth hath he uplifted, and, as a pillar bears the roof, sustains it.

translations.griffith: How shall we give with one accord oblation to Agni, to Vaiṣvânara the Bounteous? Great light, with full high growth hath he uplifted, and, as a pillar bears the roof, sustains it.
translations.oldenberg: How may we unanimously offer mighty light 1 to bountiful Agni Vaisvânara? With his mighty perfect growth he supports the high bank 2 like a pillar.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नि॑न्दत॒ य इ॒मां मह्यं॑ रा॒तिं दे॒वो द॒दौ मर्त्या॑य स्व॒धावा॑न् पाका॑य॒ गृत्सो॑ अ॒मृतो॒ विचे॑ता वैश्वान॒रो नृत॑मो य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ nindata yá imā́m máhyaṃ rātíṃ devó dadaú mártyāya svadhā́vān pā́kāya gŕ̥tso amŕ̥to vícetāḥ- vaiśvānaró nŕ̥tamo yahvó agníḥ
stanzas.translation: Reproach not him who, God and selfreliant, vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal,– Deathless, discerner, wise, to me the simple, Vaiṣvânara most manly, youthful Aini.

translations.griffith: Reproach not him who, God and selfreliant, vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal,– Deathless, discerner, wise, to me the simple, Vaiṣvânara most manly, youthful Aini.
translations.oldenberg: Do not reproach Him, the self-dependent one, who has given this bounty to me, the god to the mortal, the clever one to the simple, the wise immortal, the most manly, restless1 Agni Vaisvânara.

stanzas.sanskrit: साम॑ द्वि॒बर्हा॒ महि॑ ति॒ग्मभृ॑ष्टिः स॒हस्र॑रेता वृष॒भस्तुवि॑ष्मान् प॒दं न गोरप॑गूळ्हं विवि॒द्वान॒ग्निर्मह्यं॒ प्रेदु॑ वोचन्मनी॒षाम्
stanzas.transliteration: sā́ma dvibárhā máhi tigmábhr̥ṣṭiḥ sahásraretā vr̥ṣabhás túviṣmān padáṃ ná gór ápagūḷhaṃ vividvā́n agnír máhyam préd u vocan manīṣā́m
stanzas.translation: Sharp-pointed, powerful, strong, of boundless vigour, Agni who knows the lofty hymn, kept secret As the lost milch-cow's track, the doubly Mighty,– he hath declared to me this hidden knowledge.

translations.griffith: Sharp-pointed, powerful, strong, of boundless vigour, Agni who knows the lofty hymn, kept secret As the lost milch-cow's track, the doubly Mighty,– he hath declared to me this hidden knowledge.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the sharp-pointed, the mighty bull with thousandfold sperm, has proclaimed to me the great, doubly-powerful 1 Sâman, the prayer, having found, as it were, the hidden track of a cow 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ताँ अ॒ग्निर्ब॑भसत्ति॒ग्मज॑म्भ॒स्तपि॑ष्ठेन शो॒चिषा॒ यः सु॒राधाः॑ प्र ये मि॒नन्ति॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाम॑ प्रि॒या मि॒त्रस्य॒ चेत॑तो ध्रु॒वाणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá tā́m̐ agnír babhasat tigmájambhas tápiṣṭhena śocíṣā yáḥ surā́dhāḥ prá yé minánti váruṇasya dhā́ma priyā́ mitrásya cétato dhruvā́ṇi
stanzas.translation: May he with sharpened teeth, the Bounteous Giver, Agni, consume with flame most fiercely glowing. Those who regard not Varuṇa's commandments and the dear stedfast laws of sapient Mitra.

translations.griffith: May he with sharpened teeth, the Bounteous Giver, Agni, consume with flame most fiercely glowing. Those who regard not Varuṇa's commandments and the dear stedfast laws of sapient Mitra.
translations.oldenberg: May Agni, he who is rich in wealth, whose teeth are sharp, consume with his hottest flames those who violate the laws founded by Varuna, the beloved, firm (laws) of attentive Mitra.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भ्रा॒तरो॒ न योष॑णो॒ व्यन्तः॑ पति॒रिपो॒ न जन॑यो दु॒रेवाः॑ पा॒पासः॒ सन्तो॑ अनृ॒ता अ॑स॒त्या इ॒दं प॒दम॑जनता गभी॒रम्
stanzas.transliteration: abhrātáro ná yóṣaṇo vyántaḥ patirípo ná jánayo durévāḥ pāpā́saḥ sánto anr̥tā́ asatyā́ḥ- idám padám ajanatā gabhīrám
stanzas.translation: Like youthful women without brothers, straying, like dames who hate their lords, of evil conduct, They who are full of sin, untrue, unfaithful, they have engendered this abysmal station.

translations.griffith: Like youthful women without brothers, straying, like dames who hate their lords, of evil conduct, They who are full of sin, untrue, unfaithful, they have engendered this abysmal station.
translations.oldenberg: 1 They who roam about like brotherless girls 2, of evil conduct like women who deceive their husbands, being wicked, sinful, and untrue—they have created for themselves this deep place 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दं मे॑ अग्ने॒ किय॑ते पाव॒कामि॑नते गु॒रुं भा॒रं न मन्म॑ बृ॒हद्द॑धाथ धृष॒ता ग॑भी॒रं य॒ह्वं पृ॒ष्ठं प्रय॑सा स॒प्तधा॑तु
stanzas.transliteration: idám me agne kíyate pāvaka- -áminate gurúm bhāráṃ ná mánma br̥hád dadhātha dhr̥ṣatā́ gabhīráṃ yahvám pr̥ṣṭhám práyasā saptádhātu
stanzas.translation: To me, weak, innocent, thou, luminous Agni, bast boldly given as 'twere a heavy burthen, This Prstha hymn, profound and strong and mighty, of seven elements, and with offered dainties.

translations.griffith: To me, weak, innocent, thou, luminous Agni, bast boldly given as 'twere a heavy burthen, This Prstha hymn, profound and strong and mighty, of seven elements, and with offered dainties.
translations.oldenberg: On me, however small, but innocent, thou, O purifying Agni, hast fiercely placed this mighty, deep, vigorous prayer, like a heavy burden, this Prishtha 1, consisting of seven elements 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमिन्न्वे॒३॒॑व स॑म॒ना स॑मा॒नम॒भि क्रत्वा॑ पुन॒ती धी॒तिर॑श्याः स॒सस्य॒ चर्म॒न्नधि॒ चारु॒ पृश्ने॒रग्रे॑ रु॒प आरु॑पितं॒ जबा॑रु
stanzas.transliteration: tám ín nv èvá samanā́ samānám abhí krátvā punatī́ dhītír aśyāḥ sasásya cármann ádhi cā́ru pŕ̥śner ágre rupá ā́rupitaṃ jábāru
stanzas.translation: So may our song that purifies, through wisdom reach in a moment him the Universal, Established on the height, on earth's best .station, above the beauteous grassy skin of Pr̥iṣni.

translations.griffith: So may our song that purifies, through wisdom reach in a moment him the Universal, Established on the height, on earth's best .station, above the beauteous grassy skin of Pr̥iṣni.
translations.oldenberg: Let our prayer which purifies Him, through the power of mind (inherent in it), reach Him who is the common (property of all men) alike, the good (name?) of Prisni on the skin of the herbs, on the summit of the … 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒वाच्यं॒ वच॑सः॒ किं मे॑ अ॒स्य गुहा॑ हि॒तमुप॑ नि॒णिग्व॑दन्ति यदु॒स्रिया॑णा॒मप॒ वारि॑व॒ व्रन्पाति॑ प्रि॒यं रु॒पो अग्रं॑ प॒दं वेः
stanzas.transliteration: pravā́cyaṃ vácasaḥ kím me asyá gúhā hitám úpa niṇíg vadanti yád usríyāṇām ápa vā́r iva vrán pā́ti priyáṃ rupó ágram padáṃ véḥ
stanzas.translation: Of this my speech what shall I utter further? They indicate the milk stored up in secret When they have thrown as 'twere the cows' stalls open. The Bird protects earths' best and wellloved station.

translations.griffith: Of this my speech what shall I utter further? They indicate the milk stored up in secret When they have thrown as 'twere the cows' stalls open. The Bird protects earths' best and wellloved station.
translations.oldenberg: What should be openly uttered by me of this speech? They secretly speak of that which is hidden 1. When they have uncovered, as it were, the water of the cows 2, he guards the beloved summit of the … 3, the footstep of the bird 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दमु॒ त्यन्महि॑ म॒हामनी॑कं॒ यदु॒स्रिया॒ सच॑त पू॒र्व्यं गौः ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒दे अधि॒ दीद्या॑नं॒ गुहा॑ रघु॒ष्यद्र॑घु॒यद्वि॑वेद
stanzas.transliteration: idám u tyán máhi mahā́m ánīkaṃ yád usríyā sácata pūrvyáṃ gaúḥ r̥tásya padé ádhi dī́dyānaṃ gúhā raghuṣyád raghuyád viveda
stanzas.translation: This is the Great Ones' mighty apparition which from of old the radiant Cow hath followed. This, shining brightly in the place of Order, swift, hasting on in secret, she discovered.

translations.griffith: This is the Great Ones' mighty apparition which from of old the radiant Cow hath followed. This, shining brightly in the place of Order, swift, hasting on in secret, she discovered.
translations.oldenberg: He has found in secret that great face of the great ones which the bright cow accompanied 1, the ancient (face) shining in the abode of Rita, the quickly running, quickly moving.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ द्युता॒नः पि॒त्रोः सचा॒साम॑नुत॒ गुह्यं॒ चारु॒ पृश्नेः॑ मा॒तुष्प॒दे प॑र॒मे अन्ति॒ षद्गोर्वृष्णः॑ शो॒चिषः॒ प्रय॑तस्य जि॒ह्वा
stanzas.transliteration: ádha dyutānáḥ pitróḥ sácāsā́- -ámanuta gúhyaṃ cā́ru pŕ̥śneḥ mātúṣ padé paramé ánti ṣád gór vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ śocíṣaḥ práyatasya jihvā́
stanzas.translation: He then who shone together with his Parents remembered Pr̥iṣni's fair and secret treasure, Which, in the Mother Cow's most lofty station, the Bull's tongue, of the flame bent forward, tasted.

translations.griffith: He then who shone together with his Parents remembered Pr̥iṣni's fair and secret treasure, Which, in the Mother Cow's most lofty station, the Bull's tongue, of the flame bent forward, tasted.
translations.oldenberg: And resplendent near his parents (Heaven and Earth), in their presence, he thought of the secret, good (name?) of Prisni. The tongue of the manly, forward-bent flame (seized) that which was near at hand in the highest abode of the mother, the cow 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तं वो॑चे॒ नम॑सा पृ॒च्छ्यमा॑न॒स्तवा॒शसा॑ जातवेदो॒ यदी॒दम् त्वम॒स्य क्ष॑यसि॒ यद्ध॒ विश्वं॑ दि॒वि यदु॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ यत्पृ॑थि॒व्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥táṃ voce námasā pr̥chyámānas távāśásā jātavedo yádīdám tvám asyá kṣayasi yád dha víśvaṃ diví yád u dráviṇaṃ yát pr̥thivyā́m
stanzas.translation: With reverence I declare the Law, O Agni; what is, comes by thine order, Jâtavedas. Of this, whate'er it be, thou art the Sovran, yea, all the wealth that is in earth or heaven.

translations.griffith: With reverence I declare the Law, O Agni; what is, comes by thine order, Jâtavedas. Of this, whate'er it be, thou art the Sovran, yea, all the wealth that is in earth or heaven.
translations.oldenberg: I speak, when being asked, Rita (i. e. truth), out of reverence (for Agni, or for the gods), out of hope 1 placed in thee, O Gâtavedas, as I am here 2. Thou rulest over all this wealth whatever (dwells) in heaven and earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: किं नो॑ अ॒स्य द्रवि॑णं॒ कद्ध॒ रत्नं॒ वि नो॑ वोचो जातवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान् गुहाध्व॑नः पर॒मं यन्नो॑ अ॒स्य रेकु॑ प॒दं न नि॑दा॒ना अग॑न्म
stanzas.transliteration: kíṃ no asyá dráviṇaṃ kád dha rátnaṃ ví no voco jātavedaś cikitvā́n gúhā́dhvanaḥ paramáṃ yán no asyá réku padáṃ ná nidānā́ áganma
stanzas.translation: What is our wealth therefrom, and what our treasure? Tell us O Jâtavedas, for thou knowest, What is our best course in this secret passage: we, unreproached, have reached a t)lace far distant.

translations.griffith: What is our wealth therefrom, and what our treasure? Tell us O Jâtavedas, for thou knowest, What is our best course in this secret passage: we, unreproached, have reached a t)lace far distant.
translations.oldenberg: Which of this wealth is ours, what treasure? Mayst thou who knowest it declare to us (that treasure), O Gâtavedas! What is the highest (aim) of this our way, is hidden. We have not come scolding to an empty (?) 1 place.

stanzas.sanskrit: का म॒र्यादा॑ व॒युना॒ कद्ध॑ वा॒ममच्छा॑ गमेम र॒घवो॒ न वाज॑म् क॒दा नो॑ दे॒वीर॒मृत॑स्य॒ पत्नीः॒ सूरो॒ वर्णे॑न ततनन्नु॒षासः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kā́ maryā́dā vayúnā kád dha vāmám áchā gamema raghávo ná vā́jam kadā́ no devī́r amŕ̥tasya pátnīḥ sū́ro várṇena tatanann uṣā́saḥ
stanzas.translation: What is the limit, what the rules, the guerdon? Like fleet-foot coursers speed we to the contest. When will the Goddesses, the Immortal's Spouses, the Dawns, spread over us the Sun-God's splendour?

translations.griffith: What is the limit, what the rules, the guerdon? Like fleet-foot coursers speed we to the contest. When will the Goddesses, the Immortal's Spouses, the Dawns, spread over us the Sun-God's splendour?
translations.oldenberg: 1 What is the limit, what the objects? What pleasant (wealth) may we obtain as swift (horses gain) the prize? When will the Dawns, the divine consorts of the immortal, expand over us with the sun's splendour?
