stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒नि॒रेण॒ वच॑सा फ॒ल्ग्वे॑न प्र॒तीत्ये॑न कृ॒धुना॑तृ॒पासः॑ अधा॒ ते अ॑ग्ने॒ किमि॒हा व॑दन्त्यनायु॒धास॒ आस॑ता सचन्ताम्
stanzas.transliteration: aniréṇa vácasā phalgvèna pratī́tyena kr̥dhúnātr̥pā́saḥ ádhā té agne kím ihā́ vadanti- anāyudhā́sa ā́satā sacantām
stanzas.translation: Unsatisfied, with speech devoid of vigour, scanty and frivolous and inconclusive, Wherefore do they address thee here, O Agni? Let these who have no weapons suffer sorrow.

translations.griffith: Unsatisfied, with speech devoid of vigour, scanty and frivolous and inconclusive, Wherefore do they address thee here, O Agni? Let these who have no weapons suffer sorrow.
translations.oldenberg: And what do those insatiable ones here say, O Agni, with their sapless, feeble, weak speech that has to be listened to? Let them unarmed fall into nothingness.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य श्रि॒ये स॑मिधा॒नस्य॒ वृष्णो॒ वसो॒रनी॑कं॒ दम॒ आ रु॑रोच रुश॒द्वसा॑नः सु॒दृशी॑करूपः क्षि॒तिर्न रा॒या पु॑रु॒वारो॑ अद्यौत्
stanzas.transliteration: asyá śriyé samidhānásya vŕ̥ṣṇo vásor ánīkaṃ dáma ā́ ruroca rúśad vásānaḥ sudŕ̥śīkarūpaḥ kṣitír ná rāyā́ puruvā́ro adyaut
stanzas.translation: The majesty of him the Good, the Mighty, aflame, hath shone for glory in the dwelling. He, clothed in light, hath shone most fair to look on, wealthy in boons, as a home shines with riches.

translations.griffith: The majesty of him the Good, the Mighty, aflame, hath shone for glory in the dwelling. He, clothed in light, hath shone most fair to look on, wealthy in boons, as a home shines with riches.
translations.oldenberg: The face of this kindled, manly Vasu has shone gloriously in the house. Clothed in brilliancy, with his shape beautiful to behold, the bountiful has shone like a house 1 with its wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्ध्व ऊ॒ षु णो॑ अध्वरस्य होत॒रग्ने॒ तिष्ठ॑ दे॒वता॑ता॒ यजी॑यान् त्वं हि विश्व॑म॒भ्यसि॒ मन्म॒ प्र वे॒धस॑श्चित्तिरसि मनी॒षाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ūrdhvá ū ṣú ṇo adhvarasya hotar ágne tíṣṭha devátātā yájīyān tváṃ hí víśvam abhy ási mánma prá vedhásaś cit tirasi manīṣā́m
stanzas.translation: PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O Agni, in the Gods' service best of sacrificers, For over evei y thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e'en the wisdom of the pious.

translations.griffith: PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O Agni, in the Gods' service best of sacrificers, For over evei y thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e'en the wisdom of the pious.
translations.oldenberg: Stand upright for us, O Agni, Hotri of the sacrifice, the best performer of sacrifices among the gods. For thou art the master of every thought; thou promotest the worshipper's prayer.

stanzas.sanskrit: अमू॑रो॒ होता॒ न्य॑सादि वि॒क्ष्व१॒॑ग्निर्म॒न्द्रो वि॒दथे॑षु॒ प्रचे॑ताः ऊ॒र्ध्वं भा॒नुं स॑वि॒तेवा॑श्रे॒न्मेते॑व धू॒मं स्त॑भाय॒दुप॒ द्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: ámūro hótā ny àsādi vikṣú- -agnír mandró vidátheṣu prácetāḥ ūrdhvám bhānúṃ savitévāśret- méteva dhūmáṃ stabhāyad úpa dyā́m
stanzas.translation: He was set down mid men as Priest unerring, Agni, wise, welcome in our holy synods. Like Savitar he hath lifted up his splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.

translations.griffith: He was set down mid men as Priest unerring, Agni, wise, welcome in our holy synods. Like Savitar he hath lifted up his splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.
translations.oldenberg: The unerring Hotri has sat down among the people, joy-giving Agni, the wise one at the sacrifices 1. Like Savitri he has sent his light upward. Like a builder he has reared his smoke up to the sky.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ता सु॑जू॒र्णी रा॒तिनी॑ घृ॒ताची॑ प्रदक्षि॒णिद्दे॒वता॑तिमुरा॒णः उदु॒ स्वरु॑र्नव॒जा नाक्रः प॒श्वो अ॑नक्ति॒ सुधि॑तः सु॒मेकः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yatā́ sujūrṇī́ rātínī ghr̥tā́cī pradakṣiṇíd devátātim urāṇáḥ úd u svárur navajā́ nā́kráḥ paśvó anakti súdhitaḥ sumékaḥ
stanzas.translation: The glowing ladle, filled with oil, is lifted; choosing Gods' service to the right he circles. Eager he rises like the new-wrought pillar which, firmly set and fixed, anoints the victims.

translations.griffith: The glowing ladle, filled with oil, is lifted; choosing Gods' service to the right he circles. Eager he rises like the new-wrought pillar which, firmly set and fixed, anoints the victims.
translations.oldenberg: 1 (The ladle) glowing, filled with gifts, with butter, is stretched forth. From left to right (does Agni move) choosing the divine people. Upright (stands) the (sacrificial) post like a new-born foal 2; well-placed, well-established it anoints the victims 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्ती॒र्णे ब॒र्हिषि॑ समिधा॒ने अ॒ग्ना ऊ॒र्ध्वो अ॑ध्व॒र्युर्जु॑जुषा॒णो अ॑स्थात् पर्य॒ग्निः प॑शु॒पा न होता॑ त्रिवि॒ष्ट्ये॑ति प्र॒दिव॑ उरा॒णः
stanzas.transliteration: stīrṇé barhíṣi samidhāné agnaú- ūrdhvó adhvaryúr jujuṣāṇó asthāt páry agníḥ paśupā́ ná hótā triviṣṭy èti pradíva urāṇáḥ
stanzas.translation: When sacred grass is strewn and Agni kindled, the Adhvaryu rises to, his task rej o cing. Agni the Priest, like one who tends the cattle, goes three times round, as from of old he wills it.

translations.griffith: When sacred grass is strewn and Agni kindled, the Adhvaryu rises to, his task rej o cing. Agni the Priest, like one who tends the cattle, goes three times round, as from of old he wills it.
translations.oldenberg: After the sacrificial grass has been spread and the fire kindled, the delighted Adhvaryu has stationed himself upright. Agni, the Hotri, chosen from of old, goes round thrice, like a shepherd.

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॒ त्मना॑ मि॒तद्रु॑रेति॒ होता॒ग्निर्म॒न्द्रो मधु॑वचा ऋ॒तावा॑ द्रव॑न्त्यस्य वा॒जिनो॒ न शोका॒ भय॑न्ते॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒ यदभ्रा॑ट्
stanzas.transliteration: pári tmánā mitádrur eti hótā- -agnír mandró mádhuvacā r̥tā́vā drávanty asya vājíno ná śókāḥ- bháyante víśvā bhúvanā yád ábhrāṭ
stanzas.translation: Agni himself, the Priest, with measured motion, goes round, with sweet speech, cheerful, true to Order. His fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses; all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.

translations.griffith: Agni himself, the Priest, with measured motion, goes round, with sweet speech, cheerful, true to Order. His fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses; all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.
translations.oldenberg: As Hotri, measuredly running, Agni, the joy-giving, sweet-tongued, the righteous, goes around by his own might. His flames run forward like race-horses; all beings are afraid when he has shone forth.

stanzas.sanskrit: भ॒द्रा ते॑ अग्ने स्वनीक सं॒दृग्घो॒रस्य॑ स॒तो विषु॑णस्य॒ चारुः॑ न यत्ते॑ शो॒चिस्तम॑सा॒ वर॑न्त॒ न ध्व॒स्मान॑स्त॒न्वी॒३॒॑ रेप॒ आ धुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: bhadrā́ te agne svanīka saṃdŕ̥g ghorásya sató víṣuṇasya cā́ruḥ ná yát te śocís támasā váranta ná dhvasmā́nas tanvī̀ répa ā́ dhuḥ
stanzas.translation: Beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect, O lovely Agni, terrible when spreading. Thy splendours are not covered by the darkness: detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.

translations.griffith: Beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect, O lovely Agni, terrible when spreading. Thy splendours are not covered by the darkness: detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.
translations.oldenberg: Beautiful, O fair-faced Agni, is thy aspect, who art terrible and manifold; pleasant (it is). As they have not hindered thy light by darkness, no bespatterers have left stains on thy body.

stanzas.sanskrit: न यस्य॒ सातु॒र्जनि॑तो॒रवा॑रि॒ न मा॒तरा॑पि॒तरा॒ नू चि॑दि॒ष्टौ अधा॑ मि॒त्रो न सुधि॑तः पाव॒को॒३॒॑ऽग्निर्दी॑दाय॒ मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु
stanzas.transliteration: ná yásya sā́tur jánitor ávāri ná mātárāpitárā nū́ cid iṣṭaú ádhā mitró ná súdhitaḥ pāvakáḥ- -agnír dīdāya mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú
stanzas.translation: Naught hindered his production, Bounteous Giver: his Mother and his Sire were free to send him. Then as Friend benevolent, refulgent, Agni shone forth in human habitations.

translations.griffith: Naught hindered his production, Bounteous Giver: his Mother and his Sire were free to send him. Then as Friend benevolent, refulgent, Agni shone forth in human habitations.
translations.oldenberg: He whose mother (?) 1 has not been hindered from giving birth, nor his father and mother whenever they were incited (?) 2: this Agni, the purifier, well-established like Mitra 3, has shone among the tribes of men,—

stanzas.sanskrit: द्विर्यं पञ्च॒ जीज॑नन्त्सं॒वसा॑नाः॒ स्वसा॑रो अ॒ग्निं मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु उ॒ष॒र्बुध॑मथ॒र्यो॒३॒॑ न दन्तं॑ शु॒क्रं स्वासं॑ पर॒शुं न ति॒ग्मम्
stanzas.transliteration: dvír yám páñca jī́janan saṃvásānāḥ svásāro agním mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú uṣarbúdham atharyò ná dántaṃ śukráṃ svā́sam paraśúṃ ná tigmám
stanzas.translation: He, Agni, whom the twice-five sisters, dwelling together, in the homes of men engendered, Bright like a spear's tooth, wakened in the morning, with powerful mouth and like an axe wellsharpened.

translations.griffith: He, Agni, whom the twice-five sisters, dwelling together, in the homes of men engendered, Bright like a spear's tooth, wakened in the morning, with powerful mouth and like an axe wellsharpened.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, whom the twice-five sisters 1, dwelling together, have engendered among the human tribes, who awakes at dawn, who is bright like an elephant's (?) 2 tooth, whose mouth is beautiful, who is sharp like an axe.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॒ त्ये अ॑ग्ने ह॒रितो॑ घृत॒स्ना रोहि॑तास ऋ॒ज्वञ्चः॒ स्वञ्चः॑ अ॒रु॒षासो॒ वृष॑ण ऋजुमु॒ष्का आ दे॒वता॑तिमह्वन्त द॒स्माः
stanzas.transliteration: táva tyé agne haríto ghr̥tasnā́ḥ- róhitāsa r̥jváñcaḥ sváñcaḥ aruṣā́so vŕ̥ṣaṇa r̥jumuṣkā́ḥ- ā́ devátātim ahvanta dasmā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: These thy Bay Coursers, Agni, dropping fatness, ruddy vigorous, speeding straightly forward, And red steeds, wonderful, of mighty muscle, are to this service of the Gods invited:

translations.griffith: These thy Bay Coursers, Agni, dropping fatness, ruddy vigorous, speeding straightly forward, And red steeds, wonderful, of mighty muscle, are to this service of the Gods invited:
translations.oldenberg: 1 Agni, those golden horses of thine swimming in ghee, the red ones which go straight forward, the fleet ones, the brilliant, manly, wonderful horses, puissant stallions, have called hither the divine people.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये ह॒ त्ये ते॒ सह॑माना अ॒यास॑स्त्वे॒षासो॑ अग्ने अ॒र्चय॒श्चर॑न्ति श्ये॒नासो॒ न दु॑वस॒नासो॒ अर्थं॑ तुविष्व॒णसो॒ मारु॑तं॒ न शर्धः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé ha tyé te sáhamānā ayā́sas tveṣā́so agne arcáyaś cáranti śyenā́so ná duvasanā́so árthaṃ tuviṣvaṇáso mā́rutaṃ ná śárdhaḥ
stanzas.translation: These brightly-shining games of thine, O Agni, that move for ever restless, allsubduing, Like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry, roar loudly like the army of the Maruts.

translations.griffith: These brightly-shining games of thine, O Agni, that move for ever restless, allsubduing, Like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry, roar loudly like the army of the Maruts.
translations.oldenberg: Those victorious, never-tiring 1, fierce flames of thine, O Agni, which move about, hasten 2 to their goal like hawks; they roar mightily like the host of the Maruts.

stanzas.sanskrit: अका॑रि॒ ब्रह्म॑ समिधान॒ तुभ्यं॒ शंसा॑त्यु॒क्थं यज॑ते॒ व्यू॑ धाः होता॑रम॒ग्निं मनु॑षो॒ नि षे॑दुर्नम॒स्यन्त॑ उ॒शिजः॒ शंस॑मा॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: ákāri bráhma samidhāna túbhyaṃ śáṃsāty uktháṃ yájate vy ū̀ dhāḥ hótāram agním mánuṣo ní ṣedur namasyánta uśíjaḥ śáṃsam āyóḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee, O flaming God, hath prayer been offered. Let the priest laud thee: give to him who worships. Men have established Agni as Invoker, fain to adore the glory of the living.

translations.griffith: To thee, O flaming God, hath prayer been offered. Let the priest laud thee: give to him who worships. Men have established Agni as Invoker, fain to adore the glory of the living.
translations.oldenberg: 1 (This) hymn has been produced for thee, O Agni, when thou wert kindled. May (the priest) recite the litany; mayst thou distribute (treasures) to him who sacrifices. Men have set down Agni as the Hotri, the Usigs, adoring (Him), the praise of Âyu 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यमि॒ह प्र॑थ॒मो धा॑यि धा॒तृभि॒र्होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठो अध्व॒रेष्वीड्यः॑ यमप्न॑वानो॒ भृग॑वो विरुरु॒चुर्वने॑षु चि॒त्रं वि॒भ्वं॑ वि॒शेवि॑शे
stanzas.transliteration: ayám ihá prathamó dhāyi dhātŕ̥bhir hótā yájiṣṭho adhvaréṣv ī́ḍyaḥ yám ápnavāno bhŕ̥gavo virurucúr váneṣu citráṃ vibhvàṃ viśé-viśe
stanzas.translation: HERE by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites: Whom Apnavâna, and the Bhr̥igus caused to shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from home to home.

translations.griffith: HERE by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites: Whom Apnavâna, and the Bhr̥igus caused to shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from home to home.
translations.oldenberg: This (Agni) has been established here as the first by the establishers, the Hotri, the best sacrificer who should be magnified at the sacrifices, whom Apnavâna and the Bhrigus have made shine, brilliant in the woods, spreading to every house.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ क॒दा त॑ आनु॒षग्भुव॑द्दे॒वस्य॒ चेत॑नम् अधा॒ हि त्वा॑ जगृभ्रि॒रे मर्ता॑सो वि॒क्ष्वीड्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ágne kadā́ ta ānuṣág bhúvad devásya cétanam ádhā hí tvā jagr̥bhriré mártāso vikṣv ī́ḍyam
stanzas.translation: When shall thy glory as a God, Agni, be suddenly shown forth. For mortal men have held thee fast, adorable in all their homes,

translations.griffith: When shall thy glory as a God, Agni, be suddenly shown forth. For mortal men have held thee fast, adorable in all their homes,
translations.oldenberg: Agni! When will the splendour of thee, the god, appear in the right way? For verily the mortals have seized thee who shouldst be magnified in the houses.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तावा॑नं॒ विचे॑तसं॒ पश्य॑न्तो॒ द्यामि॑व॒ स्तृभिः॑ विश्वे॑षामध्व॒राणां॑ हस्क॒र्तारं॒ दमे॑दमे
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tā́vānaṃ vícetasam páśyanto dyā́m iva stŕ̥bhiḥ víśveṣām adhvarā́ṇāṃ haskartā́raṃ dáme-dame
stanzas.translation: Seeing thee faithful to the Law, most sapient, like the starry heaven, Illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.

translations.griffith: Seeing thee faithful to the Law, most sapient, like the starry heaven, Illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.
translations.oldenberg: Seeing the righteous, wise one, like the heaven with the stars, who produces joy at all sacrifices, from house to house—

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒शुं दू॒तं वि॒वस्व॑तो॒ विश्वा॒ यश्च॑र्ष॒णीर॒भि आ ज॑भ्रुः के॒तुमा॒यवो॒ भृग॑वाणं वि॒शेवि॑शे
stanzas.transliteration: āśúṃ dūtáṃ vivásvato víśvā yáś carṣaṇī́r abhí ā́ jabhruḥ ketúm āyávo bhŕ̥gavāṇaṃ viśé-viśe
stanzas.translation: Vivasvan's envoy living men have taken as their ensign, swift, The ruler over all mankind, moving like Bhr̥igu in each home.

translations.griffith: Vivasvan's envoy living men have taken as their ensign, swift, The ruler over all mankind, moving like Bhr̥igu in each home.
translations.oldenberg: The quick messenger of Vivasvat who rules over all human tribes: Him the Âyus have brought hither to every house, the light, him who belongs to the Bhrigus.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमीं॒ होता॑रमानु॒षक्चि॑कि॒त्वांसं॒ नि षे॑दिरे र॒ण्वं पा॑व॒कशो॑चिषं॒ यजि॑ष्ठं स॒प्त धाम॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: tám īṃ hótāram ānuṣák cikitvā́ṃsaṃ ní ṣedire raṇvám pāvakáśociṣaṃ yájiṣṭhaṃ saptá dhā́mabhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Him the intelligent have they placed duly as Invoking Priest, Welcome, with sanctifying flame, best worshipper, with sevenfold might;

translations.griffith: Him the intelligent have they placed duly as Invoking Priest, Welcome, with sanctifying flame, best worshipper, with sevenfold might;
translations.oldenberg: Him the knowing one they have set down in the right way as the Hotri, the gay one with his purifying flames, the best sacrificer with his seven (forms 1)—

stanzas.sanskrit: तं शश्व॑तीषु मा॒तृषु॒ वन॒ आ वी॒तमश्रि॑तम् चि॒त्रं सन्तं॒ गुहा॑ हि॒तं सु॒वेदं॑ कूचिद॒र्थिन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ śáśvatīṣu mātŕ̥ṣu vána ā́ vītám áśritam citráṃ sántaṃ gúhā hitáṃ suvédaṃ kūcidarthínam
stanzas.translation: In his Eternal Mothers, in the wood, concealed and unapproached, Kept secret though his flames are bright seekingon all sides, quickly found.

translations.griffith: In his Eternal Mothers, in the wood, concealed and unapproached, Kept secret though his flames are bright seekingon all sides, quickly found.
translations.oldenberg: Him who is enveloped in many mothers, in the wood 1, who does not rest thereon (?) 2, who is brilliant, though hidden in secret, easily to be found, and striving for all that is desired.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒सस्य॒ यद्वियु॑ता॒ सस्मि॒न्नूध॑न्नृ॒तस्य॒ धाम॑न्र॒णय॑न्त दे॒वाः म॒हाँ अ॒ग्निर्नम॑सा रा॒तह॑व्यो॒ वेर॑ध्व॒राय॒ सद॒मिदृ॒तावा॑
stanzas.transliteration: sasásya yád víyutā sásminn ū́dhann r̥tásya dhā́man raṇáyanta devā́ḥ mahā́m̐ agnír námasā rātáhavyo vér adhvarā́ya sádam íd r̥tā́vā
stanzas.translation: That as food spreads forth in this earthly udder, Gods may rejoice them in the home of Order, Great Agni, served with reverence and oblation, flies ever to the sacrifice, the Faithful.

translations.griffith: That as food spreads forth in this earthly udder, Gods may rejoice them in the home of Order, Great Agni, served with reverence and oblation, flies ever to the sacrifice, the Faithful.
translations.oldenberg: When the gods rejoiced in the … of the herbs 1, in that udder 2, in the foundation of Rita 3, the great -Agni, to whom offerings are made with adoration, the righteous one, always approached eagerly for the sake of sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: वेर॑ध्व॒रस्य॑ दू॒त्या॑नि वि॒द्वानु॒भे अ॒न्ता रोद॑सी संचिकि॒त्वान् दू॒त ई॑यसे प्र॒दिव॑ उरा॒णो वि॒दुष्ट॑रो दि॒व आ॒रोध॑नानि
stanzas.transliteration: vér adhvarásya dūtyā̀ni vidvā́n ubhé antā́ ródasī saṃcikitvā́n dūtá īyase pradíva urāṇó vidúṣṭaro divá āródhanāni
stanzas.translation: Bird of each rite, skilled in an envoy's duties, knowing both worlds and that which lies between them, Thou goest from of old a willing Herald, knowing full well heaven's innermost recesses.

translations.griffith: Bird of each rite, skilled in an envoy's duties, knowing both worlds and that which lies between them, Thou goest from of old a willing Herald, knowing full well heaven's innermost recesses.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Thou, the knowing one, hast eagerly performed the messengership of the sacrifice, looking over both ends, over the two worlds. Thou goest as a messenger, chosen from of old, thou who knowest best the ascents to heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: कृ॒ष्णं त॒ एम॒ रुश॑तः पु॒रो भाश्च॑रि॒ष्ण्व१॒॑र्चिर्वपु॑षा॒मिदेक॑म् यदप्र॑वीता॒ दध॑ते ह॒ गर्भं॑ स॒द्यश्चि॑ज्जा॒तो भव॒सीदु॑ दू॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: kr̥ṣṇáṃ ta éma rúśataḥ puró bhā́ś cariṣṇv àrcír vápuṣām íd ékam yád ápravītā dádhate ha gárbhaṃ sadyáś cij jātó bhávasī́d u dūtáḥ
stanzas.translation: Bright God, thy path is black: light is before thee: thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders. When she, yet unimpregnate, hath conceived thee, even when newly born thou art an envoy.

translations.griffith: Bright God, thy path is black: light is before thee: thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders. When she, yet unimpregnate, hath conceived thee, even when newly born thou art an envoy.
translations.oldenberg: Thy path is black. Light is before thee, the red one. Thy flame is speedy. This is one of the wonders: when the virgin conceives (thee as her) child 1, thou becomest a messenger, as soon as thou art born.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒द्यो जा॒तस्य॒ ददृ॑शान॒मोजो॒ यद॑स्य॒ वातो॑ अनु॒वाति॑ शो॒चिः वृ॒णक्ति॑ ति॒ग्माम॑त॒सेषु॑ जि॒ह्वां स्थि॒रा चि॒दन्ना॑ दयते॒ वि जम्भैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sadyó jātásya dádr̥śānam ójo yád asya vā́to anuvā́ti śocíḥ vr̥ṇákti tigmā́m ataséṣu jihvā́ṃ sthirā́ cid ánnā dayate ví jámbhaiḥ
stanzas.translation: Yet newly born, his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour, His sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood, and with his teeth e'en solid food consumeth.

translations.griffith: Yet newly born, his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour, His sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood, and with his teeth e'en solid food consumeth.
translations.oldenberg: As soon as he is born, his strength shows itself, when the wind blows upon his flame. He turns his sharp tongue among the dry brushwood. Even solid food he tears to pieces with his teeth.

stanzas.sanskrit: तृ॒षु यदन्ना॑ तृ॒षुणा॑ व॒वक्ष॑ तृ॒षुं दू॒तं कृ॑णुते य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निः वात॑स्य मे॒ळिं स॑चते नि॒जूर्व॑न्ना॒शुं न वा॑जयते हि॒न्वे अर्वा॑
stanzas.transliteration: tr̥ṣú yád ánnā tr̥ṣúṇā vavákṣa tr̥ṣúṃ dūtáṃ kr̥ṇute yahvó agníḥ vā́tasya meḷíṃ sacate nijū́rvann āśúṃ ná vājayate hinvé árvā
stanzas.translation: When he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly, strong Agni makes himself a speedy envoy, Follows the rustling of the wind, consuming, and courser-like, speeds, drives the swift horse onward.

translations.griffith: When he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly, strong Agni makes himself a speedy envoy, Follows the rustling of the wind, consuming, and courser-like, speeds, drives the swift horse onward.
translations.oldenberg: When he thirstily has grown strong by thirsty food 1, restless Agni appoints a thirsty messenger. Consuming (the wood) he follows the … 2 of the wind. He seems to drive forward a quick horse; the racer speeds along.

stanzas.sanskrit: दू॒तं वो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दसं हव्य॒वाह॒मम॑र्त्यम् यजि॑ष्ठमृञ्जसे गि॒रा
stanzas.transliteration: dūtáṃ vo viśvávedasaṃ havyavā́ham ámartyaṃ yájiṣṭham r̥ñjase girā́
stanzas.translation: YOUR envoy who possesses all, Immortal, bearer of your gifts, Best worshipper, I woo with song.

translations.griffith: YOUR envoy who possesses all, Immortal, bearer of your gifts, Best worshipper, I woo with song.
translations.oldenberg: I press on for you with my prayer to the all-possessing messenger, the immortal bearer of offerings, the best sacrificer.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि वेदा॒ वसु॑धितिं म॒हाँ आ॒रोध॑नं दि॒वः स दे॒वाँ एह व॑क्षति
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí védā vásudhitim mahā́m̐ āródhanaṃ diváḥ sá devā́m̐ éhá vakṣati
stanzas.translation: He, Mighty, knows the gift of wealth, he knows the deep recess of heaven: He shall bring hitherward the Gods.

translations.griffith: He, Mighty, knows the gift of wealth, he knows the deep recess of heaven: He shall bring hitherward the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: He, the great one, knows indeed the place of wealth 1, the ascent to heaven; may he, (therefore,) conduct the gods hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वे॑द दे॒व आ॒नमं॑ दे॒वाँ ऋ॑ताय॒ते दमे॑ दाति॑ प्रि॒याणि॑ चि॒द्वसु॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá veda devá ānámaṃ devā́m̐ r̥tāyaté dáme dā́ti priyā́ṇi cid vásu
stanzas.translation: He knows, a God himself, to guide Gods to the righteous in his home: He gives e'en treasures that we love.

translations.griffith: He knows, a God himself, to guide Gods to the righteous in his home: He gives e'en treasures that we love.
translations.oldenberg: He, the god, knows how to direct the gods for the righteous (worshipper), in his house. He gives (us) wealth dear (to us).

stanzas.sanskrit: स होता॒ सेदु॑ दू॒त्यं॑ चिकि॒त्वाँ अ॒न्तरी॑यते वि॒द्वाँ आ॒रोध॑नं दि॒वः
stanzas.transliteration: sá hótā séd u dūtyàṃ cikitvā́m̐ antár īyate vidvā́m̐ āródhanaṃ diváḥ
stanzas.translation: He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro, Knowing the deep recess of heaven.

translations.griffith: He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro, Knowing the deep recess of heaven.
translations.oldenberg: He is the Hotri; he who knows the office of a messenger, goes to and fro (between men and gods), knowing the ascent to heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते स्या॑म॒ ये अ॒ग्नये॑ ददा॒शुर्ह॒व्यदा॑तिभिः य ईं॒ पुष्य॑न्त इन्ध॒ते
stanzas.transliteration: té syāma yé agnáye dadāśúr havyádātibhiḥ yá īm púṣyanta indhaté
stanzas.translation: May we be they who gratify Agni with sacrificial gifts, Whocherish and enkindle him.

translations.griffith: May we be they who gratify Agni with sacrificial gifts, Whocherish and enkindle him.
translations.oldenberg: May we be of those who have worshipped Agni with the gift of offerings, who cause him to thrive and kindle him.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते रा॒या ते सु॒वीर्यैः॑ सस॒वांसो॒ वि शृ॑ण्विरे ये अ॒ग्ना द॑धि॒रे दुवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: té rāyā́ té suvī́ryaiḥ sasavā́ṃso ví śr̥ṇvire yé agnā́ dadhiré dúvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Illustrious for wealth are they, and hero deeds, victorious, Who have served Agni reverently.

translations.griffith: Illustrious for wealth are they, and hero deeds, victorious, Who have served Agni reverently.
translations.oldenberg: The men who have brought worship to Agni, are renowned as successful by wealth and by powerful offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मे रायो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ सं च॑रन्तु पुरु॒स्पृहः॑ अ॒स्मे वाजा॑स ईरताम्
stanzas.transliteration: asmé rā́yo divé-dive sáṃ carantu puruspŕ̥haḥ asmé vā́jāsa īratām
stanzas.translation: So unto us, day after day, may riches craved by many come, And power and might spring up for us.

translations.griffith: So unto us, day after day, may riches craved by many come, And power and might spring up for us.
translations.oldenberg: May much-desired wealth come to us day by day; may gains arise among us.

stanzas.sanskrit: स विप्र॑श्चर्षणी॒नां शव॑सा॒ मानु॑षाणाम् अति॑ क्षि॒प्रेव॑ विध्यति
stanzas.transliteration: sá vípraś carṣaṇīnā́ṃ śávasā mā́nuṣāṇām áti kṣipréva vidhyati
stanzas.translation: That holy Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than The swift shafts of the tribes of men.

translations.griffith: That holy Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than The swift shafts of the tribes of men.
translations.oldenberg: He (Agni), the priest of the tribes, (the priest) of men, pierces (all hostile powers) by his might as with a tossing 1 (bow).

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ मृ॒ळ म॒हाँ अ॑सि॒ य ई॒मा दे॑व॒युं जन॑म् इ॒येथ॑ ब॒र्हिरा॒सद॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ágne mr̥ḷá mahā́m̐ asi yá īm ā́ devayúṃ jánam iyétha barhír āsádam
stanzas.translation: AGNI, show favour: great art thou who to this pious man art come, To seat thee on the sacred grass.

translations.griffith: AGNI, show favour: great art thou who to this pious man art come, To seat thee on the sacred grass.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, have mercy! Thou art great, who hast come to this pious man to sit down on the sacrificial grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: स मानु॑षीषु दू॒ळभो॑ वि॒क्षु प्रा॒वीरम॑र्त्यः दू॒तो विश्वे॑षां भुवत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá mā́nuṣīṣu dūḷábho vikṣú prāvī́r ámartyaḥ dūtó víśveṣām bhuvat
stanzas.translation: May he the Immortal, Helper, bard to be deceived among mankind, Become the messenger of all.

translations.griffith: May he the Immortal, Helper, bard to be deceived among mankind, Become the messenger of all.
translations.oldenberg: He who cannot be deceived, the zealous, the immortal has among men become the messenger of all.

stanzas.sanskrit: स सद्म॒ परि॑ णीयते॒ होता॑ म॒न्द्रो दिवि॑ष्टिषु उ॒त पोता॒ नि षी॑दति
stanzas.transliteration: sá sádma pári ṇīyate hótā mandró díviṣṭiṣu utá pótā ní ṣīdati
stanzas.translation: Around the altar is he led, welcome Chief Priest at solemn rites, Or as the Potar sits him down.

translations.griffith: Around the altar is he led, welcome Chief Priest at solemn rites, Or as the Potar sits him down.
translations.oldenberg: He, the joy-giving Hotri, is led around the sacred seat at the heaven-aspiring sacrifices. And he sits down as the Potri also.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त ग्ना अ॒ग्निर॑ध्व॒र उ॒तो गृ॒हप॑ति॒र्दमे॑ उ॒त ब्र॒ह्मा नि षी॑दति
stanzas.transliteration: utá gnā́ agnír adhvaré- utó gr̥hápatir dáme utá brahmā́ ní ṣīdati
stanzas.translation: Agni in fire at sacrifice, and in the house as Lord thereof, And as a Brahman takes his seat.

translations.griffith: Agni in fire at sacrifice, and in the house as Lord thereof, And as a Brahman takes his seat.
translations.oldenberg: Agni sits down also as (the sacrificer's) wife 1 at the sacrifice, and as the master of the house in the house, and as the Brahman 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: वेषि॒ ह्य॑ध्वरीय॒तामु॑पव॒क्ता जना॑नाम् ह॒व्या च॒ मानु॑षाणाम्
stanzas.transliteration: véṣi hy àdhvarīyatā́m upavaktā́ jánānām havyā́ ca mā́nuṣāṇām
stanzas.translation: Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice, And to oblations brought by men.

translations.griffith: Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice, And to oblations brought by men.
translations.oldenberg: Thou zealously approachest as the Upavaktri 1 of the people who perform the sacrificial service, and (thou approachest) the offerings of men.

stanzas.sanskrit: वेषीद्व॑स्य दू॒त्यं१॒॑ यस्य॒ जुजो॑षो अध्व॒रम् ह॒व्यं मर्त॑स्य॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: véṣī́d v asya dūtyàṃ yásya jújoṣo adhvarám havyám mártasya vóḷhave
stanzas.translation: Thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well, To bear the mortal's gifts to heaven.

translations.griffith: Thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well, To bear the mortal's gifts to heaven.
translations.oldenberg: And thou zealously performest the messenger-ship for the man in whose sacrifice thou takest pleasure, in order to bear the mortal's offering (to the gods).

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माकं॑ जोष्यध्व॒रम॒स्माकं॑ य॒ज्ञम॑ङ्गिरः अ॒स्माकं॑ शृणुधी॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ joṣy adhvarám asmā́kaṃ yajñám aṅgiraḥ asmā́kaṃ śr̥ṇudhī hávam
stanzas.translation: Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, Angiras, with our sacrifice: Give ear and listen to our call.

translations.griffith: Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, Angiras, with our sacrifice: Give ear and listen to our call.
translations.oldenberg: Find pleasure 1 in our rites, in our sacrifice, O Aṅgiras. Hear our call!

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॑ ते दू॒ळभो॒ रथो॒ऽस्माँ अ॑श्नोतु वि॒श्वतः॑ येन॒ रक्ष॑सि दा॒शुषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: pári te dūḷábho rátho -asmā́m̐ aśnotu viśvátaḥ yéna rákṣasi dāśúṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: May thine inviolable car, wherewith thou guardest those who give, Come near to us from every side.

translations.griffith: May thine inviolable car, wherewith thou guardest those who give, Come near to us from every side.
translations.oldenberg: May thy unerring chariot, by which thou protectest the worshippers, encompass us from every side.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ तम॒द्याश्वं॒ न स्तोमैः॒ क्रतुं॒ न भ॒द्रं हृ॑दि॒स्पृश॑म् ऋ॒ध्यामा॑ त॒ ओहैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne tám adyá- -áśvaṃ ná stómaiḥ krátuṃ ná bhadráṃ hr̥dispŕ̥śam  r̥dhyā́mā ta óhaiḥ
stanzas.translation: This day with praises, Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest. Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.

translations.griffith: This day with praises, Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest. Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.
translations.oldenberg: 1 O Agni! May we to-day successfully perform, with thy heedfulness 2, this praise 3 which touches thy heart, which is like a horse, like auspicious power of the mind.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ ह्य॑ग्ने॒ क्रतो॑र्भ॒द्रस्य॒ दक्ष॑स्य सा॒धोः र॒थीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ बृह॒तो ब॒भूथ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā hy àgne krátor bhadrásya dákṣasya sādhóḥ rathī́r r̥tásya br̥ható babhū́tha
stanzas.translation: For thou hast ever been the Car-driver, Agni, of noble Strength, lofty sacrifice, and rightful judgment.

translations.griffith: For thou hast ever been the Car-driver, Agni, of noble Strength, lofty sacrifice, and rightful judgment.
translations.oldenberg: For verily thou, O Agni, hast become the charioteer of auspicious power of the mind, of real ability, and of the mighty Rita.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒भिर्नो॑ अ॒र्कैर्भवा॑ नो अ॒र्वाङ्स्व१॒॑र्ण ज्योतिः॑ अग्ने॒ विश्वे॑भिः सु॒मना॒ अनी॑कैः
stanzas.transliteration: ebhír no arkaír bhávā no arvā́ṅ svàr ṇá jyótiḥ ágne víśvebhiḥ sumánā ánīkaiḥ
stanzas.translation: Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as the sunlight, O Agni, well disposed, with all thine aspects.

translations.griffith: Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as the sunlight, O Agni, well disposed, with all thine aspects.
translations.oldenberg: Through these our hymns direct thyself hither-wards to us like the sun with its light 1, O Agni, gracious with all thy faces.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒भिष्टे॑ अ॒द्य गी॒र्भिर्गृ॒णन्तोऽग्ने॒ दाशे॑म प्र ते॑ दि॒वो न स्त॑नयन्ति॒ शुष्माः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ābhíṣ ṭe adyá gīrbhír gr̥ṇántaḥ- -ágne dā́śema prá te divó ná stanayanti śúṣmāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now may we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee, Agni. Loud as the voice of Heaven thy blasts are roaring.

translations.griffith: Now may we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee, Agni. Loud as the voice of Heaven thy blasts are roaring.
translations.oldenberg: May we to-day worship thee, O Agni, praising thee with these songs. Thy roarings thunder like (the thunder) of Heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॒ स्वादि॒ष्ठाग्ने॒ संदृ॑ष्टिरि॒दा चि॒दह्न॑ इ॒दा चि॑द॒क्तोः श्रि॒ये रु॒क्मो न रो॑चत उपा॒के
stanzas.transliteration: táva svā́diṣṭhā- -ágne sáṃdr̥ṣṭir idā́ cid áhnaḥ- idā́ cid aktóḥ śriyé rukmó ná rocata upāké
stanzas.translation: just at this time of the day and the night thy look is the sweetest . It shineth near us even as gold for glory.

translations.griffith: just at this time of the day and the night thy look is the sweetest . It shineth near us even as gold for glory.
translations.oldenberg: Thy sweetest aspect, O Agni, shines near us for glory's sake, now by day, now by night, like gold.

stanzas.sanskrit: घृ॒तं न पू॒तं त॒नूर॑रे॒पाः शुचि॒ हिर॑ण्यम् तत्ते॑ रु॒क्मो न रो॑चत स्वधावः
stanzas.transliteration: ghr̥táṃ ná pūtáṃ tanū́r arepā́ḥ śúci híraṇyam tát te rukmó ná rocata svadhāvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Spotless thy body, brilliant as gold, like clarified butter: This gleams like gold on thee, O Self. dependent.

translations.griffith: Spotless thy body, brilliant as gold, like clarified butter: This gleams like gold on thee, O Self. dependent.
translations.oldenberg: Like purified ghrita is thy stainless body; (it is) brilliant gold: that (body) of thine has shone 1, O self-dependent one, like gold.

stanzas.sanskrit: कृ॒तं चि॒द्धि ष्मा॒ सने॑मि॒ द्वेषोऽग्न॑ इ॒नोषि॒ मर्ता॑त् इ॒त्था यज॑मानादृतावः
stanzas.transliteration: kr̥táṃ cid dhí ṣmā sánemi dvéṣaḥ- -ágna inóṣi mártāt  itthā́ yájamānād r̥tāvaḥ
stanzas.translation: All hate and mischief, yea, if committed, Agni, thou turnest, Holy One, from the man who rightly worships.

translations.griffith: All hate and mischief, yea, if committed, Agni, thou turnest, Holy One, from the man who rightly worships.
translations.oldenberg: For even a malice which one has committed, thou verily drivest away entirely, O righteous Agni, from the sacrificing mortal 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: शि॒वा नः॑ स॒ख्या सन्तु॑ भ्रा॒त्राग्ने॑ दे॒वेषु॑ यु॒ष्मे सा नो॒ नाभिः॒ सद॑ने॒ सस्मि॒न्नूध॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: śivā́ naḥ sakhyā́ sántu bhrātrā́gne devéṣu yuṣmé sā́ no nā́bhiḥ sádane sásminn ū́dhan
stanzas.translation: Agni, with you Gods, prosperous be our friendships and kinships. Be this our bond here by this place, thine al tar.

translations.griffith: Agni, with you Gods, prosperous be our friendships and kinships. Be this our bond here by this place, thine al tar.
translations.oldenberg: May our friendship, O Agni, our brotherhood with you, the gods, be blessed. This is our navel (i. e. relation) in our seat, in this udder 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: भ॒द्रं ते॑ अग्ने सहसि॒न्ननी॑कमुपा॒क आ रो॑चते॒ सूर्य॑स्य रुश॑द्दृ॒शे द॑दृशे नक्त॒या चि॒दरू॑क्षितं दृ॒श आ रू॒पे अन्न॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: bhadráṃ te agne sahasinn ánīkam upāká ā́ rocate sū́ryasya rúśad dr̥śé dadr̥śe naktayā́ cid árūkṣitaṃ dr̥śá ā́ rūpé ánnam
stanzas.translation: THY blessed majesty, victorious Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of Sûrya. Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.

translations.griffith: THY blessed majesty, victorious Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of Sûrya. Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.
translations.oldenberg: Thy auspicious face, O mighty Agni, shines in the neighbourhood of the sun 1. Brilliant to see, it is seen even by night. Soft to behold is the food in thy (beautiful) body 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि षा॑ह्यग्ने गृण॒ते म॑नी॒षां खं वेप॑सा तुविजात॒ स्तवा॑नः विश्वे॑भि॒र्यद्वा॒वनः॑ शुक्र दे॒वैस्तन्नो॑ रास्व सुमहो॒ भूरि॒ मन्म॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví ṣāhy agne gr̥ṇaté manīṣā́ṃ kháṃ vépasā tuvijāta stávānaḥ víśvebhir yád vāvánaḥ śukra devaís tán no rāsva sumaho bhū́ri mánma
stanzas.translation: Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, Strong God! while thou art praised with fervour. Vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn, O Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the Gods thou lovest.

translations.griffith: Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, Strong God! while thou art praised with fervour. Vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn, O Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the Gods thou lovest.
translations.oldenberg: O Agni, disclose (wise) thoughts for him who praises thee; (disclose) the opening, when thou, O strong-born, hast been praised with trembling. Grant unto us, O very great one, such a rich prayer as thou with all the gods wilt hold dear, O brilliant one.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वद॑ग्ने॒ काव्या॒ त्वन्म॑नी॒षास्त्वदु॒क्था जा॑यन्ते॒ राध्या॑नि त्वदे॑ति॒ द्रवि॑णं वी॒रपे॑शा इ॒त्थाधि॑ये दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य
stanzas.transliteration: tvád agne kā́vyā tván manīṣā́s tvád ukthā́ jāyante rā́dhyāni tvád eti dráviṇaṃ vīrápeśāḥ- itthā́dhiye dāśúṣe mártyāya
stanzas.translation: From thee, O Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper; From thee flows wealth, with heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted man who gives oblation.

translations.griffith: From thee, O Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper; From thee flows wealth, with heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted man who gives oblation.
translations.oldenberg: From thee, O Agni, genius is born, from thee (wise) thoughts, from thee beneficent hymns. From thee comes wealth adorned with heroes 1 to the thus-minded mortal who worships thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वद्वा॒जी वा॑जम्भ॒रो विहा॑या अभिष्टि॒कृज्जा॑यते स॒त्यशु॑ष्मः त्वद्र॒यिर्दे॒वजू॑तो मयो॒भुस्त्वदा॒शुर्जू॑जु॒वाँ अ॑ग्ने॒ अर्वा॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvád vājī́ vājambharó víhāyāḥ- abhiṣṭikŕ̥j jāyate satyáśuṣmaḥ tvád rayír devájūto mayobhús tvád āśúr jūjuvā́m̐ agne árvā
stanzas.translation: From thee the hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of help, mighty, of real courage. From thee comes wealth, sent by the Gods, bliss-giving; Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.

translations.griffith: From thee the hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of help, mighty, of real courage. From thee comes wealth, sent by the Gods, bliss-giving; Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the pious mortals seek to win by their prayers as the first, thee the god with agreeable speech, O immortal, who drivest away malice, the household god, the lord of the house, the wise one.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने प्रथ॒मं दे॑व॒यन्तो॑ दे॒वं मर्ता॑ अमृत म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्वम् द्वे॒षो॒युत॒मा वि॑वासन्ति धी॒भिर्दमू॑नसं गृ॒हप॑ति॒ममू॑रम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne prathamáṃ devayánto devám mártā amr̥ta mandrájihvam dveṣoyútam ā́ vivāsanti dhībhír dámūnasaṃ gr̥hápatim ámūram
stanzas.translation: Immortal Agni, thee whose voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as God, religious mortals Invite with hyrnns; thee who removest hatred, Friend of the Home, the household's Lord, unerring.

translations.griffith: Immortal Agni, thee whose voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as God, religious mortals Invite with hyrnns; thee who removest hatred, Friend of the Home, the household's Lord, unerring.
translations.oldenberg: (Drive) far from us senselessness and anguish; (drive) far all ill-will from him whom thou attendest 1. Be gracious at evening, Agni, son of strength, to him whom thou, the god, attendest with welfare.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒रे अ॒स्मदम॑तिमा॒रे अंह॑ आ॒रे विश्वां॑ दुर्म॒तिं यन्नि॒पासि॑ दो॒षा शि॒वः स॑हसः सूनो अग्ने॒ यं दे॒व आ चि॒त्सच॑से स्व॒स्ति
stanzas.transliteration: āré asmád ámatim āré áṃhaḥ- āré víśvāṃ durmatíṃ yán nipā́si doṣā́ śiváḥ sahasaḥ sūno agne yáṃ devá ā́ cit sácase svastí
stanzas.translation: Far from us thou removest want and sorrow, far from us all ill-will when thou protectest. Son of Strength, Agni, blest is he at evening, whom thou as God attendest for his welfare.

translations.griffith: Far from us thou removest want and sorrow, far from us all ill-will when thou protectest. Son of Strength, Agni, blest is he at evening, whom thou as God attendest for his welfare.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त्वाम॑ग्न इ॒नध॑ते य॒तस्रु॒क्त्रिस्ते॒ अन्नं॑ कृ॒णव॒त्सस्मि॒न्नह॑न् स सु द्यु॒म्नैर॒भ्य॑स्तु प्र॒सक्ष॒त्तव॒ क्रत्वा॑ जातवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: yás tvā́m agna inádhate yatásruk trís te ánnaṃ kr̥ṇávat sásminn áhan sá sú dyumnaír abhy àstu prasákṣat táva krátvā jātavedaś cikitvā́n
stanzas.translation: WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day offers thee food, O Agni, May he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, wise through thy mental power, O Jâtavedas.

translations.griffith: WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day offers thee food, O Agni, May he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, wise through thy mental power, O Jâtavedas.
translations.oldenberg: May the man who holds the sacrificial ladle and kindles thee, O Agni, who thrice prepares food for thee on this day, victoriously overcome (his foes) through his lustre, wise through the power of thy mind, O Gâtavedas.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ध्मं यस्ते॑ ज॒भर॑च्छश्रमा॒णो म॒हो अ॑ग्ने॒ अनी॑क॒मा स॑प॒र्यन् स इ॑धा॒नः प्रति॑ दो॒षामु॒षासं॒ पुष्य॑न्र॒यिं स॑चते॒ घ्नन्न॒मित्रा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: idhmáṃ yás te jabhárac chaśramāṇó mahó agne ánīkam ā́ saparyán sá idhānáḥ práti doṣā́m uṣā́sam púṣyan rayíṃ sacate ghnánn amítrān
stanzas.translation: Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of mighty Agni, He, kindling thee at evening and at morning, prospers, and comes to wealth, and slays his foemen.

translations.griffith: Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of mighty Agni, He, kindling thee at evening and at morning, prospers, and comes to wealth, and slays his foemen.
translations.oldenberg: 1 He who toiling brings fuel to thee, doing service to thy, the great (god's) face, O Agni, kindling thee at evening and at dawn—he prospers, obtains wealth, and destroys his enemies.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निरी॑शे बृह॒तः क्ष॒त्रिय॑स्या॒ग्निर्वाज॑स्य पर॒मस्य॑ रा॒यः दधा॑ति॒ रत्नं॑ विध॒ते यवि॑ष्ठो॒ व्या॑नु॒षङ्मर्त्या॑य स्व॒धावा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: agnír īśe br̥hatáḥ kṣatríyasya- -agnír vā́jasya paramásya rāyáḥ dádhāti rátnaṃ vidhaté yáviṣṭho vy ā̀nuṣáṅ mártyāya svadhā́vān
stanzas.translation: Agni is Master of sublime dominion, Agni is Lord of strength and lofty riches. Straightway the self-reliant God, Most Youthful, gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.

translations.griffith: Agni is Master of sublime dominion, Agni is Lord of strength and lofty riches. Straightway the self-reliant God, Most Youthful, gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.
translations.oldenberg: Agni is master of mighty royal power 1; Agni (is master) of gain, of the highest wealth. He, the youngest, self-dependent (god) in the right way distributes treasures to the mortal worshipper.

stanzas.sanskrit: यच्चि॒द्धि ते॑ पुरुष॒त्रा य॑वि॒ष्ठाचि॑त्तिभिश्चकृ॒मा कच्चि॒दागः॑ कृ॒धी ष्व१॒॑स्माँ अदि॑ते॒रना॑गा॒न्व्येनां॑सि शिश्रथो॒ विष्व॑गग्ने
stanzas.transliteration: yác cid dhí te puruṣatrā́ yaviṣṭha- -ácittibhiś cakr̥mā́ kác cid ā́gaḥ kr̥dhī́ ṣv àsmā́m̐ áditer ánāgān vy énāṃsi śiśratho víṣvag agne
stanzas.translation: Most Youthful God, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as human beings, have committed, In sight of Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, Agni, our offences.

translations.griffith: Most Youthful God, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as human beings, have committed, In sight of Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, Agni, our offences.
translations.oldenberg: Whatever sin, O youngest (god), we have committed against thee in thoughtlessness, men as we are 1, make thou us sinless before Aditi; release us from (every) guilt on all sides, O Agni!

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हश्चि॑दग्न॒ एन॑सो अ॒भीक॑ ऊ॒र्वाद्दे॒वाना॑मु॒त मर्त्या॑नाम् मा ते॒ सखा॑यः॒ सद॒मिद्रि॑षाम॒ यच्छा॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय॒ शं योः
stanzas.transliteration: maháś cid agna énaso abhī́ke- ūrvā́d devā́nām utá mártyānām mā́ te sákhāyaḥ sádam íd riṣāma yáchā tokā́ya tánayāya śáṃ yóḥ
stanzas.translation: Even in the presence of great sin, O Agni, free us from prison of the Gods or mortals. Never may we who are thy friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.

translations.griffith: Even in the presence of great sin, O Agni, free us from prison of the Gods or mortals. Never may we who are thy friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.
translations.oldenberg: Even from great guilt, O Agni, from the prison of gods and of mortals—let us, thy friends, never be harmed; grant luck and weal to kith and kin.

stanzas.sanskrit: यथा॑ ह॒ त्यद्व॑सवो गौ॒र्यं॑ चित्प॒दि षि॒ताममु॑ञ्चता यजत्राः ए॒वो ष्व१॒॑स्मन्मु॑ञ्चता॒ व्यंहः॒ प्र ता॑र्यग्ने प्रत॒रं न॒ आयुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáthā ha tyád vasavo gauryàṃ cit padí ṣitā́m ámuñcatā yajatrāḥ evó ṣv àsmán muñcatā vy áṃhaḥ prá tāry agne prataráṃ na ā́yuḥ
stanzas.translation: Even as ye here, Gods Excellent and Holy, have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered, So also set us free from this affliction long let our life, O Agni, be extended.

translations.griffith: Even as ye here, Gods Excellent and Holy, have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered, So also set us free from this affliction long let our life, O Agni, be extended.
translations.oldenberg: 1 As you formerly have released, O Vasus, the buffalo cow bound by the foot, O worshipful gods, thus take away from us this distress. May, O Agni, our life be further prolonged.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रत्य॒ग्निरु॒षसा॒मग्र॑मख्यद्विभाती॒नां सु॒मना॑ रत्न॒धेय॑म् या॒तम॑श्विना सु॒कृतो॑ दुरो॒णमुत्सूर्यो॒ ज्योति॑षा दे॒व ए॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: práty agnír uṣásām ágram akhyad vibhātīnā́ṃ sumánā ratnadhéyam yātám aśvinā sukŕ̥to duroṇám út sū́ryo jyótiṣā devá eti
stanzas.translation: AGNI hath looked, benevolently-minded, on the wealth-giving spring of radiant Mornings. Come, Aṣvins, to the dwelling of the pious: Sûrya the God is rising with his splendour.

translations.griffith: AGNI hath looked, benevolently-minded, on the wealth-giving spring of radiant Mornings. Come, Aṣvins, to the dwelling of the pious: Sûrya the God is rising with his splendour.
translations.oldenberg: Benevolent Agni has looked on the breaking of the shining dawns, on the bestowal of treasures. Come to the dwelling of the virtuous (mortal), ye Asvins. The god Sûrya rises with his light.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्ध्वं भा॒नुं स॑वि॒ता दे॒वो अ॑श्रेद्द्र॒प्सं दवि॑ध्वद्गवि॒षो न सत्वा॑ अनु॑ व्र॒तं वरु॑णो यन्ति मि॒त्रो यत्सूर्यं॑ दि॒व्या॑रो॒हय॑न्ति
stanzas.transliteration: ūrdhvám bhānúṃ savitā́ devó aśred drapsáṃ dávidhvad gaviṣó ná sátvā ánu vratáṃ váruṇo yanti mitró yát sū́ryaṃ divy ā̀roháyanti
stanzas.translation: Savitar, God, hath spread on high his lustre, waving his flag like a spoil-seeking hero. Their stablished way go Varuṇa and Mitra, what time they make the Sun ascend the heaven.

translations.griffith: Savitar, God, hath spread on high his lustre, waving his flag like a spoil-seeking hero. Their stablished way go Varuṇa and Mitra, what time they make the Sun ascend the heaven.
translations.oldenberg: The god Savitri has sent his light upward 1, shaking his banner 2 like a warrior who fights for cows 3. Varuna and Mitra follow the law, when they make the Sun rise on heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं सी॒मकृ॑ण्व॒न्तम॑से वि॒पृचे॑ ध्रु॒वक्षे॑मा॒ अन॑वस्यन्तो॒ अर्थ॑म् तं सूर्यं॑ ह॒रितः॑ स॒प्त य॒ह्वीः स्पशं॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ जग॑तो वहन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ sīm ákr̥ṇvan támase vipŕ̥ce dhruvákṣemā ánavasyanto ártham táṃ sū́ryaṃ harítaḥ saptá yahvī́ḥ- spáśaṃ víśvasya jágato vahanti
stanzas.translation: Him whom they made to drive away the darkness, Lords of sure mansions, constant to their object, Him who beholds the universe, the Sun-God, seven strong and youthful Coursers carry onward.

translations.griffith: Him whom they made to drive away the darkness, Lords of sure mansions, constant to their object, Him who beholds the universe, the Sun-God, seven strong and youthful Coursers carry onward.
translations.oldenberg: Him whom (the gods) dwelling in firm peace, and never losing their object, have created for dispersing the darkness—Him, the Sun, the all-observer, the seven young fallow mares carry forward.

stanzas.sanskrit: वहि॑ष्ठेभिर्वि॒हर॑न्यासि॒ तन्तु॑मव॒व्यय॒न्नसि॑तं देव॒ वस्म॑ दवि॑ध्वतो र॒श्मयः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ चर्मे॒वावा॑धु॒स्तमो॑ अ॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तः
stanzas.transliteration: váhiṣṭhebhir viháran yāsi tántum avavyáyann ásitaṃ deva vásma dávidhvato raśmáyaḥ sū́ryasya cármevā́vādhus támo apsv àntáḥ
stanzas.translation: Spreading thy web with mightiest Steeds thou comest, rending apart, thou God, the black-hued mantle. The rays of Sûrya tremulously shining sink, like a hide, the darkness in the waters.

translations.griffith: Spreading thy web with mightiest Steeds thou comest, rending apart, thou God, the black-hued mantle. The rays of Sûrya tremulously shining sink, like a hide, the darkness in the waters.
translations.oldenberg: With (thy horses) most ready to run thou goest 1 forward, spreading out thy web (of light), removing (from the world) the black cloth (of darkness), O god. The rays of the Sun have shaken 2 the darkness, and have sunk it into the waters like a hide.

stanzas.sanskrit: अना॑यतो॒ अनि॑बद्धः क॒थायं न्य॑ङ्ङुत्ता॒नोऽव॑ पद्यते॒ न कया॑ याति स्व॒धया॒ को द॑दर्श दि॒वः स्क॒म्भः समृ॑तः पाति॒ नाक॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ánāyato ánibaddhaḥ kathā́yáṃ nyàṅṅ uttānó 'va padyate ná káyā yāti svadháyā kó dadarśa divá skambháḥ sámr̥taḥ pāti nā́kam
stanzas.translation: How is it that, unbound and not supported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self power moves he? Who liath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar.

translations.griffith: How is it that, unbound and not supported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self power moves he? Who liath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar.
translations.oldenberg: Unsupported, unattached, spread out downwards-turned—how is it that he 1 does not fall down? By what power of his does he move? Who has seen (that)? Erected as the pillar of Heaven he protects the firmament.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रत्य॒ग्निरु॒षसो॑ जा॒तवे॑दा॒ अख्य॑द्दे॒वो रोच॑माना॒ महो॑भिः आ ना॑सत्योरुगा॒या रथे॑ने॒मं य॒ज्ञमुप॑ नो यात॒मच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: práty agnír uṣáso jātávedāḥ- ákhyad devó rócamānā máhobhiḥ ā́ nāsatyorugāyā́ ráthena- -imáṃ yajñám úpa no yātam ácha
stanzas.translation: THE God hath looked, even Agni Jâtavedas, to meet the Dawns refulgent in their glories. Come on your chariot, ye who travel widely, come to this sacrifice of ours, Nâsatyas.

translations.griffith: THE God hath looked, even Agni Jâtavedas, to meet the Dawns refulgent in their glories. Come on your chariot, ye who travel widely, come to this sacrifice of ours, Nâsatyas.
translations.oldenberg: Agni Gâtavedas, the god, has looked on the dawns that shine with all their might 1. Come hither, O Nâsatyas 2, wide-ruling (gods), on your chariot to this our sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्ध्वं के॒तुं स॑वि॒ता दे॒वो अ॑श्रे॒ज्ज्योति॒र्विश्व॑स्मै॒ भुव॑नाय कृ॒ण्वन् आप्रा॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ वि सूर्यो॑ र॒श्मिभि॒श्चेकि॑तानः
stanzas.transliteration: ūrdhváṃ ketúṃ savitā́ devó aśrej jyótir víśvasmai bhúvanāya kr̥ṇván ā́prā dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ antárikṣaṃ ví sū́ryo raśmíbhiś cékitānaḥ
stanzas.translation: Producing light for all the world of creatures, God Savitar hath raised aloft his banner. Making his presence known by sunbeams, Sûrya hath filled the firmament and earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: Producing light for all the world of creatures, God Savitar hath raised aloft his banner. Making his presence known by sunbeams, Sûrya hath filled the firmament and earth and heaven.
translations.oldenberg: The god Savitri has sent his shine upward, producing light for the whole world. The Sun, shining with his rays, has filled Heaven and Earth and the air.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒वह॑न्त्यरु॒णीर्ज्योति॒षागा॑न्म॒ही चि॒त्रा र॒श्मिभि॒श्चेकि॑ताना प्र॒बो॒धय॑न्ती सुवि॒ताय॑ दे॒व्यु१॒॑षा ई॑यते सु॒युजा॒ रथे॑न
stanzas.transliteration: āváhanty aruṇī́r jyótiṣā́gāt- mahī́ citrā́ raśmíbhiś cékitānā prabodháyantī suvitā́ya devī́- -uṣā́ īyate suyújā ráthena
stanzas.translation: Red Dawn.is come, riding with brightness onward, distinguished by her beams, gay-hued and mighty. Dawn on her nobly-harnessed car, the Goddess, awaking men to happiness, approacheth.

translations.griffith: Red Dawn.is come, riding with brightness onward, distinguished by her beams, gay-hued and mighty. Dawn on her nobly-harnessed car, the Goddess, awaking men to happiness, approacheth.
translations.oldenberg: The red one 1, carrying hither (bliss) 2, has come with her light, the great, brilliant one, shining with her rays. Ushas, the goddess, awakening (all beings) to welfare, goes along on her well-yoked chariot.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वां॒ वहि॑ष्ठा इ॒ह ते व॑हन्तु॒ रथा॒ अश्वा॑स उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ इ॒मे हि वां॑ मधु॒पेया॑य॒ सोमा॑ अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे वृ॑षणा मादयेथाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ váhiṣṭhā ihá té vahantu ráthā áśvāsa uṣáso vyùṣṭau imé hí vām madhupéyāya sómāḥ- asmín yajñé vr̥ṣaṇā mādayethām
stanzas.translation: May those most powerful steeds and chariot bring you, O Aṣvins, hither at the break of morning. Here for your drauglit of meath are Soma juices: at this our sacrifice rejoice, ye Mighty.

translations.griffith: May those most powerful steeds and chariot bring you, O Aṣvins, hither at the break of morning. Here for your drauglit of meath are Soma juices: at this our sacrifice rejoice, ye Mighty.
translations.oldenberg: May those chariots and horses, most ready to drive, drive you 1 hither at the break of dawn. For these Somas are for you that you may drink the honey-drink 2. Rejoice, O manly ones, at this sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: अना॑यतो॒ अनि॑बद्धः क॒थायं न्य॑ङ्ङुत्ता॒नोऽव॑ पद्यते॒ न कया॑ याति स्व॒धया॒ को द॑दर्श दि॒वः स्क॒म्भः समृ॑तः पाति॒ नाक॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ánāyato ánibaddhaḥ kathā́yáṃ nyàṅṅ uttānó 'va padyate ná káyā yāti svadháyā kó dadarśa divá skambháḥ sámr̥taḥ pāti nā́kam
stanzas.translation: How is it that, unbound and unsupported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self-power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar?

translations.griffith: How is it that, unbound and unsupported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self-power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar?

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्होता॑ नो अध्व॒रे वा॒जी सन्परि॑ णीयते दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॑ य॒ज्ञियः॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnír hótā no adhvaré vājī́ sán pári ṇīyate devó devéṣu yajñíyaḥ
stanzas.translation: AGNI the Herald, like a horse, is led forth at our solemn rite, God among Gods adorable.

translations.griffith: AGNI the Herald, like a horse, is led forth at our solemn rite, God among Gods adorable.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the Hotri, he who is a strong horse, is led around at our sacrifice, the god worshipful among the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॑ त्रिवि॒ष्ट्य॑ध्व॒रं यात्य॒ग्नी र॒थीरि॑व आ दे॒वेषु॒ प्रयो॒ दध॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: pári triviṣṭy àdhvaráṃ yā́ty agnī́ rathī́r iva ā́ devéṣu práyo dádhat
stanzas.translation: Three times unto our solemn rite comes Agni like a charioteer, Bearing the viands to the Gods.

translations.griffith: Three times unto our solemn rite comes Agni like a charioteer, Bearing the viands to the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Agni goes thrice 1 around the sacrifice, like a charioteer, conveying the enjoyment 2 to the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॒ वाज॑पतिः क॒विर॒ग्निर्ह॒व्यान्य॑क्रमीत् दध॒द्रत्ना॑नि दा॒शुषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: pári vā́japatiḥ kavír agnír havyā́ny akramīt dádhad rátnāni dāśúṣe
stanzas.translation: Round the oblations hath he paced, Agni the Wise, the Lord of Strength, Giving the offerer precious boons.

translations.griffith: Round the oblations hath he paced, Agni the Wise, the Lord of Strength, Giving the offerer precious boons.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the lord of booty, the sage, has circumambulated the oblations, bestowing treasures on the worshipper.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं यः सृञ्ज॑ये पु॒रो दै॑ववा॒ते स॑मि॒ध्यते॑ द्यु॒माँ अ॑मित्र॒दम्भ॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ yáḥ sŕ̥ñjaye puró daivavāté samidhyáte dyumā́m̐ amitradámbhanaḥ
stanzas.translation: He who is kindled eastward for Sr̥injaya, Devavâta's son, Resplendent, tamer of the foe.

translations.griffith: He who is kindled eastward for Sr̥injaya, Devavâta's son, Resplendent, tamer of the foe.
translations.oldenberg: This (is the Agni) who is kindled in the front for Devavâta's son, the Sriñgaya 1, the brilliant (god), the deceiver of foes.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्य॑ घा वी॒र ईव॑तो॒ऽग्नेरी॑शीत॒ मर्त्यः॑ ति॒ग्मज॑म्भस्य मी॒ळ्हुषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ásya ghā vīrá ī́vato -agnér īśīta mártyaḥ tigmájambhasya mīḷhúṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: So mighty be the Agni whom the mortal hero shall command, With sharpened teeth and bountiful.

translations.griffith: So mighty be the Agni whom the mortal hero shall command, With sharpened teeth and bountiful.
translations.oldenberg: May the strong mortal be the master of this (god), of an Agni like this, with sharp teeth and bountiful.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमर्व॑न्तं॒ न सा॑न॒सिम॑रु॒षं न दि॒वः शिशु॑म् म॒र्मृ॒ज्यन्ते॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: tám árvantaṃ ná sānasím aruṣáṃ ná diváḥ śíśum marmr̥jyánte divé-dive
stanzas.translation: Day after day they dress him, as they clean a horse who wins the prize. Dress the red Scion of the Sky.

translations.griffith: Day after day they dress him, as they clean a horse who wins the prize. Dress the red Scion of the Sky.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Him they clean day by day like a racer that wins (booty), like (Soma), the red young child of Heaven 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: बोध॒द्यन्मा॒ हरि॑भ्यां कुमा॒रः सा॑हदे॒व्यः अच्छा॒ न हू॒त उद॑रम्
stanzas.transliteration: bódhad yán mā háribhyāṃ kumāráḥ sāhadevyáḥ áchā ná hūtá úd aram
stanzas.translation: When Sahadeva's princely son with two bay horses thought of me, Summoned by him I drew not back.

translations.griffith: When Sahadeva's princely son with two bay horses thought of me, Summoned by him I drew not back.
translations.oldenberg: When Sahadeva's son, the prince, thought of me with two bay horses 1, I rose up like one who is called.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्या य॑ज॒ता हरी॑ कुमा॒रात्सा॑हदे॒व्यात् प्रय॑ता स॒द्य आ द॑दे
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyā́ yajatā́ hárī kumārā́t sāhadevyā́t práyatā sadyá ā́ dade
stanzas.translation: And truly those two noble bays I straightway took when offered me, From Sahadeva's princely son.

translations.griffith: And truly those two noble bays I straightway took when offered me, From Sahadeva's princely son.
translations.oldenberg: And immediately I accepted from Sahadeva's son, the prince, those adorable two bay horses which he offered me.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष वां॑ देवावश्विना कुमा॒रः सा॑हदे॒व्यः दी॒र्घायु॑रस्तु॒ सोम॑कः
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá vāṃ devāv aśvinā kumāráḥ sāhadevyáḥ dīrghā́yur astu sómakaḥ
stanzas.translation: Long, O ye Aṣvins, may he live, your care, ye Gods, the princely son. Of Sahadeva, Somaka.

translations.griffith: Long, O ye Aṣvins, may he live, your care, ye Gods, the princely son. Of Sahadeva, Somaka.
translations.oldenberg: May this prince Somaka, Sahadeva's son, live long, for your sake, O divine Asvins!

stanzas.sanskrit: तं यु॒वं दे॑वावश्विना कुमा॒रं सा॑हदे॒व्यम् दी॒र्घायु॑षं कृणोतन
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ yuváṃ devāv aśvinā kumāráṃ sāhadevyám dīrghā́yuṣaṃ kr̥ṇotana
stanzas.translation: Cause him the youthful prince, the son of Sahadeva, to enjoy Long life, O Aṣvins, O ye Gods.

translations.griffith: Cause him the youthful prince, the son of Sahadeva, to enjoy Long life, O Aṣvins, O ye Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Give long life, O divine Asvins, to this son of Sahadeva, the prince!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ स॒त्यो या॑तु म॒घवाँ॑ ऋजी॒षी द्रव॑न्त्वस्य॒ हर॑य॒ उप॑ नः तस्मा॒ इदन्धः॑ सुषुमा सु॒दक्ष॑मि॒हाभि॑पि॒त्वं क॑रते गृणा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ satyó yātu maghávām̐ r̥jīṣī́ drávantv asya háraya úpa naḥ tásmā íd ándhaḥ suṣumā sudákṣam ihā́bhipitváṃ karate gr̥ṇānáḥ
stanzas.translation: IMPETUOUS, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his Tawny Coursers speed to reach us. For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.

translations.griffith: IMPETUOUS, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his Tawny Coursers speed to reach us. For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑ स्य शू॒राध्व॑नो॒ नान्ते॒ऽस्मिन्नो॑ अ॒द्य सव॑ने म॒न्दध्यै॑ शंसा॑त्यु॒क्थमु॒शने॑व वे॒धाश्चि॑कि॒तुषे॑ असु॒र्या॑य॒ मन्म॑
stanzas.transliteration: áva sya śūrā́dhvano nā́nte -asmín no adyá sávane mandádhyai śáṃsāty ukthám uśáneva vedhā́ś cikitúṣe asuryā̀ya mánma
stanzas.translation: Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation. Like Uṣanâ, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.

translations.griffith: Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation. Like Uṣanâ, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒विर्न नि॒ण्यं वि॒दथा॑नि॒ साध॒न्वृषा॒ यत्सेकं॑ विपिपा॒नो अर्चा॑त् दि॒व इ॒त्था जी॑जनत्स॒प्त का॒रूनह्ना॑ चिच्चक्रुर्व॒युना॑ गृ॒णन्तः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kavír ná niṇyáṃ vidáthāni sā́dhan vŕ̥ṣā yát sékaṃ vipipānó árcāt divá itthā́ jījanat saptá kārū́n áhnā cic cakrur vayúnā gr̥ṇántaḥ
stanzas.translation: When the Bull, quaffing, praises our Iibation, as a sage paying holy rites in secret, Seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten, who e'en by day have wrought their works while singing.

translations.griffith: When the Bull, quaffing, praises our Iibation, as a sage paying holy rites in secret, Seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten, who e'en by day have wrought their works while singing.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व१॒॑र्यद्वेदि॑ सु॒दृशी॑कम॒र्कैर्महि॒ ज्योती॑ रुरुचु॒र्यद्ध॒ वस्तोः॑ अ॒न्धा तमां॑सि॒ दुधि॑ता वि॒चक्षे॒ नृभ्य॑श्चकार॒ नृत॑मो अ॒भिष्टौ॑
stanzas.transliteration: svàr yád védi sudŕ̥śīkam arkaír máhi jyótī rurucur yád dha vástoḥ andhā́ támāṃsi dúdhitā vicákṣe nŕ̥bhyaś cakāra nŕ̥tamo abhíṣṭau
stanzas.translation: When heaven's fair light by hymns was made apparent (they made great splendour shine at break of morning), He with his succour, best of Heroes, scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.

translations.griffith: When heaven's fair light by hymns was made apparent (they made great splendour shine at break of morning), He with his succour, best of Heroes, scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒व॒क्ष इन्द्रो॒ अमि॑तमृजी॒ष्यु१॒॑भे आ प॑प्रौ॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा अत॑श्चिदस्य महि॒मा वि रे॑च्य॒भि यो विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना ब॒भूव॑
stanzas.transliteration: vavakṣá índro ámitam r̥jīṣī́- ubhé ā́ paprau ródasī mahitvā́ átaś cid asya mahimā́ ví reci- abhí yó víśvā bhúvanā babhū́va
stanzas.translation: Indra, Impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven. E'en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.

translations.griffith: Indra, Impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven. E'en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॑नि श॒क्रो नर्या॑णि वि॒द्वान॒पो रि॑रेच॒ सखि॑भि॒र्निका॑मैः अश्मा॑नं चि॒द्ये बि॑भि॒दुर्वचो॑भिर्व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तमु॒शिजो॒ वि व॑व्रुः
stanzas.transliteration: víśvāni śakró náryāṇi vidvā́n apó rireca sákhibhir níkāmaiḥ áśmānaṃ cid yé bibhidúr vácobhir vrajáṃ gómantam uśíjo ví vavruḥ
stanzas.translation: Ṣakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager Friends let loose the waters. They with their songs cleft e'en the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.

translations.griffith: Ṣakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager Friends let loose the waters. They with their songs cleft e'en the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒पो वृ॒त्रं व॑व्रि॒वांसं॒ परा॑ह॒न्प्राव॑त्ते॒ वज्रं॑ पृथि॒वी सचे॑ताः प्रार्णां॑सि समु॒द्रिया॑ण्यैनोः॒ पति॒र्भव॒ञ्छव॑सा शूर धृष्णो
stanzas.transliteration: apó vr̥tráṃ vavrivā́ṃsam párāhan prā́vat te vájram pr̥thivī́ sácetāḥ prā́rṇāṃsi samudríyāṇy ainoḥ pátir bhávañ chávasā śūra dhr̥ṣṇo
stanzas.translation: He smote away the floods' obstructer, Vr̥itra; Earth, conscious, lent her aid to speed thy thunder. Thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean, as Lord through power and might, O daring Hero.

translations.griffith: He smote away the floods' obstructer, Vr̥itra; Earth, conscious, lent her aid to speed thy thunder. Thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean, as Lord through power and might, O daring Hero.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒पो यदद्रिं॑ पुरुहूत॒ दर्द॑रा॒विर्भु॑वत्स॒रमा॑ पू॒र्व्यं ते॑ स नो॑ ने॒ता वाज॒मा द॑र्षि॒ भूरिं॑ गो॒त्रा रु॒जन्नङ्गि॑रोभिर्गृणा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: apó yád ádrim puruhūta dárdar āvír bhuvat sarámā pūrvyáṃ te sá no netā́ vā́jam ā́ darṣi bhū́riṃ gotrā́ rujánn áṅgirobhir gr̥ṇānáḥ
stanzas.translation: When, Much-invoked! the water's rock thou cleftest, Saramâ showed herself and went before thee. Hymned by Angirases, bursting the cowstalls, much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.

translations.griffith: When, Much-invoked! the water's rock thou cleftest, Saramâ showed herself and went before thee. Hymned by Angirases, bursting the cowstalls, much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ क॒विं नृ॑मणो गा अ॒भिष्टौ॒ स्व॑र्षाता मघव॒न्नाध॑मानम् ऊ॒तिभि॒स्तमि॑षणो द्यु॒म्नहू॑तौ॒ नि मा॒यावा॒नब्र॑ह्मा॒ दस्यु॑रर्त
stanzas.transliteration: áchā kavíṃ nr̥maṇo gā abhíṣṭau svàrṣātā maghavan nā́dhamānam ūtíbhis tám iṣaṇo dyumnáhūtau ní māyā́vān ábrahmā dásyur arta
stanzas.translation: Come, Maghavan, Friend of Man, to aid the singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight. Speed him with help in his irypired invokings: down sink the sorcerer, the prayerless Dasyu.

translations.griffith: Come, Maghavan, Friend of Man, to aid the singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight. Speed him with help in his irypired invokings: down sink the sorcerer, the prayerless Dasyu.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ द॑स्यु॒घ्ना मन॑सा या॒ह्यस्तं॒ भुव॑त्ते॒ कुत्सः॑ स॒ख्ये निका॑मः स्वे योनौ॒ नि ष॑दतं॒ सरू॑पा॒ वि वां॑ चिकित्सदृत॒चिद्ध॒ नारी॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ dasyughnā́ mánasā yāhy ástam bhúvat te kútsaḥ sakhyé níkāmaḥ své yónau ní ṣadataṃ sárūpā ví vāṃ cikitsad r̥tacíd dha nā́rī
stanzas.translation: Come to our home resolved to slay the Dasyu: Kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship. Alike in form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful Lady was in doubt between you.

translations.griffith: Come to our home resolved to slay the Dasyu: Kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship. Alike in form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful Lady was in doubt between you.

stanzas.sanskrit: यासि॒ कुत्से॑न स॒रथ॑मव॒स्युस्तो॒दो वात॑स्य॒ हर्यो॒रीशा॑नः ऋ॒ज्रा वाजं॒ न गध्यं॒ युयू॑षन्क॒विर्यदह॒न्पार्या॑य॒ भूषा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: yā́si kútsena sarátham avasyús todó vā́tasya háryor ī́śānaḥ r̥jrā́ vā́jaṃ ná gádhyaṃ yúyūṣan kavír yád áhan pā́ryāya bhū́ṣāt
stanzas.translation: Thou comest, fain to succour him, with Kutsa,– a goad that masters both the Wind-God's horses, That, holding the brown steeds like spoil for capture, the sage may on the final day be present.

translations.griffith: Thou comest, fain to succour him, with Kutsa,– a goad that masters both the Wind-God's horses, That, holding the brown steeds like spoil for capture, the sage may on the final day be present.

stanzas.sanskrit: कुत्सा॑य॒ शुष्ण॑म॒शुषं॒ नि ब॑र्हीः प्रपि॒त्वे अह्नः॒ कुय॑वं स॒हस्रा॑ स॒द्यो दस्यू॒न्प्र मृ॑ण कु॒त्स्येन॒ प्र सूर॑श्च॒क्रं वृ॑हताद॒भीके॑
stanzas.transliteration: kútsāya śúṣṇam aśúṣaṃ ní barhīḥ prapitvé áhnaḥ kúyavaṃ sahásrā sadyó dásyūn prá mr̥ṇa kutsyéna prá sū́raś cakráṃ vr̥hatād abhī́ke
stanzas.translation: For Kutsa, with thy thousand, thou at day-break didst hurl down greedy Ṣushṇa, foe of harvest. Quickly with Kutsa's friend destroy the Dasyus, and roll the chariot-wheel of Sarya near us.

translations.griffith: For Kutsa, with thy thousand, thou at day-break didst hurl down greedy Ṣushṇa, foe of harvest. Quickly with Kutsa's friend destroy the Dasyus, and roll the chariot-wheel of Sarya near us.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं पिप्रुं॒ मृग॑यं शूशु॒वांस॑मृ॒जिश्व॑ने वैदथि॒नाय॑ रन्धीः प॒ञ्चा॒शत्कृ॒ष्णा नि व॑पः स॒हस्रात्कं॒ न पुरो॑ जरि॒मा वि द॑र्दः
stanzas.transliteration: tvám píprum mŕ̥gayaṃ śūśuvā́ṃsam r̥jíśvane vaidathinā́ya randhīḥ pañcāśát kr̥ṣṇā́ ní vapaḥ sahásrā- -átkaṃ ná púro jarimā́ ví dardaḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou to the son of Vidathin, R̥ijiṣvan, gavest up mighty Mr̥igaya and Pipru. Thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand, and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.

translations.griffith: Thou to the son of Vidathin, R̥ijiṣvan, gavest up mighty Mr̥igaya and Pipru. Thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand, and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.

stanzas.sanskrit: सूर॑ उपा॒के त॒न्वं१॒॑ दधा॑नो॒ वि यत्ते॒ चेत्य॒मृत॑स्य॒ वर्पः॑ मृ॒गो न ह॒स्ती तवि॑षीमुषा॒णः सिं॒हो न भी॒म आयु॑धानि॒ बिभ्र॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: sū́ra upāké tanvàṃ dádhāno ví yát te céty amŕ̥tasya várpaḥ mr̥gó ná hastī́ táviṣīm uṣāṇáḥ siṃhó ná bhīmá ā́yudhāni bíbhrat
stanzas.translation: What time thou settest near the Sun thy body, thy form, Immortal One, is seen expanding: Thou a wild elephant with might invested. like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.

translations.griffith: What time thou settest near the Sun thy body, thy form, Immortal One, is seen expanding: Thou a wild elephant with might invested. like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रं॒ कामा॑ वसू॒यन्तो॑ अग्म॒न्त्स्व॑र्मीळ्हे॒ न सव॑ने चका॒नाः श्र॒व॒स्यवः॑ शशमा॒नास॑ उ॒क्थैरोको॒ न र॒ण्वा सु॒दृशी॑व पु॒ष्टिः
stanzas.transliteration: índraṃ kā́mā vasūyánto agman svàrmīḷhe ná sávane cakānā́ḥ śravasyávaḥ śaśamānā́sa ukthaír óko ná raṇvā́ sudŕ̥śīva puṣṭíḥ
stanzas.translation: Wishes for wealth have gone to Indra, longing for him in war for light and at libation, Eager for glory, labouring with praisesongs: he is like home, like sweet and fair nutrition.

translations.griffith: Wishes for wealth have gone to Indra, longing for him in war for light and at libation, Eager for glory, labouring with praisesongs: he is like home, like sweet and fair nutrition.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमिद्व॒ इन्द्रं॑ सु॒हवं॑ हुवेम॒ यस्ता च॒कार॒ नर्या॑ पु॒रूणि॑ यो माव॑ते जरि॒त्रे गध्यं॑ चिन्म॒क्षू वाजं॒ भर॑ति स्पा॒र्हरा॑धाः
stanzas.transliteration: tám íd va índraṃ suhávaṃ huvema yás tā́ cakā́ra náryā purū́ṇi yó mā́vate jaritré gádhyaṃ cit- makṣū́ vā́jam bhárati spārhárādhāḥ
stanzas.translation: Call we for you that Indra, prompt to listen, him who hath done so much for men's advantage; Who, Lord of envied bounty, to a singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.

translations.griffith: Call we for you that Indra, prompt to listen, him who hath done so much for men's advantage; Who, Lord of envied bounty, to a singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.

stanzas.sanskrit: ति॒ग्मा यद॒न्तर॒शनिः॒ पता॑ति॒ कस्मि॑ञ्चिच्छूर मुहु॒के जना॑नाम् घो॒रा यद॑र्य॒ समृ॑ति॒र्भवा॒त्यध॑ स्मा नस्त॒न्वो॑ बोधि गो॒पाः
stanzas.transliteration: tigmā́ yád antár aśániḥ pátāti kásmiñ cic chūra muhuké jánānām ghorā́ yád arya sámr̥tir bhávāti- ádha smā nas tanvò bodhi gopā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: When the sharp-pointed arrow, O thou Hero, flieth mid any conflict of the people, When, Faithful One, the dread encounter cometh, then be thou the Protector of our body.

translations.griffith: When the sharp-pointed arrow, O thou Hero, flieth mid any conflict of the people, When, Faithful One, the dread encounter cometh, then be thou the Protector of our body.

stanzas.sanskrit: भुवो॑ऽवि॒ता वा॒मदे॑वस्य धी॒नां भुवः॒ सखा॑वृ॒को वाज॑सातौ त्वामनु॒ प्रम॑ति॒मा ज॑गन्मोरु॒शंसो॑ जरि॒त्रे वि॒श्वध॑ स्याः
stanzas.transliteration: bhúvo 'vitā́ vāmádevasya dhīnā́m bhúvaḥ sákhāvr̥kó vā́jasātau tvā́m ánu prámatim ā́ jaganma- -uruśáṃso jaritré viśvádha syāḥ
stanzas.translation: Further the holy thoughts of Vâmadeva be thou a guileless Friend in fight for booty. We come to thee whose providence protects us: wide be thy sway for ever for thy singer.

translations.griffith: Further the holy thoughts of Vâmadeva be thou a guileless Friend in fight for booty. We come to thee whose providence protects us: wide be thy sway for ever for thy singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒भिर्नृभि॑रिन्द्र त्वा॒युभि॑ष्ट्वा म॒घव॑द्भिर्मघव॒न्विश्व॑ आ॒जौ द्यावो॒ न द्यु॒म्नैर॒भि सन्तो॑ अ॒र्यः क्ष॒पो म॑देम श॒रद॑श्च पू॒र्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: ebhír nŕ̥bhir indra tvāyúbhiṣ ṭvā maghávadbhir maghavan víśva ājaú dyā́vo ná dyumnaír abhí sánto aryáḥ kṣapó madema śarádaś ca pūrvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: O Indra, with these men who love thee truly, free givers, Maghavan, in every battle, May we rejoice through many autumns, quelling our foes, as days subdue the nights with splendour.

translations.griffith: O Indra, with these men who love thee truly, free givers, Maghavan, in every battle, May we rejoice through many autumns, quelling our foes, as days subdue the nights with splendour.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वेदिन्द्रा॑य वृष॒भाय॒ वृष्णे॒ ब्रह्मा॑कर्म॒ भृग॑वो॒ न रथ॑म् नू चि॒द्यथा॑ नः स॒ख्या वि॒योष॒दस॑न्न उ॒ग्रो॑ऽवि॒ता त॑नू॒पाः
stanzas.transliteration: evéd índrāya vr̥ṣabhā́ya vŕ̥ṣṇe bráhmākarma bhŕ̥gavo ná rátham nū́ cid yáthā naḥ sakhyā́ viyóṣad ásan na ugrò 'vitā́ tanūpā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, as the Bhr̥igus wrought a car, for Indra the Strong, the Mighty, we our prayer have fashioned, That he may, ne'er withdraw from us his friendship, but be our bodies' guard and strong defender.

translations.griffith: Now, as the Bhr̥igus wrought a car, for Indra the Strong, the Mighty, we our prayer have fashioned, That he may, ne'er withdraw from us his friendship, but be our bodies' guard and strong defender.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell. high like rivers for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell. high like rivers for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं म॒हाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॑ ह॒ क्षा अनु॑ क्ष॒त्रं मं॒हना॑ मन्यत॒ द्यौः त्वं वृ॒त्रं शव॑सा जघ॒न्वान्त्सृ॒जः सिन्धूँ॒रहि॑ना जग्रसा॒नान्
stanzas.transliteration: tvám mahā́m̐ indra túbhyaṃ ha kṣā́ḥ- ánu kṣatrám maṃhánā manyata dyaúḥ tváṃ vr̥tráṃ śávasā jaghanvā́n sr̥jáḥ síndhūm̐r áhinā jagrasānā́n
stanzas.translation: GREAT art thou, Indra; yea, the earth, with gladness, and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion. Thou in thy vigour having slaughtered Vr̥itra didst free the floods arrested by the Dragon.

translations.griffith: GREAT art thou, Indra; yea, the earth, with gladness, and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion. Thou in thy vigour having slaughtered Vr̥itra didst free the floods arrested by the Dragon.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ त्वि॒षो जनि॑मन्रेजत॒ द्यौ रेज॒द्भूमि॑र्भि॒यसा॒ स्वस्य॑ म॒न्योः ऋ॒घा॒यन्त॑ सु॒भ्व१॒॑ः पर्व॑तास॒ आर्द॒न्धन्वा॑नि स॒रय॑न्त॒ आपः॑
stanzas.transliteration: táva tviṣó jániman rejata dyaúr éjad bhū́mir bhiyásā svásya manyóḥ r̥ghāyánta subhvàḥ párvatāsaḥ- ā́rdan dhánvāni saráyanta ā́paḥ
stanzas.translation: Heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence; Earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure. The stedfast mountains shook in agitation . the waters flowed, and desert spots were flooded.

translations.griffith: Heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence; Earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure. The stedfast mountains shook in agitation . the waters flowed, and desert spots were flooded.

stanzas.sanskrit: भि॒नद्गि॒रिं शव॑सा॒ वज्र॑मि॒ष्णन्ना॑विष्कृण्वा॒नः स॑हसा॒न ओजः॑ वधी॑द्वृ॒त्रं वज्रे॑ण मन्दसा॒नः सर॒न्नापो॒ जव॑सा ह॒तवृ॑ष्णीः
stanzas.transliteration: bhinád giríṃ śávasā vájram iṣṇánn āviṣkr̥ṇvānáḥ sahasāná ójaḥ vádhīd vr̥tráṃ vájreṇa mandasānáḥ sárann ā́po jávasā hatávr̥ṣṇīḥ
stanzas.translation: Hurling his bolt with might he cleft the mountain, while, putting forth his strength, he showed his vigour. He slaughtered Vr̥itra with his bolt, exulting, and, their lord slain, forth flowed the waters swiftly.

translations.griffith: Hurling his bolt with might he cleft the mountain, while, putting forth his strength, he showed his vigour. He slaughtered Vr̥itra with his bolt, exulting, and, their lord slain, forth flowed the waters swiftly.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒वीर॑स्ते जनि॒ता म॑न्यत॒ द्यौरिन्द्र॑स्य क॒र्ता स्वप॑स्तमो भूत् य ईं॑ ज॒जान॑ स्व॒र्यं॑ सु॒वज्र॒मन॑पच्युतं॒ सद॑सो॒ न भूम॑
stanzas.transliteration: suvī́ras te janitā́ manyata dyaúr índrasya kartā́ svápastamo bhūt yá īṃ jajā́na svaryàṃ suvájram ánapacyutaṃ sádaso ná bhū́ma
stanzas.translation: Thy Father Dyaus esteemed himself a hero: most noble was the work of Indra's Maker, His who begat the strong bolt's Lord who roareth, immovable like earth from her foundation.

translations.griffith: Thy Father Dyaus esteemed himself a hero: most noble was the work of Indra's Maker, His who begat the strong bolt's Lord who roareth, immovable like earth from her foundation.

stanzas.sanskrit: य एक॑ इच्च्या॒वय॑ति॒ प्र भूमा॒ राजा॑ कृष्टी॒नां पु॑रुहू॒त इन्द्रः॑ स॒त्यमे॑न॒मनु॒ विश्वे॑ मदन्ति रा॒तिं दे॒वस्य॑ गृण॒तो म॒घोनः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yá éka ic cyāváyati prá bhū́mā rā́jā kr̥ṣṭīnā́m puruhūtá índraḥ satyám enam ánu víśve madanti rātíṃ devásya gr̥ṇató maghónaḥ
stanzas.translation: He who alone o'erthrows the world of creatures, Indra the peoples' King, invoked of many- Verily all rejoice in him, extolling the boons which Maghavan the God hath sent them.

translations.griffith: He who alone o'erthrows the world of creatures, Indra the peoples' King, invoked of many- Verily all rejoice in him, extolling the boons which Maghavan the God hath sent them.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्रा सोमा॑ अभवन्नस्य॒ विश्वे॑ स॒त्रा मदा॑सो बृह॒तो मदि॑ष्ठाः स॒त्राभ॑वो॒ वसु॑पति॒र्वसू॑नां॒ दत्रे॒ विश्वा॑ अधिथा इन्द्र कृ॒ष्टीः
stanzas.transliteration: satrā́ sómā abhavann asya víśve satrā́ mádāso br̥ható mádiṣṭhāḥ satrā́bhavo vásupatir vásūnāṃ dátre víśvā adhithā indra kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: All Soma juices are his own for ever, most gladdening draughts are ever his, the Mighty, Thou ever wast the Treasure-Lord of treasures: Indra, thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.

translations.griffith: All Soma juices are his own for ever, most gladdening draughts are ever his, the Mighty, Thou ever wast the Treasure-Lord of treasures: Indra, thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.
