stanzas.sanskrit: त्वमध॑ प्रथ॒मं जाय॑मा॒नोऽमे॒ विश्वा॑ अधिथा इन्द्र कृ॒ष्टीः त्वं प्रति॑ प्र॒वत॑ आ॒शया॑न॒महिं॒ वज्रे॑ण मघव॒न्वि वृ॑श्चः
stanzas.transliteration: tvám ádha prathamáṃ jā́yamānaḥ- -áme víśvā adhithā indra kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ tvám práti praváta āśáyānam áhiṃ vájreṇa maghavan ví vr̥ścaḥ
stanzas.translation: Moreover, when thou first wast born, O Indra, thou struckest terror into all the people. Thou, Maghavan, rentest with thy bolt the Dragon who lay against the waterfloods of heaven.

translations.griffith: Moreover, when thou first wast born, O Indra, thou struckest terror into all the people. Thou, Maghavan, rentest with thy bolt the Dragon who lay against the waterfloods of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्रा॒हणं॒ दाधृ॑षिं॒ तुम्र॒मिन्द्रं॑ म॒हाम॑पा॒रं वृ॑ष॒भं सु॒वज्र॑म् हन्ता॒ यो वृ॒त्रं सनि॑तो॒त वाजं॒ दाता॑ म॒घानि॑ म॒घवा॑ सु॒राधाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: satrāháṇaṃ dā́dhr̥ṣiṃ túmram índram mahā́m apāráṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ suvájram hántā yó vr̥tráṃ sánitotá vā́jaṃ dā́tā maghā́ni maghávā surā́dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: The ever-slaying, bold and furious Indra, the bright bolt's Lord, infinite, strong and mighty, Who slayeth Vr̥itra and acquireth booty, giver of blessings, Maghavan the bounteous:

translations.griffith: The ever-slaying, bold and furious Indra, the bright bolt's Lord, infinite, strong and mighty, Who slayeth Vr̥itra and acquireth booty, giver of blessings, Maghavan the bounteous:

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं वृत॑श्चातयते समी॒चीर्य आ॒जिषु॑ म॒घवा॑ शृ॒ण्व एकः॑ अ॒यं वाजं॑ भरति॒ यं स॒नोत्य॒स्य प्रि॒यासः॑ स॒ख्ये स्या॑म
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ vŕ̥taś cātayate samīcī́r yá ājíṣu maghávā śr̥ṇvá ékaḥ ayáṃ vā́jam bharati yáṃ sanóti- asyá priyā́saḥ sakhyé syāma
stanzas.translation: Alone renowned as Maghavan in battles, he frighteneth away assembled armies. He bringeth us the booty that he winneth may we, well-loved, continue in his friendship.

translations.griffith: Alone renowned as Maghavan in battles, he frighteneth away assembled armies. He bringeth us the booty that he winneth may we, well-loved, continue in his friendship.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं शृ॑ण्वे॒ अध॒ जय॑न्नु॒त घ्नन्न॒यमु॒त प्र कृ॑णुते यु॒धा गाः य॒दा स॒त्यं कृ॑णु॒ते म॒न्युमिन्द्रो॒ विश्वं॑ दृ॒ळ्हं भ॑यत॒ एज॑दस्मात्
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ śr̥ṇve ádha jáyann utá ghnánn ayám utá prá kr̥ṇute yudhā́ gā́ḥ yadā́ satyáṃ kr̥ṇuté manyúm índro víśvaṃ dr̥ḷhám bhayata éjad asmāt
stanzas.translation: Renowned is he when conquering and when slaying: 'fis he who winneth cattle in the combat. When Indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.

translations.griffith: Renowned is he when conquering and when slaying: 'fis he who winneth cattle in the combat. When Indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.

stanzas.sanskrit: समिन्द्रो॒ गा अ॑जय॒त्सं हिर॑ण्या॒ सम॑श्वि॒या म॒घवा॒ यो ह॑ पू॒र्वीः ए॒भिर्नृभि॒र्नृत॑मो अस्य शा॒कै रा॒यो वि॑भ॒क्ता स॑म्भ॒रश्च॒ वस्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sám índro gā́ ajayat sáṃ híraṇyā sám aśviyā́ maghávā yó ha pūrvī́ḥ ebhír nŕ̥bhir nŕ̥tamo asya śākaíḥ- rāyó vibhaktā́ sambharáś ca vásvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra hath won all kine, all gold, all horses,– Maghavan, he who breaketh forts in pieces; Most manly with these men of his who help him, dealing out wealth and gathering the treasure.

translations.griffith: Indra hath won all kine, all gold, all horses,– Maghavan, he who breaketh forts in pieces; Most manly with these men of his who help him, dealing out wealth and gathering the treasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: किय॑त्स्वि॒दिन्द्रो॒ अध्ये॑ति मा॒तुः किय॑त्पि॒तुर्ज॑नि॒तुर्यो ज॒जान॑ यो अ॑स्य॒ शुष्मं॑ मुहु॒कैरिय॑र्ति॒ वातो॒ न जू॒तः स्त॒नय॑द्भिर॒भ्रैः
stanzas.transliteration: kíyat svid índro ádhy eti mātúḥ kíyat pitúr janitúr yó jajā́na yó asya śúṣmam muhukaír íyarti vā́to ná jūtá stanáyadbhir abhraíḥ
stanzas.translation: What is the care of Indra for his Mother, what cares he for the Father who begat him? His care is that which speeds his might in conflicts, like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.

translations.griffith: What is the care of Indra for his Mother, what cares he for the Father who begat him? His care is that which speeds his might in conflicts, like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्षि॒यन्तं॑ त्व॒मक्षि॑यन्तं कृणो॒तीय॑र्ति रे॒णुं म॒घवा॑ स॒मोह॑म् वि॒भ॒ञ्ज॒नुर॒शनि॑माँ इव॒ द्यौरु॒त स्तो॒तारं॑ म॒घवा॒ वसौ॑ धात्
stanzas.transliteration: kṣiyántaṃ tvam ákṣiyantaṃ kr̥ṇoti- -íyarti reṇúm maghávā samóham vibhañjanúr aśánimām̐ iva dyaúr utá stotā́ram maghávā vásau dhāt
stanzas.translation: Maghavan makes the settled man unsettled: he scatters dust that he hath swept together, Breaking in pieces like Heaven armed with lightning: Maghavan shall enrich the man who lauds h;m.

translations.griffith: Maghavan makes the settled man unsettled: he scatters dust that he hath swept together, Breaking in pieces like Heaven armed with lightning: Maghavan shall enrich the man who lauds h;m.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं च॒क्रमि॑षण॒त्सूर्य॑स्य॒ न्येत॑शं रीरमत्ससृमा॒णम् आ कृ॒ष्ण ईं॑ जुहुरा॒णो जि॑घर्ति त्व॒चो बु॒ध्ने रज॑सो अ॒स्य योनौ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ cakrám iṣaṇat sū́ryasya ny étaśaṃ rīramat sasr̥māṇám ā́ kr̥ṣṇá īṃ juhurāṇó jigharti tvacó budhné rájaso asyá yónau
stanzas.translation: He urged the chariot-wheel of Sûrya forward: Etaṣa, speeding on his way, he rested. Him the black undulating cloud bedeweth, in this mid-air's depth, at the base of darkness,

translations.griffith: He urged the chariot-wheel of Sûrya forward: Etaṣa, speeding on his way, he rested. Him the black undulating cloud bedeweth, in this mid-air's depth, at the base of darkness,

stanzas.sanskrit: असि॑क्न्यां॒ यज॑मानो॒ न होता॑
stanzas.transliteration: ásiknyāṃ yájamāno ná hótā
stanzas.translation: As in the night the sacrificing priest.

translations.griffith: As in the night the sacrificing priest.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग॒व्यन्त॒ इन्द्रं॑ स॒ख्याय॒ विप्रा॑ अश्वा॒यन्तो॒ वृष॑णं वा॒जय॑न्तः ज॒नी॒यन्तो॑ जनि॒दामक्षि॑तोति॒मा च्या॑वयामोऽव॒ते न कोश॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: gavyánta índraṃ sakhyā́ya víprāḥ- aśvāyánto vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vājáyantaḥ janīyánto janidā́m ákṣitotim ā́ cyāvayāmo 'vaté ná kóśam
stanzas.translation: Eager for booty, craving strength and horses, we-singers stir Indra, the strong, for friendship, Who gives the wives we seek, whose succour fails not, to hasten, like a pitcher to the fountain.

translations.griffith: Eager for booty, craving strength and horses, we-singers stir Indra, the strong, for friendship, Who gives the wives we seek, whose succour fails not, to hasten, like a pitcher to the fountain.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रा॒ता नो॑ बोधि॒ ददृ॑शान आ॒पिर॑भिख्या॒ता म॑र्डि॒ता सो॒म्याना॑म् सखा॑ पि॒ता पि॒तृत॑मः पितॄ॒णां कर्ते॑मु लो॒कमु॑श॒ते व॑यो॒धाः
stanzas.transliteration: trātā́ no bodhi dádr̥śāna āpír abhikhyātā́ marḍitā́ somyā́nām sákhā pitā́ pitŕ̥tamaḥ pitr̥̄ṇā́ṃ kártem ulokám uśaté vayodhā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Be thou our guardian, show thyself our kinsman, watching and blessing those who pour the Soma; As Friend, as Sire, most fatherly of fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.

translations.griffith: Be thou our guardian, show thyself our kinsman, watching and blessing those who pour the Soma; As Friend, as Sire, most fatherly of fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒खी॒य॒ताम॑वि॒ता बो॑धि॒ सखा॑ गृणा॒न इ॑न्द्र स्तुव॒ते वयो॑ धाः व॒यं ह्या ते॑ चकृ॒मा स॒बाध॑ आ॒भिः शमी॑भिर्म॒हय॑न्त इन्द्र
stanzas.transliteration: sakhīyatā́m avitā́ bodhi sákhā gr̥ṇāná indra stuvaté váyo dhāḥ vayáṃ hy ā́ te cakr̥mā́ sabā́dhaḥ- ābhíḥ śámībhir maháyanta indra
stanzas.translation: Be helping Friend of those who seek thy friendship . give life, when lauded, Indra, to the singer. For, Indra, we the priests have paid thee worship, exalting thee with these our sacrifices.

translations.griffith: Be helping Friend of those who seek thy friendship . give life, when lauded, Indra, to the singer. For, Indra, we the priests have paid thee worship, exalting thee with these our sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तु॒त इन्द्रो॑ म॒घवा॒ यद्ध॑ वृ॒त्रा भूरी॒ण्येको॑ अप्र॒तीनि॑ हन्ति अ॒स्य प्रि॒यो ज॑रि॒ता यस्य॒ शर्म॒न्नकि॑र्दे॒वा वा॒रय॑न्ते॒ न मर्ताः॑
stanzas.transliteration: stutá índro maghávā yád dha vr̥trā́ bhū́rīṇy éko apratī́ni hanti asyá priyó jaritā́ yásya śárman nákir devā́ vāráyante ná mártāḥ
stanzas.translation: Alone, when Indra Maghavan is lauded, he slayeth many ne'er-resisted Vr̥itras. Him in whose keeping is the well-loved singer never do Gods or mortals stay or hinder.

translations.griffith: Alone, when Indra Maghavan is lauded, he slayeth many ne'er-resisted Vr̥itras. Him in whose keeping is the well-loved singer never do Gods or mortals stay or hinder.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा न॒ इन्द्रो॑ म॒घवा॑ विर॒प्शी कर॑त्स॒त्या च॑र्षणी॒धृद॑न॒र्वा त्वं राजा॑ ज॒नुषां॑ धेह्य॒स्मे अधि॒ श्रवो॒ माहि॑नं॒ यज्ज॑रि॒त्रे
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ na índro maghávā virapśī́ kárat satyā́ carṣaṇīdhŕ̥d anarvā́ tváṃ rā́jā janúṣāṃ dhehy asmé ádhi śrávo mā́hinaṃ yáj jaritré
stanzas.translation: E'en so let Maghavan, the loud-voiced Indra, give us true blessings, foeless, men's upholder. King of all creatures, give us glory amply, exalted glory due to him who lauds thee.

translations.griffith: E'en so let Maghavan, the loud-voiced Indra, give us true blessings, foeless, men's upholder. King of all creatures, give us glory amply, exalted glory due to him who lauds thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं पन्था॒ अनु॑वित्तः पुरा॒णो यतो॑ दे॒वा उ॒दजा॑यन्त॒ विश्वे॑ अत॑श्चि॒दा ज॑निषीष्ट॒ प्रवृ॑द्धो॒ मा मा॒तर॑ममु॒या पत्त॑वे कः
stanzas.transliteration: ayám pánthā ánuvittaḥ purāṇó yáto devā́ udájāyanta víśve átaś cid ā́ janiṣīṣṭa právr̥ddho mā́ mātáram amuyā́ páttave kaḥ
stanzas.translation: THIS is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all Gods have come into existence. Hereby could one be born though waxen mighty. Let him not, otherwise, destroy his Mother.

translations.griffith: THIS is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all Gods have come into existence. Hereby could one be born though waxen mighty. Let him not, otherwise, destroy his Mother.

stanzas.sanskrit: नाहमतो॒ निर॑या दु॒र्गहै॒तत्ति॑र॒श्चता॑ पा॒र्श्वान्निर्ग॑माणि ब॒हूनि॑ मे॒ अकृ॑ता॒ कर्त्वा॑नि॒ युध्यै॑ त्वेन॒ सं त्वे॑न पृच्छै
stanzas.transliteration: nā́hám áto nír ayā durgáhaitát tiraścátā pārśvā́n nír gamāṇi bahū́ni me ákr̥tā kártvāni yúdhyai tvena sáṃ tvena pr̥chai
stanzas.translation: Not this way go I forth: hard is the passage. Forth from the side obliquely will I issue. Much that is yet undone must I accomplish; one must I combat and the other question.

translations.griffith: Not this way go I forth: hard is the passage. Forth from the side obliquely will I issue. Much that is yet undone must I accomplish; one must I combat and the other question.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒रा॒य॒तीं मा॒तर॒मन्व॑चष्ट॒ न नानु॑ गा॒न्यनु॒ नू ग॑मानि त्वष्टु॑र्गृ॒हे अ॑पिब॒त्सोम॒मिन्द्रः॑ शतध॒न्यं॑ च॒म्वोः॑ सु॒तस्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: parāyatī́m mātáram ánv acaṣṭa ná nā́nu gāny ánu nū́ gamāni tváṣṭur gr̥hé apibat sómam índraḥ śatadhanyàṃ camvòḥ sutásya
stanzas.translation: He bent his eye upon the dying Mother: My word I now withdraw. That way I follow. In Tvashṭar's dwelling India drank the Soma, a hundredworth of juice pressed from the mortar.

translations.griffith: He bent his eye upon the dying Mother: My word I now withdraw. That way I follow. In Tvashṭar's dwelling India drank the Soma, a hundredworth of juice pressed from the mortar.

stanzas.sanskrit: किं स ऋध॑क्कृणव॒द्यं स॒हस्रं॑ मा॒सो ज॒भार॑ श॒रद॑श्च पू॒र्वीः न॒ही न्व॑स्य प्रति॒मान॒मस्त्य॒न्तर्जा॒तेषू॒त ये जनि॑त्वाः
stanzas.transliteration: kíṃ sá ŕ̥dhak kr̥ṇavad yáṃ sahásram māsó jabhā́ra śarádaś ca pūrvī́ḥ nahī́ nv àsya pratimā́nam ásti- antár jātéṣūtá yé jánitvāḥ
stanzas.translation: What strange act shall he do, he whom his Mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns? No peer hath he among those born already, nor among those who shall be born hereafter.

translations.griffith: What strange act shall he do, he whom his Mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns? No peer hath he among those born already, nor among those who shall be born hereafter.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒व॒द्यमि॑व॒ मन्य॑माना॒ गुहा॑क॒रिन्द्रं॑ मा॒ता वी॒र्ये॑णा॒ न्यृ॑ष्टम् अथोद॑स्थात्स्व॒यमत्कं॒ वसा॑न॒ आ रोद॑सी अपृणा॒ज्जाय॑मानः
stanzas.transliteration: avadyám iva mányamānā gúhākar índram mātā́ vīryèṇā nyr̥̀ṣṭam áthód asthāt svayám átkaṃ vásānaḥ- ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇāj jā́yamānaḥ
stanzas.translation: Deeming him a reproach, his mother hid him, Indra, endowed with all heroic valour. Then up he sprang himself, assumed his vesture, and filled, as soon as born, the earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: Deeming him a reproach, his mother hid him, Indra, endowed with all heroic valour. Then up he sprang himself, assumed his vesture, and filled, as soon as born, the earth and heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ता अ॑र्षन्त्यलला॒भव॑न्तीर्ऋ॒ताव॑रीरिव सं॒क्रोश॑मानाः ए॒ता वि पृ॑च्छ॒ किमि॒दं भ॑नन्ति॒ कमापो॒ अद्रिं॑ परि॒धिं रु॑जन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ arṣanty alalābhávantīr r̥tā́varīr iva saṃkróśamānāḥ etā́ ví pr̥cha kím idám bhananti kám ā́po ádrim paridhíṃ rujanti
stanzas.translation: With lively motion onward flow these waters, the Holy Ones, shouting, as 'twere, together. Ask them to. tell thee what the floods are saying, what girdling rock the waters burst asunder.

translations.griffith: With lively motion onward flow these waters, the Holy Ones, shouting, as 'twere, together. Ask them to. tell thee what the floods are saying, what girdling rock the waters burst asunder.

stanzas.sanskrit: किमु॑ ष्विदस्मै नि॒विदो॑ भन॒न्तेन्द्र॑स्याव॒द्यं दि॑धिषन्त॒ आपः॑ ममै॒तान्पु॒त्रो म॑ह॒ता व॒धेन॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अ॑सृज॒द्वि सिन्धू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: kím u ṣvid asmai nivído bhananta- -índrasyāvadyáṃ didhiṣanta ā́paḥ mámaitā́n putró mahatā́ vadhéna vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ asr̥jad ví síndhūn
stanzas.translation: Are they addressing him with words of welcome? Will the floods take on them the shame of Indra? With his great thunderbolt my Son hath slaughtered Vr̥itra, and set these rivers free to wander.

translations.griffith: Are they addressing him with words of welcome? Will the floods take on them the shame of Indra? With his great thunderbolt my Son hath slaughtered Vr̥itra, and set these rivers free to wander.

stanzas.sanskrit: मम॑च्च॒न त्वा॑ युव॒तिः प॒रास॒ मम॑च्च॒न त्वा॑ कु॒षवा॑ ज॒गार॑ मम॑च्चि॒दापः॒ शिश॑वे ममृड्यु॒र्मम॑च्चि॒दिन्द्रः॒ सह॒सोद॑तिष्ठत्
stanzas.transliteration: mámac caná tvā yuvatíḥ parā́sa mámac caná tvā kuṣávā jagā́ra mámac cid ā́paḥ śíśave mamr̥ḍyur mámac cid índraḥ sáhasód atiṣṭhat
stanzas.translation: I cast thee from me, mine,– thy youthful mother: thee, mine own offspring, Kushavâ hath swallowed. To him, mine infant, were the waters gracious. Indra, my Son, rose up in conquering vigour.

translations.griffith: I cast thee from me, mine,– thy youthful mother: thee, mine own offspring, Kushavâ hath swallowed. To him, mine infant, were the waters gracious. Indra, my Son, rose up in conquering vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: मम॑च्च॒न ते॑ मघव॒न्व्यं॑सो निविवि॒ध्वाँ अप॒ हनू॑ ज॒घान॑ अधा॒ निवि॑द्ध॒ उत्त॑रो बभू॒वाञ्छिरो॑ दा॒सस्य॒ सं पि॑णग्व॒धेन॑
stanzas.transliteration: mámac caná te maghavan vyàṃso nivividhvā́m̐ ápa hánū jaghā́na ádhā níviddha úttaro babhūvā́ñ -śíro dāsásya sám piṇag vadhéna
stanzas.translation: Thou art mine own, O Maghavan, whom Vyansa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces. But, smitten through, the mastery thou wonnest, and with thy bolt the Dâsa's head thou crushedst.

translations.griffith: Thou art mine own, O Maghavan, whom Vyansa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces. But, smitten through, the mastery thou wonnest, and with thy bolt the Dâsa's head thou crushedst.

stanzas.sanskrit: गृ॒ष्टिः स॑सूव॒ स्थवि॑रं तवा॒गाम॑नाधृ॒ष्यं वृ॑ष॒भं तुम्र॒मिन्द्र॑म् अरी॑ळ्हं व॒त्सं च॒रथा॑य मा॒ता स्व॒यं गा॒तुं त॒न्व॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नम्
stanzas.transliteration: gr̥ṣṭíḥ sasūva stháviraṃ tavāgā́m anādhr̥ṣyáṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ túmram índram árīḷhaṃ vatsáṃ caráthāya mātā́ svayáṃ gātúṃ tanvà ichámānam
stanzas.translation: The Heifer hath brought forth the Strong, the Mighty, the unconquerable Bull, the furious Indra. The Mother left her unlicked Calf to wander, seeking himself, the path that he would follow.

translations.griffith: The Heifer hath brought forth the Strong, the Mighty, the unconquerable Bull, the furious Indra. The Mother left her unlicked Calf to wander, seeking himself, the path that he would follow.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त मा॒ता म॑हि॒षमन्व॑वेनद॒मी त्वा॑ जहति पुत्र दे॒वाः अथा॑ब्रवीद्वृ॒त्रमिन्द्रो॑ हनि॒ष्यन्त्सखे॑ विष्णो वित॒रं वि क्र॑मस्व
stanzas.transliteration: utá mātā́ mahiṣám ánv avenad amī́ tvā jahati putra devā́ḥ áthābravīd vr̥trám índro haniṣyán sákhe viṣṇo vitaráṃ ví kramasva
stanzas.translation: Then to her mighty Child the Mother turned her, saying, My son, these Deities forsake thee. Then Indra said, about to slaughter Vr̥itra, O my friend Vr̥itra, stride full boldly forward.

translations.griffith: Then to her mighty Child the Mother turned her, saying, My son, these Deities forsake thee. Then Indra said, about to slaughter Vr̥itra, O my friend Vr̥itra, stride full boldly forward.

stanzas.sanskrit: कस्ते॑ मा॒तरं॑ वि॒धवा॑मचक्रच्छ॒युं कस्त्वाम॑जिघांस॒च्चर॑न्तम् कस्ते॑ दे॒वो अधि॑ मार्डी॒क आ॑सी॒द्यत्प्राक्षि॑णाः पि॒तरं॑ पाद॒गृह्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: kás te mātáraṃ vidhávām acakrac -śayúṃ kás tvā́m ajighāṃsac cárantam kás te devó ádhi mārḍīká āsīd yát prā́kṣiṇāḥ pitáram pādagŕ̥hya
stanzas.translation: Who was he then who made thy Mother widow? Who sought to stay thee lying still or moving? What God, when by the foot thy Sire thou tookest and slewest, was at hand to give thee comfort?

translations.griffith: Who was he then who made thy Mother widow? Who sought to stay thee lying still or moving? What God, when by the foot thy Sire thou tookest and slewest, was at hand to give thee comfort?

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑र्त्या॒ शुन॑ आ॒न्त्राणि॑ पेचे॒ न दे॒वेषु॑ विविदे मर्डि॒तार॑म् अप॑श्यं जा॒यामम॑हीयमाना॒मधा॑ मे श्ये॒नो मध्वा ज॑भार
stanzas.transliteration: ávartyā śúna āntrā́ṇi pece ná devéṣu vivide marḍitā́ram ápaśyaṃ jāyā́m ámahīyamānām ádhā me śyenó mádhv ā́ jabhāra
stanzas.translation: In deep distress I cooked a dog's intestines. Among the Gods I found not one to comfort. My consort I beheld in degradation. The Falcon then brought me the pleasant Soma.

translations.griffith: In deep distress I cooked a dog's intestines. Among the Gods I found not one to comfort. My consort I beheld in degradation. The Falcon then brought me the pleasant Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा त्वामि॑न्द्र वज्रि॒न्नत्र॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासः॑ सु॒हवा॑स॒ ऊमाः॑ म॒हामु॒भे रोद॑सी वृ॒द्धमृ॒ष्वं निरेक॒मिद्वृ॑णते वृत्र॒हत्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ tvā́m indra vajrinn átra víśve devā́saḥ suhávāsa ū́māḥ mahā́m ubhé ródasī vr̥ddhám r̥ṣváṃ nír ékam íd vr̥ṇate vr̥trahátye
stanzas.translation: THEE, verily, O Thunder-wielding Indra, all the Gods here, the Helpers swift to listen, And both the worlds elected, thee the Mighty, High, waxen strong, alone to slaughter Vr̥itra.

translations.griffith: THEE, verily, O Thunder-wielding Indra, all the Gods here, the Helpers swift to listen, And both the worlds elected, thee the Mighty, High, waxen strong, alone to slaughter Vr̥itra.

stanzas.sanskrit: अवा॑सृजन्त॒ जिव्र॑यो॒ न दे॒वा भुवः॑ स॒म्राळि॑न्द्र स॒त्ययो॑निः अह॒न्नहिं॑ परि॒शया॑न॒मर्णः॒ प्र व॑र्त॒नीर॑रदो वि॒श्वधे॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: ávāsr̥janta jívrayo ná devā́ḥ- bhúvaḥ samrā́ḷ indra satyáyoniḥ áhann áhim pariśáyānam árṇaḥ- prá vartanī́r arado viśvádhenāḥ
stanzas.translation: The Gods, as worn witheld, relaxed their efforts: thou, Indra, born of truth, wast Sovran Ruler. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and duggest out their all-supporting channels.

translations.griffith: The Gods, as worn witheld, relaxed their efforts: thou, Indra, born of truth, wast Sovran Ruler. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and duggest out their all-supporting channels.

stanzas.sanskrit: अतृ॑प्णुवन्तं॒ विय॑तमबु॒ध्यमबु॑ध्यमानं सुषुपा॒णमि॑न्द्र स॒प्त प्रति॑ प्र॒वत॑ आ॒शया॑न॒महिं॒ वज्रे॑ण॒ वि रि॑णा अप॒र्वन्
stanzas.transliteration: átr̥pṇuvantaṃ víyatam abudhyám ábudhyamānaṃ suṣupāṇám indra saptá práti praváta āśáyānam áhiṃ vájreṇa ví riṇā aparván
stanzas.translation: The insatiate one, extended, hard to waken, who slumbered in perpetual sleep, O Indra,– The Dragon stretched against the seven prone rivers, where no joint was, thou rentest with thy thunder.

translations.griffith: The insatiate one, extended, hard to waken, who slumbered in perpetual sleep, O Indra,– The Dragon stretched against the seven prone rivers, where no joint was, thou rentest with thy thunder.

stanzas.sanskrit: अक्षो॑दय॒च्छव॑सा॒ क्षाम॑ बु॒ध्नं वार्ण वात॒स्तवि॑षीभि॒रिन्द्रः॑ दृ॒ळ्हान्यौ॑भ्नादु॒शमा॑न॒ ओजोऽवा॑भिनत्क॒कुभः॒ पर्व॑तानाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ákṣodayac chávasā kṣā́ma budhnáṃ vā́r ṇá vā́tas táviṣībhir índraḥ dr̥ḷhā́ny aubhnād uśámāna ójaḥ- -ávābhinat kakúbhaḥ párvatānām
stanzas.translation: Indra with might shook earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the water with its fury. Striving, with strength he burst the firm asunder, and tore away the summits of the mountains.

translations.griffith: Indra with might shook earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the water with its fury. Striving, with strength he burst the firm asunder, and tore away the summits of the mountains.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि प्र द॑द्रु॒र्जन॑यो॒ न गर्भं॒ रथा॑ इव॒ प्र य॑युः सा॒कमद्र॑यः अत॑र्पयो वि॒सृत॑ उ॒ब्ज ऊ॒र्मीन्त्वं वृ॒ताँ अ॑रिणा इन्द्र॒ सिन्धू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: abhí prá dadrur jánayo ná gárbhaṃ ráthā iva prá yayuḥ sākám ádrayaḥ átarpayo visŕ̥ta ubjá ūrmī́n tváṃ vr̥tā́m̐ ariṇā indra síndhūn
stanzas.translation: They ran to thee as mothers to their offspring: the clouds, like chariots, hastened forth together. Thou didst refresh the streams and force the billows: thou, Indra, settest free obstructed rivers.

translations.griffith: They ran to thee as mothers to their offspring: the clouds, like chariots, hastened forth together. Thou didst refresh the streams and force the billows: thou, Indra, settest free obstructed rivers.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं म॒हीम॒वनिं॑ वि॒श्वधे॑नां तु॒र्वीत॑ये व॒य्या॑य॒ क्षर॑न्तीम् अर॑मयो॒ नम॒सैज॒दर्णः॑ सुतर॒णाँ अ॑कृणोरिन्द्र॒ सिन्धू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: tvám mahī́m avániṃ viśvádhenāṃ turvī́taye vayyā̀ya kṣárantīm áramayo námasaíjad árṇaḥ sutaraṇā́m̐ akr̥ṇor indra síndhūn
stanzas.translation: Thou for the sake of Vayya and Turvîti didst stay the great stream, flowing, allsustaining: Yea, at their prayer didst check the rushing river and make the floods easy to cross, O Indra.

translations.griffith: Thou for the sake of Vayya and Turvîti didst stay the great stream, flowing, allsustaining: Yea, at their prayer didst check the rushing river and make the floods easy to cross, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्राग्रुवो॑ नभ॒न्वो॒३॒॑ न वक्वा॑ ध्व॒स्रा अ॑पिन्वद्युव॒तीर्ऋ॑त॒ज्ञाः धन्वा॒न्यज्राँ॑ अपृणक्तृषा॒णाँ अधो॒गिन्द्रः॑ स्त॒र्यो॒३॒॑ दंसु॑पत्नीः
stanzas.transliteration: prā́grúvo nabhanvò ná vákvā dhvasrā́ apinvad yuvatī́r r̥tajñā́ḥ dhánvāny ájrām̐ apr̥ṇak tr̥ṣāṇā́m̐ ádhog índra staryò dáṃsupatnīḥ
stanzas.translation: He let the young Maids skilled in Law, unwedded, like fountains, bubbling, flow forth streaming onward. He inundated thirsty plains and deserts, and milked the dry Cows of the mighty master.

translations.griffith: He let the young Maids skilled in Law, unwedded, like fountains, bubbling, flow forth streaming onward. He inundated thirsty plains and deserts, and milked the dry Cows of the mighty master.

stanzas.sanskrit: पू॒र्वीरु॒षसः॑ श॒रद॑श्च गू॒र्ता वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अ॑सृज॒द्वि सिन्धू॑न् परि॑ष्ठिता अतृणद्बद्बधा॒नाः सी॒रा इन्द्रः॒ स्रवि॑तवे पृथि॒व्या
stanzas.transliteration: pūrvī́r uṣásaḥ śarádaś ca gūrtā́ vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ asr̥jad ví síndhūn páriṣṭhitā atr̥ṇad badbadhānā́ḥ sīrā́ índraḥ srávitave pr̥thivyā́
stanzas.translation: Through many a morn and many a lovely autumn, having slain Vr̥itra, lie set free the rivers. Indra hath set at liberty to wander on earth the streams encompassed pressed together.

translations.griffith: Through many a morn and many a lovely autumn, having slain Vr̥itra, lie set free the rivers. Indra hath set at liberty to wander on earth the streams encompassed pressed together.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒म्रीभिः॑ पु॒त्रम॒ग्रुवो॑ अदा॒नं नि॒वेश॑नाद्धरिव॒ आ ज॑भर्थ व्य१॒॑न्धो अ॑ख्य॒दहि॑माददा॒नो निर्भू॑दुख॒च्छित्सम॑रन्त॒ पर्व॑
stanzas.transliteration: vamrī́bhiḥ putrám agrúvo adānáṃ nivéśanād dhariva ā́ jabhartha vy àndhó akhyad áhim ādadānó nír bhūd ukhachít sám aranta párva
stanzas.translation: Lord of Bay Steeds, thou broughtest from the ant-hill the unwedded damsel's son whom ants were eating. The blind saw clearly, as he grasped the serpent, rose, brake the jar: hisjoints again united.

translations.griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, thou broughtest from the ant-hill the unwedded damsel's son whom ants were eating. The blind saw clearly, as he grasped the serpent, rose, brake the jar: hisjoints again united.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ते॒ पूर्वा॑णि॒ कर॑णानि विप्रावि॒द्वाँ आ॑ह वि॒दुषे॒ करां॑सि यथा॑यथा॒ वृष्ण्या॑नि॒ स्वगू॒र्तापां॑सि राज॒न्नर्यावि॑वेषीः
stanzas.transliteration: prá te pū́rvāṇi káraṇāni vipra- -āvidvā́m̐ āha vidúṣe kárāṃsi yáthā-yathā vŕ̥ṣṇyāni svágūrtā- -ápāṃsi rājan náryā́viveṣīḥ
stanzas.translation: To the wise man, O Sage and Sovran Ruler, the man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits. Hath told these deeds of might as thou hast wrought them, great acts, spontaneous, and to man's advantage.

translations.griffith: To the wise man, O Sage and Sovran Ruler, the man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits. Hath told these deeds of might as thou hast wrought them, great acts, spontaneous, and to man's advantage.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let powers swell high, like rivers, for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let powers swell high, like rivers, for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ न॒ इन्द्रो॑ दू॒रादा न॑ आ॒साद॑भिष्टि॒कृदव॑से यासदु॒ग्रः ओजि॑ष्ठेभिर्नृ॒पति॒र्वज्र॑बाहुः सं॒गे स॒मत्सु॑ तु॒र्वणिः॑ पृत॒न्यून्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ na índro dūrā́d ā́ na āsā́d abhiṣṭikŕ̥d ávase yāsad ugráḥ ójiṣṭhebhir nr̥pátir vájrabāhuḥ saṃgé samátsu turváṇiḥ pr̥tanyū́n
stanzas.translation: FROM near or far away may mighty Indra giver of succour, come for our protection Lord of men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, slaying his foes in conflict, in the battles.

translations.griffith: FROM near or far away may mighty Indra giver of succour, come for our protection Lord of men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, slaying his foes in conflict, in the battles.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ न॒ इन्द्रो॒ हरि॑भिर्या॒त्वच्छा॑र्वाची॒नोऽव॑से॒ राध॑से च तिष्ठा॑ति व॒ज्री म॒घवा॑ विर॒प्शीमं य॒ज्ञमनु॑ नो॒ वाज॑सातौ
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ na índro háribhir yātv ácha- -arvācīnó 'vase rā́dhase ca tíṣṭhāti vajrī́ maghávā virapśī́- -imáṃ yajñám ánu no vā́jasātau
stanzas.translation: May Indra come to us with Tawny Coursers, inclined to us, to favour and enrich us. May Maghavan, loud-voiced and wielding thunder, stand by us at this sacrifice, in combat.

translations.griffith: May Indra come to us with Tawny Coursers, inclined to us, to favour and enrich us. May Maghavan, loud-voiced and wielding thunder, stand by us at this sacrifice, in combat.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं त्वम॒स्माक॑मिन्द्र पु॒रो दध॑त्सनिष्यसि॒ क्रतुं॑ नः श्व॒घ्नीव॑ वज्रिन्त्स॒नये॒ धना॑नां॒ त्वया॑ व॒यम॒र्य आ॒जिं ज॑येम
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ yajñáṃ tvám asmā́kam indra puró dádhat saniṣyasi krátuṃ naḥ śvaghnī́va vajrin sanáye dhánānāṃ tváyā vayám aryá ājíṃ jayema
stanzas.translation: Thou, honouring this our sacrifice, O Indra, shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage. To win the booty, Thunder-armed! like hunters may we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.

translations.griffith: Thou, honouring this our sacrifice, O Indra, shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage. To win the booty, Thunder-armed! like hunters may we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒शन्नु॒ षु णः॑ सु॒मना॑ उपा॒के सोम॑स्य॒ नु सुषु॑तस्य स्वधावः पा इ॑न्द्र॒ प्रति॑भृतस्य॒ मध्वः॒ समन्ध॑सा ममदः पृ॒ष्ठ्ये॑न
stanzas.transliteration: uśánn u ṣú ṇaḥ sumánā upāké sómasya nú súṣutasya svadhāvaḥ pā́ indra prátibhr̥tasya mádhvaḥ sám ándhasā mamadaḥ pr̥ṣṭhyèna
stanzas.translation: Loving us well, benevolent, close beside us, drink, Godlike Indra, of the wellpressed Soma. Drink of the meath we offer, and delight thee with food that cometh from the mountain ridges.

translations.griffith: Loving us well, benevolent, close beside us, drink, Godlike Indra, of the wellpressed Soma. Drink of the meath we offer, and delight thee with food that cometh from the mountain ridges.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि यो र॑र॒प्श ऋषि॑भि॒र्नवे॑भिर्वृ॒क्षो न प॒क्वः सृण्यो॒ न जेता॑ मर्यो॒ न योषा॑म॒भि मन्य॑मा॒नोऽच्छा॑ विवक्मि पुरुहू॒तमिन्द्र॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ví yó rarapśá ŕ̥ṣibhir návebhir vr̥kṣó ná pakváḥ sŕ̥ṇyo ná jétā máryo ná yóṣām abhí mányamānaḥ- -áchā vivakmi puruhūtám índram
stanzas.translation: Him who is sung aloud by recent sages, like a ripe-fruited tree, a scythe-armed victor,– I, like a bridegroom thinking of his consort, call hither Indra, him invoked of many;

translations.griffith: Him who is sung aloud by recent sages, like a ripe-fruited tree, a scythe-armed victor,– I, like a bridegroom thinking of his consort, call hither Indra, him invoked of many;

stanzas.sanskrit: गि॒रिर्न यः स्वत॑वाँ ऋ॒ष्व इन्द्रः॑ स॒नादे॒व सह॑से जा॒त उ॒ग्रः आद॑र्ता॒ वज्रं॒ स्थवि॑रं॒ न भी॒म उ॒द्नेव॒ कोशं॒ वसु॑ना॒ न्यृ॑ष्टम्
stanzas.transliteration: girír ná yáḥ svátavām̐ r̥ṣvá índraḥ sanā́d evá sáhase jātá ugráḥ ā́dartā vrajáṃ* stháviraṃ ná bhīmáḥ- udnéva kóśaṃ vásunā nyr̥̀ṣṭam
stanzas.translation: Him who in native strength is like a mountain, the lofty Indra born or old for conquest, Terrific wielder of the ancient thunder. filled full with splendour as a jar with water.

translations.griffith: Him who in native strength is like a mountain, the lofty Indra born or old for conquest, Terrific wielder of the ancient thunder. filled full with splendour as a jar with water.

stanzas.sanskrit: न यस्य॑ व॒र्ता ज॒नुषा॒ न्वस्ति॒ न राध॑स आमरी॒ता म॒घस्य॑ उ॒द्वा॒वृ॒षा॒णस्त॑विषीव उग्रा॒स्मभ्यं॑ दद्धि पुरुहूत रा॒यः
stanzas.transliteration: ná yásya vartā́ janúṣā nv ásti ná rā́dhasa āmarītā́ maghásya udvāvr̥ṣāṇás taviṣīva ugra- -asmábhyaṃ daddhi puruhūta rāyáḥ
stanzas.translation: Whom from of old there is not one to hinder, none to curtail the riches of his bounty. Pouring forth freely, O thou Strong and Mighty, vouchsafe us riches, God invoked of many!

translations.griffith: Whom from of old there is not one to hinder, none to curtail the riches of his bounty. Pouring forth freely, O thou Strong and Mighty, vouchsafe us riches, God invoked of many!

stanzas.sanskrit: ईक्षे॑ रा॒यः क्षय॑स्य चर्षणी॒नामु॒त व्र॒जम॑पव॒र्तासि॒ गोना॑म् शि॒क्षा॒न॒रः स॑मि॒थेषु॑ प्र॒हावा॒न्वस्वो॑ रा॒शिम॑भिने॒तासि॒ भूरि॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ī́kṣe rāyáḥ kṣáyasya carṣaṇīnā́m utá vrajám apavartā́si gónām śikṣānaráḥ samithéṣu prahā́vān vásvo rāśím abhinetā́si bhū́rim
stanzas.translation: Of wealth and homes of men thou art the ruler, and opener of the stable of the cattle. Helper of men, winner of spoil in combats, thou leadest to an ample heap of riches.

translations.griffith: Of wealth and homes of men thou art the ruler, and opener of the stable of the cattle. Helper of men, winner of spoil in combats, thou leadest to an ample heap of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: कया॒ तच्छृ॑ण्वे॒ शच्या॒ शचि॑ष्ठो॒ यया॑ कृ॒णोति॒ मुहु॒ का चि॑दृ॒ष्वः पु॒रु दा॒शुषे॒ विच॑यिष्ठो॒ अंहोऽथा॑ दधाति॒ द्रवि॑णं जरि॒त्रे
stanzas.transliteration: káyā tác chr̥ṇve śácyā śáciṣṭho yáyā kr̥ṇóti múhu kā́ cid r̥ṣváḥ purú dāśúṣe vícayiṣṭho áṃhaḥ- -áthā dadhāti dráviṇaṃ jaritré
stanzas.translation: By what great might is he renowned as strongest, wherewith the Lofty One stirs up wild battles? Best soother of the worshipper's great sorrow, he gives possessions to the man who lauds him.

translations.griffith: By what great might is he renowned as strongest, wherewith the Lofty One stirs up wild battles? Best soother of the worshipper's great sorrow, he gives possessions to the man who lauds him.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नो॑ मर्धी॒रा भ॑रा द॒द्धि तन्नः॒ प्र दा॒शुषे॒ दात॑वे॒ भूरि॒ यत्ते॑ नव्ये॑ दे॒ष्णे श॒स्ते अ॒स्मिन्त॑ उ॒क्थे प्र ब्र॑वाम व॒यमि॑न्द्र स्तु॒वन्तः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ no mardhīr ā́ bharā daddhí tán naḥ prá dāśúṣe dā́tave bhū́ri yát te návye deṣṇé śasté asmín ta ukthé prá bravāma vayám indra stuvántaḥ
stanzas.translation: Slay us not; bring, bestow onus the ample gift which thou hast to give to him who offers. At this new gift, with this laud sung before thee, extolling thee, we, Indra, will declare it.

translations.griffith: Slay us not; bring, bestow onus the ample gift which thou hast to give to him who offers. At this new gift, with this laud sung before thee, extolling thee, we, Indra, will declare it.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for the singer. A new hymn, Lord of Bays! for thee is fashioned. May we, car-born, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for the singer. A new hymn, Lord of Bays! for thee is fashioned. May we, car-born, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॒त्विन्द्रोऽव॑स॒ उप॑ न इ॒ह स्तु॒तः स॑ध॒माद॑स्तु॒ शूरः॑ वा॒वृ॒धा॒नस्तवि॑षी॒र्यस्य॑ पू॒र्वीर्द्यौर्न क्ष॒त्रम॒भिभू॑ति॒ पुष्या॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yātv índró 'vasa úpa naḥ- ihá stutáḥ sadhamā́d astu śū́raḥ vāvr̥dhānás táviṣīr yásya pūrvī́r dyaúr ná kṣatrám abhíbhūti púṣyāt
stanzas.translation: MAY Indra come to us for our protection; here be the Hero, praised, our feast-companion. May he whose powers are many, waxen mighty, cherish, like Dyaus, his own supreme dominion.

translations.griffith: MAY Indra come to us for our protection; here be the Hero, praised, our feast-companion. May he whose powers are many, waxen mighty, cherish, like Dyaus, his own supreme dominion.

stanzas.sanskrit: तस्येदि॒ह स्त॑वथ॒ वृष्ण्या॑नि तुविद्यु॒म्नस्य॑ तुवि॒राध॑सो॒ नॄन् यस्य॒ क्रतु॑र्विद॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ न स॒म्राट् सा॒ह्वान्तरु॑त्रो अ॒भ्यस्ति॑ कृ॒ष्टीः
stanzas.transliteration: tásyéd ihá stavatha vŕ̥ṣṇyāni tuvidyumnásya tuvirā́dhaso nr̥̄́n yásya krátur vidathyò ná samrā́ṭ sāhvā́n tárutro abhy ásti kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Here magnify his great heroic exploits, most glorious One, enriching men with bounties, Whose will is like a Sovran in assembly, who rules the people, Conqueror, all-surpassing.

translations.griffith: Here magnify his great heroic exploits, most glorious One, enriching men with bounties, Whose will is like a Sovran in assembly, who rules the people, Conqueror, all-surpassing.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॒त्विन्द्रो॑ दि॒व आ पृ॑थि॒व्या म॒क्षू स॑मु॒द्रादु॒त वा॒ पुरी॑षात् स्व॑र्णरा॒दव॑से नो म॒रुत्वा॑न्परा॒वतो॑ वा॒ सद॑नादृ॒तस्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yātv índro divá ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ- makṣū́ samudrā́d utá vā púrīṣāt svàrṇarād ávase no marútvān parāváto vā sádanād r̥tásya
stanzas.translation: Hither let Indra come from earth or heaven, hither with speech from firmament or ocean; With Maruts, from the realm of light to aid us, or from a distance, from the seat of Order.

translations.griffith: Hither let Indra come from earth or heaven, hither with speech from firmament or ocean; With Maruts, from the realm of light to aid us, or from a distance, from the seat of Order.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्थू॒रस्य॑ रा॒यो बृ॑ह॒तो य ईशे॒ तमु॑ ष्टवाम वि॒दथे॒ष्विन्द्र॑म् यो वा॒युना॒ जय॑ति॒ गोम॑तीषु॒ प्र धृ॑ष्णु॒या नय॑ति॒ वस्यो॒ अच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: sthūrásya rāyó br̥ható yá ī́śe tám u ṣṭavāma vidátheṣv índram yó vāyúnā jáyati gómatīṣu prá dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ náyati vásyo ácha
stanzas.translation: That Indra will we laud in our assemblies, him who is Lord of great and lasting riches, Victor with Vâyu where the herds are gathered, who leads with boldness on to higher fortune.

translations.griffith: That Indra will we laud in our assemblies, him who is Lord of great and lasting riches, Victor with Vâyu where the herds are gathered, who leads with boldness on to higher fortune.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॒ यो नमो॒ नम॑सि स्तभा॒यन्निय॑र्ति॒ वाचं॑ ज॒नय॒न्यज॑ध्यै ऋ॒ञ्ज॒सा॒नः पु॑रु॒वार॑ उ॒क्थैरेन्द्रं॑ कृण्वीत॒ सद॑नेषु॒ होता॑
stanzas.transliteration: úpa yó námo námasi stabhāyánn íyarti vā́caṃ janáyan yájadhyai r̥ñjasānáḥ puruvā́ra ukthaír éndraṃ kr̥ṇvīta sádaneṣu hótā
stanzas.translation: May the Priest, Lord of many blessings, striving,– who fixing reverence on reverence, giving Vent to his voice, inciteth men to worshipwith lauds bring Indra hither to our dwellings.

translations.griffith: May the Priest, Lord of many blessings, striving,– who fixing reverence on reverence, giving Vent to his voice, inciteth men to worshipwith lauds bring Indra hither to our dwellings.

stanzas.sanskrit: धि॒षा यदि॑ धिष॒ण्यन्तः॑ सर॒ण्यान्त्सद॑न्तो॒ अद्रि॑मौशि॒जस्य॒ गोहे॑ आ दु॒रोषाः॑ पा॒स्त्यस्य॒ होता॒ यो नो॑ म॒हान्त्सं॒वर॑णेषु॒ वह्निः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dhiṣā́ yádi dhiṣaṇyántaḥ saraṇyā́n sádanto ádrim auśijásya góhe ā́ duróṣāḥ pāstyásya hótā yó no mahā́n saṃváraṇeṣu váhniḥ
stanzas.translation: When sitting pondering in deep devotion in Auṣija's abode they ply the press-stone, May he whose wrath is fierce, the mighty bearer, come as the house-lord's priest within our chambers.

translations.griffith: When sitting pondering in deep devotion in Auṣija's abode they ply the press-stone, May he whose wrath is fierce, the mighty bearer, come as the house-lord's priest within our chambers.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्रा यदीं॑ भार्व॒रस्य॒ वृष्णः॒ सिष॑क्ति॒ शुष्मः॑ स्तुव॒ते भरा॑य गुहा॒ यदी॑मौशि॒जस्य॒ गोहे॒ प्र यद्धि॒ये प्राय॑से॒ मदा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: satrā́ yád īm bhārvarásya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ síṣakti śúṣma stuvaté bhárāya gúhā yád īm auśijásya góhe prá yád dhiyé prā́yase mádāya
stanzas.translation: Surely the power of Bhârvara the mighty for ever helpeth to support the singer; That which in Auṣija's abode lies hidden, to come forth for delight and for devotion.

translations.griffith: Surely the power of Bhârvara the mighty for ever helpeth to support the singer; That which in Auṣija's abode lies hidden, to come forth for delight and for devotion.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि यद्वरां॑सि॒ पर्व॑तस्य वृ॒ण्वे पयो॑भिर्जि॒न्वे अ॒पां जवां॑सि वि॒दद्गौ॒रस्य॑ गव॒यस्य॒ गोहे॒ यदी॒ वाजा॑य सु॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ वह॑न्ति
stanzas.transliteration: ví yád várāṃsi párvatasya vr̥ṇvé páyobhir jinvé apā́ṃ jávāṃsi vidád gaurásya gavayásya góhe yádī vā́jāya sudhyò váhanti
stanzas.translation: When he unbars the spaces of the mountains, and quickens with his floods the water-torrents, He finds in lair the buffalo and wild-ox when the wise lead him on to vigorous exploit.

translations.griffith: When he unbars the spaces of the mountains, and quickens with his floods the water-torrents, He finds in lair the buffalo and wild-ox when the wise lead him on to vigorous exploit.

stanzas.sanskrit: भ॒द्रा ते॒ हस्ता॒ सुकृ॑तो॒त पा॒णी प्र॑य॒न्तारा॑ स्तुव॒ते राध॑ इन्द्र का ते॒ निष॑त्तिः॒ किमु॒ नो म॑मत्सि॒ किं नोदु॑दु हर्षसे॒ दात॒वा उ॑
stanzas.transliteration: bhadrā́ te hástā súkr̥totá pāṇī́ prayantā́rā stuvaté rā́dha indra kā́ te níṣattiḥ kím u nó mamatsi kíṃ nód-ud u harṣase dā́tavā́ u
stanzas.translation: Auspicious are thy hands, thine arms wellfashioned which proffer bounty, Indra, to thy praiser. What sloth is this? Why dost thou not rejoice thee? Why dost thou not delight thyself with giving?

translations.griffith: Auspicious are thy hands, thine arms wellfashioned which proffer bounty, Indra, to thy praiser. What sloth is this? Why dost thou not rejoice thee? Why dost thou not delight thyself with giving?

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा वस्व॒ इन्द्रः॑ स॒त्यः स॒म्राड्ढन्ता॑ वृ॒त्रं वरि॑वः पू॒रवे॑ कः पुरु॑ष्टुत॒ क्रत्वा॑ नः शग्धि रा॒यो भ॑क्षी॒य तेऽव॑सो॒ दैव्य॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ vásva índraḥ satyáḥ samrā́ḍ -hántā vr̥tráṃ várivaḥ pūráve kaḥ púruṣṭuta krátvā naḥ śagdhi rāyó bhakṣīyá té 'vaso daívyasya
stanzas.translation: So Indra is the truthful Lord of treasure. Freedom he gave to man by slaying Vr̥itra. Much-lauded! help us with thy power to riches: may I be sharer of thy Godlike favour.

translations.griffith: So Indra is the truthful Lord of treasure. Freedom he gave to man by slaying Vr̥itra. Much-lauded! help us with thy power to riches: may I be sharer of thy Godlike favour.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for,the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, care-borne, through song be victqrs ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for,the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, care-borne, through song be victqrs ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: यन्न॒ इन्द्रो॑ जुजु॒षे यच्च॒ वष्टि॒ तन्नो॑ म॒हान्क॑रति शु॒ष्म्या चि॑त् ब्रह्म॒ स्तोमं॑ म॒घवा॒ सोम॑मु॒क्था यो अश्मा॑नं॒ शव॑सा॒ बिभ्र॒देति॑
stanzas.transliteration: yán na índro jujuṣé yác ca váṣṭi tán no mahā́n karati śuṣmy ā́ cit bráhma stómam maghávā sómam ukthā́ yó áśmānaṃ śávasā bíbhrad éti
stanzas.translation: THAT gift of ours which Indra loves and welcomes, even that he makes for us, the Great and Strong One. He who comes wielding in his might the thunder, Maghavan, gives prayer, praise, and laud, and Soma.

translations.griffith: THAT gift of ours which Indra loves and welcomes, even that he makes for us, the Great and Strong One. He who comes wielding in his might the thunder, Maghavan, gives prayer, praise, and laud, and Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॒ वृष॑न्धिं॒ चतु॑रश्रि॒मस्य॑न्नु॒ग्रो बा॒हुभ्यां॒ नृत॑मः॒ शची॑वान् श्रि॒ये परु॑ष्णीमु॒षमा॑ण॒ ऊर्णां॒ यस्याः॒ पर्वा॑णि स॒ख्याय॑ वि॒व्ये
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣandhiṃ cáturaśrim ásyann ugró bāhúbhyāṃ nŕ̥tamaḥ śácīvān śriyé páruṣṇīm uṣámāṇa ū́rṇāṃ yásyāḥ párvāṇi sakhyā́ya vivyé
stanzas.translation: Bull, hurler of the four-edged rain-producer with both his arms, strong, mighty, most heroic; Wearing as wool Parushṇî for adornment, whose joints for sake of friendship he hath covered.

translations.griffith: Bull, hurler of the four-edged rain-producer with both his arms, strong, mighty, most heroic; Wearing as wool Parushṇî for adornment, whose joints for sake of friendship he hath covered.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो दे॒वो दे॒वत॑मो॒ जाय॑मानो म॒हो वाजे॑भिर्म॒हद्भि॑श्च॒ शुष्मैः॑ दधा॑नो॒ वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोरु॒शन्तं॒ द्याममे॑न रेजय॒त्प्र भूम॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó devó devátamo jā́yamāno mahó vā́jebhir mahádbhiś ca śúṣmaiḥ dádhāno vájram bāhvór uśántaṃ dyā́m ámena rejayat prá bhū́ma
stanzas.translation: God who of all the Gods was born divinest, endowed with ample strength and mighty powers, And bearing in his arrns the yearning thunder, with violent rush caused heaven and earth to tremble.

translations.griffith: God who of all the Gods was born divinest, endowed with ample strength and mighty powers, And bearing in his arrns the yearning thunder, with violent rush caused heaven and earth to tremble.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॒ रोधां॑सि प्र॒वत॑श्च पू॒र्वीर्द्यौर्ऋ॒ष्वाज्जनि॑मन्रेजत॒ क्षाः आ मा॒तरा॒ भर॑ति शु॒ष्म्या गोर्नृ॒वत्परि॑ज्मन्नोनुवन्त॒ वाताः॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśvā ródhāṃsi pravátaś ca pūrvī́r dyaúr r̥ṣvā́j jániman rejata kṣā́ḥ ā́ mātárā bhárati śuṣmy ā́ gór nr̥vát párijman nonuvanta vā́tāḥ
stanzas.translation: Before the High God, at his birth, heaven trembled, earth, many floods and all the precipices. The Strong One bringeth nigh the Bull's two Parents: loud sing the winds, like men, in air's midregion.

translations.griffith: Before the High God, at his birth, heaven trembled, earth, many floods and all the precipices. The Strong One bringeth nigh the Bull's two Parents: loud sing the winds, like men, in air's midregion.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता तू त॑ इन्द्र मह॒तो म॒हानि॒ विश्वे॒ष्वित्सव॑नेषु प्र॒वाच्या॑ यच्छू॑र धृष्णो धृष॒ता द॑धृ॒ष्वानहिं॒ वज्रे॑ण॒ शव॒सावि॑वेषीः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ tū́ ta indra maható mahā́ni víśveṣv ít sávaneṣu pravā́cyā yác chūra dhr̥ṣṇo dhr̥ṣatā́ dadhr̥ṣvā́n áhiṃ vájreṇa śávasā́viveṣīḥ
stanzas.translation: These are thy great deeds, Indra, thine, the Mighty, deeds to be told aloud at all libations, That thou, O Hero, bold and boldly daring, didst with thy bolt, by strength, destroy the Dragon.

translations.griffith: These are thy great deeds, Indra, thine, the Mighty, deeds to be told aloud at all libations, That thou, O Hero, bold and boldly daring, didst with thy bolt, by strength, destroy the Dragon.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता तू ते॑ स॒त्या तु॑विनृम्ण॒ विश्वा॒ प्र धे॒नवः॑ सिस्रते॒ वृष्ण॒ ऊध्नः॑ अधा॑ ह॒ त्वद्वृ॑षमणो भिया॒नाः प्र सिन्ध॑वो॒ जव॑सा चक्रमन्त
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ tū́ te satyā́ tuvinr̥mṇa víśvā prá dhenávaḥ sisrate vŕ̥ṣṇa ū́dhnaḥ ádhā ha tvád vr̥ṣamaṇo bhiyānā́ḥ prá síndhavo jávasā cakramanta
stanzas.translation: True are all these thy deeds, O Most Heroic. The Milch-kine issued from the streaming udder. In fear of thee, O thou of manly spirit, the rivers swiftly set themselves in motion.

translations.griffith: True are all these thy deeds, O Most Heroic. The Milch-kine issued from the streaming udder. In fear of thee, O thou of manly spirit, the rivers swiftly set themselves in motion.

stanzas.sanskrit: अत्राह॑ ते हरिव॒स्ता उ॑ दे॒वीरवो॑भिरिन्द्र स्तवन्त॒ स्वसा॑रः यत्सी॒मनु॒ प्र मु॒चो ब॑द्बधा॒ना दी॒र्घामनु॒ प्रसि॑तिं स्यन्द॒यध्यै॑
stanzas.transliteration: átrā́ha te harivas tā́ u devī́r ávobhir indra stavanta svásāraḥ yát sīm ánu prá mucó badbadhānā́ḥ- dīrghā́m ánu prásitiṃ syandayádhyai
stanzas.translation: With joy, O Indra, Lord of Tawny Coursers, the Sisters then, these Goddesses, extolled thee, When thou didst give the prisoned ones their freedom to wander at their will in long succession.

translations.griffith: With joy, O Indra, Lord of Tawny Coursers, the Sisters then, these Goddesses, extolled thee, When thou didst give the prisoned ones their freedom to wander at their will in long succession.

stanzas.sanskrit: पि॒पी॒ळे अं॒शुर्मद्यो॒ न सिन्धु॒रा त्वा॒ शमी॑ शशमा॒नस्य॑ श॒क्तिः अ॒स्म॒द्र्य॑क्छुशुचा॒नस्य॑ यम्या आ॒शुर्न र॒श्मिं तु॒व्योज॑सं॒ गोः
stanzas.transliteration: pipīḷé aṃśúr mádyo ná síndhur ā́ tvā śámī śaśamānásya śaktíḥ asmadryàk chuśucānásya yamyāḥ- āśúr ná raśmíṃ tuvyójasaṃ góḥ
stanzas.translation: Pressed is the gladdening stalk as 'twere a river: so let the rite, the toiler's power, attract thee To us-ward, of the Bright One, as the courser strains his. exceedingly strong leather bridle.

translations.griffith: Pressed is the gladdening stalk as 'twere a river: so let the rite, the toiler's power, attract thee To us-ward, of the Bright One, as the courser strains his. exceedingly strong leather bridle.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मे वर्षि॑ष्ठा कृणुहि॒ ज्येष्ठा॑ नृ॒म्णानि॑ स॒त्रा स॑हुरे॒ सहां॑सि अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ वृ॒त्रा सु॒हना॑नि रन्धि ज॒हि वध॑र्व॒नुषो॒ मर्त्य॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: asmé várṣiṣṭhā kr̥ṇuhi jyéṣṭhā nr̥mṇā́ni satrā́ sahure sáhāṃsi asmábhyaṃ vr̥trā́ suhánāni randhi jahí vádhar vanúṣo mártyasya
stanzas.translation: Ever by us perform thy most heroic, thine highest, best victorious deeds, O Victor. For us make Vr̥itras easy to be conquered: destroy the weapon of our mortal foeman.

translations.griffith: Ever by us perform thy most heroic, thine highest, best victorious deeds, O Victor. For us make Vr̥itras easy to be conquered: destroy the weapon of our mortal foeman.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॒मित्सु शृ॑णुहि॒ त्वमि॑न्द्रा॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्राँ उप॑ माहि॒ वाजा॑न् अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ विश्वा॑ इषणः॒ पुरं॑धीर॒स्माकं॒ सु म॑घवन्बोधि गो॒दाः
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam ít sú śr̥ṇuhi tvám indra- -asmábhyaṃ citrā́m̐ úpa māhi vā́jān asmábhyaṃ víśvā iṣaṇaḥ púraṃdhīr asmā́kaṃ sú maghavan bodhi godā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Graciously listen to our prayer, O Indra, and strength of varied sort bestow thou on us. Send to us all intelligence arid wisdom O Maghavan, be he who gives us cattle.

translations.griffith: Graciously listen to our prayer, O Indra, and strength of varied sort bestow thou on us. Send to us all intelligence arid wisdom O Maghavan, be he who gives us cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell hiah like rivers to the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell hiah like rivers to the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था म॒हाम॑वृध॒त्कस्य॒ होतु॑र्य॒ज्ञं जु॑षा॒णो अ॒भि सोम॒मूधः॑ पिब॑न्नुशा॒नो जु॒षमा॑णो॒ अन्धो॑ वव॒क्ष ऋ॒ष्वः शु॑च॒ते धना॑य
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ mahā́m avr̥dhat kásya hótur yajñáṃ juṣāṇó abhí sómam ū́dhaḥ píbann uśānó juṣámāṇo ándho vavakṣá r̥ṣváḥ śucaté dhánāya
stanzas.translation: How, what priest's sacrifice hath he made mighty, rejoicing in the Soma and its fountain? Delighting in juice, eagerly drinking, the Lofty One hath waxed for splendid riches.

translations.griffith: How, what priest's sacrifice hath he made mighty, rejoicing in the Soma and its fountain? Delighting in juice, eagerly drinking, the Lofty One hath waxed for splendid riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: को अ॑स्य वी॒रः स॑ध॒माद॑माप॒ समा॑नंश सुम॒तिभिः॒ को अ॑स्य कद॑स्य चि॒त्रं चि॑किते॒ कदू॒ती वृ॒धे भु॑वच्छशमा॒नस्य॒ यज्योः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kó asya vīráḥ sadhamā́dam āpa sám ānaṃśa sumatíbhiḥ kó asya kád asya citráṃ cikite kád ūtī́ vr̥dhé bhuvac chaśamānásya yájyoḥ
stanzas.translation: What hero hath been made his feast-companion? Who hath been partner in his loving-kindness? What know we of his wondrous acts? How often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler?

translations.griffith: What hero hath been made his feast-companion? Who hath been partner in his loving-kindness? What know we of his wondrous acts? How often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler?

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था शृ॑णोति हू॒यमा॑न॒मिन्द्रः॑ क॒था शृ॒ण्वन्नव॑सामस्य वेद का अ॑स्य पू॒र्वीरुप॑मातयो ह क॒थैन॑माहुः॒ पपु॑रिं जरि॒त्रे
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ śr̥ṇoti hūyámānam índraḥ kathā́ śr̥ṇvánn ávasām asya veda kā́ asya pūrvī́r úpamātayo ha kathaínam āhuḥ pápuriṃ jaritré
stanzas.translation: How heareth Indra offered invocation? How, hearing, marketh he the invoker's wishes? What are his ancient acts of bounty? Wherefore call they him One who filleth full the singer?

translations.griffith: How heareth Indra offered invocation? How, hearing, marketh he the invoker's wishes? What are his ancient acts of bounty? Wherefore call they him One who filleth full the singer?

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था स॒बाधः॑ शशमा॒नो अ॑स्य॒ नश॑द॒भि द्रवि॑णं॒ दीध्या॑नः दे॒वो भु॑व॒न्नवे॑दा म ऋ॒तानां॒ नमो॑ जगृ॒भ्वाँ अ॒भि यज्जुजो॑षत्
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ sabā́dhaḥ śaśamānó asya náśad abhí dráviṇaṃ dī́dhyānaḥ devó bhuvan návedā ma r̥tā́nāṃ námo jagr̥bhvā́m̐ abhí yáj jújoṣat
stanzas.translation: How doth the priest who laboureth, ever longing, win for himself the wealth which he possesseth? May he, the God, mark well my truthful praises, having received the homage which he loveth.

translations.griffith: How doth the priest who laboureth, ever longing, win for himself the wealth which he possesseth? May he, the God, mark well my truthful praises, having received the homage which he loveth.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था कद॒स्या उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ दे॒वो मर्त॑स्य स॒ख्यं जु॑जोष क॒था कद॑स्य स॒ख्यं सखि॑भ्यो॒ ये अ॑स्मि॒न्कामं॑ सु॒युजं॑ तत॒स्रे
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ kád asyā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭau devó mártasya sakhyáṃ jujoṣa kathā́ kád asya sakhyáṃ sákhibhyo yé asmin kā́maṃ suyújaṃ tatasré
stanzas.translation: How, and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the God chosen as this morn is breaking? How, and what love hath he for those who love him, who have entwined in him their firm affection?

translations.griffith: How, and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the God chosen as this morn is breaking? How, and what love hath he for those who love him, who have entwined in him their firm affection?

stanzas.sanskrit: किमादम॑त्रं स॒ख्यं सखि॑भ्यः क॒दा नु ते॑ भ्रा॒त्रं प्र ब्र॑वाम श्रि॒ये सु॒दृशो॒ वपु॑रस्य॒ सर्गाः॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण चि॒त्रत॑ममिष॒ आ गोः
stanzas.transliteration: kím ā́d ámatraṃ sakhyáṃ sákhibhyaḥ kadā́ nú te bhrātrám prá bravāma śriyé sudŕ̥śo vápur asya sárgāḥ svàr ṇá citrátamam iṣa ā́ góḥ
stanzas.translation: Is then thy friendship with thy friends most mighty? Thy brotherhood with us, -when may we tell it? The streams of milk move, as most wondrous sunlight, the beauty of the Lovely One for glory.

translations.griffith: Is then thy friendship with thy friends most mighty? Thy brotherhood with us, -when may we tell it? The streams of milk move, as most wondrous sunlight, the beauty of the Lovely One for glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्रुहं॒ जिघां॑सन्ध्व॒रस॑मनि॒न्द्रां तेति॑क्ते ति॒ग्मा तु॒जसे॒ अनी॑का ऋ॒णा चि॒द्यत्र॑ ऋण॒या न॑ उ॒ग्रो दू॒रे अज्ञा॑ता उ॒षसो॑ बबा॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: drúhaṃ jíghāṃsan dhvarásam anindrā́ṃ tétikte tigmā́ tujáse ánīkā r̥ṇā́ cid yátra r̥ṇayā́ na ugró dūré ájñātā uṣáso babādhé
stanzas.translation: About to stay the Indra-less destructive spirit he sharpens his keen arms to strike her. Whereby the Strong, although our debts' exactor, drives in the distant mornings that we know not.

translations.griffith: About to stay the Indra-less destructive spirit he sharpens his keen arms to strike her. Whereby the Strong, although our debts' exactor, drives in the distant mornings that we know not.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तस्य॒ हि शु॒रुधः॒ सन्ति॑ पू॒र्वीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ धी॒तिर्वृ॑जि॒नानि॑ हन्ति ऋ॒तस्य॒ श्लोको॑ बधि॒रा त॑तर्द॒ कर्णा॑ बुधा॒नः शु॒चमा॑न आ॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tásya hí śurúdhaḥ sánti pūrvī́r r̥tásya dhītír vr̥jinā́ni hanti r̥tásya ślóko badhirā́ tatarda kárṇā budhānáḥ śucámāna āyóḥ
stanzas.translation: Eternal Law hath varied food that strengthens; thought of eternal Law, removes transgressions. The praise-hymn of eternal Law, arousing, glowing, hath oped the deaf ears of the living.

translations.griffith: Eternal Law hath varied food that strengthens; thought of eternal Law, removes transgressions. The praise-hymn of eternal Law, arousing, glowing, hath oped the deaf ears of the living.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तस्य॑ दृ॒ळ्हा ध॒रुणा॑नि सन्ति पु॒रूणि॑ च॒न्द्रा वपु॑षे॒ वपूं॑षि ऋ॒तेन॑ दी॒र्घमि॑षणन्त॒ पृक्ष॑ ऋ॒तेन॒ गाव॑ ऋ॒तमा वि॑वेशुः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tásya dr̥ḷhā́ dharúṇāni santi purū́ṇi candrā́ vápuṣe vápūṃṣi r̥téna dīrghám iṣaṇanta pŕ̥kṣaḥ- r̥téna gā́va r̥tám ā́ viveśuḥ
stanzas.translation: Firm-seated are eternal Law's foundations in its fair form are many splendid beauties. By holy Law long lasting food they bring us; by holy Law have cows come to our worship.

translations.griffith: Firm-seated are eternal Law's foundations in its fair form are many splendid beauties. By holy Law long lasting food they bring us; by holy Law have cows come to our worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तं ये॑मा॒न ऋ॒तमिद्व॑नोत्यृ॒तस्य॒ शुष्म॑स्तुर॒या उ॑ ग॒व्युः ऋ॒ताय॑ पृ॒थ्वी ब॑हु॒ले ग॑भी॒रे ऋ॒ताय॑ धे॒नू प॑र॒मे दु॑हाते
stanzas.transliteration: r̥táṃ yemāná r̥tám íd vanoti- r̥tásya śúṣmas turayā́ u gavyúḥ r̥tā́ya pr̥thvī́ bahulé gabhīré r̥tā́ya dhenū́ paramé duhāte
stanzas.translation: Fixing eternal Law he, too, upholds it swift moves the might of Law and wins the booty. To Law belong the vast deep Earth and Heaven: Milch-kine supreme, to Law their milk they render.

translations.griffith: Fixing eternal Law he, too, upholds it swift moves the might of Law and wins the booty. To Law belong the vast deep Earth and Heaven: Milch-kine supreme, to Law their milk they render.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded,– glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers to the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded,– glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers to the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: का सु॑ष्टु॒तिः शव॑सः सू॒नुमिन्द्र॑मर्वाची॒नं राध॑स॒ आ व॑वर्तत् द॒दिर्हि वी॒रो गृ॑ण॒ते वसू॑नि॒ स गोप॑तिर्नि॒ष्षिधां॑ नो जनासः
stanzas.transliteration: kā́ suṣṭutíḥ śávasaḥ sūnúm índram arvācīnáṃ rā́dhasa ā́ vavartat dadír hí vīró gr̥ṇaté vásūni sá gópatir niṣṣídhāṃ no janāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: WHAT worthy praise will bring before us Indra, the Son of Strength, that he may grant us riches; For he the Hero, gives the singer treasures: he is the Lord who sends us gifts, ye people.

translations.griffith: WHAT worthy praise will bring before us Indra, the Son of Strength, that he may grant us riches; For he the Hero, gives the singer treasures: he is the Lord who sends us gifts, ye people.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॒ हव्यः॒ स ईड्यः॒ स सुष्टु॑त॒ इन्द्रः॑ स॒त्यरा॑धाः स याम॒न्ना म॒घवा॒ मर्त्या॑य ब्रह्मण्य॒ते सुष्व॑ये॒ वरि॑वो धात्
stanzas.transliteration: sá vr̥trahátye hávyaḥ sá ī́ḍyaḥ sá súṣṭuta índraḥ satyárādhāḥ sá yā́mann ā́ maghávā mártyāya brahmaṇyaté súṣvaye várivo dhāt
stanzas.translation: To be invoked and hymned in fight with Vr̥itra, that well-praised Indra gives us real bounties. That Maghavan brings comfort in the foray to the religious man who pours libations.

translations.griffith: To be invoked and hymned in fight with Vr̥itra, that well-praised Indra gives us real bounties. That Maghavan brings comfort in the foray to the religious man who pours libations.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमिन्नरो॒ वि ह्व॑यन्ते समी॒के रि॑रि॒क्वांस॑स्त॒न्वः॑ कृण्वत॒ त्राम् मि॒थो यत्त्या॒गमु॒भया॑सो॒ अग्म॒न्नर॑स्तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑यस्य सा॒तौ
stanzas.transliteration: tám ín náro ví hvayante samīké ririkvā́ṃsas tanvàḥ kr̥ṇvata trā́m mithó yát tyāgám ubháyāso ágman náras tokásya tánayasya sātaú
stanzas.translation: Him, verily, the men invoke in combat; risking their lives they make him their protector, When heroes, foe to foe, give up their bodies, fighting, each side, for children and their offspring.

translations.griffith: Him, verily, the men invoke in combat; risking their lives they make him their protector, When heroes, foe to foe, give up their bodies, fighting, each side, for children and their offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्र॒तू॒यन्ति॑ क्षि॒तयो॒ योग॑ उग्राशुषा॒णासो॑ मि॒थो अर्ण॑सातौ सं यद्विशोऽव॑वृत्रन्त यु॒ध्मा आदिन्नेम॑ इन्द्रयन्ते अ॒भीके॑
stanzas.transliteration: kratūyánti kṣitáyo yóga ugra- -āśuṣāṇā́so mithó árṇasātau sáṃ yád víśó 'vavr̥tranta yudhmā́ḥ- ā́d ín néma indrayante abhī́ke
stanzas.translation: Strong God! the folk at need put forth their vigour, striving together in the whirl of battle. When warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like Indra.

translations.griffith: Strong God! the folk at need put forth their vigour, striving together in the whirl of battle. When warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: आदिद्ध॒ नेम॑ इन्द्रि॒यं य॑जन्त॒ आदित्प॒क्तिः पु॑रो॒ळाशं॑ रिरिच्यात् आदित्सोमो॒ वि प॑पृच्या॒दसु॑ष्वी॒नादिज्जु॑जोष वृष॒भं यज॑ध्यै
stanzas.transliteration: ā́d íd dha néma indriyáṃ yajante- ā́d ít paktíḥ puroḷā́śaṃ riricyāt ā́d ít sómo ví papr̥cyād ásuṣvīn ā́d íj jujoṣa vr̥ṣabháṃ yájadhyai
stanzas.translation: Hence many a one worships the might of Indra: hence let the brew succeed the meal-oblation. Hence let the Soma banish those who pour not: even hence I joy to pay the Strong One worship.

translations.griffith: Hence many a one worships the might of Indra: hence let the brew succeed the meal-oblation. Hence let the Soma banish those who pour not: even hence I joy to pay the Strong One worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: कृ॒णोत्य॑स्मै॒ वरि॑वो॒ य इ॒त्थेन्द्रा॑य॒ सोम॑मुश॒ते सु॒नोति॑ स॒ध्री॒चीने॑न॒ मन॒सावि॑वेन॒न्तमित्सखा॑यं कृणुते स॒मत्सु॑
stanzas.transliteration: kr̥ṇóty asmai várivo yá itthā́- -índrāya sómam uśaté sunóti sadhrīcī́nena mánasā́vivenan tám ít sákhāyaṃ kr̥ṇute samátsu
stanzas.translation: Indra gives comfort to the man who truly presses, for him who longs fot it, the Soma, Not disaffected, with devoted spirit this man he takes to be his friend in battles.

translations.griffith: Indra gives comfort to the man who truly presses, for him who longs fot it, the Soma, Not disaffected, with devoted spirit this man he takes to be his friend in battles.

stanzas.sanskrit: य इन्द्रा॑य सु॒नव॒त्सोम॑म॒द्य पचा॑त्प॒क्तीरु॒त भृ॒ज्जाति॑ धा॒नाः प्रति॑ मना॒योरु॒चथा॑नि॒ हर्य॒न्तस्मि॑न्दध॒द्वृष॑णं॒ शुष्म॒मिन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yá índrāya sunávat sómam adyá pácāt paktī́r utá bhr̥jjā́ti dhānā́ḥ práti manāyór ucáthāni háryan tásmin dadhad vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ śúṣmam índraḥ
stanzas.translation: He who this day for Indra presses Soma, prepares the brew and fries the grains of barley- Loving the hymns of that devoted servant, to him may Indra give heroic vigour.

translations.griffith: He who this day for Indra presses Soma, prepares the brew and fries the grains of barley- Loving the hymns of that devoted servant, to him may Indra give heroic vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒दा स॑म॒र्यं व्यचे॒दृघा॑वा दी॒र्घं यदा॒जिम॒भ्यख्य॑द॒र्यः अचि॑क्रद॒द्वृष॑णं॒ पत्न्यच्छा॑ दुरो॒ण आ निशि॑तं सोम॒सुद्भिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yadā́ samaryáṃ vy áced ŕ̥ghāvā dīrgháṃ yád ājím abhy ákhyad aryáḥ ácikradad vŕ̥ṣaṇam pátny áchā duroṇá ā́ níśitaṃ somasúdbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: When the impetuous chief hath sought the confliet, and the lord looked upon the long-drawn battle, The matron calls to the Strong God whom pressers of Soma have encouraged int the dwelling.

translations.griffith: When the impetuous chief hath sought the confliet, and the lord looked upon the long-drawn battle, The matron calls to the Strong God whom pressers of Soma have encouraged int the dwelling.

stanzas.sanskrit: भूय॑सा व॒स्नम॑चर॒त्कनी॒योऽवि॑क्रीतो अकानिषं॒ पुन॒र्यन् स भूय॑सा॒ कनी॑यो॒ नारि॑रेचीद्दी॒ना दक्षा॒ वि दु॑हन्ति॒ प्र वा॒णम्
stanzas.transliteration: bhū́yasā vasnám acarat kánīyaḥ- -ávikrīto akāniṣam púnar yán sá bhū́yasā kánīyo nā́rirecīd dīnā́ dákṣā ví duhanti prá vāṇám
stanzas.translation: He bid a small price for a thing of value: I was content, returning, still unpurchased. He heightened not his insufficient offer. Simple and clever, both milk out the udder.

translations.griffith: He bid a small price for a thing of value: I was content, returning, still unpurchased. He heightened not his insufficient offer. Simple and clever, both milk out the udder.

stanzas.sanskrit: क इ॒मं द॒शभि॒र्ममेन्द्रं॑ क्रीणाति धे॒नुभिः॑ य॒दा वृ॒त्राणि॒ जङ्घ॑न॒दथै॑नं मे॒ पुन॑र्ददत्
stanzas.transliteration: ká imáṃ daśábhir máma- -índraṃ krīṇāti dhenúbhiḥ yadā́ vr̥trā́ṇi jáṅghanad áthainam me púnar dadat
stanzas.translation: Who for ten milch-kine purchaseth from rne this Indra who is mine? When he hath slain the Vr̥itras let the buyer give him back to me.

translations.griffith: Who for ten milch-kine purchaseth from rne this Indra who is mine? When he hath slain the Vr̥itras let the buyer give him back to me.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू ष्टु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ नू गृ॑णा॒न इषं॑ जरि॒त्रे न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ न पी॑पेः अका॑रि ते हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्यं॑ धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭutá indra nū́ gr̥ṇānáḥ- íṣaṃ jaritré nadyò ná pīpeḥ ákāri te harivo bráhma návyaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell high like rivers for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell high like rivers for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: को अ॒द्य नर्यो॑ दे॒वका॑म उ॒शन्निन्द्र॑स्य स॒ख्यं जु॑जोष को वा॑ म॒हेऽव॑से॒ पार्या॑य॒ समि॑द्धे अ॒ग्नौ सु॒तसो॑म ईट्टे
stanzas.transliteration: kó adyá náryo devákāmaḥ- uśánn índrasya sakhyáṃ jujoṣa kó vā mahé 'vase pā́ryāya sámiddhe agnaú sutásoma īṭṭe
stanzas.translation: WHAT friend of man, God-loving, hath delighted, yearning therefor, this day in Indra's friendship? Who with enkindled flame and flowing Soma laudeth him for his great protecting favour?

translations.griffith: WHAT friend of man, God-loving, hath delighted, yearning therefor, this day in Indra's friendship? Who with enkindled flame and flowing Soma laudeth him for his great protecting favour?

stanzas.sanskrit: को ना॑नाम॒ वच॑सा सो॒म्याय॑ मना॒युर्वा॑ भवति॒ वस्त॑ उ॒स्राः क इन्द्र॑स्य॒ युज्यं॒ कः स॑खि॒त्वं को भ्रा॒त्रं व॑ष्टि क॒वये॒ क ऊ॒ती
stanzas.transliteration: kó nānāma vácasā somyā́ya manāyúr vā bhavati vásta usrā́ḥ ká índrasya yújyaṃ káḥ sakhitváṃ kó bhrātráṃ vaṣṭi kaváye ká ūtī́
stanzas.translation: Who hath with prayer bowed to the Soma-lover? What pious man endues the beams of morning? Who seeks bond, fritridship, brotherhood with Indra? Who hath recourse unto the Sage for succour?

translations.griffith: Who hath with prayer bowed to the Soma-lover? What pious man endues the beams of morning? Who seeks bond, fritridship, brotherhood with Indra? Who hath recourse unto the Sage for succour?

stanzas.sanskrit: को दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीते॒ क आ॑दि॒त्याँ अदि॑तिं॒ ज्योति॑रीट्टे कस्या॒श्विना॒विन्द्रो॑ अ॒ग्निः सु॒तस्यां॒शोः पि॑बन्ति॒ मन॒सावि॑वेनम्
stanzas.transliteration: kó devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīte ká ādityā́m̐ áditiṃ jyótir īṭṭe kásyāśvínāv índro agníḥ sutásya- -aṃśóḥ pibanti mánasā́vivenam
stanzas.translation: Who claims to-day the Deities' protection, asks Aditi for light, or the Âdityas? Of whose pressed stalk of Soma drink the Aṣvins, Indra, and Agni, well-inclined in spirit?

translations.griffith: Who claims to-day the Deities' protection, asks Aditi for light, or the Âdityas? Of whose pressed stalk of Soma drink the Aṣvins, Indra, and Agni, well-inclined in spirit?

stanzas.sanskrit: तस्मा॑ अ॒ग्निर्भार॑तः॒ शर्म॑ यंस॒ज्ज्योक्प॑श्या॒त्सूर्य॑मु॒च्चर॑न्तम् य इन्द्रा॑य सु॒नवा॒मेत्याह॒ नरे॒ नर्या॑य॒ नृत॑माय नृ॒णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: tásmā agnír bhā́rataḥ śárma yaṃsaj jyók paśyāt sū́ryam uccárantam yá índrāya sunávāméty ā́ha náre náryāya nŕ̥tamāya nr̥ṇā́m
stanzas.translation: To him shall Agni Bharata give shelter: long shall he look upon the Sun up-rising, Who sayeth, Let us press the juice for Indra, man's Friend, the Hero manliest of heroes.

translations.griffith: To him shall Agni Bharata give shelter: long shall he look upon the Sun up-rising, Who sayeth, Let us press the juice for Indra, man's Friend, the Hero manliest of heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: न तं जि॑नन्ति ब॒हवो॒ न द॒भ्रा उ॒र्व॑स्मा॒ अदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यंसत् प्रि॒यः सु॒कृत्प्रि॒य इन्द्रे॑ मना॒युः प्रि॒यः सु॑प्रा॒वीः प्रि॒यो अ॑स्य सो॒मी
stanzas.transliteration: ná táṃ jinanti bahávo ná dabhrā́ḥ- urv àsmā áditiḥ śárma yaṃsat priyáḥ sukŕ̥t priyá índre manāyúḥ priyáḥ suprāvī́ḥ priyó asya somī́
stanzas.translation: Him neither few men overcome, nor many to him shall Aditi give spacious shelter. Dear is the pious, the devout, to Indra dear is the zealous, dear the Soma-bringer.

translations.griffith: Him neither few men overcome, nor many to him shall Aditi give spacious shelter. Dear is the pious, the devout, to Indra dear is the zealous, dear the Soma-bringer.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒प्रा॒व्यः॑ प्राशु॒षाळे॒ष वी॒रः सुष्वेः॑ प॒क्तिं कृ॑णुते॒ केव॒लेन्द्रः॑ नासु॑ष्वेरा॒पिर्न सखा॒ न जा॒मिर्दु॑ष्प्रा॒व्यो॑ऽवह॒न्तेदवा॑चः
stanzas.transliteration: suprāvyàḥ prāśuṣā́ḷ eṣá vīráḥ súṣveḥ paktíṃ kr̥ṇute kévaléndraḥ nā́suṣver āpír ná sákhā ná jāmír duṣprāvyò 'vahantéd ávācaḥ
stanzas.translation: This Hero curbs the mighty for the zealous: the presser's brew Indra possesses solely: No brother, kin, or friend to him who pours not, destroyer of the dumb who would resist him.

translations.griffith: This Hero curbs the mighty for the zealous: the presser's brew Indra possesses solely: No brother, kin, or friend to him who pours not, destroyer of the dumb who would resist him.

stanzas.sanskrit: न रे॒वता॑ प॒णिना॑ स॒ख्यमिन्द्रोऽसु॑न्वता सुत॒पाः सं गृ॑णीते आस्य॒ वेदः॑ खि॒दति॒ हन्ति॑ न॒ग्नं वि सुष्व॑ये प॒क्तये॒ केव॑लो भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: ná revátā paṇínā sakhyám índraḥ- -ásunvatā sutapā́ḥ sáṃ gr̥ṇīte ā́sya védaḥ khidáti hánti nagnáṃ ví súṣvaye paktáye kévalo bhūt
stanzas.translation: Not with the wealthy churl who pours no Soma doth Indra, Soma-drinker, bind alliance. He draws away his wealth and slays him naked, own Friend to him who offers, for oblation.

translations.griffith: Not with the wealthy churl who pours no Soma doth Indra, Soma-drinker, bind alliance. He draws away his wealth and slays him naked, own Friend to him who offers, for oblation.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रं॒ परेऽव॑रे मध्य॒मास॒ इन्द्रं॒ यान्तोऽव॑सितास॒ इन्द्र॑म् इन्द्रं॑ क्षि॒यन्त॑ उ॒त युध्य॑माना॒ इन्द्रं॒ नरो॑ वाज॒यन्तो॑ हवन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: índram páré 'vare madhyamā́saḥ- índraṃ yā́ntó 'vasitāsa índram índraṃ kṣiyánta utá yúdhyamānāḥ- índraṃ náro vājayánto havante
stanzas.translation: Highest and lowest, men who stand between diem, going, returning, dwelling in contentment, Those who show forth their strength when urged to battle-these are the men who call for aid on Indra.

translations.griffith: Highest and lowest, men who stand between diem, going, returning, dwelling in contentment, Those who show forth their strength when urged to battle-these are the men who call for aid on Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हं मनु॑रभवं॒ सूर्य॑श्चा॒हं क॒क्षीवाँ॒ ऋषि॑रस्मि॒ विप्रः॑ अ॒हं कुत्स॑मार्जुने॒यं न्यृ॑ञ्जे॒ऽहं क॒विरु॒शना॒ पश्य॑ता मा
stanzas.transliteration: ahám mánur abhavaṃ sū́ryaś ca- -aháṃ kakṣī́vām̐ ŕ̥ṣir asmi vípraḥ aháṃ kútsam ārjuneyáṃ ny r̥̀ñje -aháṃ kavír uśánā páśyatā mā
stanzas.translation: I WAS aforetime Manu, I was Sûrya: I am the sage Kakshîvân, holy singer. Kutsa the son of Arjuni I master. I am the sapient Uṣanâ behold me.

translations.griffith: I WAS aforetime Manu, I was Sûrya: I am the sage Kakshîvân, holy singer. Kutsa the son of Arjuni I master. I am the sapient Uṣanâ behold me.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हं भूमि॑मददा॒मार्या॑या॒हं वृ॒ष्टिं दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य अ॒हम॒पो अ॑नयं वावशा॒ना मम॑ दे॒वासो॒ अनु॒ केत॑मायन्
stanzas.transliteration: ahám bhū́mim adadām ā́ryāya- -aháṃ vr̥ṣṭíṃ dāśúṣe mártyāya ahám apó anayaṃ vāvaśānā́ḥ- máma devā́so ánu kétam āyan
stanzas.translation: I have bestowed the earth upon the Ârya, and rain upon the man who brings oblation. I guided forth the loudly-roaring waters, and the Gods moved according to my pleasure.

translations.griffith: I have bestowed the earth upon the Ârya, and rain upon the man who brings oblation. I guided forth the loudly-roaring waters, and the Gods moved according to my pleasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हं पुरो॑ मन्दसा॒नो व्यै॑रं॒ नव॑ सा॒कं न॑व॒तीः शम्ब॑रस्य श॒त॒त॒मं वे॒श्यं॑ स॒र्वता॑ता॒ दिवो॑दासमतिथि॒ग्वं यदाव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ahám púro mandasānó vy aìraṃ náva sākáṃ navatī́ḥ śámbarasya śatatamáṃ veśyàṃ sarvátātā dívodāsam atithigváṃ yád ā́vam
stanzas.translation: In the wild joy of Soma I demolished Ṣambara's forts, ninety-and-nine, together; And, utterly, the hundredth habitation, when helping Divodâsa Âtithigva.

translations.griffith: In the wild joy of Soma I demolished Ṣambara's forts, ninety-and-nine, together; And, utterly, the hundredth habitation, when helping Divodâsa Âtithigva.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र सु ष विभ्यो॑ मरुतो॒ विर॑स्तु॒ प्र श्ये॒नः श्ये॒नेभ्य॑ आशु॒पत्वा॑ अ॒च॒क्रया॒ यत्स्व॒धया॑ सुप॒र्णो ह॒व्यं भर॒न्मन॑वे दे॒वजु॑ष्टम्
stanzas.transliteration: prá sú ṣá víbhyo maruto vír astu prá śyenáḥ śyenébhya āśupátvā acakráyā yát svadháyā suparṇó havyám bháran mánave devájuṣṭam
stanzas.translation: Before all birds be ranked this Bird, O Maruts; supreme of falcons be this fleet-winged Falcon, Because, strong- pinioned, with no car to bear him, he brought to Manu the Godloved oblation.

translations.griffith: Before all birds be ranked this Bird, O Maruts; supreme of falcons be this fleet-winged Falcon, Because, strong- pinioned, with no car to bear him, he brought to Manu the Godloved oblation.

stanzas.sanskrit: भर॒द्यदि॒ विरतो॒ वेवि॑जानः प॒थोरुणा॒ मनो॑जवा असर्जि तूयं॑ ययौ॒ मधु॑ना सो॒म्येनो॒त श्रवो॑ विविदे श्ये॒नो अत्र॑
stanzas.transliteration: bhárad yádi vír áto vévijānaḥ pathórúṇā mánojavā asarji tū́yaṃ yayau mádhunā somyéna- -utá śrávo vivide śyenó átra
stanzas.translation: When the Bird brought it, hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried. Swift he returned with sweetness of the Soma, and hence the Falcon hath acquired his glory.

translations.griffith: When the Bird brought it, hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried. Swift he returned with sweetness of the Soma, and hence the Falcon hath acquired his glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒जी॒पी श्ये॒नो दद॑मानो अं॒शुं प॑रा॒वतः॑ शकु॒नो म॒न्द्रं मद॑म् सोमं॑ भरद्दादृहा॒णो दे॒वावा॑न्दि॒वो अ॒मुष्मा॒दुत्त॑रादा॒दाय॑
stanzas.transliteration: r̥jīpī́ śyenó dádamāno aṃśúm parāvátaḥ śakunó mandrám mádam sómam bharad dādr̥hāṇó devā́vān divó amúṣmād úttarād ādā́ya
stanzas.translation: Bearing the stalk, the Falcon speeding onward, Bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens, Friend of the Gods, brought, grasping fast, the Soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest heaven.

translations.griffith: Bearing the stalk, the Falcon speeding onward, Bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens, Friend of the Gods, brought, grasping fast, the Soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒दाय॑ श्ये॒नो अ॑भर॒त्सोमं॑ स॒हस्रं॑ स॒वाँ अ॒युतं॑ च सा॒कम् अत्रा॒ पुरं॑धिरजहा॒दरा॑ती॒र्मदे॒ सोम॑स्य मू॒रा अमू॑रः
stanzas.transliteration: ādā́ya śyenó abharat sómaṃ sahásraṃ savā́m̐ ayútaṃ ca sākám átrā púraṃdhir ajahād árātīr máde sómasya mūrā́ ámūraḥ
stanzas.translation: The Falcon took and brought the Soma, bearing thousand libations with him, yea, ten thousand. The Bold One left Malignities behind him, wise, in wild joy of Soma, left the foolish.

translations.griffith: The Falcon took and brought the Soma, bearing thousand libations with him, yea, ten thousand. The Bold One left Malignities behind him, wise, in wild joy of Soma, left the foolish.

stanzas.sanskrit: गर्भे॒ नु सन्नन्वे॑षामवेदम॒हं दे॒वानां॒ जनि॑मानि॒ विश्वा॑ श॒तं मा॒ पुर॒ आय॑सीररक्ष॒न्नध॑ श्ये॒नो ज॒वसा॒ निर॑दीयम्
stanzas.transliteration: gárbhe nú sánn ánv eṣām avedam aháṃ devā́nāṃ jánimāni víśvā śatám mā púra ā́yasīr arakṣann ádha śyenó javásā nír adīyam
stanzas.translation: I, As I lay within the womb, considered all generations of these Gods in order. A hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth I flew with rapid speed a Falcon.

translations.griffith: I, As I lay within the womb, considered all generations of these Gods in order. A hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth I flew with rapid speed a Falcon.

stanzas.sanskrit: न घा॒ स मामप॒ जोषं॑ जभारा॒भीमा॑स॒ त्वक्ष॑सा वी॒र्ये॑ण ई॒र्मा पुरं॑धिरजहा॒दरा॑तीरु॒त वाताँ॑ अतर॒च्छूशु॑वानः
stanzas.transliteration: ná ghā sá mā́m ápa jóṣaṃ jabhāra- -abhī́m āsa tvákṣasā vīryèṇa īrmā́ púraṃdhir ajahād árātīr utá vā́tām̐ atarac chū́śuvānaḥ
stanzas.translation: Not at his own free pleasure did he bear me: he conquered with his strength and manly courage. Straightway the Bold One left the fiends behind him and passed the winds as he grew yet more mighty.

translations.griffith: Not at his own free pleasure did he bear me: he conquered with his strength and manly courage. Straightway the Bold One left the fiends behind him and passed the winds as he grew yet more mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॒ यच्छ्ये॒नो अस्व॑नी॒दध॒ द्योर्वि यद्यदि॒ वात॑ ऊ॒हुः पुरं॑धिम् सृ॒जद्यद॑स्मा॒ अव॑ ह क्षि॒पज्ज्यां कृ॒शानु॒रस्ता॒ मन॑सा भुर॒ण्यन्
stanzas.transliteration: áva yác chyenó ásvanīd ádha dyór ví yád yádi vā́ta ūhúḥ púraṃdhim sr̥jád yád asmā áva ha kṣipáj jyā́ṃ kr̥śā́nur ástā mánasā bhuraṇyán
stanzas.translation: When with loud cry from heaven down sped the Falcon, thence hasting like the wind he bore the Bold One. Then, wildly raging in his mind, the archer Kr̥iṣanu aimed and loosed the string to strike him.

translations.griffith: When with loud cry from heaven down sped the Falcon, thence hasting like the wind he bore the Bold One. Then, wildly raging in his mind, the archer Kr̥iṣanu aimed and loosed the string to strike him.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒जि॒प्य ई॒मिन्द्रा॑वतो॒ न भु॒ज्युं श्ये॒नो ज॑भार बृह॒तो अधि॒ ष्णोः अ॒न्तः प॑तत्पत॒त्र्य॑स्य प॒र्णमध॒ याम॑नि॒ प्रसि॑तस्य॒ तद्वेः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥jipyá īm índrāvato ná bhujyúṃ śyenó jabhāra br̥ható ádhi ṣṇóḥ antáḥ patat patatry àsya parṇám ádha yā́mani prásitasya tád véḥ
stanzas.translation: The Falcon bore him from heaven's lofty summit as the swift car of Indra's Friend bore Bhujyu. Then downward bither fell a flying feather of the Bird hasting forward in his journey.

translations.griffith: The Falcon bore him from heaven's lofty summit as the swift car of Indra's Friend bore Bhujyu. Then downward bither fell a flying feather of the Bird hasting forward in his journey.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ श्वे॒तं क॒लशं॒ गोभि॑र॒क्तमा॑पिप्या॒नं म॒घवा॑ शु॒क्रमन्धः॑ अ॒ध्व॒र्युभिः॒ प्रय॑तं॒ मध्वो॒ अग्र॒मिन्द्रो॒ मदा॑य॒ प्रति॑ ध॒त्पिब॑ध्यै॒ शूरो॒ मदा॑य॒ प्रति॑ ध॒त्पिब॑ध्यै
stanzas.transliteration: ádha śvetáṃ kaláśaṃ góbhir aktám āpipyānám maghávā śukrám ándhaḥ adhvaryúbhiḥ práyatam mádhvo ágram índro mádāya práti dhat píbadhyai śū́ro mádāya práti dhat píbadhyai
stanzas.translation: And now let Maghavan accept the beaker, white, filled with milk, filled with the shining liquid; The best of sweet meath which the priests have offered: that Indra to his joy may drink, the Hero, that he may take and drink it to his rapture.
