translations.griffith: And now let Maghavan accept the beaker, white, filled with milk, filled with the shining liquid; The best of sweet meath which the priests have offered: that Indra to his joy may drink, the Hero, that he may take and drink it to his rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वा यु॒जा तव॒ तत्सो॑म स॒ख्य इन्द्रो॑ अ॒पो मन॑वे स॒स्रुत॑स्कः अह॒न्नहि॒मरि॑णात्स॒प्त सिन्धू॒नपा॑वृणो॒दपि॑हितेव॒ खानि॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ yujā́ táva tát soma sakhyé- índro apó mánave sasrútas kaḥ áhann áhim áriṇāt saptá síndhūn ápāvr̥ṇod ápihiteva khā́ni
stanzas.translation: ALLIED with thee, in this thy friendship, Soma, Indra for man made waters flow together, Slew Ahi, and sent forth the Seven Rivers, and opened as it were obstructed fountains.

translations.griffith: ALLIED with thee, in this thy friendship, Soma, Indra for man made waters flow together, Slew Ahi, and sent forth the Seven Rivers, and opened as it were obstructed fountains.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वा यु॒जा नि खि॑द॒त्सूर्य॒स्येन्द्र॑श्च॒क्रं सह॑सा स॒द्य इ॑न्दो अधि॒ ष्णुना॑ बृह॒ता वर्त॑मानं म॒हो द्रु॒हो अप॑ वि॒श्वायु॑ धायि
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ yujā́ ní khidat sū́ryasya- -índraś cakráṃ sáhasā sadyá indo ádhi ṣṇúnā br̥hatā́ vártamānam mahó druhó ápa viśvā́yu dhāyi
stanzas.translation: Indu, with thee for his confederate, Indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of Sûrya. What rolled, all life's support, on heaven's high summit was separated from the great oppressor.

translations.griffith: Indu, with thee for his confederate, Indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of Sûrya. What rolled, all life's support, on heaven's high summit was separated from the great oppressor.

stanzas.sanskrit: अह॒न्निन्द्रो॒ अद॑हद॒ग्निरि॑न्दो पु॒रा दस्यू॑न्म॒ध्यंदि॑नाद॒भीके॑ दु॒र्गे दु॑रो॒णे क्रत्वा॒ न या॒तां पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॒ शर्वा॒ नि ब॑र्हीत्
stanzas.transliteration: áhann índro ádahad agnír indo purā́ dásyūn madhyáṃdinād abhī́ke durgé duroṇé krátvā ná yātā́m purū́ sahásrā śárvā ní barhīt
stanzas.translation: Indra smote down, Agni consumed, O Indu, the Dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict. Of those who gladly sought a hard-won dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.

translations.griffith: Indra smote down, Agni consumed, O Indu, the Dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict. Of those who gladly sought a hard-won dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्व॑स्मात्सीमध॒माँ इ॑न्द्र॒ दस्यू॒न्विशो॒ दासी॑रकृणोरप्रश॒स्ताः अबा॑धेथा॒ममृ॑णतं॒ नि शत्रू॒नवि॑न्देथा॒मप॑चितिं॒ वध॑त्रैः
stanzas.transliteration: víśvasmāt sīm adhamā́m̐ indra dásyūn víśo dā́sīr akr̥ṇor apraśastā́ḥ ábādhethām ámr̥ṇataṃ ní śátrūn ávindethām ápacitiṃ vádhatraiḥ
stanzas.translation: Lower than all besides hast thou, O Indra, cast down the Dasyus, abject tribes of Dâsas. Ye drave away, ye put to death the foemen, and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.

translations.griffith: Lower than all besides hast thou, O Indra, cast down the Dasyus, abject tribes of Dâsas. Ye drave away, ye put to death the foemen, and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा स॒त्यं म॑घवाना यु॒वं तदिन्द्र॑श्च सोमो॒र्वमश्व्यं॒ गोः आद॑र्दृत॒मपि॑हिता॒न्यश्ना॑ रिरि॒चथुः॒ क्षाश्चि॑त्ततृदा॒ना
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ satyám maghavānā yuváṃ tád índraś ca somorvám áśvyaṃ góḥ ā́dardr̥tam ápihitāny áśnā riricáthuḥ kṣā́ś cit tatr̥dānā́
stanzas.translation: So, of a truth, Indra and Soma, Heroes, ye burst the stable of the kine and horses, The stable which the bar or stone obstructed; and piercing through set free the habitations.

translations.griffith: So, of a truth, Indra and Soma, Heroes, ye burst the stable of the kine and horses, The stable which the bar or stone obstructed; and piercing through set free the habitations.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नः॑ स्तु॒त उप॒ वाजे॑भिरू॒ती इन्द्र॑ या॒हि हरि॑भिर्मन्दसा॒नः ति॒रश्चि॑द॒र्यः सव॑ना पु॒रूण्या॑ङ्गू॒षेभि॑र्गृणा॒नः स॒त्यरा॑धाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ na stutá úpa vā́jebhir ūtī́ índra yāhí háribhir mandasānáḥ tiráś cid aryáḥ sávanā purū́ṇi- āṅgūṣébhir gr̥ṇānáḥ satyárādhāḥ
stanzas.translation: COME, lauded, unto us with powers and succours, O Indra, with thy Tawny Steeds; exulting, Past even the foeman's manifold libations, glorified with our hymns, true Wealth-bestower.

translations.griffith: COME, lauded, unto us with powers and succours, O Indra, with thy Tawny Steeds; exulting, Past even the foeman's manifold libations, glorified with our hymns, true Wealth-bestower.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ हि ष्मा॒ याति॒ नर्य॑श्चिकि॒त्वान्हू॒यमा॑नः सो॒तृभि॒रुप॑ य॒ज्ञम् स्वश्वो॒ यो अभी॑रु॒र्मन्य॑मानः सुष्वा॒णेभि॒र्मद॑ति॒ सं ह॑ वी॒रैः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ hí ṣmā yā́ti náryaś cikitvā́n hūyámānaḥ sotŕ̥bhir úpa yajñám sváśvo yó ábhīrur mányamānaḥ suṣvāṇébhir mádati sáṃ ha vīraíḥ
stanzas.translation: Man's Friend, to this our sacrifice he cometh marking how he is called by Soma-pressers. Fearless, and conscious that his Steeds are noble, he joyeth with the Soma-pouring heroes.

translations.griffith: Man's Friend, to this our sacrifice he cometh marking how he is called by Soma-pressers. Fearless, and conscious that his Steeds are noble, he joyeth with the Soma-pouring heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रा॒वयेद॑स्य॒ कर्णा॑ वाज॒यध्यै॒ जुष्टा॒मनु॒ प्र दिशं॑ मन्द॒यध्यै॑ उ॒द्वा॒वृ॒षा॒णो राध॑से॒ तुवि॑ष्मा॒न्कर॑न्न॒ इन्द्रः॑ सुती॒र्थाभ॑यं च
stanzas.transliteration: śrāváyéd asya kárṇā vājayádhyai júṣṭām ánu prá díśam mandayádhyai udvāvr̥ṣāṇó rā́dhase túviṣmān káran na índraḥ sutīrthā́bhayaṃ ca
stanzas.translation: Make his cars hear, that he may show his vigour and may be joyful in the way he loveth. May mighty Indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety;

translations.griffith: Make his cars hear, that he may show his vigour and may be joyful in the way he loveth. May mighty Indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety;

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॒ यो गन्ता॒ नाध॑मानमू॒ती इ॒त्था विप्रं॒ हव॑मानं गृ॒णन्त॑म् उप॒ त्मनि॒ दधा॑नो धु॒र्या॒३॒॑शून्त्स॒हस्रा॑णि श॒तानि॒ वज्र॑बाहुः
stanzas.transliteration: áchā yó gántā nā́dhamānam ūtī́ itthā́ vípraṃ hávamānaṃ gr̥ṇántam úpa tmáni dádhāno dhury ā̀śū́n sahásrāṇi śatā́ni vájrabāhuḥ
stanzas.translation: He who with succour comes to his implorer, the singer here who with his song invites him; He who himself sets to the pole swift Coursers, he who hath hundreds, thousands, Thunder-wielder.

translations.griffith: He who with succour comes to his implorer, the singer here who with his song invites him; He who himself sets to the pole swift Coursers, he who hath hundreds, thousands, Thunder-wielder.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वोता॑सो मघवन्निन्द्र॒ विप्रा॑ व॒यं ते॑ स्याम सू॒रयो॑ गृ॒णन्तः॑ भे॒जा॒नासो॑ बृ॒हद्दि॑वस्य रा॒य आ॑का॒य्य॑स्य दा॒वने॑ पुरु॒क्षोः
stanzas.transliteration: tvótāso maghavann indra víprāḥ- vayáṃ te syāma sūráyo gr̥ṇántaḥ bhejānā́so br̥háddivasya rāyáḥ- ākāyyàsya dāváne purukṣóḥ
stanzas.translation: O Indra Maghavan, by thee protected may we be thine, princes and priests and singers, Sharing the riches sent from lofty heaven which yields much food, and all desire its bounty.

translations.griffith: O Indra Maghavan, by thee protected may we be thine, princes and priests and singers, Sharing the riches sent from lofty heaven which yields much food, and all desire its bounty.

stanzas.sanskrit: नकि॑रिन्द्र॒ त्वदुत्त॑रो॒ न ज्यायाँ॑ अस्ति वृत्रहन् नकि॑रे॒वा यथा॒ त्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: nákir indra tvád úttaro ná jyā́yām̐ asti vr̥trahan nákir evā́ yáthā tvám
stanzas.translation: O INDRA, Vr̥itra-slayer, none is better, mightier than thou: Verily there is none like thee.

translations.griffith: O INDRA, Vr̥itra-slayer, none is better, mightier than thou: Verily there is none like thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्रा ते॒ अनु॑ कृ॒ष्टयो॒ विश्वा॑ च॒क्रेव॑ वावृतुः स॒त्रा म॒हाँ अ॑सि श्रु॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: satrā́ te ánu kr̥ṣṭáyo víśvā cakréva vāvr̥tuḥ satrā́ mahā́m̐ asi śrutáḥ
stanzas.translation: Like chariot-wheels these people all together follow after thee: Thou ever art renowned as Great.

translations.griffith: Like chariot-wheels these people all together follow after thee: Thou ever art renowned as Great.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ च॒नेद॒ना त्वा॑ दे॒वास॑ इन्द्र युयुधुः यदहा॒ नक्त॒माति॑रः
stanzas.transliteration: víśve canéd anā́ tvā devā́sa indra yuyudhuḥ yád áhā náktam ā́tiraḥ
stanzas.translation: Not even all the gathered Gods conquered thee, Indra, in the war, When thou didst lengthen days by night.

translations.griffith: Not even all the gathered Gods conquered thee, Indra, in the war, When thou didst lengthen days by night.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्रो॒त बा॑धि॒तेभ्य॑श्च॒क्रं कुत्सा॑य॒ युध्य॑ते मु॒षा॒य इ॑न्द्र॒ सूर्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yátrotá bādhitébhyaś cakráṃ kútsāya yúdhyate muṣāyá indra sū́ryam
stanzas.translation: When for the sake of those oppressed, and Kutsa as he battled, Thou stolest away the Sun's car-wheel.

translations.griffith: When for the sake of those oppressed, and Kutsa as he battled, Thou stolest away the Sun's car-wheel.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्र॑ दे॒वाँ ऋ॑घाय॒तो विश्वाँ॒ अयु॑ध्य॒ एक॒ इत् त्वमि॑न्द्र व॒नूँरह॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: yátra devā́m̐ r̥ghāyató víśvām̐ áyudhya éka ít tvám indra vanū́m̐r áhan
stanzas.translation: When, fighting singly, Indra. thou o'ercamest all the furious Gods, thou slewest those who strove with thee.

translations.griffith: When, fighting singly, Indra. thou o'ercamest all the furious Gods, thou slewest those who strove with thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्रो॒त मर्त्या॑य॒ कमरि॑णा इन्द्र॒ सूर्य॑म् प्रावः॒ शची॑भि॒रेत॑शम्
stanzas.transliteration: yátrotá mártyāya kám áriṇā indra sū́ryam prā́vaḥ śácībhir étaśam
stanzas.translation: When also for a mortal man, Indra, thou speddest forth the Sun, And holpest Etaṣa with might.

translations.griffith: When also for a mortal man, Indra, thou speddest forth the Sun, And holpest Etaṣa with might.

stanzas.sanskrit: किमादु॒तासि॑ वृत्रह॒न्मघ॑वन्मन्यु॒मत्त॑मः अत्राह॒ दानु॒माति॑रः
stanzas.transliteration: kím ā́d utā́si vr̥trahan mághavan manyumáttamaḥ átrā́ha dā́num ā́tiraḥ
stanzas.translation: What? Vr̥itra-slayer, art not thou, Maghavan, fiercest in thy wrath? So hast thou quelled the demon too.

translations.griffith: What? Vr̥itra-slayer, art not thou, Maghavan, fiercest in thy wrath? So hast thou quelled the demon too.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒तद्घेदु॒त वी॒र्य१॒॑मिन्द्र॑ च॒कर्थ॒ पौंस्य॑म् स्त्रियं॒ यद्दु॑र्हणा॒युवं॒ वधी॑र्दुहि॒तरं॑ दि॒वः
stanzas.transliteration: etád ghéd utá vīryàm índra cakártha paúṃsyam stríyaṃ yád durhaṇāyúvaṃ vádhīr duhitáraṃ diváḥ
stanzas.translation: And this heroic deed of might thou, Indra, also hast achieved, That thou didst smite to death the Dame, Heaven's Daughter, meditating ill.

translations.griffith: And this heroic deed of might thou, Indra, also hast achieved, That thou didst smite to death the Dame, Heaven's Daughter, meditating ill.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वश्चि॑द्घा दुहि॒तरं॑ म॒हान्म॑ही॒यमा॑नाम् उ॒षास॑मिन्द्र॒ सं पि॑णक्
stanzas.transliteration: diváś cid ghā duhitáram mahā́n mahīyámānām uṣā́sam indra sám piṇak
stanzas.translation: Thou, Indra, Mighty One, didst crush Ushas, though Daughter of the Sky. When lifting up herself in pride.

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, Mighty One, didst crush Ushas, though Daughter of the Sky. When lifting up herself in pride.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपो॒षा अन॑सः सर॒त्सम्पि॑ष्टा॒दह॑ बि॒भ्युषी॑ नि यत्सीं॑ शि॒श्नथ॒द्वृषा॑
stanzas.transliteration: ápoṣā́ ánasaḥ sarat sámpiṣṭād áha bibhyúṣī ní yát sīṃ śiśnáthad vŕ̥ṣā
stanzas.translation: Then from her chariot Ushas fled, affrighted, from her ruined car. When the strong God had shattered it.

translations.griffith: Then from her chariot Ushas fled, affrighted, from her ruined car. When the strong God had shattered it.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒तद॑स्या॒ अनः॑ शये॒ सुस॑म्पिष्टं॒ विपा॒श्या स॒सार॑ सीं परा॒वतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: etád asyā ánaḥ śaye súsampiṣṭaṃ vípāśy ā́ sasā́ra sīm parāvátaḥ
stanzas.translation: So there this car of Ushas lay, broken to pieces, in Vipâṣ, And she herself fled far away.

translations.griffith: So there this car of Ushas lay, broken to pieces, in Vipâṣ, And she herself fled far away.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त सिन्धुं॑ विबा॒ल्यं॑ वितस्था॒नामधि॒ क्षमि॑ परि॑ ष्ठा इन्द्र मा॒यया॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá síndhuṃ vibālyàṃ vitasthānā́m ádhi kṣámi pári ṣṭhā indra māyáyā
stanzas.translation: Thou, Indra, didst with magic power resist the overflowing stream Who spread her waters o'er the land.

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, didst with magic power resist the overflowing stream Who spread her waters o'er the land.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त शुष्ण॑स्य धृष्णु॒या प्र मृ॑क्षो अ॒भि वेद॑नम् पुरो॒ यद॑स्य सम्पि॒णक्
stanzas.transliteration: utá śúṣṇasya dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ prá mr̥kṣo abhí védanam púro yád asya sampiṇák
stanzas.translation: Valiantly didst thou seize and take the store which Ṣushṇa had amassed, When thou didst crush his fortresses.

translations.griffith: Valiantly didst thou seize and take the store which Ṣushṇa had amassed, When thou didst crush his fortresses.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त दा॒सं कौ॑लित॒रं बृ॑ह॒तः पर्व॑ता॒दधि॑ अवा॑हन्निन्द्र॒ शम्ब॑रम्
stanzas.transliteration: utá dāsáṃ kaulitarám br̥hatáḥ párvatād ádhi ávāhann indra śámbaram
stanzas.translation: Thou, Indra, also smotest down Kulitara's son Ṣambara, The Dâsa, from the lofty hill.

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, also smotest down Kulitara's son Ṣambara, The Dâsa, from the lofty hill.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त दा॒सस्य॑ व॒र्चिनः॑ स॒हस्रा॑णि श॒ताव॑धीः अधि॒ पञ्च॑ प्र॒धीँरि॑व
stanzas.transliteration: utá dāsásya varcínaḥ sahásrāṇi śatā́vadhīḥ ádhi páñca pradhī́m̐r iva
stanzas.translation: Of Dâsa Varcin's thou didst slay the hundred thousand and the five, Crushed like the fellies, of a car.

translations.griffith: Of Dâsa Varcin's thou didst slay the hundred thousand and the five, Crushed like the fellies, of a car.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्यं पु॒त्रम॒ग्रुवः॒ परा॑वृक्तं श॒तक्र॑तुः उ॒क्थेष्विन्द्र॒ आभ॑जत्
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyám putrám agrúvaḥ párāvr̥ktaṃ śatákratuḥ ukthéṣv índra ā́bhajat
stanzas.translation: So Indra, Lord of Heroes, Powers, caused the unwedded damsel's son, The castaway, to share the lauds.

translations.griffith: So Indra, Lord of Heroes, Powers, caused the unwedded damsel's son, The castaway, to share the lauds.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्या तु॒र्वशा॒यदू॑ अस्ना॒तारा॒ शची॒पतिः॑ इन्द्रो॑ वि॒द्वाँ अ॑पारयत्
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyā́ turváśāyádū asnātā́rā śácīpátiḥ índro vidvā́m̐ apārayat
stanzas.translation: So sapient Indra, Lord of Might, brought Turvaga and Yadu, those Who feared the flood, in safel o'er.

translations.griffith: So sapient Indra, Lord of Might, brought Turvaga and Yadu, those Who feared the flood, in safel o'er.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्या स॒द्य आर्या॑ स॒रयो॑रिन्द्र पा॒रतः॑ अर्णा॑चि॒त्रर॑थावधीः
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyā́ sadyá ā́ryā saráyor indra pārátaḥ árṇācitrárathāvadhīḥ
stanzas.translation: Arṇa and Chitraratha, both Aryas, thou, Indra, slewest swift, On yonder side of Sarayu,

translations.griffith: Arṇa and Chitraratha, both Aryas, thou, Indra, slewest swift, On yonder side of Sarayu,

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॒ द्वा ज॑हि॒ता न॑यो॒ऽन्धं श्रो॒णं च॑ वृत्रहन् न तत्ते॑ सु॒म्नमष्ट॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: ánu dvā́ jahitā́ nayo -andháṃ śroṇáṃ ca vr̥trahan ná tát te sumnám áṣṭave
stanzas.translation: Thou, Vr̥itra-slayer, didst conduct those two forlorn, the blind, the lame. None may attain this bliss of thine.

translations.griffith: Thou, Vr̥itra-slayer, didst conduct those two forlorn, the blind, the lame. None may attain this bliss of thine.

stanzas.sanskrit: श॒तम॑श्म॒न्मयी॑नां पु॒रामिन्द्रो॒ व्या॑स्यत् दिवो॑दासाय दा॒शुषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: śatám aśmanmáyīnām purā́m índro vy ā̀syat dívodāsāya dāśúṣe
stanzas.translation: For Divodâsa, him who brought oblationt, Indra overthrew A hundred fortresses of stone.

translations.griffith: For Divodâsa, him who brought oblationt, Indra overthrew A hundred fortresses of stone.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्वा॑पयद्द॒भीत॑ये स॒हस्रा॑ त्रिं॒शतं॒ हथैः॑ दा॒साना॒मिन्द्रो॑ मा॒यया॑
stanzas.transliteration: ásvāpayad dabhī́taye sahásrā triṃśátaṃ háthaiḥ dāsā́nām índro māyáyā
stanzas.translation: The thirty thousand Disas he with magic power and weapons sent To slumber, for Dabhîti's sake.

translations.griffith: The thirty thousand Disas he with magic power and weapons sent To slumber, for Dabhîti's sake.

stanzas.sanskrit: स घेदु॒तासि॑ वृत्रहन्त्समा॒न इ॑न्द्र॒ गोप॑तिः यस्ता विश्वा॑नि चिच्यु॒षे
stanzas.transliteration: sá ghéd utā́si vr̥trahan samāná indra gópatiḥ yás tā́ víśvāni cicyuṣé
stanzas.translation: As such, O Vr̥itra-slayer, thou art general Lord of kine for all, Thou Shaker of all things that be.

translations.griffith: As such, O Vr̥itra-slayer, thou art general Lord of kine for all, Thou Shaker of all things that be.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नू॒नं यदि॑न्द्रि॒यं क॑रि॒ष्या इ॑न्द्र॒ पौंस्य॑म् अ॒द्या नकि॒ष्टदा मि॑नत्
stanzas.transliteration: utá nūnáṃ yád indriyáṃ kariṣyā́ indra paúṃsyam adyā́ nákiṣ ṭád ā́ minat
stanzas.translation: Indra, whatever deed of might thou hast this day to execute, None be there now to hinder it.

translations.griffith: Indra, whatever deed of might thou hast this day to execute, None be there now to hinder it.

stanzas.sanskrit: वा॒मंवा॑मं त आदुरे दे॒वो द॑दात्वर्य॒मा वा॒मं पू॒षा वा॒मं भगो॑ वा॒मं दे॒वः करू॑ळती
stanzas.transliteration: vāmáṃ-vāmaṃ ta ādure devó dadātv aryamā́ vāmám pūṣā́ vāmám bhágo vāmáṃ deváḥ kárūḷatī
stanzas.translation: O Watchful One, may Aryaman the God give thee all goodly things. May Pûshan, Bhaga, and the God Karûlatî give all things fair.

translations.griffith: O Watchful One, may Aryaman the God give thee all goodly things. May Pûshan, Bhaga, and the God Karûlatî give all things fair.

stanzas.sanskrit: कया॑ नश्चि॒त्र आ भु॑वदू॒ती स॒दावृ॑धः॒ सखा॑ कया॒ शचि॑ष्ठया वृ॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: káyā naś citrá ā́ bhuvad ūtī́ sadā́vr̥dhaḥ sákhā káyā śáciṣṭhayā vr̥tā́
stanzas.translation: WITH what help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing Friend; With what most mighty company?

translations.griffith: WITH what help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing Friend; With what most mighty company?

stanzas.sanskrit: कस्त्वा॑ स॒त्यो मदा॑नां॒ मंहि॑ष्ठो मत्स॒दन्ध॑सः दृ॒ळ्हा चि॑दा॒रुजे॒ वसु॑
stanzas.transliteration: kás tvā satyó mádānām máṃhiṣṭho matsad ándhasaḥ dr̥ḷhā́ cid ārúje vásu
stanzas.translation: What genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst Open e'en strongly-guarded wealth?

translations.griffith: What genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst Open e'en strongly-guarded wealth?

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भी षु णः॒ सखी॑नामवि॒ता ज॑रितॄ॒णाम् श॒तं भ॑वास्यू॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: abhī́ ṣú ṇaḥ sákhīnām avitā́ jaritr̥̄ṇā́m śatám bhavāsy ūtíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Do thou who art Protector of us thy friends who praise thee With hundred aids approach us.

translations.griffith: Do thou who art Protector of us thy friends who praise thee With hundred aids approach us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भी न॒ आ व॑वृत्स्व च॒क्रं न वृ॒त्तमर्व॑तः नि॒युद्भि॑श्चर्षणी॒नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: abhī́ na ā́ vavr̥tsva cakráṃ ná vr̥ttám árvataḥ niyúdbhiś carṣaṇīnā́m
stanzas.translation: Like as a courser's circling wheel, so turn thee hitherward to us, Attracted by the hymns of men.

translations.griffith: Like as a courser's circling wheel, so turn thee hitherward to us, Attracted by the hymns of men.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒वता॒ हि क्रतू॑ना॒मा हा॑ प॒देव॒ गच्छ॑सि अभ॑क्षि॒ सूर्ये॒ सचा॑
stanzas.transliteration: pravátā hí krátūnām ā́ hā padéva gáchasi ábhakṣi sū́rye sácā
stanzas.translation: Thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of powers: I share thee even with the Sun.

translations.griffith: Thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of powers: I share thee even with the Sun.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं यत्त॑ इन्द्र म॒न्यवः॒ सं च॒क्राणि॑ दधन्वि॒रे अध॒ त्वे अध॒ सूर्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: sáṃ yát ta indra manyávaḥ sáṃ cakrā́ṇi dadhanviré ádha tvé ádha sū́rye
stanzas.translation: What time thy courage and his wheels together, Indra, run their course With thee and with the Sun alike,

translations.griffith: What time thy courage and his wheels together, Indra, run their course With thee and with the Sun alike,

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्मा॒ हि त्वामा॒हुरिन्म॒घवा॑नं शचीपते दाता॑र॒मवि॑दीधयुम्
stanzas.transliteration: utá smā hí tvā́m āhúr ín maghávānaṃ śacīpate dā́tāram ávidīdhayum
stanzas.translation: So even, Lord of Power and Might, the people call thee Maghavan, Giver, who pauses not to think.

translations.griffith: So even, Lord of Power and Might, the people call thee Maghavan, Giver, who pauses not to think.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्मा॑ स॒द्य इत्परि॑ शशमा॒नाय॑ सुन्व॒ते पु॒रू चि॑न्मंहसे॒ वसु॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá smā sadyá ít pári śaśamānā́ya sunvaté purū́ cin maṃhase vásu
stanzas.translation: And verily to him who toils and presses Soma juice for thee Thou quickly givest ample wealth.

translations.griffith: And verily to him who toils and presses Soma juice for thee Thou quickly givest ample wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: न॒हि ष्मा॑ ते श॒तं च॒न राधो॒ वर॑न्त आ॒मुरः॑ न च्यौ॒त्नानि॑ करिष्य॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: nahí ṣmā te śatáṃ caná rā́dho váranta āmúraḥ ná cyautnā́ni kariṣyatáḥ
stanzas.translation: No, not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bounty's flow, Nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.

translations.griffith: No, not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bounty's flow, Nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माँ अ॑वन्तु ते श॒तम॒स्मान्त्स॒हस्र॑मू॒तयः॑ अ॒स्मान्विश्वा॑ अ॒भिष्ट॑यः
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́m̐ avantu te śatám asmā́n sahásram ūtáyaḥ asmā́n víśvā abhíṣṭayaḥ
stanzas.translation: May thine assistance keep us safe, thy hundred and thy thousand aids: May all thy favours strengthen us.

translations.griffith: May thine assistance keep us safe, thy hundred and thy thousand aids: May all thy favours strengthen us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माँ इ॒हा वृ॑णीष्व स॒ख्याय॑ स्व॒स्तये॑ म॒हो रा॒ये दि॒वित्म॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́m̐ ihā́ vr̥ṇīṣva sakhyā́ya svastáye mahó rāyé divítmate
stanzas.translation: Do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity, And great celestial opulence.

translations.griffith: Do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity, And great celestial opulence.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माँ अ॑विड्ढि वि॒श्वहेन्द्र॑ रा॒या परी॑णसा अ॒स्मान्विश्वा॑भिरू॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́m̐ aviḍḍhi viśváhā- -índra rāyā́ párīṇasā asmā́n víśvābhir ūtíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Favour us, Indra, evermore with overflowing store of wealth: With all thy succours aid thou us.

translations.griffith: Favour us, Indra, evermore with overflowing store of wealth: With all thy succours aid thou us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ ताँ अपा॑ वृधि व्र॒जाँ अस्ते॑व॒ गोम॑तः नवा॑भिरिन्द्रो॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tā́m̐ ápā vr̥dhi vrajā́m̐ ásteva gómataḥ návābhir indrotíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: With new protections, Indra, like an archer, open thou forus The stables that are filled with kine.

translations.griffith: With new protections, Indra, like an archer, open thou forus The stables that are filled with kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माकं॑ धृष्णु॒या रथो॑ द्यु॒माँ इ॒न्द्रान॑पच्युतः ग॒व्युर॑श्व॒युरी॑यते
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ rátho dyumā́m̐ indrā́napacyutaḥ gavyúr aśvayúr īyate
stanzas.translation: Our chariot, Indra, boldly moves endued with splendour, ne'er repulsed, Winning for us both kine andsteeds.

translations.griffith: Our chariot, Indra, boldly moves endued with splendour, ne'er repulsed, Winning for us both kine andsteeds.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॑मुत्त॒मं कृ॑धि॒ श्रवो॑ दे॒वेषु॑ सूर्य वर्षि॑ष्ठं॒ द्यामि॑वो॒परि॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam uttamáṃ kr̥dhi śrávo devéṣu sūrya várṣiṣṭhaṃ dyā́m ivopári
stanzas.translation: O Sûrya, make our fame to be most excellent among the Gods, Most lofty as the heaven on high.

translations.griffith: O Sûrya, make our fame to be most excellent among the Gods, Most lofty as the heaven on high.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ तू न॑ इन्द्र वृत्रहन्न॒स्माक॑म॒र्धमा ग॑हि म॒हान्म॒हीभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ tū́ na indra vr̥trahann asmā́kam ardhám ā́ gahi mahā́n mahī́bhir ūtíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: O THOU who slewest Vr̥itra, come, O Indra, hither to our side, Mighty One with thy mighty aids.

translations.griffith: O THOU who slewest Vr̥itra, come, O Indra, hither to our side, Mighty One with thy mighty aids.

stanzas.sanskrit: भृमि॑श्चिद्घासि॒ तूतु॑जि॒रा चि॑त्र चि॒त्रिणी॒ष्वा चि॒त्रं कृ॑णोष्यू॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: bhŕ̥miś cid ghāsi tū́tujir ā́ citra citríṇīṣv ā́ citráṃ kr̥ṇoṣy ūtáye
stanzas.translation: Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk: Thou doest marvels for our help.

translations.griffith: Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk: Thou doest marvels for our help.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒भ्रेभि॑श्चि॒च्छशी॑यांसं॒ हंसि॒ व्राध॑न्त॒मोज॑सा सखि॑भि॒र्ये त्वे सचा॑
stanzas.transliteration: dabhrébhiś cic cháśīyāṃsaṃ háṃsi vrā́dhantam ójasā sákhibhir yé tvé sácā
stanzas.translation: Even with the weak thou smitest down him who is stronger, with thy strength The mighty, with the Friends thou hast.

translations.griffith: Even with the weak thou smitest down him who is stronger, with thy strength The mighty, with the Friends thou hast.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यमि॑न्द्र॒ त्वे सचा॑ व॒यं त्वा॒भि नो॑नुमः अ॒स्मा॑स्माँ॒ इदुद॑व
stanzas.transliteration: vayám indra tvé sácā vayáṃ tvābhí nonumaḥ asmā́m̐-asmām̐ íd úd ava
stanzas.translation: O Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our songs: Help hnd defend us, even us.

translations.griffith: O Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our songs: Help hnd defend us, even us.

stanzas.sanskrit: स न॑श्चि॒त्राभि॑रद्रिवोऽनव॒द्याभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ अना॑धृष्टाभि॒रा ग॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: sá naś citrā́bhir adrivo -anavadyā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ ánādhr̥ṣṭābhir ā́ gahi
stanzas.translation: As such, O Caster of the Stone, come with thy succours wonderful, Blameless, and irresistible.

translations.griffith: As such, O Caster of the Stone, come with thy succours wonderful, Blameless, and irresistible.

stanzas.sanskrit: भू॒यामो॒ षु त्वाव॑तः॒ सखा॑य इन्द्र॒ गोम॑तः युजो॒ वाजा॑य॒ घृष्व॑ये
stanzas.transliteration: bhūyā́mo ṣú tvā́vataḥ sákhāya indra gómataḥ yújo vā́jāya ghŕ̥ṣvaye
stanzas.translation: May we be friends of one like thee, O Indra, with the wealth of kine, Comrades for lively energy.

translations.griffith: May we be friends of one like thee, O Indra, with the wealth of kine, Comrades for lively energy.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं ह्येक॒ ईशि॑ष॒ इन्द्र॒ वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑तः स नो॑ यन्धि म॒हीमिष॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ hy éka ī́śiṣe- índra vā́jasya gómataḥ sá no yandhi mahī́m íṣam
stanzas.translation: For thou, O Indra, art alone the Lord of strength that comes from kine So grant thou us abundant food.

translations.griffith: For thou, O Indra, art alone the Lord of strength that comes from kine So grant thou us abundant food.

stanzas.sanskrit: न त्वा॑ वरन्ते अ॒न्यथा॒ यद्दित्स॑सि स्तु॒तो म॒घम् स्तो॒तृभ्य॑ इन्द्र गिर्वणः
stanzas.transliteration: ná tvā varante anyáthā yád dítsasi stutó maghám stotŕ̥bhya indra girvaṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the Song, Thou wilt give wealth to those who praise.

translations.griffith: They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the Song, Thou wilt give wealth to those who praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि त्वा॒ गोत॑मा गि॒रानू॑षत॒ प्र दा॒वने॑ इन्द्र॒ वाजा॑य॒ घृष्व॑ये
stanzas.transliteration: abhí tvā gótamā girā́ -ánūṣata prá dāváne índra vā́jāya ghŕ̥ṣvaye
stanzas.translation: The Gotamas have sung their song of praise to thee that thou mayst give, Indra, for lively energy.

translations.griffith: The Gotamas have sung their song of praise to thee that thou mayst give, Indra, for lively energy.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ते॑ वोचाम वी॒र्या॒३॒॑ या म॑न्दसा॒न आरु॑जः पुरो॒ दासी॑र॒भीत्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá te vocāma vīryā̀ yā́ mandasāná ā́rujaḥ púro dā́sīr abhī́tya
stanzas.translation: We will declare thy hero deeds, what Disa forts thou brakest down, Attacking them in rapturous joy.

translations.griffith: We will declare thy hero deeds, what Disa forts thou brakest down, Attacking them in rapturous joy.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता ते॑ गृणन्ति वे॒धसो॒ यानि॑ च॒कर्थ॒ पौंस्या॑ सु॒तेष्वि॑न्द्र गिर्वणः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ te gr̥ṇanti vedháso yā́ni cakártha paúṃsyā sutéṣv indra girvaṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: The sages sing those manly deeds which, Indra, Lover of the Song, Thou wrougbtest when the Soma flowed.

translations.griffith: The sages sing those manly deeds which, Indra, Lover of the Song, Thou wrougbtest when the Soma flowed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अवी॑वृधन्त॒ गोत॑मा॒ इन्द्र॒ त्वे स्तोम॑वाहसः ऐषु॑ धा वी॒रव॒द्यशः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ávīvr̥dhanta gótamāḥ- índra tvé stómavāhasaḥ aíṣu dhā vīrávad yáśaḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra, the Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown strong by thee. Give them renown with hero sons.

translations.griffith: Indra, the Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown strong by thee. Give them renown with hero sons.

stanzas.sanskrit: यच्चि॒द्धि शश्व॑ता॒मसीन्द्र॒ साधा॑रण॒स्त्वम् तं त्वा॑ व॒यं ह॑वामहे
stanzas.transliteration: yác cid dhí śáśvatām ási- -índra sā́dhāraṇas tvám táṃ tvā vayáṃ havāmahe
stanzas.translation: For, Indra, verily thou art the general treasure even of all . Thee, therefore, do we invocate.

translations.griffith: For, Indra, verily thou art the general treasure even of all . Thee, therefore, do we invocate.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वा॒ची॒नो व॑सो भवा॒स्मे सु म॒त्स्वान्ध॑सः सोमा॑नामिन्द्र सोमपाः
stanzas.transliteration: arvācīnó vaso bhava- -asmé sú matsvā́ndhasaḥ sómānām indra somapāḥ
stanzas.translation: Excellent Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the juice Of Somas, Soma-drinker thou.

translations.griffith: Excellent Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the juice Of Somas, Soma-drinker thou.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माकं॑ त्वा मती॒नामा स्तोम॑ इन्द्र यच्छतु अ॒र्वागा व॑र्तया॒ हरी॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ tvā matīnā́m ā́ stóma indra yachatu arvā́g ā́ vartayā hárī
stanzas.translation: May praise from us who think Qn thee, O Indra, bring thee near to us. Turn thy two Bay Steeds hitherward.

translations.griffith: May praise from us who think Qn thee, O Indra, bring thee near to us. Turn thy two Bay Steeds hitherward.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ च नो॒ घसो॑ जो॒षया॑से॒ गिर॑श्च नः व॒धू॒युरि॑व॒ योष॑णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: puroḷā́śaṃ ca no gháso joṣáyāse gíraś ca naḥ vadhūyúr iva yóṣaṇām
stanzas.translation: Eat of our sacrificial cake: rejoice thee in the songs we sing. Even as a lover in his bride.

translations.griffith: Eat of our sacrificial cake: rejoice thee in the songs we sing. Even as a lover in his bride.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒हस्रं॒ व्यती॑नां यु॒क्ताना॒मिन्द्र॑मीमहे श॒तं सोम॑स्य खा॒र्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sahásraṃ vyátīnāṃ yuktā́nām índram īmahe śatáṃ sómasya khāryàḥ
stanzas.translation: To India for a thousand steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we pray, And hundred jars of Soma juice.

translations.griffith: To India for a thousand steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we pray, And hundred jars of Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒हस्रा॑ ते श॒ता व॒यं गवा॒मा च्या॑वयामसि अ॒स्म॒त्रा राध॑ एतु ते
stanzas.transliteration: sahásrā te śatā́ vayáṃ gávām ā́ cyāvayāmasi asmatrā́ rā́dha etu te
stanzas.translation: We make a hundred of thy kine, yea, and a thousand, hasten nigh: So let thy bounty come to us.

translations.griffith: We make a hundred of thy kine, yea, and a thousand, hasten nigh: So let thy bounty come to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: दश॑ ते क॒लशा॑नां॒ हिर॑ण्यानामधीमहि भू॒रि॒दा अ॑सि वृत्रहन्
stanzas.transliteration: dáśa te kaláśānāṃ híraṇyānām adhīmahi bhūridā́ asi vr̥trahan
stanzas.translation: We have obtained, a gift from thee, ten water-ewers wrought of gold: Thou, Vr̥itra-slayer, givest much.

translations.griffith: We have obtained, a gift from thee, ten water-ewers wrought of gold: Thou, Vr̥itra-slayer, givest much.

stanzas.sanskrit: भूरि॑दा॒ भूरि॑ देहि नो॒ मा द॒भ्रं भूर्या भ॑र भूरि॒ घेदि॑न्द्र दित्ससि
stanzas.transliteration: bhū́ridā bhū́ri dehi no mā́ dabhrám bhū́ry ā́ bhara bhū́ri ghéd indra ditsasi
stanzas.translation: A bounteous Giver, give us much, bring much and not a trifling gift: Much, Indra, wilt thou fain bestow.

translations.griffith: A bounteous Giver, give us much, bring much and not a trifling gift: Much, Indra, wilt thou fain bestow.

stanzas.sanskrit: भू॒रि॒दा ह्यसि॑ श्रु॒तः पु॑रु॒त्रा शू॑र वृत्रहन् आ नो॑ भजस्व॒ राध॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: bhūridā́ hy ási śrutáḥ purutrā́ śūra vr̥trahan ā́ no bhajasva rā́dhasi
stanzas.translation: O Vr̥itra-slayer, thou art famed in many a place as bountiful Hero, thy bounty let us share.

translations.griffith: O Vr̥itra-slayer, thou art famed in many a place as bountiful Hero, thy bounty let us share.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ते॑ ब॒भ्रू वि॑चक्षण॒ शंसा॑मि गोषणो नपात् माभ्यां॒ गा अनु॑ शिश्रथः
stanzas.transliteration: prá te babhrū́ vicakṣaṇa śáṃsāmi goṣaṇo napāt mā́bhyāṃ gā́ ánu śiśrathaḥ
stanzas.translation: I praise thy pair of Tawny Steeds, wise Son of him who giveth kine Terrify not the cows with these.

translations.griffith: I praise thy pair of Tawny Steeds, wise Son of him who giveth kine Terrify not the cows with these.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒नी॒न॒केव॑ विद्र॒धे नवे॑ द्रुप॒दे अ॑र्भ॒के ब॒भ्रू यामे॑षु शोभेते
stanzas.transliteration: kanīnakéva vidradhé náve drupadé arbhaké babhrū́ yā́meṣu śobhete
stanzas.translation: Like two slight images of girls, unrobed, upon a new-wrought post, So shine the Bay Steeds in their course.

translations.griffith: Like two slight images of girls, unrobed, upon a new-wrought post, So shine the Bay Steeds in their course.

stanzas.sanskrit: अरं॑ म उ॒स्रया॒म्णेऽर॒मनु॑स्रयाम्णे ब॒भ्रू यामे॑ष्व॒स्रिधा॑
stanzas.transliteration: áram ma usráyāmṇe- -áram ánusrayāmṇe babhrū́ yā́meṣv asrídhā
stanzas.translation: For me the Bays are ready when I start, or start not, with the dawn, Innocuous in the ways they take.

translations.griffith: For me the Bays are ready when I start, or start not, with the dawn, Innocuous in the ways they take.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ऋ॒भुभ्यो॑ दू॒तमि॑व॒ वाच॑मिष्य उप॒स्तिरे॒ श्वैत॑रीं धे॒नुमी॑ळे ये वात॑जूतास्त॒रणि॑भि॒रेवैः॒ परि॒ द्यां स॒द्यो अ॒पसो॑ बभू॒वुः
stanzas.transliteration: prá r̥bhúbhyo dūtám iva vā́cam iṣye- upastíre śvaítarīṃ dhenúm īḷe yé vā́tajūtās taráṇibhir évaiḥ pári dyā́ṃ sadyó apáso babhūvúḥ
stanzas.translation: I SEND my voice as herald to the R̥ibhus; I crave the white cow for the overspreading. Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.

translations.griffith: I SEND my voice as herald to the R̥ibhus; I crave the white cow for the overspreading. Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒दार॒मक्र॑न्नृ॒भवः॑ पि॒तृभ्यां॒ परि॑विष्टी वे॒षणा॑ दं॒सना॑भिः आदिद्दे॒वाना॒मुप॑ स॒ख्यमा॑य॒न्धीरा॑सः पु॒ष्टिम॑वहन्म॒नायै॑
stanzas.transliteration: yadā́ram ákrann r̥bhávaḥ pitŕ̥bhyām páriviṣṭī veṣáṇā daṃsánābhiḥ ā́d íd devā́nām úpa sakhyám āyan dhī́rāsaḥ puṣṭím avahan manā́yai
stanzas.translation: What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their Parents, They won the friendship of the Gods; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.

translations.griffith: What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their Parents, They won the friendship of the Gods; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.

stanzas.sanskrit: पुन॒र्ये च॒क्रुः पि॒तरा॒ युवा॑ना॒ सना॒ यूपे॑व जर॒णा शया॑ना ते वाजो॒ विभ्वाँ॑ ऋ॒भुरिन्द्र॑वन्तो॒ मधु॑प्सरसो नोऽवन्तु य॒ज्ञम्
stanzas.transliteration: púnar yé cakrúḥ pitárā yúvānā sánā yū́peva jaraṇā́ śáyānā té vā́jo víbhvām̐ r̥bhúr índravanto mádhupsaraso no 'vantu yajñám
stanzas.translation: May they who made their Parents, who were lying like posts that moulder, young again for ever,– May Vâja, Vibhvan, R̥ibhu, joined with Indra , protect our sacrifice, the Soma-lovers.

translations.griffith: May they who made their Parents, who were lying like posts that moulder, young again for ever,– May Vâja, Vibhvan, R̥ibhu, joined with Indra , protect our sacrifice, the Soma-lovers.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्सं॒वत्स॑मृ॒भवो॒ गामर॑क्ष॒न्यत्सं॒वत्स॑मृ॒भवो॒ मा अपिं॑शन् यत्सं॒वत्स॒मभ॑र॒न्भासो॑ अस्या॒स्ताभिः॒ शमी॑भिरमृत॒त्वमा॑शुः
stanzas.transliteration: yát saṃvátsam r̥bhávo gā́m árakṣan yát saṃvátsam r̥bhávo mā́ ápiṃśan yát saṃvátsam ábharan bhā́so asyās tā́bhiḥ śámībhir amr̥tatvám āśuḥ
stanzas.translation: As for a year the R̥ibhus kept the Milch-cow, throughout a year fashioned and formed her body, And through a year's space still sustained her brightness, through these their labours they were made immortal.

translations.griffith: As for a year the R̥ibhus kept the Milch-cow, throughout a year fashioned and formed her body, And through a year's space still sustained her brightness, through these their labours they were made immortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: ज्ये॒ष्ठ आ॑ह चम॒सा द्वा क॒रेति॒ कनी॑या॒न्त्रीन्कृ॑णवा॒मेत्या॑ह क॒नि॒ष्ठ आ॑ह च॒तुर॑स्क॒रेति॒ त्वष्ट॑ ऋभव॒स्तत्प॑नय॒द्वचो॑ वः
stanzas.transliteration: jyeṣṭhá āha camasā́ dvā́ karéti kánīyān trī́n kr̥ṇavāméty āha kaniṣṭhá āha catúras karéti tváṣṭa r̥bhavas tát panayad váco vaḥ
stanzas.translation: Two beakers let us make,– thus said the eldest. Lct us make three,– this was the younger's sentence. Four beakers let us make,– thus spoke the youngest. Tvashṭar approved this rede of yours, O R̥ibhus.

translations.griffith: Two beakers let us make,– thus said the eldest. Lct us make three,– this was the younger's sentence. Four beakers let us make,– thus spoke the youngest. Tvashṭar approved this rede of yours, O R̥ibhus.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्यमू॑चु॒र्नर॑ ए॒वा हि च॒क्रुरनु॑ स्व॒धामृ॒भवो॑ जग्मुरे॒ताम् वि॒भ्राज॑मानाँश्चम॒साँ अहे॒वावे॑न॒त्त्वष्टा॑ च॒तुरो॑ ददृ॒श्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: satyám ūcur nára evā́ hí cakrúr ánu svadhā́m r̥bhávo jagmur etā́m vibhrā́jamānāṃś camasā́m̐ áheva- -ávenat tváṣṭā catúro dadr̥śvā́n
stanzas.translation: The men spake truth and even so they acted: this Godlike way of theirs the R̥ibhus followed. And Tvashṭar, when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day, was moved with envy.

translations.griffith: The men spake truth and even so they acted: this Godlike way of theirs the R̥ibhus followed. And Tvashṭar, when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day, was moved with envy.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्वाद॑श॒ द्यून्यदगो॑ह्यस्याति॒थ्ये रण॑न्नृ॒भवः॑ स॒सन्तः॑ सु॒क्षेत्रा॑कृण्व॒न्नन॑यन्त॒ सिन्धू॒न्धन्वाति॑ष्ठ॒न्नोष॑धीर्नि॒म्नमापः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dvā́daśa dyū́n yád ágohyasya- -ātithyé ráṇann r̥bhávaḥ sasántaḥ sukṣétrākr̥ṇvann ánayanta síndhūn dhánvā́tiṣṭhann óṣadhīr nimnám ā́paḥ
stanzas.translation: When for twelve days the R̥ibhus joyed reposing as guests of him who never may be hidden, lley made fair fertile fields, they brought the rivers. Plants spread o'er deserts, waters filled the hollows.

translations.griffith: When for twelve days the R̥ibhus joyed reposing as guests of him who never may be hidden, lley made fair fertile fields, they brought the rivers. Plants spread o'er deserts, waters filled the hollows.

stanzas.sanskrit: रथं॒ ये च॒क्रुः सु॒वृतं॑ नरे॒ष्ठां ये धे॒नुं वि॑श्व॒जुवं॑ वि॒श्वरू॑पाम् त आ त॑क्षन्त्वृ॒भवो॑ र॒यिं नः॒ स्वव॑सः॒ स्वप॑सः सु॒हस्ताः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ráthaṃ yé cakrúḥ suvŕ̥taṃ nareṣṭhā́ṃ yé dhenúṃ viśvajúvaṃ viśvárūpām tá ā́ takṣantv r̥bhávo rayíṃ naḥ svávasaḥ svápasaḥ suhástāḥ
stanzas.translation: May they who formed the swift car, bearing Heroes, and the Cow omniform and all-impelling, Even may they form wealth for us,– the R̥ibhus, dexterous-handed, deft in work and gracious.

translations.griffith: May they who formed the swift car, bearing Heroes, and the Cow omniform and all-impelling, Even may they form wealth for us,– the R̥ibhus, dexterous-handed, deft in work and gracious.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपो॒ ह्ये॑षा॒मजु॑षन्त दे॒वा अ॒भि क्रत्वा॒ मन॑सा॒ दीध्या॑नाः वाजो॑ दे॒वाना॑मभवत्सु॒कर्मेन्द्र॑स्य ऋभु॒क्षा वरु॑णस्य॒ विभ्वा॑
stanzas.transliteration: ápo hy èṣām ájuṣanta devā́ḥ- abhí krátvā mánasā dī́dhyānāḥ vā́jo devā́nām abhavat sukármā- -índrasya r̥bhukṣā́ váruṇasya víbhvā
stanzas.translation: So in their work the Gods had satisfaction, pondering it with thought and mental insight. The Gods' expert artificer was Vâja, Indra's R̥ibhukshan, Varuṇa's was Vibhvan.

translations.griffith: So in their work the Gods had satisfaction, pondering it with thought and mental insight. The Gods' expert artificer was Vâja, Indra's R̥ibhukshan, Varuṇa's was Vibhvan.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये हरी॑ मे॒धयो॒क्था मद॑न्त॒ इन्द्रा॑य च॒क्रुः सु॒युजा॒ ये अश्वा॑ ते रा॒यस्पोषं॒ द्रवि॑णान्य॒स्मे ध॒त्त ऋ॑भवः क्षेम॒यन्तो॒ न मि॒त्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: yé hárī medháyokthā́ mádantaḥ- índrāya cakrúḥ suyújā yé áśvā té rāyás póṣaṃ dráviṇāny asmé dhattá r̥bhavaḥ kṣemayánto ná mitrám
stanzas.translation: They whol made glad with sacrifice and praises, wrought the two Bays, his docile Steeds, for Indra,– R̥ibhus, as those who wish a friend to prosper, bestow upon us gear and growth of riches.

translations.griffith: They whol made glad with sacrifice and praises, wrought the two Bays, his docile Steeds, for Indra,– R̥ibhus, as those who wish a friend to prosper, bestow upon us gear and growth of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दाह्नः॑ पी॒तिमु॒त वो॒ मदं॑ धु॒र्न ऋ॒ते श्रा॒न्तस्य॑ स॒ख्याय॑ दे॒वाः ते नू॒नम॒स्मे ऋ॑भवो॒ वसू॑नि तृ॒तीये॑ अ॒स्मिन्त्सव॑ने दधात
stanzas.transliteration: idā́hnaḥ pītím utá vo mádaṃ dhur ná r̥té śrāntásya sakhyā́ya devā́ḥ té nūnám asmé r̥bhavo vásūni tr̥tī́ye asmín sávane dadhāta
stanzas.translation: This day have they set gladdening drink before you. Not without toil are Gods inclined to friendship. Therefore do ye who are so great, O R̥ibhus, vouchsafe us treasures at this third libation.

translations.griffith: This day have they set gladdening drink before you. Not without toil are Gods inclined to friendship. Therefore do ye who are so great, O R̥ibhus, vouchsafe us treasures at this third libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒भुर्विभ्वा॒ वाज॒ इन्द्रो॑ नो॒ अच्छे॒मं य॒ज्ञं र॑त्न॒धेयोप॑ यात इ॒दा हि वो॑ धि॒षणा॑ दे॒व्यह्ना॒मधा॑त्पी॒तिं सं मदा॑ अग्मता वः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥bhúr víbhvā vā́ja índro no ácha- -imáṃ yajñáṃ ratnadhéyópa yāta idā́ hí vo dhiṣáṇā devy áhnām ádhāt pītíṃ sám mádā agmatā vaḥ
stanzas.translation: To this our sacrifice come R̥ibhu, Vibhvan, Vâja, and Indra with the gift of riches, Because this day hath Dhishaṇâ the Goddess set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.

translations.griffith: To this our sacrifice come R̥ibhu, Vibhvan, Vâja, and Indra with the gift of riches, Because this day hath Dhishaṇâ the Goddess set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒दा॒नासो॒ जन्म॑नो वाजरत्ना उ॒त ऋ॒तुभि॑र्ऋभवो मादयध्वम् सं वो॒ मदा॒ अग्म॑त॒ सं पुरं॑धिः सु॒वीरा॑म॒स्मे र॒यिमेर॑यध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: vidānā́so jánmano vājaratnāḥ- utá r̥túbhir r̥bhavo mādayadhvam sáṃ vo mádā ágmata sám púraṃdhiḥ suvī́rām asmé rayím érayadhvam
stanzas.translation: Knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure, R̥ibhus, rejoice together with the Rtus. The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us riches with good store of heroes.

translations.griffith: Knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure, R̥ibhus, rejoice together with the Rtus. The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us riches with good store of heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं वो॑ य॒ज्ञ ऋ॑भवोऽकारि॒ यमा म॑नु॒ष्वत्प्र॒दिवो॑ दधि॒ध्वे प्र वोऽच्छा॑ जुजुषा॒णासो॑ अस्थु॒रभू॑त॒ विश्वे॑ अग्रि॒योत वा॑जाः
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ vo yajñá r̥bhavo 'kāri yám ā́ manuṣvát pradívo dadhidhvé prá vó 'chā jujuṣāṇā́so asthur ábhūta víśve agriyótá vājāḥ
stanzas.translation: For you was made this sacrifice, O R̥ibhus, which ye, like men, won for yourselves aforetime. To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were-even the two elder-Vâjas.

translations.griffith: For you was made this sacrifice, O R̥ibhus, which ye, like men, won for yourselves aforetime. To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were-even the two elder-Vâjas.

stanzas.sanskrit: अभू॑दु वो विध॒ते र॑त्न॒धेय॑मि॒दा न॑रो दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य पिब॑त वाजा ऋभवो द॒दे वो॒ महि॑ तृ॒तीयं॒ सव॑नं॒ मदा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: ábhūd u vo vidhaté ratnadhéyam idā́ naro dāśúṣe mártyāya píbata vājā r̥bhavo dadé vo máhi tr̥tī́yaṃ sávanam mádāya
stanzas.translation: Now for the mortal worshipper, O Heroes, for him who served you, was the gift of riches. Drink, Vâjas, R̥ibhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.

translations.griffith: Now for the mortal worshipper, O Heroes, for him who served you, was the gift of riches. Drink, Vâjas, R̥ibhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वा॑जा या॒तोप॑ न ऋभुक्षा म॒हो न॑रो॒ द्रवि॑णसो गृणा॒नाः आ वः॑ पी॒तयो॑ऽभिपि॒त्वे अह्ना॑मि॒मा अस्तं॑ नव॒स्व॑ इव ग्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vājā yātópa na r̥bhukṣāḥ- mahó naro dráviṇaso gr̥ṇānā́ḥ ā́ vaḥ pītáyo 'bhipitvé áhnām imā́ ástaṃ navasvà iva gman
stanzas.translation: Come to us, Heroes, Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, glorified for the sake of mighty treasure. These draughts approach you as the day is closing, as cows, whose calves are newly-born, their stable.

translations.griffith: Come to us, Heroes, Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, glorified for the sake of mighty treasure. These draughts approach you as the day is closing, as cows, whose calves are newly-born, their stable.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ न॑पातः शवसो यात॒नोपे॒मं य॒ज्ञं नम॑सा हू॒यमा॑नाः स॒जोष॑सः सूरयो॒ यस्य॑ च॒ स्थ मध्वः॑ पात रत्न॒धा इन्द्र॑वन्तः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ napātaḥ śavaso yātanópa- -imáṃ yajñáṃ námasā hūyámānāḥ sajóṣasaḥ sūrayo yásya ca sthá mádhvaḥ pāta ratnadhā́ índravantaḥ
stanzas.translation: Come to this sacrifice of ours, ye Children of Strength, invoked with humble adoration. Drink of this meath, Wealth-givers, joined with Indra with whom ye are in full accord, ye Princes.

translations.griffith: Come to this sacrifice of ours, ye Children of Strength, invoked with humble adoration. Drink of this meath, Wealth-givers, joined with Indra with whom ye are in full accord, ye Princes.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒जोषा॑ इन्द्र॒ वरु॑णेन॒ सोमं॑ स॒जोषाः॑ पाहि गिर्वणो म॒रुद्भिः॑ अ॒ग्रे॒पाभि॑र्ऋतु॒पाभिः॑ स॒जोषा॒ ग्नास्पत्नी॑भी रत्न॒धाभिः॑ स॒जोषाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sajóṣā indra váruṇena sómaṃ sajóṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marúdbhiḥ agrepā́bhir r̥tupā́bhiḥ sajóṣāḥ- gnā́spátnībhī ratnadhā́bhiḥ sajóṣāḥ
stanzas.translation: Close knit with Varuṇa drink the Soma, Indra; close-knit, ilymn-lover! with the Maruts drink it: Close-knit with drinkers first, who drink in season; close-knit with heavenly Dames who give us treasures.

translations.griffith: Close knit with Varuṇa drink the Soma, Indra; close-knit, ilymn-lover! with the Maruts drink it: Close-knit with drinkers first, who drink in season; close-knit with heavenly Dames who give us treasures.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒जोष॑स आदि॒त्यैर्मा॑दयध्वं स॒जोष॑स ऋभवः॒ पर्व॑तेभिः स॒जोष॑सो॒ दैव्ये॑ना सवि॒त्रा स॒जोष॑सः॒ सिन्धु॑भी रत्न॒धेभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sajóṣasa ādityaír mādayadhvaṃ sajóṣasa r̥bhavaḥ párvatebhiḥ sajóṣaso daívyenā savitrā́ sajóṣasaḥ síndhubhī ratnadhébhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Rejoice in full accord with the Âdityas, in concord with the Parvatas, O R̥ibhus; In full accord with Savitar, Divine One; in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.

translations.griffith: Rejoice in full accord with the Âdityas, in concord with the Parvatas, O R̥ibhus; In full accord with Savitar, Divine One; in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये अ॒श्विना॒ ये पि॒तरा॒ य ऊ॒ती धे॒नुं त॑त॒क्षुर्ऋ॒भवो॒ ये अश्वा॑ ये अंस॑त्रा॒ य ऋध॒ग्रोद॑सी॒ ये विभ्वो॒ नरः॑ स्वप॒त्यानि॑ च॒क्रुः
stanzas.transliteration: yé aśvínā yé pitárā yá ūtī́ dhenúṃ tatakṣúr r̥bhávo yé áśvā yé áṃsatrā yá ŕ̥dhag ródasī yé víbhvo náraḥ svapatyā́ni cakrúḥ
stanzas.translation: R̥ibhus, who helped their Parents and the Aṣvins, who formed the Milch-cow and the pair of horses, Made armour, set the heaven and earth asunder,– far- reaching Heroes, they have made good offspring.

translations.griffith: R̥ibhus, who helped their Parents and the Aṣvins, who formed the Milch-cow and the pair of horses, Made armour, set the heaven and earth asunder,– far- reaching Heroes, they have made good offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये गोम॑न्तं॒ वाज॑वन्तं सु॒वीरं॑ र॒यिं ध॒त्थ वसु॑मन्तं पुरु॒क्षुम् ते अ॑ग्रे॒पा ऋ॑भवो मन्दसा॒ना अ॒स्मे ध॑त्त॒ ये च॑ रा॒तिं गृ॒णन्ति॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé gómantaṃ vā́javantaṃ suvī́raṃ rayíṃ dhatthá vásumantam purukṣúm té agrepā́ r̥bhavo mandasānā́ḥ- asmé dhatta yé ca rātíṃ gr̥ṇánti
stanzas.translation: Ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty, in heroes, in rich sustenance and treasure, Such, O ye R̥ibhus, first to drink, rejoicing, give unto us and those who laud our present.

translations.griffith: Ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty, in heroes, in rich sustenance and treasure, Such, O ye R̥ibhus, first to drink, rejoicing, give unto us and those who laud our present.

stanzas.sanskrit: नापा॑भूत॒ न वो॑ऽतीतृषा॒मानिः॑शस्ता ऋभवो य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन् समिन्द्रे॑ण॒ मद॑थ॒ सं म॒रुद्भिः॒ सं राज॑भी रत्न॒धेया॑य देवाः
stanzas.transliteration: nā́pābhūta ná vo 'tītr̥ṣāma- -ániḥśastā r̥bhavo yajñé asmín sám índreṇa mádatha sám marúdbhiḥ sáṃ rā́jabhī ratnadhéyāya devāḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye were not far: we have not left you thirsting, blameless in this our sacrifice, O R̥ibhus. Rejoice you with the Maruts and with Indra, with the Kings, Gods! that ye may give us riches.

translations.griffith: Ye were not far: we have not left you thirsting, blameless in this our sacrifice, O R̥ibhus. Rejoice you with the Maruts and with Indra, with the Kings, Gods! that ye may give us riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒होप॑ यात शवसो नपातः॒ सौध॑न्वना ऋभवो॒ माप॑ भूत अ॒स्मिन्हि वः॒ सव॑ने रत्न॒धेयं॒ गम॒न्त्विन्द्र॒मनु॑ वो॒ मदा॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: ihópa yāta śavaso napātaḥ saúdhanvanā r̥bhavo mā́pa bhūta asmín hí vaḥ sávane ratnadhéyaṃ gámantv índram ánu vo mádāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, ye R̥ibhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan. At this libation is your gift of treasure. Let gladdening draughts approach you after Indra's.

translations.griffith: Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, ye R̥ibhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan. At this libation is your gift of treasure. Let gladdening draughts approach you after Indra's.

stanzas.sanskrit: आग॑न्नृभू॒णामि॒ह र॑त्न॒धेय॒मभू॒त्सोम॑स्य॒ सुषु॑तस्य पी॒तिः सु॒कृ॒त्यया॒ यत्स्व॑प॒स्यया॑ चँ॒ एकं॑ विच॒क्र च॑म॒सं च॑तु॒र्धा
stanzas.transliteration: ā́gann r̥bhūṇā́m ihá ratnadhéyam ábhūt sómasya súṣutasya pītíḥ sukr̥tyáyā yát svapasyáyā cam̐ ékaṃ vicakrá camasáṃ caturdhā́
stanzas.translation: Hither is come the R̥ibhus' gift of riches; here was the drinking of the well-pressed Soma, Since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold

translations.griffith: Hither is come the R̥ibhus' gift of riches; here was the drinking of the well-pressed Soma, Since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold

stanzas.sanskrit: व्य॑कृणोत चम॒सं च॑तु॒र्धा सखे॒ वि शि॒क्षेत्य॑ब्रवीत अथै॑त वाजा अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ पन्थां॑ ग॒णं दे॒वाना॑मृभवः सुहस्ताः
stanzas.transliteration: vy àkr̥ṇota camasáṃ caturdhā́ sákhe ví śikṣéty abravīta áthaita vājā amŕ̥tasya pánthāṃ gaṇáṃ devā́nām r̥bhavaḥ suhastāḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single: ye spake these words and said, O Friend, assist us; Then, Vâjas! gained the path of life eternal, deft-handed R̥ibhus, to the Gods' assembly.

translations.griffith: Ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single: ye spake these words and said, O Friend, assist us; Then, Vâjas! gained the path of life eternal, deft-handed R̥ibhus, to the Gods' assembly.

stanzas.sanskrit: कि॒म्मयः॑ स्विच्चम॒स ए॒ष आ॑स॒ यं काव्ये॑न च॒तुरो॑ विच॒क्र अथा॑ सुनुध्वं॒ सव॑नं॒ मदा॑य पा॒त ऋ॑भवो॒ मधु॑नः सो॒म्यस्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: kimmáyaḥ svic camasá eṣá āsa yáṃ kā́vyena catúro vicakrá áthā sunudhvaṃ sávanam mádāya pātá r̥bhavo mádhunaḥ somyásya
stanzas.translation: Out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom? Now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor, and drink, O R̥ibhus, of die meath of Soma.

translations.griffith: Out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom? Now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor, and drink, O R̥ibhus, of die meath of Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: शच्या॑कर्त पि॒तरा॒ युवा॑ना॒ शच्या॑कर्त चम॒सं दे॑व॒पान॑म् शच्या॒ हरी॒ धनु॑तरावतष्टेन्द्र॒वाहा॑वृभवो वाजरत्नाः
stanzas.transliteration: śácyākarta pitárā yúvānā śácyākarta camasáṃ devapā́nam śácyā hárī dhánutarāv ataṣṭa- -indravā́hāv r̥bhavo vājaratnāḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye with your cunning made your Parents youthful; the cup, for Gods to drink, ye formed with cunning; With cunning, R̥ibhus, rich in treasure, fashioned the two swift Tawny Steeds who carry Indra.

translations.griffith: Ye with your cunning made your Parents youthful; the cup, for Gods to drink, ye formed with cunning; With cunning, R̥ibhus, rich in treasure, fashioned the two swift Tawny Steeds who carry Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो वः॑ सु॒नोत्य॑भिपि॒त्वे अह्नां॑ ती॒व्रं वा॑जासः॒ सव॑नं॒ मदा॑य तस्मै॑ र॒यिमृ॑भवः॒ सर्व॑वीर॒मा त॑क्षत वृषणो मन्दसा॒नाः
stanzas.transliteration: yó vaḥ sunóty abhipitvé áhnāṃ tīvráṃ vājāsaḥ sávanam mádāya tásmai rayím r̥bhavaḥ sárvavīram ā́ takṣata vr̥ṣaṇo mandasānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Whoso pours out for you, when days are closing, the sharp libation for your joy, O Vâjas, For him, O mighty R̥ibhus, ye, rejoicing, have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.

translations.griffith: Whoso pours out for you, when days are closing, the sharp libation for your joy, O Vâjas, For him, O mighty R̥ibhus, ye, rejoicing, have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रा॒तः सु॒तम॑पिबो हर्यश्व॒ माध्यं॑दिनं॒ सव॑नं॒ केव॑लं ते समृ॒भुभिः॑ पिबस्व रत्न॒धेभिः॒ सखीँ॒र्याँ इ॑न्द्र चकृ॒षे सु॑कृ॒त्या
stanzas.transliteration: prātáḥ sutám apibo haryaśva mā́dhyaṃdinaṃ sávanaṃ kévalaṃ te sám r̥bhúbhiḥ pibasva ratnadhébhiḥ sákhīm̐r yā́m̐ indra cakr̥ṣé sukr̥tyā́
stanzas.translation: Lord of Bay Steeds, at dawn thejuice thou drankest: thine, only thine, is the noonday libation. Now drink thou with the wealth-bestowing R̥ibhus, whom for their skill thou madest friends, O Indra.

translations.griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, at dawn thejuice thou drankest: thine, only thine, is the noonday libation. Now drink thou with the wealth-bestowing R̥ibhus, whom for their skill thou madest friends, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये दे॒वासो॒ अभ॑वता सुकृ॒त्या श्ये॒ना इ॒वेदधि॑ दि॒वि नि॑षे॒द ते रत्नं॑ धात शवसो नपातः॒ सौध॑न्वना॒ अभ॑वता॒मृता॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: yé devā́so ábhavatā sukr̥tyā́ śyenā́ ivéd ádhi diví niṣedá té rátnaṃ dhāta śavaso napātaḥ saúdhanvanā ábhavatāmŕ̥tāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye, whom your artist skill hath raised to Godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons. So give us riches, Children of Sudhanvan, O Sons of Strength; ye have become immortal.

translations.griffith: Ye, whom your artist skill hath raised to Godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons. So give us riches, Children of Sudhanvan, O Sons of Strength; ye have become immortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्तृ॒तीयं॒ सव॑नं रत्न॒धेय॒मकृ॑णुध्वं स्वप॒स्या सु॑हस्ताः तदृ॑भवः॒ परि॑षिक्तं व ए॒तत्सं मदे॑भिरिन्द्रि॒येभिः॑ पिबध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: yát tr̥tī́yaṃ sávanaṃ ratnadhéyam ákr̥ṇudhvaṃ svapasyā́ suhastāḥ tád r̥bhavaḥ páriṣiktaṃ va etát sám mádebhir indriyébhiḥ pibadhvam
stanzas.translation: The third libation, that bestoweth treasure, which ye have won by skill, ye dexterous-handed,– This drink hath been effused for you, O R̥ibhus . drink it with high delight, with joy like Indra's.

translations.griffith: The third libation, that bestoweth treasure, which ye have won by skill, ye dexterous-handed,– This drink hath been effused for you, O R̥ibhus . drink it with high delight, with joy like Indra's.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒न॒श्वो जा॒तो अ॑नभी॒शुरु॒क्थ्यो॒३॒॑ रथ॑स्त्रिच॒क्रः परि॑ वर्तते॒ रजः॑ म॒हत्तद्वो॑ दे॒व्य॑स्य प्र॒वाच॑नं॒ द्यामृ॑भवः पृथि॒वीं यच्च॒ पुष्य॑थ
stanzas.transliteration: anaśvó jātó anabhīśúr ukthyò ráthas tricakráḥ pári vartate rájaḥ mahát tád vo devyàsya pravā́canaṃ dyā́m r̥bhavaḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ yác ca púṣyatha
stanzas.translation: THia car that was not made for horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the firmament. That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye R̥ibhus, ye sustain the earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: THia car that was not made for horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the firmament. That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye R̥ibhus, ye sustain the earth and heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: रथं॒ ये च॒क्रुः सु॒वृतं॑ सु॒चेत॒सोऽवि॑ह्वरन्तं॒ मन॑स॒स्परि॒ ध्यया॑ ताँ ऊ॒ न्व१॒॑स्य सव॑नस्य पी॒तय॒ आ वो॑ वाजा ऋभवो वेदयामसि
stanzas.transliteration: ráthaṃ yé cakrúḥ suvŕ̥taṃ sucétasaḥ- -ávihvarantam mánasas pári dhyáyā tā́m̐ ū nv àsyá sávanasya pītáye- ā́ vo vājā r̥bhavo vedayāmasi
stanzas.translation: Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling car out of your mind, by thought, the car that never errs, You, being such, to drink of this drinkoffering, you, O ye Vâjas, and ye R̥ibhus, we invoke.

translations.griffith: Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling car out of your mind, by thought, the car that never errs, You, being such, to drink of this drinkoffering, you, O ye Vâjas, and ye R̥ibhus, we invoke.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्वो॑ वाजा ऋभवः सुप्रवाच॒नं दे॒वेषु॑ विभ्वो अभवन्महित्व॒नम् जिव्री॒ यत्सन्ता॑ पि॒तरा॑ सना॒जुरा॒ पुन॒र्युवा॑ना च॒रथा॑य॒ तक्ष॑थ
stanzas.transliteration: tád vo vājā r̥bhavaḥ supravācanáṃ devéṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanám jívrī yát sántā pitárā sanājúrā púnar yúvānā caráthāya tákṣatha
stanzas.translation: O Vâjas, R̥ibhus, reaching far, among the Gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared, In that your aged Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.

translations.griffith: O Vâjas, R̥ibhus, reaching far, among the Gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared, In that your aged Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.

stanzas.sanskrit: एकं॒ वि च॑क्र चम॒सं चतु॑र्वयं॒ निश्चर्म॑णो॒ गाम॑रिणीत धी॒तिभिः॑ अथा॑ दे॒वेष्व॑मृत॒त्वमा॑नश श्रु॒ष्टी वा॑जा ऋभव॒स्तद्व॑ उ॒क्थ्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ékaṃ ví cakra camasáṃ cáturvayaṃ níś cármaṇo gā́m ariṇīta dhītíbhir áthā devéṣv amr̥tatvám ānaśa śruṣṭī́ vājā r̥bhavas tád va ukthyàm
stanzas.translation: The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the Cow forth from the hide. So quickly, mid the Gods, ye gained immortal life. Vâjas and R̥ibhus, your great work must be extolled.

translations.griffith: The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the Cow forth from the hide. So quickly, mid the Gods, ye gained immortal life. Vâjas and R̥ibhus, your great work must be extolled.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒भु॒तो र॒यिः प्र॑थ॒मश्र॑वस्तमो॒ वाज॑श्रुतासो॒ यमजी॑जन॒न्नरः॑ वि॒भ्व॒त॒ष्टो वि॒दथे॑षु प्र॒वाच्यो॒ यं दे॑वा॒सोऽव॑था॒ स विच॑र्षणिः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥bhutó rayíḥ prathamáśravastamo vā́jaśrutāso yám ájījanan náraḥ vibhvataṣṭó vidátheṣu pravā́cyo yáṃ devāsó 'vathā sá vícarṣaṇiḥ
stanzas.translation: Wealth from the R̥ibhus is most glorious in renown, that which the Heroes, famed for vigour, have produced. In synods must be sung the car which Vibhvan wrought: that which ye favour, Gods! is famed among mankind.

translations.griffith: Wealth from the R̥ibhus is most glorious in renown, that which the Heroes, famed for vigour, have produced. In synods must be sung the car which Vibhvan wrought: that which ye favour, Gods! is famed among mankind.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वा॒ज्यर्वा॒ स ऋषि॑र्वच॒स्यया॒ स शूरो॒ अस्ता॒ पृत॑नासु दु॒ष्टरः॑ स रा॒यस्पोषं॒ स सु॒वीर्यं॑ दधे॒ यं वाजो॒ विभ्वाँ॑ ऋ॒भवो॒ यमावि॑षुः
stanzas.transliteration: sá vājy árvā sá ŕ̥ṣir vacasyáyā sá śū́ro ástā pŕ̥tanāsu duṣṭáraḥ sá rāyás póṣaṃ sá suvī́ryaṃ dadhe yáṃ vā́jo víbhvām̐ r̥bhávo yám ā́viṣuḥ
stanzas.translation: Strong is the steed, the man a sage in eloquence, the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight, Great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom Vâja, Vibhvan, R̥ibhus have looked kindly on.

translations.griffith: Strong is the steed, the man a sage in eloquence, the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight, Great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom Vâja, Vibhvan, R̥ibhus have looked kindly on.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रेष्ठं॑ वः॒ पेशो॒ अधि॑ धायि दर्श॒तं स्तोमो॑ वाजा ऋभव॒स्तं जु॑जुष्टन धीरा॑सो॒ हि ष्ठा क॒वयो॑ विप॒श्चित॒स्तान्व॑ ए॒ना ब्रह्म॒णा वे॑दयामसि
stanzas.transliteration: śréṣṭhaṃ vaḥ péśo ádhi dhāyi darśatáṃ stómo vājā r̥bhavas táṃ jujuṣṭana dhī́rāso hí ṣṭhā́ kaváyo vipaścítas tā́n va enā́ bráhmaṇā́ vedayāmasi
stanzas.translation: To you hath been assigned the fairest ornament, the hymn of praise: Vâjas and R̥ibhus, joy therein; For ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill: as such, with this our prayer we call on you to come.

translations.griffith: To you hath been assigned the fairest ornament, the hymn of praise: Vâjas and R̥ibhus, joy therein; For ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill: as such, with this our prayer we call on you to come.

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यम॒स्मभ्यं॑ धि॒षणा॑भ्य॒स्परि॑ वि॒द्वांसो॒ विश्वा॒ नर्या॑णि॒ भोज॑ना द्यु॒मन्तं॒ वाजं॒ वृष॑शुष्ममुत्त॒ममा नो॑ र॒यिमृ॑भवस्तक्ष॒ता वयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yūyám asmábhyaṃ dhiṣáṇābhyas pári vidvā́ṃso víśvā náryāṇi bhójanā dyumántaṃ vā́jaṃ vŕ̥ṣaśuṣmam uttamám ā́ no rayím r̥bhavas takṣatā́ váyaḥ
stanzas.translation: According to the wishes of our hearts may ye, who have full knowledge of all the delights of men, Fashion for us, O R̥ibhus, power and splendid wealth, rich in high courage, excellent, and vital strength.

translations.griffith: According to the wishes of our hearts may ye, who have full knowledge of all the delights of men, Fashion for us, O R̥ibhus, power and splendid wealth, rich in high courage, excellent, and vital strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ह प्र॒जामि॒ह र॒यिं ररा॑णा इ॒ह श्रवो॑ वी॒रव॑त्तक्षता नः येन॑ व॒यं चि॒तये॒मात्य॒न्यान्तं वाजं॑ चि॒त्रमृ॑भवो ददा नः
stanzas.transliteration: ihá prajā́m ihá rayíṃ rárāṇāḥ- ihá śrávo vīrávat takṣatā naḥ yéna vayáṃ citáyemā́ty anyā́n táṃ vā́jaṃ citrám r̥bhavo dadā naḥ
stanzas.translation: Bestowing on us here riches and offspring, here fashion fame for us befitting heroes. Vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort, O R̥ibhus, that we may make us more renowned than others.

translations.griffith: Bestowing on us here riches and offspring, here fashion fame for us befitting heroes. Vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort, O R̥ibhus, that we may make us more renowned than others.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ नो वाजा अध्व॒रमृ॑भुक्षा॒ देवा॑ या॒त प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानैः॑ यथा॑ य॒ज्ञं मनु॑षो वि॒क्ष्वा॒३॒॑सु द॑धि॒ध्वे र॑ण्वाः सु॒दिने॒ष्वह्ना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: úpa no vājā adhvarám r̥bhukṣāḥ- dévā yātá pathíbhir devayā́naiḥ yáthā yajñám mánuṣo vikṣv ā̀sú dadhidhvé raṇvāḥ sudíneṣv áhnām
stanzas.translation: COME to our sacrifice, Vâjas, R̥ibhukshans, Gods, by the paths which Gods are wont to travel, As ye, gay Gods, accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of Manus.

translations.griffith: COME to our sacrifice, Vâjas, R̥ibhukshans, Gods, by the paths which Gods are wont to travel, As ye, gay Gods, accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of Manus.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते वो॑ हृ॒दे मन॑से सन्तु य॒ज्ञा जुष्टा॑सो अ॒द्य घृ॒तनि॑र्णिजो गुः प्र वः॑ सु॒तासो॑ हरयन्त पू॒र्णाः क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॑य हर्षयन्त पी॒ताः
stanzas.transliteration: té vo hr̥dé mánase santu yajñā́ḥ- júṣṭāso adyá ghr̥tánirṇijo guḥ prá vaḥ sutā́so harayanta pūrṇā́ḥ krátve dákṣāya harṣayanta pītā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: May these rites please you in your heart and spirit; may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you. May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, delight you.

translations.griffith: May these rites please you in your heart and spirit; may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you. May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, delight you.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्र्यु॒दा॒यं दे॒वहि॑तं॒ यथा॑ वः॒ स्तोमो॑ वाजा ऋभुक्षणो द॒दे वः॑ जु॒ह्वे म॑नु॒ष्वदुप॑रासु वि॒क्षु यु॒ष्मे सचा॑ बृ॒हद्दि॑वेषु॒ सोम॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tryudāyáṃ deváhitaṃ yáthā vaḥ- stómo vājā r̥bhukṣaṇo dadé vaḥ juhvé manuṣvád úparāsu vikṣú yuṣmé sácā br̥háddiveṣu sómam
stanzas.translation: Your threefold going near is God-appointed, so praise is given you, Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans. So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in heaven, the Soma.

translations.griffith: Your threefold going near is God-appointed, so praise is given you, Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans. So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in heaven, the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: पीवो॑अश्वाः शु॒चद्र॑था॒ हि भू॒तायः॑शिप्रा वाजिनः सुनि॒ष्काः इन्द्र॑स्य सूनो शवसो नपा॒तोऽनु॑ वश्चेत्यग्रि॒यं मदा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: pī́voaśvāḥ śucádrathā hí bhūtá- -áyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkā́ḥ índrasya sūno śavaso napātaḥ- -ánu vaś cety agriyám mádāya
stanzas.translation: Strong, with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid car and well-fed horses. Ye Sons of Strength, ye progeny of Indra, to you the best is offered to delight you.

translations.griffith: Strong, with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid car and well-fed horses. Ye Sons of Strength, ye progeny of Indra, to you the best is offered to delight you.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒भुमृ॑भुक्षणो र॒यिं वाजे॑ वा॒जिन्त॑मं॒ युज॑म् इन्द्र॑स्वन्तं हवामहे सदा॒सात॑मम॒श्विन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥bhúm r̥bhukṣaṇo rayíṃ vā́je vājíntamaṃ yújam índrasvantaṃ havāmahe sadāsā́tamam aśvínam
stanzas.translation: R̥ibhukshans! him, for handy wealth, the mightiest comrade in the fight, Him, Indra's equal, we invoke, most bounteous ever, rich in steeds.

translations.griffith: R̥ibhukshans! him, for handy wealth, the mightiest comrade in the fight, Him, Indra's equal, we invoke, most bounteous ever, rich in steeds.

stanzas.sanskrit: सेदृ॑भवो॒ यमव॑थ यू॒यमिन्द्र॑श्च॒ मर्त्य॑म् स धी॒भिर॑स्तु॒ सनि॑ता मे॒धसा॑ता॒ सो अर्व॑ता
stanzas.transliteration: séd r̥bhavo yám ávatha yūyám índraś ca mártyam sá dhībhír astu sánitā medhásātā só árvatā
stanzas.translation: The mortal man whom, R̥ibhus, ye and Indra favour with your help, Must be successful, by his thoughts, at sacrifice and with the steed.

translations.griffith: The mortal man whom, R̥ibhus, ye and Indra favour with your help, Must be successful, by his thoughts, at sacrifice and with the steed.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि नो॑ वाजा ऋभुक्षणः प॒थश्चि॑तन॒ यष्ट॑वे अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ सूरयः स्तु॒ता विश्वा॒ आशा॑स्तरी॒षणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví no vājā r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ patháś citana yáṣṭave asmábhyaṃ sūraya stutā́ḥ- víśvā ā́śās tarīṣáṇi
stanzas.translation: O Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, free for us the paths to sacrifice, Ye Princes, lauded, that we may press forward to each point of heaven.

translations.griffith: O Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, free for us the paths to sacrifice, Ye Princes, lauded, that we may press forward to each point of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं नो॑ वाजा ऋभुक्षण॒ इन्द्र॒ नास॑त्या र॒यिम् समश्वं॑ चर्ष॒णिभ्य॒ आ पु॒रु श॑स्त म॒घत्त॑ये
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ no vājā r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ- índra nā́satyā rayím sám áśvaṃ carṣaṇíbhya~ā́ purú śasta magháttaye
stanzas.translation: O Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, ye Nâsatyas, Indra, bless this wealth, And, before other men's, the steed, that ample riches may be won.

translations.griffith: O Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, ye Nâsatyas, Indra, bless this wealth, And, before other men's, the steed, that ample riches may be won.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒तो हि वां॑ दा॒त्रा सन्ति॒ पूर्वा॒ या पू॒रुभ्य॑स्त्र॒सद॑स्युर्नितो॒शे क्षे॒त्रा॒सां द॑दथुरुर्वरा॒सां घ॒नं दस्यु॑भ्यो अ॒भिभू॑तिमु॒ग्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: utó hí vāṃ dātrā́ sánti pū́rvā yā́ pūrúbhyas trasádasyur nitośé kṣetrāsā́ṃ dadathur urvarāsā́ṃ ghanáṃ dásyubhyo abhíbhūtim ugrám
stanzas.translation: FROM you two came the gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Pûrus. Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the strong smiter who subdued the Dasytis.

translations.griffith: FROM you two came the gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Pûrus. Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the strong smiter who subdued the Dasytis.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त वा॒जिनं॑ पुरुनि॒ष्षिध्वा॑नं दधि॒क्रामु॑ ददथुर्वि॒श्वकृ॑ष्टिम् ऋ॒जि॒प्यं श्ये॒नं प्रु॑षि॒तप्सु॑मा॒शुं च॒र्कृत्य॑म॒र्यो नृ॒पतिं॒ न शूर॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: utá vājínam puruniṣṣídhvānaṃ dadhikrā́m u dadathur viśvákr̥ṣṭim r̥jipyáṃ śyenám pruṣitápsum āśúṃ carkŕ̥tyam aryó nr̥pátiṃ ná śū́ram
stanzas.translation: And ye gave mighty Dadhikrâs, the giver of many gifts, who visiteth all people, Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a brave King whom each true man must honour.

translations.griffith: And ye gave mighty Dadhikrâs, the giver of many gifts, who visiteth all people, Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a brave King whom each true man must honour.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं सी॒मनु॑ प्र॒वते॑व॒ द्रव॑न्तं॒ विश्वः॑ पू॒रुर्मद॑ति॒ हर्ष॑माणः प॒ड्भिर्गृध्य॑न्तं मेध॒युं न शूरं॑ रथ॒तुरं॒ वात॑मिव॒ ध्रज॑न्तम्
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ sīm ánu praváteva drávantaṃ víśvaḥ pūrúr mádati hárṣamāṇaḥ paḍbhír gŕ̥dhyantam medhayúṃ ná śū́raṃ rathatúraṃ vā́tam iva dhrájantam
stanzas.translation: Whom, as 'twere down a precipice, swift rushing, each Pûru praises and his heart rejoices,– Springing forth like a hero fain for battle, whirling the car and flying like the tempest.

translations.griffith: Whom, as 'twere down a precipice, swift rushing, each Pûru praises and his heart rejoices,– Springing forth like a hero fain for battle, whirling the car and flying like the tempest.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः स्मा॑रुन्धा॒नो गध्या॑ स॒मत्सु॒ सनु॑तर॒श्चर॑ति॒ गोषु॒ गच्छ॑न् आ॒विर्ऋ॑जीको वि॒दथा॑ नि॒चिक्य॑त्ति॒रो अ॑र॒तिं पर्याप॑ आ॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ smārundhānó gádhyā samátsu sánutaraś cárati góṣu gáchan āvírr̥jīko vidáthā nicíkyat tiró aratím páry ā́pa āyóḥ
stanzas.translation: Who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth, winning spoil, among the cattle; Shown in bright colour, looking on the assemblies, beyond the churl, to worship of the living.

translations.griffith: Who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth, winning spoil, among the cattle; Shown in bright colour, looking on the assemblies, beyond the churl, to worship of the living.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्मै॑नं वस्त्र॒मथिं॒ न ता॒युमनु॑ क्रोशन्ति क्षि॒तयो॒ भरे॑षु नी॒चाय॑मानं॒ जसु॑रिं॒ न श्ये॒नं श्रव॒श्चाच्छा॑ पशु॒मच्च॑ यू॒थम्
stanzas.transliteration: utá smainaṃ vastramáthiṃ ná tāyúm ánu krośanti kṣitáyo bháreṣu nīcā́yamānaṃ jásuriṃ ná śyenáṃ śrávaś cā́chā paśumác ca yūthám
stanzas.translation: Loudly the folk cry after him in battles, as 'twere a thief who steals away a garment; Speeding to glory, or a herd of cattle, even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.

translations.griffith: Loudly the folk cry after him in battles, as 'twere a thief who steals away a garment; Speeding to glory, or a herd of cattle, even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्मा॑सु प्रथ॒मः स॑रि॒ष्यन्नि वे॑वेति॒ श्रेणि॑भी॒ रथा॑नाम् स्रजं॑ कृण्वा॒नो जन्यो॒ न शुभ्वा॑ रे॒णुं रेरि॑हत्कि॒रणं॑ दद॒श्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: utá smāsu prathamáḥ sariṣyán ní veveti śréṇibhī ráthānām srájaṃ kr̥ṇvānó jányo ná śúbhvā reṇúṃ rérihat kiráṇaṃ dadaśvā́n
stanzas.translation: And, fain to come forth first amid these armies, this way and that with rows of cars he rushes, Gay like a bridesman, making him a garland, tossing the dust, champing the rein that holds him.

translations.griffith: And, fain to come forth first amid these armies, this way and that with rows of cars he rushes, Gay like a bridesman, making him a garland, tossing the dust, champing the rein that holds him.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्य वा॒जी सहु॑रिर्ऋ॒तावा॒ शुश्रू॑षमाणस्त॒न्वा॑ सम॒र्ये तुरं॑ य॒तीषु॑ तु॒रय॑न्नृजि॒प्योऽधि॑ भ्रु॒वोः कि॑रते रे॒णुमृ॒ञ्जन्
stanzas.transliteration: utá syá vājī́ sáhurir r̥tā́vā śúśrūṣamāṇas tanvā̀ samaryé túraṃ yatī́ṣu turáyann r̥jipyó -ádhi bhruvóḥ kirate reṇúm r̥ñján
stanzas.translation: And that strong Steed, victorious and faithful, obedient with his body in the combat, Speeding straight on amid the swiftly ressing, casts o'er his brows the dust he tosses upward.

translations.griffith: And that strong Steed, victorious and faithful, obedient with his body in the combat, Speeding straight on amid the swiftly ressing, casts o'er his brows the dust he tosses upward.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्मा॑स्य तन्य॒तोरि॑व॒ द्योर्ऋ॑घाय॒तो अ॑भि॒युजो॑ भयन्ते य॒दा स॒हस्र॑म॒भि षी॒मयो॑धीद्दु॒र्वर्तुः॑ स्मा भवति भी॒म ऋ॒ञ्जन्
stanzas.transliteration: utá smāsya tanyatór iva dyór r̥ghāyató abhiyújo bhayante yadā́ sahásram abhí ṣīm áyodhīd durvártuḥ smā bhavati bhīmá r̥ñján
stanzas.translation: And at his thunder, like the roar of heaven, those who attack tremble and are affrighted; For when he fights against embattled thousands, dread is he in his striving; none may stay him.

translations.griffith: And at his thunder, like the roar of heaven, those who attack tremble and are affrighted; For when he fights against embattled thousands, dread is he in his striving; none may stay him.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्मा॑स्य पनयन्ति॒ जना॑ जू॒तिं कृ॑ष्टि॒प्रो अ॒भिभू॑तिमा॒शोः उ॒तैन॑माहुः समि॒थे वि॒यन्तः॒ परा॑ दधि॒क्रा अ॑सरत्स॒हस्रैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá smāsya panayanti jánāḥ- jūtíṃ kr̥ṣṭipró abhíbhūtim āśóḥ utaínam āhuḥ samithé viyántaḥ párā dadhikrā́ asarat sahásraiḥ
stanzas.translation: The people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet Steed who giveth men abundance. Of him they say when drawing back from battle. Dadhikrâs hath sped forward with his thousands.

translations.griffith: The people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet Steed who giveth men abundance. Of him they say when drawing back from battle. Dadhikrâs hath sped forward with his thousands.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ द॑धि॒क्राः शव॑सा॒ पञ्च॑ कृ॒ष्टीः सूर्य॑ इव॒ ज्योति॑षा॒पस्त॑तान स॒ह॒स्र॒साः श॑त॒सा वा॒ज्यर्वा॑ पृ॒णक्तु॒ मध्वा॒ समि॒मा वचां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ dadhikrā́ḥ śávasā páñca kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ sū́rya iva jyótiṣāpás tatāna sahasrasā́ḥ śatasā́ vājy árvā pr̥ṇáktu mádhvā sám imā́ vácāṃsi
stanzas.translation: Dadhikrâs hath o'erspread the Fivefold People with vigour, as the Sun lightens the waters. May the strong Steed who winneth bundreds, thousands, requite with sweetness these my words and praises.

translations.griffith: Dadhikrâs hath o'erspread the Fivefold People with vigour, as the Sun lightens the waters. May the strong Steed who winneth bundreds, thousands, requite with sweetness these my words and praises.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒शुं द॑धि॒क्रां तमु॒ नु ष्ट॑वाम दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्या उ॒त च॑र्किराम उ॒च्छन्ती॒र्मामु॒षसः॑ सूदय॒न्त्वति॒ विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒तानि॑ पर्षन्
stanzas.transliteration: āśúṃ dadhikrā́ṃ tám u nú ṣṭavāma divás pr̥thivyā́ utá carkirāma uchántīr mā́m uṣásaḥ sūdayantu- áti víśvāni duritā́ni parṣan
stanzas.translation: Now give we praise to Dadhikrâs the rapid, and mention in our laud the Earth and Heaven. May the Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.

translations.griffith: Now give we praise to Dadhikrâs the rapid, and mention in our laud the Earth and Heaven. May the Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हश्च॑र्क॒र्म्यर्व॑तः क्रतु॒प्रा द॑धि॒क्राव्णः॑ पुरु॒वार॑स्य॒ वृष्णः॑ यं पू॒रुभ्यो॑ दीदि॒वांसं॒ नाग्निं द॒दथु॑र्मित्रावरुणा॒ ततु॑रिम्
stanzas.transliteration: maháś carkarmy árvataḥ kratuprā́ḥ- dadhikrā́vṇaḥ puruvā́rasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ yám pūrúbhyo dīdivā́ṃsaṃ nā́gníṃ dadáthur mitrāvaruṇā táturim
stanzas.translation: I praise the mighty Steed who fills my spirit, the Stallion Dadhikrâvan rich in bounties, Whom, swift of foot aind shining bright as Agni, ye, Varuṇa and Mitra, gave to Pûrus.

translations.griffith: I praise the mighty Steed who fills my spirit, the Stallion Dadhikrâvan rich in bounties, Whom, swift of foot aind shining bright as Agni, ye, Varuṇa and Mitra, gave to Pûrus.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो अश्व॑स्य दधि॒क्राव्णो॒ अका॑री॒त्समि॑द्धे अ॒ग्ना उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ अना॑गसं॒ तमदि॑तिः कृणोतु॒ स मि॒त्रेण॒ वरु॑णेना स॒जोषाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó áśvasya dadhikrā́vṇo ákārīt sámiddhe agnā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭau ánāgasaṃ tám áditiḥ kr̥ṇotu sá mitréṇa váruṇenā sajóṣāḥ
stanzas.translation: Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of dawn, the Courser Dadhikrâvan, Him, of one mind with Varuṇa and Mitra may Aditi make free from all transgression.

translations.griffith: Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of dawn, the Courser Dadhikrâvan, Him, of one mind with Varuṇa and Mitra may Aditi make free from all transgression.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒धि॒क्राव्ण॑ इ॒ष ऊ॒र्जो म॒हो यदम॑न्महि म॒रुतां॒ नाम॑ भ॒द्रम् स्व॒स्तये॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रम॒ग्निं हवा॑मह॒ इन्द्रं॒ वज्र॑बाहुम्
stanzas.transliteration: dadhikrā́vṇa iṣá ūrjó mahó yád ámanmahi marútāṃ nā́ma bhadrám svastáye váruṇam mitrám agníṃ hávāmaha índraṃ vájrabāhum
stanzas.translation: When we remember mighty Dadhikrâvan our food and strength, then the blest name of Maruts, Varuṇa, Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and Agni, and the thunder-wielding Indra.

translations.griffith: When we remember mighty Dadhikrâvan our food and strength, then the blest name of Maruts, Varuṇa, Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and Agni, and the thunder-wielding Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑मि॒वेदु॒भये॒ वि ह्व॑यन्त उ॒दीरा॑णा य॒ज्ञमु॑पप्र॒यन्तः॑ द॒धि॒क्रामु॒ सूद॑नं॒ मर्त्या॑य द॒दथु॑र्मित्रावरुणा नो॒ अश्व॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: índram ivéd ubháye ví hvayante- udī́rāṇā yajñám upaprayántaḥ dadhikrā́m u sū́danam mártyāya dadáthur mitrāvaruṇā no áśvam
stanzas.translation: Both sides invoke him as they call on Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing. To us have Varuṇa and Mitra granted the Courser Dadhikrâs, a guide for mortals.

translations.griffith: Both sides invoke him as they call on Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing. To us have Varuṇa and Mitra granted the Courser Dadhikrâs, a guide for mortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒धि॒क्राव्णो॑ अकारिषं जि॒ष्णोरश्व॑स्य वा॒जिनः॑ सु॒र॒भि नो॒ मुखा॑ कर॒त्प्र ण॒ आयूं॑षि तारिषत्
stanzas.transliteration: dadhikrā́vṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇór áśvasya vājínaḥ surabhí no múkhā karat prá ṇa ā́yūṃṣi tāriṣat
stanzas.translation: So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikrâvan, conquering Steed. Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.

translations.griffith: So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikrâvan, conquering Steed. Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒धि॒क्राव्ण॒ इदु॒ नु च॑र्किराम॒ विश्वा॒ इन्मामु॒षसः॑ सूदयन्तु अ॒पाम॒ग्नेरु॒षसः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ बृह॒स्पते॑राङ्गिर॒सस्य॑ जि॒ष्णोः
stanzas.transliteration: dadhikrā́vṇa íd u nú carkirāma víśvā ín mā́m uṣásaḥ sūdayantu apā́m agnér uṣásaḥ sū́ryasya bŕ̥haspáter āṅgirasásya jiṣṇóḥ
stanzas.translation: LET us recite the praise of Dadhikrâvan: may all the Mornings move me to exertion; Praise of the Lord of Waters, Dawn, and Agni, Br̥ihaspati Son of Angiras, and Sûrya.
