translations.griffith: LET us recite the praise of Dadhikrâvan: may all the Mornings move me to exertion; Praise of the Lord of Waters, Dawn, and Agni, Br̥ihaspati Son of Angiras, and Sûrya.

stanzas.sanskrit: सत्वा॑ भरि॒षो ग॑वि॒षो दु॑वन्य॒सच्छ्र॑व॒स्यादि॒ष उ॒षस॑स्तुरण्य॒सत् स॒त्यो द्र॒वो द्र॑व॒रः प॑तंग॒रो द॑धि॒क्रावेष॒मूर्जं॒ स्व॑र्जनत्
stanzas.transliteration: sátvā bhariṣó gaviṣó duvanyasác -śravasyā́d iṣá uṣásas turaṇyasát satyó dravó dravaráḥ pataṃgaró dadhikrā́véṣam ū́rjaṃ svàr janat
stanzas.translation: Brave, seeking war and booty, dwelling with the good and with the swift, may he hasten the food of Dawn. May he the true, the fleet, the lover of the course, the bird-like Dadhikrâvan, bring food, strength, and light.

translations.griffith: Brave, seeking war and booty, dwelling with the good and with the swift, may he hasten the food of Dawn. May he the true, the fleet, the lover of the course, the bird-like Dadhikrâvan, bring food, strength, and light.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्मा॑स्य॒ द्रव॑तस्तुरण्य॒तः प॒र्णं न वेरनु॑ वाति प्रग॒र्धिनः॑ श्ये॒नस्ये॑व॒ ध्रज॑तो अङ्क॒सं परि॑ दधि॒क्राव्णः॑ स॒होर्जा तरि॑त्रतः
stanzas.transliteration: utá smāsya drávatas turaṇyatáḥ parṇáṃ ná vér ánu vāti pragardhínaḥ śyenásyeva dhrájato aṅkasám pári dadhikrā́vṇaḥ sahórjā́ táritrataḥ
stanzas.translation: His pinion, rapid runner, fans him m his way, as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim, And, as it were a falcon's gliding through the air, strikes Dadhikrâvan's side as he speeds on with might.

translations.griffith: His pinion, rapid runner, fans him m his way, as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim, And, as it were a falcon's gliding through the air, strikes Dadhikrâvan's side as he speeds on with might.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्य वा॒जी क्षि॑प॒णिं तु॑रण्यति ग्री॒वायां॑ ब॒द्धो अ॑पिक॒क्ष आ॒सनि॑ क्रतुं॑ दधि॒क्रा अनु॑ सं॒तवी॑त्वत्प॒थामङ्कां॒स्यन्वा॒पनी॑फणत्
stanzas.transliteration: utá syá vājī́ kṣipaṇíṃ turaṇyati grīvā́yām baddhó apikakṣá āsáni krátuṃ dadhikrā́ ánu saṃtávītvat pathā́m áṅkāṃsy ánv āpánīphaṇat
stanzas.translation: Bound by the neck and by the flanks and by the mouth, the vigorous Courser lends new swiftness to his speed. Drawing himself together, as his strength allows, Dadhikrâs springs along the windings of the paths.

translations.griffith: Bound by the neck and by the flanks and by the mouth, the vigorous Courser lends new swiftness to his speed. Drawing himself together, as his strength allows, Dadhikrâs springs along the windings of the paths.

stanzas.sanskrit: हं॒सः शु॑चि॒षद्वसु॑रन्तरिक्ष॒सद्धोता॑ वेदि॒षदति॑थिर्दुरोण॒सत् नृ॒षद्व॑र॒सदृ॑त॒सद्व्यो॑म॒सद॒ब्जा गो॒जा ऋ॑त॒जा अ॑द्रि॒जा ऋ॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: haṃsáḥ śuciṣád vásur antarikṣasád -hótā vediṣád átithir duroṇasát nr̥ṣád varasád r̥tasád vyomasád abjā́ gojā́ r̥tajā́ adrijā́ r̥tám
stanzas.translation: The Hamsa homed in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the priest beside the altar, in the house the guest, Dweller in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, he is holy Law.

translations.griffith: The Hamsa homed in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the priest beside the altar, in the house the guest, Dweller in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, he is holy Law.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॒ को वां॑ वरुणा सु॒म्नमा॑प॒ स्तोमो॑ ह॒विष्माँ॑ अ॒मृतो॒ न होता॑ यो वां॑ हृ॒दि क्रतु॑माँ अ॒स्मदु॒क्तः प॒स्पर्श॑दिन्द्रावरुणा॒ नम॑स्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: índrā kó vāṃ varuṇā sumnám āpa stómo havíṣmām̐ amŕ̥to ná hótā yó vāṃ hr̥dí krátumām̐ asmád uktáḥ paspárśad indrāvaruṇā námasvān
stanzas.translation: WHAT laud, O Indra-Varuṇa, with oblation, hath like the Immortal Priest obtained your favour? Hath our effectual laud, addressed with homage, touched you, O Indra-Varuṇa, in spirit?

translations.griffith: WHAT laud, O Indra-Varuṇa, with oblation, hath like the Immortal Priest obtained your favour? Hath our effectual laud, addressed with homage, touched you, O Indra-Varuṇa, in spirit?

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ ह॒ यो वरु॑णा च॒क्र आ॒पी दे॒वौ मर्तः॑ स॒ख्याय॒ प्रय॑स्वान् स ह॑न्ति वृ॒त्रा स॑मि॒थेषु॒ शत्रू॒नवो॑भिर्वा म॒हद्भिः॒ स प्र शृ॑ण्वे
stanzas.transliteration: índrā ha yó váruṇā cakrá āpī́ devaú mártaḥ sakhyā́ya práyasvān sá hanti vr̥trā́ samithéṣu śátrūn ávobhir vā mahádbhiḥ sá prá śr̥ṇve
stanzas.translation: He who with dainty food hath won you, Indra and Varuṇa, Gods, as his allies to friendship, Jayeth the Vr̥itras and his foes in battles, and through your mighty favours is made famous.

translations.griffith: He who with dainty food hath won you, Indra and Varuṇa, Gods, as his allies to friendship, Jayeth the Vr̥itras and his foes in battles, and through your mighty favours is made famous.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ ह॒ रत्नं॒ वरु॑णा॒ धेष्ठे॒त्था नृभ्यः॑ शशमा॒नेभ्य॒स्ता यदी॒ सखा॑या स॒ख्याय॒ सोमैः॑ सु॒तेभिः॑ सुप्र॒यसा॑ मा॒दयै॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: índrā ha rátnaṃ váruṇā dhéṣṭhā- -itthā́ nŕ̥bhyaḥ śaśamānébhyas tā́ yádī sákhāyā sakhyā́ya sómaiḥ sutébhiḥ suprayásā mādáyaite
stanzas.translation: Indra and Varuṇa are most liberal givers of treasure to the men who toil to serve them, When they, as Friends inclined to friendship, honoured with dainty food, delight in flowing Soma.

translations.griffith: Indra and Varuṇa are most liberal givers of treasure to the men who toil to serve them, When they, as Friends inclined to friendship, honoured with dainty food, delight in flowing Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ यु॒वं व॑रुणा दि॒द्युम॑स्मि॒न्नोजि॑ष्ठमुग्रा॒ नि व॑धिष्टं॒ वज्र॑म् यो नो॑ दु॒रेवो॑ वृ॒कति॑र्द॒भीति॒स्तस्मि॑न्मिमाथाम॒भिभू॒त्योजः॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrā yuváṃ varuṇā didyúm asminn ójiṣṭham ugrā ní vadhiṣṭaṃ vájram yó no durévo vr̥kátir dabhī́tis tásmin mimāthām abhíbhūty ójaḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra and Varuṇa, ye hurl, O Mighty, on him your strongest flashing bolt of thunder Who treats us ill, the robber and oppressor: measure on him your overwhelming vigour.

translations.griffith: Indra and Varuṇa, ye hurl, O Mighty, on him your strongest flashing bolt of thunder Who treats us ill, the robber and oppressor: measure on him your overwhelming vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ यु॒वं व॑रुणा भू॒तम॒स्या धि॒यः प्रे॒तारा॑ वृष॒भेव॑ धे॒नोः सा नो॑ दुहीय॒द्यव॑सेव ग॒त्वी स॒हस्र॑धारा॒ पय॑सा म॒ही गौः
stanzas.transliteration: índrā yuváṃ varuṇā bhūtám asyā́ḥ- dhiyáḥ pretā́rā vr̥ṣabhéva dhenóḥ sā́ no duhīyad yávaseva gatvī́ sahásradhārā páyasā mahī́ gaúḥ
stanzas.translation: O Indra-Varuṇa, be ye the lovers of this my song, as steers who love the milch-Cow. Milk may it yield us as, gone forth to pasture, the great Cow pouring out her thousand rivers.

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, be ye the lovers of this my song, as steers who love the milch-Cow. Milk may it yield us as, gone forth to pasture, the great Cow pouring out her thousand rivers.

stanzas.sanskrit: तो॒के हि॒ते तन॑य उ॒र्वरा॑सु॒ सूरो॒ दृशी॑के॒ वृष॑णश्च॒ पौंस्ये॑ इन्द्रा॑ नो॒ अत्र॒ वरु॑णा स्याता॒मवो॑भिर्द॒स्मा परि॑तक्म्यायाम्
stanzas.transliteration: toké hité tánaya urvárāsu sū́ro dŕ̥śīke vŕ̥ṣaṇaś ca paúṃsye índrā no átra váruṇā syātām ávobhir dasmā́ páritakmyāyām
stanzas.translation: For fertile fields, for worthy sons and grandsons, for the Sun's beauty and for steer-like vigour, May Indra-Varuṇa with gracious favours work marvels for us in the stress of battle.

translations.griffith: For fertile fields, for worthy sons and grandsons, for the Sun's beauty and for steer-like vigour, May Indra-Varuṇa with gracious favours work marvels for us in the stress of battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वामिद्ध्यव॑से पू॒र्व्याय॒ परि॒ प्रभू॑ती ग॒विषः॑ स्वापी वृ॒णी॒महे॑ स॒ख्याय॑ प्रि॒याय॒ शूरा॒ मंहि॑ष्ठा पि॒तरे॑व श॒म्भू
stanzas.transliteration: yuvā́m íd dhy ávase pūrvyā́ya pári prábhūtī gavíṣaḥ svāpī vr̥ṇīmáhe sakhyā́ya priyā́ya śū́rā máṃhiṣṭhā pitáreva śambhū́
stanzas.translation: For you, as Princes, for your ancient kindness, good comrades of the man who seeks for booty, We choose to us for the dear bond of friendship, most liberal Heroes bringing bliss like parents.

translations.griffith: For you, as Princes, for your ancient kindness, good comrades of the man who seeks for booty, We choose to us for the dear bond of friendship, most liberal Heroes bringing bliss like parents.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता वां॒ धियोऽव॑से वाज॒यन्ती॑रा॒जिं न ज॑ग्मुर्युव॒यूः सु॑दानू श्रि॒ये न गाव॒ उप॒ सोम॑मस्थु॒रिन्द्रं॒ गिरो॒ वरु॑णं मे मनी॒षाः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ dhíyó 'vase vājayántīr ājíṃ ná jagmur yuvayū́ḥ sudānū śriyé ná gā́va úpa sómam asthur índraṃ gíro váruṇam me manīṣā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Showing their strength, these hymns for grace, Free-givers I have gone to you, devoted, as to battle. For glory have they gone, as milk to Soma, to Indra-Varuṇa my thoughts and praises.

translations.griffith: Showing their strength, these hymns for grace, Free-givers I have gone to you, devoted, as to battle. For glory have they gone, as milk to Soma, to Indra-Varuṇa my thoughts and praises.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा इन्द्रं॒ वरु॑णं मे मनी॒षा अग्म॒न्नुप॒ द्रवि॑णमि॒च्छमा॑नाः उपे॑मस्थुर्जो॒ष्टार॑ इव॒ वस्वो॑ र॒घ्वीरि॑व॒ श्रव॑सो॒ भिक्ष॑माणाः
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ índraṃ váruṇam me manīṣā́ḥ- ágmann úpa dráviṇam ichámānāḥ úpem asthur joṣṭā́ra iva vásvo raghvī́r iva śrávaso bhíkṣamāṇāḥ
stanzas.translation: To Indra and to Varuṇa, desirous of gaining wealth have these my thoughts proceeded. They have come nigh to you as treasurelovers, like mares, fleet-footed, eager for the glory.

translations.griffith: To Indra and to Varuṇa, desirous of gaining wealth have these my thoughts proceeded. They have come nigh to you as treasurelovers, like mares, fleet-footed, eager for the glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्व्य॑स्य॒ त्मना॒ रथ्य॑स्य पु॒ष्टेर्नित्य॑स्य रा॒यः पत॑यः स्याम ता च॑क्रा॒णा ऊ॒तिभि॒र्नव्य॑सीभिरस्म॒त्रा रायो॑ नि॒युतः॑ सचन्ताम्
stanzas.transliteration: áśvyasya tmánā ráthyasya puṣṭér nítyasya rāyáḥ pátayaḥ syāma tā́ cakrāṇā́ ūtíbhir návyasībhir asmatrā́ rā́yo niyútaḥ sacantām
stanzas.translation: May we ourselves be lords of during riches, of ample sustenance for car and hones. So may the Twain who work with newest succours bring yoked teams hitherward to us and riches.

translations.griffith: May we ourselves be lords of during riches, of ample sustenance for car and hones. So may the Twain who work with newest succours bring yoked teams hitherward to us and riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ बृहन्ता बृह॒तीभि॑रू॒ती इन्द्र॑ या॒तं व॑रुण॒ वाज॑सातौ यद्दि॒द्यवः॒ पृत॑नासु प्र॒क्रीळा॒न्तस्य॑ वां स्याम सनि॒तार॑ आ॒जेः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no br̥hantā br̥hatī́bhir ūtī́ índra yātáṃ varuṇa vā́jasātau yád didyávaḥ pŕ̥tanāsu prakrī́ḷān tásya vāṃ syāma sanitā́ra ājéḥ
stanzas.translation: Come with your mighty succours, O ye Mighty; come, Indra-Varuṇa, to us in battle. What time the flashing arrows play in combat, may we through you be winners in the contest.

translations.griffith: Come with your mighty succours, O ye Mighty; come, Indra-Varuṇa, to us in battle. What time the flashing arrows play in combat, may we through you be winners in the contest.

stanzas.sanskrit: मम॑ द्वि॒ता रा॒ष्ट्रं क्ष॒त्रिय॑स्य वि॒श्वायो॒र्विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॒ यथा॑ नः क्रतुं॑ सचन्ते॒ वरु॑णस्य दे॒वा राजा॑मि कृ॒ष्टेरु॑प॒मस्य॑ व॒व्रेः
stanzas.transliteration: máma dvitā́ rāṣṭráṃ kṣatríyasya viśvā́yor víśve amŕ̥tā yáthā naḥ krátuṃ sacante váruṇasya devā́ḥ- rā́jāmi kr̥ṣṭér upamásya vavréḥ
stanzas.translation: I AM the royal Ruler, mine is empire, as mine who sway all life are all Immortals. Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

translations.griffith: I AM the royal Ruler, mine is empire, as mine who sway all life are all Immortals. Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हं राजा॒ वरु॑णो॒ मह्यं॒ तान्य॑सु॒र्या॑णि प्रथ॒मा धा॑रयन्त क्रतुं॑ सचन्ते॒ वरु॑णस्य दे॒वा राजा॑मि कृ॒ष्टेरु॑प॒मस्य॑ व॒व्रेः
stanzas.transliteration: aháṃ rā́jā váruṇo máhyaṃ tā́ni- asuryā̀ṇi prathamā́ dhārayanta krátuṃ sacante váruṇasya devā́ḥ- rā́jāmi kr̥ṣṭér upamásya vavréḥ
stanzas.translation: I am King Varuṇa. To me were given these first existinghigh celestial powers. Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

translations.griffith: I am King Varuṇa. To me were given these first existinghigh celestial powers. Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हमिन्द्रो॒ वरु॑ण॒स्ते म॑हि॒त्वोर्वी ग॑भी॒रे रज॑सी सु॒मेके॑ त्वष्टे॑व॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि वि॒द्वान्त्समै॑रयं॒ रोद॑सी धा॒रयं॑ च
stanzas.transliteration: ahám índro váruṇas té mahitvā́- -urvī́ gabhīré rájasī suméke tváṣṭeva víśvā bhúvanāni vidvā́n sám airayaṃ ródasī dhāráyaṃ ca
stanzas.translation: I Varuṇa am Indra: in their greatness, these the two wide deep fairly-fashioned regions, These the two world-halves have I, even as Tvashṭar knowing all beings, joined and held together.

translations.griffith: I Varuṇa am Indra: in their greatness, these the two wide deep fairly-fashioned regions, These the two world-halves have I, even as Tvashṭar knowing all beings, joined and held together.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हम॒पो अ॑पिन्वमु॒क्षमा॑णा धा॒रयं॒ दिवं॒ सद॑न ऋ॒तस्य॑ ऋ॒तेन॑ पु॒त्रो अदि॑तेर्ऋ॒तावो॒त त्रि॒धातु॑ प्रथय॒द्वि भूम॑
stanzas.transliteration: ahám apó apinvam ukṣámāṇāḥ- dhāráyaṃ dívaṃ sádana r̥tásya r̥téna putró áditer r̥tā́vā- -utá tridhā́tu prathayad ví bhū́ma
stanzas.translation: I made to flow the moisture-shedding waters, and set the heaven firm in the scat of Order. By Law the Son of Aditi, Law Observer, hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.

translations.griffith: I made to flow the moisture-shedding waters, and set the heaven firm in the scat of Order. By Law the Son of Aditi, Law Observer, hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.

stanzas.sanskrit: मां नरः॒ स्वश्वा॑ वा॒जय॑न्तो॒ मां वृ॒ताः स॒मर॑णे हवन्ते कृ॒णोम्या॒जिं म॒घवा॒हमिन्द्र॒ इय॑र्मि रे॒णुम॒भिभू॑त्योजाः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ṃ náraḥ sváśvā vājáyanto mā́ṃ vr̥tā́ḥ samáraṇe havante kr̥ṇómy ājím maghávāhám índraḥ- íyarmi reṇúm abhíbhūtyojāḥ
stanzas.translation: Heroes with noble horses, fain for battle, selected warriors, call on me in combat. I Indra Maghavan, excite the conflict; I stir the dust, Lord of surpassing vigour.

translations.griffith: Heroes with noble horses, fain for battle, selected warriors, call on me in combat. I Indra Maghavan, excite the conflict; I stir the dust, Lord of surpassing vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हं ता विश्वा॑ चकरं॒ नकि॑र्मा॒ दैव्यं॒ सहो॑ वरते॒ अप्र॑तीतम् यन्मा॒ सोमा॑सो म॒मद॒न्यदु॒क्थोभे भ॑येते॒ रज॑सी अपा॒रे
stanzas.transliteration: aháṃ tā́ víśvā cakaraṃ nákir mā daívyaṃ sáho varate ápratītam yán mā sómāso mamádan yád ukthā́- -ubhé bhayete rájasī apāré
stanzas.translation: All this I did. The Gods' own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth. When lauds and Soma juice have made me joyful, both the unbounded regions are affrighted.

translations.griffith: All this I did. The Gods' own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth. When lauds and Soma juice have made me joyful, both the unbounded regions are affrighted.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒दुष्टे॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ तस्य॒ ता प्र ब्र॑वीषि॒ वरु॑णाय वेधः त्वं वृ॒त्राणि॑ शृण्विषे जघ॒न्वान्त्वं वृ॒ताँ अ॑रिणा इन्द्र॒ सिन्धू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: vidúṣ ṭe víśvā bhúvanāni tásya tā́ prá bravīṣi váruṇāya vedhaḥ tváṃ vr̥trā́ṇi śr̥ṇviṣe jaghanvā́n tváṃ vr̥tā́m̐ ariṇā indra síndhūn
stanzas.translation: All beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto Varuṇa, thou great Disposer! Thou art renowned as having slain the Vr̥itras. Thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.

translations.griffith: All beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto Varuṇa, thou great Disposer! Thou art renowned as having slain the Vr̥itras. Thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॒मत्र॑ पि॒तर॒स्त आ॑सन्त्स॒प्त ऋष॑यो दौर्ग॒हे ब॒ध्यमा॑ने त आय॑जन्त त्र॒सद॑स्युमस्या॒ इन्द्रं॒ न वृ॑त्र॒तुर॑मर्धदे॒वम्
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam átra pitáras tá āsan saptá ŕ̥ṣayo daurgahé badhyámāne tá ā́yajanta trasádasyum asyāḥ- índraṃ ná vr̥tratúram ardhadevám
stanzas.translation: Our fathers then were these, the Seven his, what time the son of Durgaha was captive. For her they gained by sacrifice Trasadasyu, a demi-god, like Indra, conquering foemen.

translations.griffith: Our fathers then were these, the Seven his, what time the son of Durgaha was captive. For her they gained by sacrifice Trasadasyu, a demi-god, like Indra, conquering foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रु॒कुत्सा॑नी॒ हि वा॒मदा॑शद्ध॒व्येभि॑रिन्द्रावरुणा॒ नमो॑भिः अथा॒ राजा॑नं त्र॒सद॑स्युमस्या वृत्र॒हणं॑ ददथुरर्धदे॒वम्
stanzas.transliteration: purukútsānī hí vām ádāśad -havyébhir indrāvaruṇā námobhiḥ áthā rā́jānaṃ trasádasyum asyāḥ- vr̥traháṇaṃ dadathur ardhadevám
stanzas.translation: The spouse of Purukutsa gave oblations to you, O Indra-Varuṇa, with homage. Then unto her ye gave King Trasadasyu, the demi-god, the slayer of the foeman.

translations.griffith: The spouse of Purukutsa gave oblations to you, O Indra-Varuṇa, with homage. Then unto her ye gave King Trasadasyu, the demi-god, the slayer of the foeman.

stanzas.sanskrit: रा॒या व॒यं स॑स॒वांसो॑ मदेम ह॒व्येन॑ दे॒वा यव॑सेन॒ गावः॑ तां धे॒नुमि॑न्द्रावरुणा यु॒वं नो॑ वि॒श्वाहा॑ धत्त॒मन॑पस्फुरन्तीम्
stanzas.transliteration: rāyā́ vayáṃ sasavā́ṃso madema havyéna devā́ yávasena gā́vaḥ tā́ṃ dhenúm indrāvaruṇā yuváṃ no viśvā́hā dhattam ánapasphurantīm
stanzas.translation: May we, possessing much, delight in riches, Gods in oblations and the kine in pasture; And that Milch-cow who ahrinks not from the milking, O Indra-Varuṇa, give to us daily.

translations.griffith: May we, possessing much, delight in riches, Gods in oblations and the kine in pasture; And that Milch-cow who ahrinks not from the milking, O Indra-Varuṇa, give to us daily.

stanzas.sanskrit: क उ॑ श्रवत्कत॒मो य॒ज्ञिया॑नां व॒न्दारु॑ दे॒वः क॑त॒मो जु॑षाते कस्ये॒मां दे॒वीम॒मृते॑षु॒ प्रेष्ठां॑ हृ॒दि श्रे॑षाम सुष्टु॒तिं सु॑ह॒व्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: ká u śravat katamó yajñíyānāṃ vandā́ru deváḥ katamó juṣāte kásyemā́ṃ devī́m amŕ̥teṣu préṣṭhāṃ hr̥dí śreṣāma suṣṭutíṃ suhavyā́m
stanzas.translation: WHO will hear, who of those who merit worship, which of all Gods take pleasure in our homage? On whose heart shall we lay this laud celestial, rich with fair offerings, dearest to Immortals?

translations.griffith: WHO will hear, who of those who merit worship, which of all Gods take pleasure in our homage? On whose heart shall we lay this laud celestial, rich with fair offerings, dearest to Immortals?

stanzas.sanskrit: को मृ॑ळाति कत॒म आग॑मिष्ठो दे॒वाना॑मु कत॒मः शम्भ॑विष्ठः रथं॒ कमा॑हुर्द्र॒वद॑श्वमा॒शुं यं सूर्य॑स्य दुहि॒तावृ॑णीत
stanzas.transliteration: kó mr̥ḷāti katamá ā́gamiṣṭho devā́nām u katamáḥ śámbhaviṣṭhaḥ ráthaṃ kám āhur dravádaśvam āśúṃ yáṃ sū́ryasya duhitā́vr̥ṇīta
stanzas.translation: Who will be gracious? Who will come most uickly of all the Gods? Who will bring liss most largely? What car do they call swift with rapid coursers? That which the Daughter of the Sun elected.

translations.griffith: Who will be gracious? Who will come most uickly of all the Gods? Who will bring liss most largely? What car do they call swift with rapid coursers? That which the Daughter of the Sun elected.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒क्षू हि ष्मा॒ गच्छ॑थ॒ ईव॑तो॒ द्यूनिन्द्रो॒ न श॒क्तिं परि॑तक्म्यायाम् दि॒व आजा॑ता दि॒व्या सु॑प॒र्णा कया॒ शची॑नां भवथः॒ शचि॑ष्ठा
stanzas.transliteration: makṣū́ hí ṣmā gáchatha ī́vato dyū́n índro ná śaktím páritakmyāyām divá ā́jātā divyā́ suparṇā́ káyā śácīnām bhavathaḥ śáciṣṭhā
stanzas.translation: So many days do ye come swiftly hither, as Indra to give help in stress of battle. Descended from the sky, divine, strong-pinioned, by which of all your powers are ye most mighty?

translations.griffith: So many days do ye come swiftly hither, as Indra to give help in stress of battle. Descended from the sky, divine, strong-pinioned, by which of all your powers are ye most mighty?

stanzas.sanskrit: का वां॑ भू॒दुप॑मातिः॒ कया॑ न॒ आश्वि॑ना गमथो हू॒यमा॑ना को वां॑ म॒हश्चि॒त्त्यज॑सो अ॒भीक॑ उरु॒ष्यतं॑ माध्वी दस्रा न ऊ॒ती
stanzas.transliteration: kā́ vām bhūd úpamātiḥ káyā naḥ- ā́śvinā gamatho hūyámānā kó vām maháś cit tyájaso abhī́ke- uruṣyátam mādhvī dasrā na ūtī́
stanzas.translation: What is the prayer that we should bring you, Aṣvins, whereby ye come to us when invocated? Whether of you confronts e'en great betrayal? Lovers of sweetness, Dasras, help and save us.

translations.griffith: What is the prayer that we should bring you, Aṣvins, whereby ye come to us when invocated? Whether of you confronts e'en great betrayal? Lovers of sweetness, Dasras, help and save us.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रु वां॒ रथः॒ परि॑ नक्षति॒ द्यामा यत्स॑मु॒द्राद॒भि वर्त॑ते वाम् मध्वा॑ माध्वी॒ मधु॑ वां प्रुषाय॒न्यत्सीं॑ वां॒ पृक्षो॑ भु॒रज॑न्त प॒क्वाः
stanzas.transliteration: urú vāṃ ráthaḥ pári nakṣati dyā́m ā́ yát samudrā́d abhí vártate vām mádhvā mādhvī mádhu vām pruṣāyan yát sīṃ vām pŕ̥kṣo bhurájanta pakvā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: In the wide space your chariot reacheth heaven, what time it turneth hither from the ocean. Sweets from your sweet shall drop, lovers of sweetness! These have they dressed for you as dainty viands.

translations.griffith: In the wide space your chariot reacheth heaven, what time it turneth hither from the ocean. Sweets from your sweet shall drop, lovers of sweetness! These have they dressed for you as dainty viands.

stanzas.sanskrit: सिन्धु॑र्ह वां र॒सया॑ सिञ्च॒दश्वा॑न्घृ॒णा वयो॑ऽरु॒षासः॒ परि॑ ग्मन् तदू॒ षु वा॑मजि॒रं चे॑ति॒ यानं॒ येन॒ पती॒ भव॑थः सू॒र्यायाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: síndhur ha vāṃ rasáyā siñcad áśvān ghr̥ṇā́ váyo 'ruṣā́saḥ pári gman tád ū ṣú vām ajiráṃ ceti yā́naṃ yéna pátī bhávathaḥ sūryā́yāḥ
stanzas.translation: Let Sindhu with his wave bedew your horses: in fiery glow have the red birds come hither. Observed of all was that your rapid going, whereby ye were the Lords of Siirya's Daughter.

translations.griffith: Let Sindhu with his wave bedew your horses: in fiery glow have the red birds come hither. Observed of all was that your rapid going, whereby ye were the Lords of Siirya's Daughter.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒हेह॒ यद्वां॑ सम॒ना प॑पृ॒क्षे सेयम॒स्मे सु॑म॒तिर्वा॑जरत्ना उ॒रु॒ष्यतं॑ जरि॒तारं॑ यु॒वं ह॑ श्रि॒तः कामो॑ नासत्या युव॒द्रिक्
stanzas.transliteration: ihéha yád vāṃ samanā́ papr̥kṣé séyám asmé sumatír vājaratnā uruṣyátaṃ jaritā́raṃ yuváṃ ha śritáḥ kā́mo nāsatyā yuvadrík
stanzas.translation: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nâsatyas, is my wish directed.

translations.griffith: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nâsatyas, is my wish directed.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वां॒ रथं॑ व॒यम॒द्या हु॑वेम पृथु॒ज्रय॑मश्विना॒ संग॑तिं॒ गोः यः सू॒र्यां वह॑ति वन्धुरा॒युर्गिर्वा॑हसं पुरु॒तमं॑ वसू॒युम्
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vāṃ ráthaṃ vayám adyā́ huvema pr̥thujráyam aśvinā sáṃgatiṃ góḥ yáḥ sūryā́ṃ váhati vandhurāyúr gírvāhasam purutámaṃ vasūyúm
stanzas.translation: WE will invoke this day your car, farspreading, O Aṣvins, even the gathering, of the sunlight,– Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Sûrya.

translations.griffith: WE will invoke this day your car, farspreading, O Aṣvins, even the gathering, of the sunlight,– Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Sûrya.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वं श्रिय॑मश्विना दे॒वता॒ तां दिवो॑ नपाता वनथः॒ शची॑भिः यु॒वोर्वपु॑र॒भि पृक्षः॑ सचन्ते॒ वह॑न्ति॒ यत्क॑कु॒हासो॒ रथे॑ वाम्
stanzas.transliteration: yuváṃ śríyam aśvinā devátā tā́ṃ dívo napātā vanathaḥ śácībhiḥ yuvór vápur abhí pŕ̥kṣaḥ sacante váhanti yát kakuhā́so ráthe vām
stanzas.translation: Aṣvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power. Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.

translations.griffith: Aṣvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power. Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.

stanzas.sanskrit: को वा॑म॒द्या क॑रते रा॒तह॑व्य ऊ॒तये॑ वा सुत॒पेया॑य वा॒र्कैः ऋ॒तस्य॑ वा व॒नुषे॑ पू॒र्व्याय॒ नमो॑ येमा॒नो अ॑श्वि॒ना व॑वर्तत्
stanzas.transliteration: kó vām adyā́ karate rātáhavyaḥ- ūtáye vā sutapéyāya vārkaíḥ r̥tásya vā vanúṣe pūrvyā́ya námo yemānó aśvinā́ vavartat
stanzas.translation: Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblation, or with hymns to drink the juices? Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Aṣvins, offering homage?

translations.griffith: Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblation, or with hymns to drink the juices? Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Aṣvins, offering homage?

stanzas.sanskrit: हि॒र॒ण्यये॑न पुरुभू॒ रथे॑ने॒मं य॒ज्ञं ना॑स॒त्योप॑ यातम् पिबा॑थ॒ इन्मधु॑नः सो॒म्यस्य॒ दध॑थो॒ रत्नं॑ विध॒ते जना॑य
stanzas.transliteration: hiraṇyáyena purubhū ráthena- -imáṃ yajñáṃ nāsatyópa yātam píbātha ín mádhunaḥ somyásya dádhatho rátnaṃ vidhaté jánāya
stanzas.translation: Borne on your golden car, ye omnipresent! come to this sacrifice of ours, Nâsatyas. Drink of the pleasant liquor of the Soma give riches to the people who adore you.

translations.griffith: Borne on your golden car, ye omnipresent! come to this sacrifice of ours, Nâsatyas. Drink of the pleasant liquor of the Soma give riches to the people who adore you.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ यातं दि॒वो अच्छा॑ पृथि॒व्या हि॑र॒ण्यये॑न सु॒वृता॒ रथे॑न मा वा॑म॒न्ये नि य॑मन्देव॒यन्तः॒ सं यद्द॒दे नाभिः॑ पू॒र्व्या वा॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no yātaṃ divó áchā pr̥thivyā́ḥ- hiraṇyáyena suvŕ̥tā ráthena mā́ vām anyé ní yaman devayántaḥ sáṃ yád dadé nā́bhiḥ pūrvyā́ vām
stanzas.translation: Come hitherward to us from earth, from heaven, borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly. Suffer not other worshippers to stay you here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.

translations.griffith: Come hitherward to us from earth, from heaven, borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly. Suffer not other worshippers to stay you here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू नो॑ र॒यिं पु॑रु॒वीरं॑ बृ॒हन्तं॒ दस्रा॒ मिमा॑थामु॒भये॑ष्व॒स्मे नरो॒ यद्वा॑मश्विना॒ स्तोम॒माव॑न्त्स॒धस्तु॑तिमाजमी॒ळ्हासो॑ अग्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ no rayím puruvī́ram br̥hántaṃ dásrā mímāthām ubháyeṣv asmé náro yád vām aśvinā stómam ā́van sadhástutim ājamīḷhā́so agman
stanzas.translation: Now for us both, mete out, O WonderWorkers, riches exceeding great with store of heroes, Because the men have sent you praise, O Aṣvins, and Ajamîḷhas come to the laudation.

translations.griffith: Now for us both, mete out, O WonderWorkers, riches exceeding great with store of heroes, Because the men have sent you praise, O Aṣvins, and Ajamîḷhas come to the laudation.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒हेह॒ यद्वां॑ सम॒ना प॑पृ॒क्षे सेयम॒स्मे सु॑म॒तिर्वा॑जरत्ना उ॒रु॒ष्यतं॑ जरि॒तारं॑ यु॒वं ह॑ श्रि॒तः कामो॑ नासत्या युव॒द्रिक्
stanzas.transliteration: ihéha yád vāṃ samanā́ papr̥kṣé séyám asmé sumatír vājaratnā uruṣyátaṃ jaritā́raṃ yuváṃ ha śritáḥ kā́mo nāsatyā yuvadrík
stanzas.translation: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nâsatyas, is my wish directed.

translations.griffith: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nâsatyas, is my wish directed.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष स्य भा॒नुरुदि॑यर्ति यु॒ज्यते॒ रथः॒ परि॑ज्मा दि॒वो अ॒स्य सान॑वि पृ॒क्षासो॑ अस्मिन्मिथु॒ना अधि॒ त्रयो॒ दृति॑स्तु॒रीयो॒ मधु॑नो॒ वि र॑प्शते
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá syá bhānúr úd iyarti yujyáte ráthaḥ párijmā divó asyá sā́navi pr̥kṣā́so asmin mithunā́ ádhi tráyo dŕ̥tis turī́yo mádhuno ví rapśate
stanzas.translation: YONDER goes up that light: your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven. Within this car are stored three kindred shares of food, and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.

translations.griffith: YONDER goes up that light: your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven. Within this car are stored three kindred shares of food, and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद्वां॑ पृ॒क्षासो॒ मधु॑मन्त ईरते॒ रथा॒ अश्वा॑स उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु अ॒पो॒र्णु॒वन्त॒स्तम॒ आ परी॑वृतं॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॒क्रं त॒न्वन्त॒ आ रजः॑
stanzas.transliteration: úd vām pr̥kṣā́so mádhumanta īrate ráthā áśvāsa uṣáso vyùṣṭiṣu aporṇuvántas táma ā́ párīvr̥taṃ svàr ṇá śukráṃ tanvánta ā́ rájaḥ
stanzas.translation: Forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath, and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn, Stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom, and spreading through mid-air bright radiance like the Sun.

translations.griffith: Forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath, and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn, Stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom, and spreading through mid-air bright radiance like the Sun.

stanzas.sanskrit: मध्वः॑ पिबतं मधु॒पेभि॑रा॒सभि॑रु॒त प्रि॒यं मधु॑ने युञ्जाथां॒ रथ॑म् आ व॑र्त॒निं मधु॑ना जिन्वथस्प॒थो दृतिं॑ वहेथे॒ मधु॑मन्तमश्विना
stanzas.transliteration: mádhvaḥ pibatam madhupébhir āsábhiḥ utá priyám mádhune yuñjāthāṃ rátham ā́ vartaním mádhunā jinvathas pathó dŕ̥tiṃ vahethe mádhumantam aśvinā
stanzas.translation: Drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught; harness for the meath's sake the chariot that ye love. Refresh the way ye go, refresh the paths with meath: hither, O Aṣvins, bring the skin that holds the meath.

translations.griffith: Drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught; harness for the meath's sake the chariot that ye love. Refresh the way ye go, refresh the paths with meath: hither, O Aṣvins, bring the skin that holds the meath.

stanzas.sanskrit: हं॒सासो॒ ये वां॒ मधु॑मन्तो अ॒स्रिधो॒ हिर॑ण्यपर्णा उ॒हुव॑ उष॒र्बुधः॑ उ॒द॒प्रुतो॑ म॒न्दिनो॑ मन्दिनि॒स्पृशो॒ मध्वो॒ न मक्षः॒ सव॑नानि गच्छथः
stanzas.transliteration: haṃsā́so yé vām mádhumanto asrídho híraṇyaparṇā uhúva uṣarbúdhaḥ udaprúto mandíno mandinispŕ̥śo mádhvo ná mákṣaḥ sávanāni gachathaḥ
stanzas.translation: The swans ye have are friendly, rich in store of mcath, gold-pinioned, strong to draw, awake at early morn, Swimming the flood, exultant, fain for draughts that cheer: ye come like flies to our libations of-the meath.

translations.griffith: The swans ye have are friendly, rich in store of mcath, gold-pinioned, strong to draw, awake at early morn, Swimming the flood, exultant, fain for draughts that cheer: ye come like flies to our libations of-the meath.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒ध्व॒रासो॒ मधु॑मन्तो अ॒ग्नय॑ उ॒स्रा ज॑रन्ते॒ प्रति॒ वस्तो॑र॒श्विना॑ यन्नि॒क्तह॑स्तस्त॒रणि॑र्विचक्ष॒णः सोमं॑ सु॒षाव॒ मधु॑मन्त॒मद्रि॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: svadhvarā́so mádhumanto agnáyaḥ- usrā́ jarante práti vástor aśvínā yán niktáhastas taráṇir vicakṣaṇáḥ sómaṃ suṣā́va mádhumantam ádribhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath, the fires sing to the morning Aṣvins at the break of day, When with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the Soma rich in meath.

translations.griffith: Well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath, the fires sing to the morning Aṣvins at the break of day, When with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the Soma rich in meath.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒के॒नि॒पासो॒ अह॑भि॒र्दवि॑ध्वतः॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॒क्रं त॒न्वन्त॒ आ रजः॑ सूर॑श्चि॒दश्वा॑न्युयुजा॒न ई॑यते॒ विश्वाँ॒ अनु॑ स्व॒धया॑ चेतथस्प॒थः
stanzas.transliteration: ākenipā́so áhabhir dávidhvataḥ svàr ṇá śukráṃ tanvánta ā́ rájaḥ sū́raś cid áśvān yuyujāná īyate víśvām̐ ánu svadháyā cetathas patháḥ
stanzas.translation: The rays advancing nigh, chasing with day the gloom, spread through the firmament bright radiance like the Sun; And the Sun harnessing his horses goeth forth: ye through your Godlike nature let his paths be known.

translations.griffith: The rays advancing nigh, chasing with day the gloom, spread through the firmament bright radiance like the Sun; And the Sun harnessing his horses goeth forth: ye through your Godlike nature let his paths be known.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वा॑मवोचमश्विना धियं॒धा रथः॒ स्वश्वो॑ अ॒जरो॒ यो अस्ति॑ येन॑ स॒द्यः परि॒ रजां॑सि या॒थो ह॒विष्म॑न्तं त॒रणिं॑ भो॒जमच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá vām avocam aśvinā dhiyaṃdhā́ḥ- ráthaḥ sváśvo ajáro yó ásti yéna sadyáḥ pári rájāṃsi yāthó havíṣmantaṃ taráṇim bhojám ácha
stanzas.translation: Devout in thought I have declared, O Aṣvins, your chariot with good steeds, which lasts for ever, Wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.

translations.griffith: Devout in thought I have declared, O Aṣvins, your chariot with good steeds, which lasts for ever, Wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्रं॑ पिबा॒ मधू॑नां सु॒तं वा॑यो॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु त्वं हि पू॑र्व॒पा असि॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágram pibā mádhūnāṃ sutáṃ vāyo díviṣṭiṣu tváṃ hí pūrvapā́ ási
stanzas.translation: DRINK the best draught of Soma-juice, O Vâyu, at our holy rites: For thou art he who drinketh first.

translations.griffith: DRINK the best draught of Soma-juice, O Vâyu, at our holy rites: For thou art he who drinketh first.

stanzas.sanskrit: श॒तेना॑ नो अ॒भिष्टि॑भिर्नि॒युत्वाँ॒ इन्द्र॑सारथिः वायो॑ सु॒तस्य॑ तृम्पतम्
stanzas.transliteration: śaténā no abhíṣṭibhir niyútvām̐ índrasārathiḥ vā́yo sutásya tr̥mpatam
stanzas.translation: Come, team-drawn, with thy hundred helps, with Indra, seated in the car, Vaya, and drink your fill of juice.

translations.griffith: Come, team-drawn, with thy hundred helps, with Indra, seated in the car, Vaya, and drink your fill of juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वां॑ स॒हस्रं॒ हर॑य॒ इन्द्र॑वायू अ॒भि प्रयः॑ वह॑न्तु॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ sahásraṃ hárayaḥ- índravāyū abhí práyaḥ váhantu sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: May steeds a thousand bring you both, Indra. and Vâyu, hitherward To drink the Soma, to the feagt.

translations.griffith: May steeds a thousand bring you both, Indra. and Vâyu, hitherward To drink the Soma, to the feagt.

stanzas.sanskrit: रथं॒ हिर॑ण्यवन्धुर॒मिन्द्र॑वायू स्वध्व॒रम् आ हि स्थाथो॑ दिवि॒स्पृश॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ráthaṃ híraṇyavandhuram índravāyū svadhvarám ā́ hí sthā́tho divispŕ̥śam
stanzas.translation: For ye, O Indra-Vâyu, mount the goldenseated car that aids The sacrifice, that reaches heaven.

translations.griffith: For ye, O Indra-Vâyu, mount the goldenseated car that aids The sacrifice, that reaches heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: रथे॑न पृथु॒पाज॑सा दा॒श्वांस॒मुप॑ गच्छतम् इन्द्र॑वायू इ॒हा ग॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: ráthena pr̥thupā́jasā dāśvā́ṃsam úpa gachatam índravāyū ihā́ gatam
stanzas.translation: On far-refulgent chariot come unto the man who offers gifts: Come, Indra-Vâyu, hitherward.

translations.griffith: On far-refulgent chariot come unto the man who offers gifts: Come, Indra-Vâyu, hitherward.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑वायू अ॒यं सु॒तस्तं दे॒वेभिः॑ स॒जोष॑सा पिब॑तं दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे
stanzas.transliteration: índravāyū ayáṃ sutás táṃ devébhiḥ sajóṣasā píbataṃ dāśúṣo gr̥hé
stanzas.translation: Here, Indra-Vâyu, is the juice: drink it, accordant with the Gods, Within the giver's dwelling-place.

translations.griffith: Here, Indra-Vâyu, is the juice: drink it, accordant with the Gods, Within the giver's dwelling-place.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ह प्र॒याण॑मस्तु वा॒मिन्द्र॑वायू वि॒मोच॑नम् इ॒ह वां॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: ihá prayā́ṇam astu vām índravāyū vimócanam ihá vāṃ sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: Hither, O Indra-Vâyu, be your journey here unyoke your steeds, Here for your draught of Soma juice.

translations.griffith: Hither, O Indra-Vâyu, be your journey here unyoke your steeds, Here for your draught of Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: वायो॑ शु॒क्रो अ॑यामि ते॒ मध्वो॒ अग्रं॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु आ या॑हि॒ सोम॑पीतये स्पा॒र्हो दे॑व नि॒युत्व॑ता
stanzas.transliteration: vā́yo śukró ayāmi te mádhvo ágraṃ díviṣṭiṣu ā́ yāhi sómapītaye spārhó deva niyútvatā
stanzas.translation: Vâyu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites. Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God, longed-for, on thy team-drawn car.

translations.griffith: Vâyu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites. Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God, longed-for, on thy team-drawn car.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑श्च वायवेषां॒ सोमा॑नां पी॒तिम॑र्हथः यु॒वां हि यन्तीन्द॑वो नि॒म्नमापो॒ न स॒ध्र्य॑क्
stanzas.transliteration: índraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ sómānām pītím arhathaḥ yuvā́ṃ hí yántī́ndavo nimnám ā́po ná sadhryàk
stanzas.translation: O Vâyu, thou and Indra are meet drinkers of these Soma-draughts, For unto you the drops proceed as waters gather to the vale.

translations.griffith: O Vâyu, thou and Indra are meet drinkers of these Soma-draughts, For unto you the drops proceed as waters gather to the vale.

stanzas.sanskrit: वाय॒विन्द्र॑श्च शु॒ष्मिणा॑ स॒रथं॑ शवसस्पती नि॒युत्व॑न्ता न ऊ॒तय॒ आ या॑तं॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: vā́yav índraś ca śuṣmíṇā saráthaṃ śavasas patī niyútvantā na ūtáye- ā́ yātaṃ sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: O Indra-Vâyu, mighty Twain, speeding together, Lords of Strength, Come to our succour with your team, that ye may drink the Soma juice.

translations.griffith: O Indra-Vâyu, mighty Twain, speeding together, Lords of Strength, Come to our succour with your team, that ye may drink the Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: या वां॒ सन्ति॑ पुरु॒स्पृहो॑ नि॒युतो॑ दा॒शुषे॑ नरा अ॒स्मे ता य॑ज्ञवाह॒सेन्द्र॑वायू॒ नि य॑च्छतम्
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ vāṃ sánti puruspŕ̥ho niyúto dāśúṣe narā asmé tā́ yajñavāhasā- -índravāyū ní yachatam
stanzas.translation: The longed-for teams which ye possess, O Heroes, for the worshipper, Turn to us, Indra-Vâyu, ye to whom the sacrifice is paid.

translations.griffith: The longed-for teams which ye possess, O Heroes, for the worshipper, Turn to us, Indra-Vâyu, ye to whom the sacrifice is paid.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒हि होत्रा॒ अवी॑ता॒ विपो॒ न रायो॑ अ॒र्यः वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: vihí hótrā ávītāḥ- vípo ná rā́yo aryáḥ vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena yāhí sutásya pītáye
stanzas.translation: TASTE offerings never tasted yet, as bards enjoy the foeman's wealth. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

translations.griffith: TASTE offerings never tasted yet, as bards enjoy the foeman's wealth. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि॒र्यु॒वा॒णो अश॑स्तीर्नि॒युत्वाँ॒ इन्द्र॑सारथिः वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: niryuvāṇó áśastīr niyútvām̐ índrasārathiḥ vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena yāhí sutásya pītáye
stanzas.translation: Removing curses, drawn by teams, with Indra, seated by thy side, O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

translations.griffith: Removing curses, drawn by teams, with Indra, seated by thy side, O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॑ कृ॒ष्णे वसु॑धिती ये॒माते॑ वि॒श्वपे॑शसा वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: ánu kr̥ṣṇé vásudhitī yemā́te viśvápeśasā vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena yāhí sutásya pītáye
stanzas.translation: The two dark treasuries of wealth that wear all beauties wait on thee. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

translations.griffith: The two dark treasuries of wealth that wear all beauties wait on thee. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: वह॑न्तु त्वा मनो॒युजो॑ यु॒क्तासो॑ नव॒तिर्नव॑ वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: váhantu tvā manoyújo yuktā́so navatír náva vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena yāhí sutásya pītáye
stanzas.translation: May nine-and-ninety harnessed steeds who yoke them at thy will bring thee. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

translations.griffith: May nine-and-ninety harnessed steeds who yoke them at thy will bring thee. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: वायो॑ श॒तं हरी॑णां यु॒वस्व॒ पोष्या॑णाम् उ॒त वा॑ ते सह॒स्रिणो॒ रथ॒ आ या॑तु॒ पाज॑सा
stanzas.transliteration: vā́yo śatáṃ hárīṇāṃ yuvásva póṣyāṇām utá vā te sahasríṇo rátha ā́ yātu pā́jasā
stanzas.translation: Harness, O Vâyu, to thy car a hundred well-fed tawny steeds, Yea, or a thousand steeds, and let thy chariot come to us with might.

translations.griffith: Harness, O Vâyu, to thy car a hundred well-fed tawny steeds, Yea, or a thousand steeds, and let thy chariot come to us with might.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दं वा॑मा॒स्ये॑ ह॒विः प्रि॒यमि॑न्द्राबृहस्पती उ॒क्थं मद॑श्च शस्यते
stanzas.transliteration: idáṃ vām āsyè havíḥ priyám indrābr̥haspatī ukthám mádaś ca śasyate
stanzas.translation: DEAR is this offering in your mouth, O Indra and Br̥ihaspati: Famed is the laud, the gladdening draught.

translations.griffith: DEAR is this offering in your mouth, O Indra and Br̥ihaspati: Famed is the laud, the gladdening draught.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं वां॒ परि॑ षिच्यते॒ सोम॑ इन्द्राबृहस्पती चारु॒र्मदा॑य पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ vām pári ṣicyate sóma indrābr̥haspatī cā́rur mádāya pītáye
stanzas.translation: This lovely Soma is effused, O Indra and Br̥ihaspati, For you, to drink it and rejoice.

translations.griffith: This lovely Soma is effused, O Indra and Br̥ihaspati, For you, to drink it and rejoice.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ न॑ इन्द्राबृहस्पती गृ॒हमिन्द्र॑श्च गच्छतम् सो॒म॒पा सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ na indrābr̥haspatī gr̥hám índraś ca gachatam somapā́ sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: As Soma-drinkers to our house come, Indra and Br̥ihaspati-and Indra-to drink Soma juice.

translations.griffith: As Soma-drinkers to our house come, Indra and Br̥ihaspati-and Indra-to drink Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मे इ॑न्द्राबृहस्पती र॒यिं ध॑त्तं शत॒ग्विन॑म् अश्वा॑वन्तं सह॒स्रिण॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: asmé indrābr̥haspatī rayíṃ dhattaṃ śatagvínam áśvāvantaṃ sahasríṇam
stanzas.translation: Vouchsafe us riches hundredfold, O Indra, and Br̥ihaspati, With store of horses, thousandfold.

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us riches hundredfold, O Indra, and Br̥ihaspati, With store of horses, thousandfold.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॒बृह॒स्पती॑ व॒यं सु॒ते गी॒र्भिर्ह॑वामहे अ॒स्य सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrābŕ̥haspátī vayáṃ suté gīrbhír havāmahe asyá sómasya pītáye
stanzas.translation: O Indra. and Br̥ihaspati, we call you when the meath is shed, With songs, to drink the Soma juice.

translations.griffith: O Indra. and Br̥ihaspati, we call you when the meath is shed, With songs, to drink the Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: सोम॑मिन्द्राबृहस्पती॒ पिब॑तं दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे मा॒दये॑थां॒ तदो॑कसा
stanzas.transliteration: sómam indrābr̥haspatī píbataṃ dāśúṣo gr̥hé mādáyethāṃ tádokasā
stanzas.translation: Drink, Indra and Br̥ihaspati, the Soma in the giver's house: Delight yourselves abiding there.

translations.griffith: Drink, Indra and Br̥ihaspati, the Soma in the giver's house: Delight yourselves abiding there.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त॒स्तम्भ॒ सह॑सा॒ वि ज्मो अन्ता॒न्बृह॒स्पति॑स्त्रिषध॒स्थो रवे॑ण तं प्र॒त्नास॒ ऋष॑यो॒ दीध्या॑नाः पु॒रो विप्रा॑ दधिरे म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: yás tastámbha sáhasā ví jmó ántān bŕ̥haspátis triṣadhasthó ráveṇa tám pratnā́sa ŕ̥ṣayo dī́dhyānāḥ puró víprā dadhire mandrájihvam
stanzas.translation: Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Br̥ihaspati, with thunder, Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep-thinking, holy singers, set before them.

translations.griffith: Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Br̥ihaspati, with thunder, Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep-thinking, holy singers, set before them.
translations.macdonell: Bṛhaspati, in his three seats with thunder Who mightily has propped apart earth's limits. Him of the charming tongue, the ancient sages, Inspired and deeply thinking, placed before them.

stanzas.sanskrit: धु॒नेत॑यः सुप्रके॒तं मद॑न्तो॒ बृह॑स्पते अ॒भि ये न॑स्तत॒स्रे पृष॑न्तं सृ॒प्रमद॑ब्धमू॒र्वं बृह॑स्पते॒ रक्ष॑तादस्य॒ योनि॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: dhunétayaḥ supraketám mádanto bŕ̥haspate abhí yé nas tatasré pŕ̥ṣantaṃ sr̥prám ádabdham ūrvám bŕ̥haspate rákṣatād asya yónim
stanzas.translation: Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they, Br̥ihaspati, who pressed around us. Preserve Br̥ihaspati, the stall uninjured, this company's raining, ever-moving birthplace.

translations.griffith: Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they, Br̥ihaspati, who pressed around us. Preserve Br̥ihaspati, the stall uninjured, this company's raining, ever-moving birthplace.
translations.macdonell: Bṛhaspati, come from the farthest distance They, cherishing the rite, for thee are seated. For thee streams, pressed with stones, and flowing channels, Distil on all sides mead in great abundance.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृह॑स्पते॒ या प॑र॒मा प॑रा॒वदत॒ आ त॑ ऋत॒स्पृशो॒ नि षे॑दुः तुभ्यं॑ खा॒ता अ॑व॒ता अद्रि॑दुग्धा॒ मध्वः॑ श्चोतन्त्य॒भितो॑ विर॒प्शम्
stanzas.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate yā́ paramā́ parāvád áta ā́ ta r̥taspŕ̥śo ní ṣeduḥ túbhyaṃ khātā́ avatā́ ádridugdhāḥ- mádhva ścotanty abhíto virapśám
stanzas.translation: Br̥ihaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal. For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.

translations.griffith: Br̥ihaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal. For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृह॒स्पतिः॑ प्रथ॒मं जाय॑मानो म॒हो ज्योति॑षः पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् स॒प्तास्य॑स्तुविजा॒तो रवे॑ण॒ वि स॒प्तर॑श्मिरधम॒त्तमां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátiḥ prathamáṃ jā́yamāno mahó jyótiṣaḥ paramé vyòman saptā́syas tuvijātó ráveṇa ví saptáraśmir adhamat támāṃsi
stanzas.translation: Br̥ihaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven, Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays, blew and dispersed the darkness.

translations.griffith: Br̥ihaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven, Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays, blew and dispersed the darkness.
translations.macdonell: Bṛhaspati when first he was engendered From mighty lustre in the highest heaven, Seven-mouthed and high-born, with his voice of thunder And seven rays asunder blew the darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: स सु॒ष्टुभा॒ स ऋक्व॑ता ग॒णेन॑ व॒लं रु॑रोज फलि॒गं रवे॑ण बृह॒स्पति॑रु॒स्रिया॑ हव्य॒सूदः॒ कनि॑क्रद॒द्वाव॑शती॒रुदा॑जत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá suṣṭúbhā sá ŕ̥kvatā gaṇéna valáṃ ruroja phaligáṃ ráveṇa bŕ̥haspátir usríyā havyasū́daḥ kánikradad vā́vaśatīr úd ājat
stanzas.translation: With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed obstructive Vala. Br̥ihaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.

translations.griffith: With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed obstructive Vala. Br̥ihaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.
translations.macdonell: He with his loudly praising throng of singers Burst open the enclosing cave with thunder. Bṛhaspati then drove out, loudly roaring, The ruddy kine that sweeten the oblation.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा पि॒त्रे वि॒श्वदे॑वाय॒ वृष्णे॑ य॒ज्ञैर्वि॑धेम॒ नम॑सा ह॒विर्भिः॑ बृह॑स्पते सुप्र॒जा वी॒रव॑न्तो व॒यं स्या॑म॒ पत॑यो रयी॒णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ pitré viśvádevāya vŕ̥ṣṇe yajñaír vidhema námasā havírbhiḥ bŕ̥haspate suprajā́ vīrávanto vayáṃ syāma pátayo rayīṇā́m
stanzas.translation: Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father. Br̥ihaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and store of heroes.

translations.griffith: Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father. Br̥ihaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and store of heroes.
translations.macdonell: Him, mighty friend of all the gods, the father, Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, obeisance. With goodly offspring and a throng of heroes Bṛhaspati, we would be lords of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इद्राजा॒ प्रति॑जन्यानि॒ विश्वा॒ शुष्मे॑ण तस्थाव॒भि वी॒र्ये॑ण बृह॒स्पतिं॒ यः सुभृ॑तं बि॒भर्ति॑ वल्गू॒यति॒ वन्द॑ते पूर्व॒भाज॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá íd rā́jā prátijanyāni víśvā śúṣmeṇa tasthāv abhí vīryèṇa bŕ̥haspátiṃ yáḥ súbhr̥tam bibhárti valgūyáti vándate pūrvabhā́jam
stanzas.translation: Surely that King by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes' posses-ions, Who cherishes Br̥ihaspati well-tended, adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.

translations.griffith: Surely that King by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes' posses-ions, Who cherishes Br̥ihaspati well-tended, adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.
translations.macdonell: That king indeed by his heroic prowess And energy defeats all hostile forces, Who keeps Bṛhaspati well nourished, Honours and lauds him as the first partaker.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इत्क्षे॑ति॒ सुधि॑त॒ ओक॑सि॒ स्वे तस्मा॒ इळा॑ पिन्वते विश्व॒दानी॑म् तस्मै॒ विशः॑ स्व॒यमे॒वा न॑मन्ते॒ यस्मि॑न्ब्र॒ह्मा राज॑नि॒ पूर्व॒ एति॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá ít kṣeti súdhita ókasi své tásmā íḷā pinvate viśvadā́nīm tásmai víśaḥ svayám evā́ namante yásmin brahmā́ rā́jani pū́rva éti
stanzas.translation: In his own house he dwells in peace and comfort: to him for ever holy food flows richly. To him the people with free will pay homage-the King with whom the Brahman hath precedence.

translations.griffith: In his own house he dwells in peace and comfort: to him for ever holy food flows richly. To him the people with free will pay homage-the King with whom the Brahman hath precedence.
translations.macdonell: He truly in his house dwells well-established, To him the sacred food affords abundance, To him his subjects with free will pay homage, If from this king the priest receives precedence.

stanzas.sanskrit: अप्र॑तीतो जयति॒ सं धना॑नि॒ प्रति॑जन्यान्यु॒त या सज॑न्या अ॒व॒स्यवे॒ यो वरि॑वः कृ॒णोति॑ ब्र॒ह्मणे॒ राजा॒ तम॑वन्ति दे॒वाः
stanzas.transliteration: ápratīto jayati sáṃ dhánāni prátijanyāny utá yā́ sájanyā avasyáve yó várivaḥ kr̥ṇóti brahmáṇe rā́jā tám avanti devā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: He, unopposed, is master of the riches.of his own subjects and of hostile people. The Gods uphold that King with their protection who helps the Brahman when he seeks his favour.

translations.griffith: He, unopposed, is master of the riches.of his own subjects and of hostile people. The Gods uphold that King with their protection who helps the Brahman when he seeks his favour.
translations.macdonell: He unresisted ever wins the riches Of his own people and surrounding foemen. The king who to the priest desiring favour Gives liberty, receives the gods' protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑श्च॒ सोमं॑ पिबतं बृहस्पते॒ऽस्मिन्य॒ज्ञे म॑न्दसा॒ना वृ॑षण्वसू आ वां॑ विश॒न्त्विन्द॑वः स्वा॒भुवो॒ऽस्मे र॒यिं सर्व॑वीरं॒ नि य॑च्छतम्
stanzas.transliteration: índraś ca sómam pibatam br̥haspate -asmín yajñé mandasānā́ vr̥ṣaṇvasū ā́ vāṃ viśantv índavaḥ svābhúvo -asmé rayíṃ sárvavīraṃ ní yachatam
stanzas.translation: Indra, Br̥ihaspati, rainers of treasure, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the Soma. Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.

translations.griffith: Indra, Br̥ihaspati, rainers of treasure, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the Soma. Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.
translations.macdonell: Bṛhaspati and Indra, ye of mighty wealth, Drink Soma here, rejoicing at this sacrifice. May these invigorating drops now enter you: Bestow on us great wealth and sons exclusively.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृह॑स्पत इन्द्र॒ वर्ध॑तं नः॒ सचा॒ सा वां॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे अ॒वि॒ष्टं धियो॑ जिगृ॒तं पुरं॑धीर्जज॒स्तम॒र्यो व॒नुषा॒मरा॑तीः
stanzas.transliteration: bŕ̥haspata indra várdhataṃ naḥ sácā sā́ vāṃ sumatír bhūtv asmé aviṣṭáṃ dhíyo jigr̥tám púraṃdhīr jajastám aryó vanúṣām árātīḥ
stanzas.translation: Br̥ihaspati and Indra, make us prosper may this be your benevolence to usward. Assist our holy thoughts, wake up our spirit: weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.

translations.griffith: Br̥ihaspati and Indra, make us prosper may this be your benevolence to usward. Assist our holy thoughts, wake up our spirit: weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.
translations.macdonell: Bṛhaspati and Indra, make us prosper, Let that benevolence of yours be with us, Arouse rewards and give our prayers fulfilment, The enmities of foes and rivals weaken.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दमु॒ त्यत्पु॑रु॒तमं॑ पु॒रस्ता॒ज्ज्योति॒स्तम॑सो व॒युना॑वदस्थात् नू॒नं दि॒वो दु॑हि॒तरो॑ विभा॒तीर्गा॒तुं कृ॑णवन्नु॒षसो॒ जना॑य
stanzas.transliteration: idám u tyát purutámam purástāj jyótis támaso vayúnāvad asthāt nūnáṃ divó duhitáro vibhātī́r gātúṃ kr̥ṇavann uṣáso jánāya
stanzas.translation: FORTH from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hath mounted. Now verily the far-refulgent Mornings, Daughters of Heaven, bring welfare to the people.

translations.griffith: FORTH from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hath mounted. Now verily the far-refulgent Mornings, Daughters of Heaven, bring welfare to the people.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्थु॑रु चि॒त्रा उ॒षसः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑न्मि॒ता इ॑व॒ स्वर॑वोऽध्व॒रेषु॑ व्यू॑ व्र॒जस्य॒ तम॑सो॒ द्वारो॒च्छन्ती॑रव्र॒ञ्छुच॑यः पाव॒काः
stanzas.transliteration: ásthur u citrā́ uṣásaḥ purástāt- mitā́ iva sváravo 'dhvaréṣu vy ū̀ vrajásya támaso dvā́rā- -uchántīr avrañ chúcayaḥ pāvakā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: The richly-coloured Dawns have mounted eastward, like pillars planted at our sacrifices, And, flushing far, splendid and purifying, unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.

translations.griffith: The richly-coloured Dawns have mounted eastward, like pillars planted at our sacrifices, And, flushing far, splendid and purifying, unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒च्छन्ती॑र॒द्य चि॑तयन्त भो॒जान्रा॑धो॒देया॑यो॒षसो॑ म॒घोनीः॑ अ॒चि॒त्रे अ॒न्तः प॒णयः॑ सस॒न्त्वबु॑ध्यमाना॒स्तम॑सो॒ विम॑ध्ये
stanzas.transliteration: uchántīr adyá citayanta bhojā́n rādhodéyāyoṣáso maghónīḥ acitré antáḥ paṇáyaḥ sasantu- ábudhyamānās támaso vímadhye
stanzas.translation: Dispelling gloom this day the wealthy Mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures. In the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.

translations.griffith: Dispelling gloom this day the wealthy Mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures. In the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.

stanzas.sanskrit: कु॒वित्स दे॑वीः स॒नयो॒ नवो॑ वा॒ यामो॑ बभू॒यादु॑षसो वो अ॒द्य येना॒ नव॑ग्वे॒ अङ्गि॑रे॒ दश॑ग्वे स॒प्तास्ये॑ रेवती रे॒वदू॒ष
stanzas.transliteration: kuvít sá devīḥ sanáyo návo vā yā́mo babhūyā́d uṣaso vo adyá yénā návagve áṅgire dáśagve saptā́sye revatī revád ūṣá
stanzas.translation: O Goddesses, is this your car, I ask you, ancient this day, or is it new, ye Mornings, Wherewith, rich Dawns, ye seek with wealth Navagva, Daṣagva Angira, the seven-toned singer?

translations.griffith: O Goddesses, is this your car, I ask you, ancient this day, or is it new, ye Mornings, Wherewith, rich Dawns, ye seek with wealth Navagva, Daṣagva Angira, the seven-toned singer?

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यं हि दे॑वीर्ऋत॒युग्भि॒रश्वैः॑ परिप्रया॒थ भुव॑नानि स॒द्यः प्र॒बो॒धय॑न्तीरुषसः स॒सन्तं॑ द्वि॒पाच्चतु॑ष्पाच्च॒रथा॑य जी॒वम्
stanzas.transliteration: yūyáṃ hí devīr r̥tayúgbhir áśvaiḥ pariprayāthá bhúvanāni sadyáḥ prabodháyantīr uṣasaḥ sasántaṃ dvipā́c cátuṣpāc caráthāya jīvám
stanzas.translation: With horses harnessed by eternal Order, Goddesses, swiftly round the worlds ye travel, Arousing from their rest, O Dawns, the sleeping, and all that lives, man, bird, and beast, to motion.

translations.griffith: With horses harnessed by eternal Order, Goddesses, swiftly round the worlds ye travel, Arousing from their rest, O Dawns, the sleeping, and all that lives, man, bird, and beast, to motion.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्व॑ स्विदासां कत॒मा पु॑रा॒णी यया॑ वि॒धाना॑ विद॒धुर्ऋ॑भू॒णाम् शुभं॒ यच्छु॒भ्रा उ॒षस॒श्चर॑न्ति॒ न वि ज्ञा॑यन्ते स॒दृशी॑रजु॒र्याः
stanzas.transliteration: kvà svid āsāṃ katamā́ purāṇī́ yáyā vidhā́nā vidadhúr r̥bhūṇā́m śúbhaṃ yác chubhrā́ uṣásaś cáranti ná ví jñāyante sadŕ̥śīr ajuryā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Which among these is eldest, and where is she through whom they fixed the R̥ibhus' regulations? What time the splendid Dawns go forth for splendour, they are not known aparto alike, unwasting.

translations.griffith: Which among these is eldest, and where is she through whom they fixed the R̥ibhus' regulations? What time the splendid Dawns go forth for splendour, they are not known aparto alike, unwasting.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता घा॒ ता भ॒द्रा उ॒षसः॑ पु॒रासु॑रभि॒ष्टिद्यु॑म्ना ऋ॒तजा॑तसत्याः यास्वी॑जा॒नः श॑शमा॒न उ॒क्थैः स्तु॒वञ्छंस॒न्द्रवि॑णं स॒द्य आप॑
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ ghā tā́ bhadrā́ uṣásaḥ purā́sur abhiṣṭídyumnā r̥tájātasatyāḥ yā́sv ījānáḥ śaśamāná ukthaíḥ- stuváñ cháṃsan dráviṇaṃ sadyá ā́pa
stanzas.translation: Blest were these Dawns of old, shining with succour, true with the truth that springs from holy Order; With whom the toiling worshipper, by praises, hymning and lauding, soon attained to riches.

translations.griffith: Blest were these Dawns of old, shining with succour, true with the truth that springs from holy Order; With whom the toiling worshipper, by praises, hymning and lauding, soon attained to riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता आ च॑रन्ति सम॒ना पु॒रस्ता॑त्समा॒नतः॑ सम॒ना प॑प्रथा॒नाः ऋ॒तस्य॑ दे॒वीः सद॑सो बुधा॒ना गवां॒ न सर्गा॑ उ॒षसो॑ जरन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ ā́ caranti samanā́ purástāt samānátaḥ samanā́ paprathānā́ḥ r̥tásya devī́ḥ sádaso budhānā́ḥ- gávāṃ ná sárgā uṣáso jarante
stanzas.translation: Hither from eastward all at once they travel, from one place spreading in the selfsame manner. Awaking, from the seat of holy Order the Godlike Dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.

translations.griffith: Hither from eastward all at once they travel, from one place spreading in the selfsame manner. Awaking, from the seat of holy Order the Godlike Dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता इन्न्वे॒३॒॑व स॑म॒ना स॑मा॒नीरमी॑तवर्णा उ॒षस॑श्चरन्ति गूह॑न्ती॒रभ्व॒मसि॑तं॒ रुश॑द्भिः शु॒क्रास्त॒नूभिः॒ शुच॑यो रुचा॒नाः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ ín nv èvá samanā́ samānī́r ámītavarṇā uṣásaś caranti gū́hantīr ábhvam ásitaṃ rúśadbhiḥ śukrā́s tanū́bhiḥ śúcayo rucānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Thus they go forth with undiminished colours, these Mornings similar, in self-same fashion, Concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.

translations.griffith: Thus they go forth with undiminished colours, these Mornings similar, in self-same fashion, Concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.

stanzas.sanskrit: र॒यिं दि॑वो दुहितरो विभा॒तीः प्र॒जाव॑न्तं यच्छता॒स्मासु॑ देवीः स्यो॒नादा वः॑ प्रति॒बुध्य॑मानाः सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ पत॑यः स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: rayíṃ divo duhitaro vibhātī́ḥ prajā́vantaṃ yachatāsmā́su devīḥ syonā́d ā́ vaḥ pratibúdhyamānāḥ suvī́ryasya pátayaḥ syāma
stanzas.translation: O Goddesses, O Heaven's refulgent Daughters, bestow upon us wealth with store of children. As from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.

translations.griffith: O Goddesses, O Heaven's refulgent Daughters, bestow upon us wealth with store of children. As from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्वो॑ दिवो दुहितरो विभा॒तीरुप॑ ब्रुव उषसो य॒ज्ञके॑तुः व॒यं स्या॑म य॒शसो॒ जने॑षु॒ तद्द्यौश्च॑ ध॒त्तां पृ॑थि॒वी च॑ दे॒वी
stanzas.transliteration: tád vo divo duhitaro vibhātī́r úpa bruva uṣaso yajñáketuḥ vayáṃ syāma yaśáso jáneṣu tád dyaúś ca dhattā́m pr̥thivī́ ca devī́
stanzas.translation: Well-skilled in lore of sacrifice, ye Daughters of Heaven, refulgent Dawns, I thus address you. May we be glorious among the people. May Heaven vouchsafe us this, and Earth the Goddess,

translations.griffith: Well-skilled in lore of sacrifice, ye Daughters of Heaven, refulgent Dawns, I thus address you. May we be glorious among the people. May Heaven vouchsafe us this, and Earth the Goddess,

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रति॒ ष्या सू॒नरी॒ जनी॑ व्यु॒च्छन्ती॒ परि॒ स्वसुः॑ दि॒वो अ॑दर्शि दुहि॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: práti ṣyā́ sūnárī jánī vyuchántī pári svásuḥ divó adarśi duhitā́
stanzas.translation: THIS Lady, giver of delight, after her Sister shining forth, Daughter of Heaven, hath shown herself.-

translations.griffith: THIS Lady, giver of delight, after her Sister shining forth, Daughter of Heaven, hath shown herself.-

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वे॑व चि॒त्रारु॑षी मा॒ता गवा॑मृ॒ताव॑री सखा॑भूद॒श्विनो॑रु॒षाः
stanzas.transliteration: áśveva citrā́ruṣī mātā́ gávām r̥tā́varī sákhābhūd aśvínor uṣā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Unfailing, Mother of the Kine, in colour like a bright red mare, The Dawn became the Aṣvins' Friend.

translations.griffith: Unfailing, Mother of the Kine, in colour like a bright red mare, The Dawn became the Aṣvins' Friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त सखा॑स्य॒श्विनो॑रु॒त मा॒ता गवा॑मसि उ॒तोषो॒ वस्व॑ ईशिषे
stanzas.transliteration: utá sákhāsy aśvínor utá mātā́ gávām asi utóṣo vásva īśiṣe
stanzas.translation: Yea, and thou art the Aṣvins' Friend, the Mother of the Kine art thou: O Dawn thou rulest over wealth.

translations.griffith: Yea, and thou art the Aṣvins' Friend, the Mother of the Kine art thou: O Dawn thou rulest over wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: या॒व॒यद्द्वे॑षसं त्वा चिकि॒त्वित्सू॑नृतावरि प्रति॒ स्तोमै॑रभुत्स्महि
stanzas.transliteration: yāvayáddveṣasaṃ tvā cikitvít sūnr̥tāvari práti stómair abhutsmahi
stanzas.translation: Thinking of thee, O joyous One, as her who driveth hate away, We woke to meet thee with our lauds.

translations.griffith: Thinking of thee, O joyous One, as her who driveth hate away, We woke to meet thee with our lauds.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रति॑ भ॒द्रा अ॑दृक्षत॒ गवां॒ सर्गा॒ न र॒श्मयः॑ ओषा अ॑प्रा उ॒रु ज्रयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: práti bhadrā́ adr̥kṣata gávāṃ sárgā ná raśmáyaḥ óṣā́ aprā urú jráyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Our eyes behold thy blessed rays like troops of cattle loosed to feed. Dawn hath filled full the wide expanse.

translations.griffith: Our eyes behold thy blessed rays like troops of cattle loosed to feed. Dawn hath filled full the wide expanse.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒प॒प्रुषी॑ विभावरि॒ व्या॑व॒र्ज्योति॑षा॒ तमः॑ उषो॒ अनु॑ स्व॒धाम॑व
stanzas.transliteration: āpaprúṣī vibhāvari vy ā̀var jyótiṣā támaḥ úṣo ánu svadhā́m ava
stanzas.translation: When thou hast filled it, Fulgent One! thou layest bare the gloom with light. After thy nature aid us, Dawn.

translations.griffith: When thou hast filled it, Fulgent One! thou layest bare the gloom with light. After thy nature aid us, Dawn.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ द्यां त॑नोषि र॒श्मिभि॒रान्तरि॑क्षमु॒रु प्रि॒यम् उषः॑ शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ dyā́ṃ tanoṣi raśmíbhir ā́ntárikṣam urú priyám -úṣaḥ śukréṇa śocíṣā
stanzas.translation: Thou overspreadest heaven with rays, the dear wide region of mid-air. With thy bright shining lustre, Dawn.

translations.griffith: Thou overspreadest heaven with rays, the dear wide region of mid-air. With thy bright shining lustre, Dawn.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुर्वार्यं॑ म॒हद्वृ॑णी॒महे॒ असु॑रस्य॒ प्रचे॑तसः छ॒र्दिर्येन॑ दा॒शुषे॒ यच्छ॑ति॒ त्मना॒ तन्नो॑ म॒हाँ उद॑यान्दे॒वो अ॒क्तुभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tád devásya savitúr vā́ryam mahád vr̥ṇīmáhe ásurasya prácetasaḥ chardír yéna dāśúṣe yáchati tmánā tán no mahā́m̐ úd ayān devó aktúbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: OF Savitar the God, the sapient Asura, we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice, Wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defence. This with his rays the Great God hath vouchsafed to us.

translations.griffith: OF Savitar the God, the sapient Asura, we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice, Wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defence. This with his rays the Great God hath vouchsafed to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वो ध॒र्ता भुव॑नस्य प्र॒जाप॑तिः पि॒शङ्गं॑ द्रा॒पिं प्रति॑ मुञ्चते क॒विः वि॒च॒क्ष॒णः प्र॒थय॑न्नापृ॒णन्नु॒र्वजी॑जनत्सवि॒ता सु॒म्नमु॒क्थ्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: divó dhartā́ bhúvanasya prajā́patiḥ piśáṅgaṃ drāpím práti muñcate kavíḥ vicakṣaṇáḥ pratháyann āpr̥ṇánn urú- ájījanat savitā́ sumnám ukthyàm
stanzas.translation: Sustainer of the heaven, Lord of the whole world's life, the Sage, he putteth on his golden-coloured mail. Clear-sighted, spreading far, filling the spacious realm, Savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud.

translations.griffith: Sustainer of the heaven, Lord of the whole world's life, the Sage, he putteth on his golden-coloured mail. Clear-sighted, spreading far, filling the spacious realm, Savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud.

stanzas.sanskrit: आप्रा॒ रजां॑सि दि॒व्यानि॒ पार्थि॑वा॒ श्लोकं॑ दे॒वः कृ॑णुते॒ स्वाय॒ धर्म॑णे प्र बा॒हू अ॑स्राक्सवि॒ता सवी॑मनि निवे॒शय॑न्प्रसु॒वन्न॒क्तुभि॒र्जग॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́prā rájāṃsi divyā́ni pā́rthivā ślókaṃ deváḥ kr̥ṇute svā́ya dhármaṇe prá bāhū́ asrāk savitā́ sávīmani niveśáyan prasuvánn aktúbhir jágat
stanzas.translation: He hath filled full the regions of the heaven and earth: the God for his own strengthening waketh up the hymn. Savitar hath stretched out his arms to cherish life, producing with his rays and lulling all that moves.

translations.griffith: He hath filled full the regions of the heaven and earth: the God for his own strengthening waketh up the hymn. Savitar hath stretched out his arms to cherish life, producing with his rays and lulling all that moves.

stanzas.sanskrit: अदा॑भ्यो॒ भुव॑नानि प्र॒चाक॑शद्व्र॒तानि॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ताभि र॑क्षते प्रास्रा॑ग्बा॒हू भुव॑नस्य प्र॒जाभ्यो॑ धृ॒तव्र॑तो म॒हो अज्म॑स्य राजति
stanzas.transliteration: ádābhyo bhúvanāni pracā́kaśad vratā́ni deváḥ savitā́bhí rakṣate prā́srāg bāhū́ bhúvanasya prajā́bhyo dhr̥távrato mahó ájmasya rājati
stanzas.translation: Lighting all living creatures, neer to be deceived, Savitar, God, protects each holy ordinance. He hath stretched out his arms to all the folk of earth, and, with his laws observed, rules his own mighty course.

translations.griffith: Lighting all living creatures, neer to be deceived, Savitar, God, protects each holy ordinance. He hath stretched out his arms to all the folk of earth, and, with his laws observed, rules his own mighty course.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रिर॒न्तरि॑क्षं सवि॒ता म॑हित्व॒ना त्री रजां॑सि परि॒भुस्त्रीणि॑ रोच॒ना ति॒स्रो दिवः॑ पृथि॒वीस्ति॒स्र इ॑न्वति त्रि॒भिर्व्र॒तैर॒भि नो॑ रक्षति॒ त्मना॑
stanzas.transliteration: trír antárikṣaṃ savitā́ mahitvanā́ trī́ rájāṃsi paribhū́s trī́ṇi rocanā́ tisró dívaḥ pr̥thivī́s tisrá invati tribhír vrataír abhí no rakṣati tmánā
stanzas.translation: Savitar thrice surrounding with his mightiness mid-air, three regions, and the triple sphere of light, Sets the three heavens in motion and the threefold earth, and willingly protects us with his triple law.

translations.griffith: Savitar thrice surrounding with his mightiness mid-air, three regions, and the triple sphere of light, Sets the three heavens in motion and the threefold earth, and willingly protects us with his triple law.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृ॒हत्सु॑म्नः प्रसवी॒ता नि॒वेश॑नो॒ जग॑तः स्था॒तुरु॒भय॑स्य॒ यो व॒शी स नो॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता शर्म॑ यच्छत्व॒स्मे क्षया॑य त्रि॒वरू॑थ॒मंह॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: br̥hátsumnaḥ prasavītā́ nivéśano jágata sthātúr ubháyasya yó vaśī́ sá no deváḥ savitā́ śárma yachatu- asmé kṣáyāya trivárūtham áṃhasaḥ
stanzas.translation: Most gracious God, who brings to life and lulls to rest, he who controls the world, what moves not and what moves, May he vouchsafe us shelter, -Savitar the God,– for tranquil life, with triple bar against distress.

translations.griffith: Most gracious God, who brings to life and lulls to rest, he who controls the world, what moves not and what moves, May he vouchsafe us shelter, -Savitar the God,– for tranquil life, with triple bar against distress.

stanzas.sanskrit: आग॑न्दे॒व ऋ॒तुभि॒र्वर्ध॑तु॒ क्षयं॒ दधा॑तु नः सवि॒ता सु॑प्र॒जामिष॑म् स नः॑ क्ष॒पाभि॒रह॑भिश्च जिन्वतु प्र॒जाव॑न्तं र॒यिम॒स्मे समि॑न्वतु
stanzas.transliteration: ā́gan devá r̥túbhir várdhatu kṣáyaṃ dádhātu naḥ savitā́ suprajā́m íṣam sá naḥ kṣapā́bhir áhabhiś ca jinvatu prajā́vantaṃ rayím asmé sám invatu
stanzas.translation: With the year's seasons hath Savitar, God, come nigh: may he prosper our home, give food and noble sons. May he invigorate us through the days and nights, and may he send us opulence with progeny.

translations.griffith: With the year's seasons hath Savitar, God, come nigh: may he prosper our home, give food and noble sons. May he invigorate us through the days and nights, and may he send us opulence with progeny.

stanzas.sanskrit: अभू॑द्दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता वन्द्यो॒ नु न॑ इ॒दानी॒मह्न॑ उप॒वाच्यो॒ नृभिः॑ वि यो रत्ना॒ भज॑ति मान॒वेभ्यः॒ श्रेष्ठं॑ नो॒ अत्र॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ यथा॒ दध॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: ábhūd deváḥ savitā́ vándyo nú naḥ- idā́nīm áhna upavā́cyo nŕ̥bhiḥ ví yó rátnā bhájati mānavébhyaḥ śréṣṭhaṃ no átra dráviṇaṃ yáthā dádhat
stanzas.translation: Now must we praise and honour Savitar the God: at this time of the day the men must call to him, Him who distributes wealth to Manu's progeny, that he may grant us here riches most excellent.

translations.griffith: Now must we praise and honour Savitar the God: at this time of the day the men must call to him, Him who distributes wealth to Manu's progeny, that he may grant us here riches most excellent.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वेभ्यो॒ हि प्र॑थ॒मं य॒ज्ञिये॑भ्योऽमृत॒त्वं सु॒वसि॑ भा॒गमु॑त्त॒मम् आदिद्दा॒मानं॑ सवित॒र्व्यू॑र्णुषेऽनूची॒ना जी॑वि॒ता मानु॑षेभ्यः
stanzas.transliteration: devébhyo hí prathamáṃ yajñíyebhyo -amr̥tatváṃ suvási bhāgám uttamám ā́d íd dāmā́naṃ savitar vy ū̀rṇuṣe -anūcīnā́ jīvitā́ mā́nuṣebhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immor-tality: Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life.

translations.griffith: For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immor-tality: Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life.

stanzas.sanskrit: अचि॑त्ती॒ यच्च॑कृ॒मा दैव्ये॒ जने॑ दी॒नैर्दक्षैः॒ प्रभू॑ती पूरुष॒त्वता॑ दे॒वेषु॑ च सवित॒र्मानु॑षेषु च॒ त्वं नो॒ अत्र॑ सुवता॒दना॑गसः
stanzas.transliteration: ácittī yác cakr̥mā́ daívye jáne dīnaír dákṣaiḥ prábhūtī pūruṣatvátā devéṣu ca savitar mā́nuṣeṣu ca tváṃ no átra suvatād ánāgasaḥ
stanzas.translation: If we, men as we are, have sinned against the Gods through want of thought, in weakness, or through insolence, Absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin, O Savitar, alike among both Gods and men.

translations.griffith: If we, men as we are, have sinned against the Gods through want of thought, in weakness, or through insolence, Absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin, O Savitar, alike among both Gods and men.

stanzas.sanskrit: न प्र॒मिये॑ सवि॒तुर्दैव्य॑स्य॒ तद्यथा॒ विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं धारयि॒ष्यति॑ यत्पृ॑थि॒व्या वरि॑म॒न्ना स्व॑ङ्गु॒रिर्वर्ष्म॑न्दि॒वः सु॒वति॑ स॒त्यम॑स्य॒ तत्
stanzas.transliteration: ná pramíye savitúr daívyasya tád yáthā víśvam bhúvanaṃ dhārayiṣyáti yát pr̥thivyā́ várimann ā́ svaṅgurír várṣman diváḥ suváti satyám asya tát
stanzas.translation: None may impede that power of Savitar the God whereby he will maintain the universal world. What the fair-fingered God brings forth on earth's expanse or in the heightof heaven, that work of his stands sure.

translations.griffith: None may impede that power of Savitar the God whereby he will maintain the universal world. What the fair-fingered God brings forth on earth's expanse or in the heightof heaven, that work of his stands sure.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठान्बृ॒हद्भ्यः॒ पर्व॑तेभ्यः॒ क्षयाँ॑ एभ्यः सुवसि प॒स्त्या॑वतः यथा॑यथा प॒तय॑न्तो वियेमि॒र ए॒वैव त॑स्थुः सवितः स॒वाय॑ ते
stanzas.transliteration: índrajyeṣṭhān br̥hádbhyaḥ párvatebhyaḥ kṣáyām̐ ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyā̀vataḥ yáthā-yathā patáyanto viyemiré- evaívá tasthuḥ savitaḥ savā́ya te
stanzas.translation: To lofty hills thou sendest those whom Indra leads, and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these. However they may fly and draw themselves apart, still, Savitar, they stand obeying thy behest.

translations.griffith: To lofty hills thou sendest those whom Indra leads, and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these. However they may fly and draw themselves apart, still, Savitar, they stand obeying thy behest.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये ते॒ त्रिरह॑न्त्सवितः स॒वासो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ सौभ॑गमासु॒वन्ति॑ इन्द्रो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी सिन्धु॑र॒द्भिरा॑दि॒त्यैर्नो॒ अदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यंसत्
stanzas.transliteration: yé te trír áhan savitaḥ savā́so divé-dive saúbhagam āsuvánti índro dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ síndhur adbhír ādityaír no áditiḥ śárma yaṃsat
stanzas.translation: May the libations poured to thee thrice daily, day after day, O Savitar, bring us blessing. May Indra, Heaven, Earth, Sindhu with the Waters, Aditi with Âdityas, give us shelter.

translations.griffith: May the libations poured to thee thrice daily, day after day, O Savitar, bring us blessing. May Indra, Heaven, Earth, Sindhu with the Waters, Aditi with Âdityas, give us shelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: को व॑स्त्रा॒ता व॑सवः॒ को व॑रू॒ता द्यावा॑भूमी अदिते॒ त्रासी॑थां नः सही॑यसो वरुण मित्र॒ मर्ता॒त्को वो॑ऽध्व॒रे वरि॑वो धाति देवाः
stanzas.transliteration: kó vas trātā́ vasavaḥ kó varūtā́ dyā́vābhūmī adite trā́sīthāṃ naḥ sáhīyaso varuṇa mitra mártāt kó vo 'dhvaré várivo dhāti devāḥ
stanzas.translation: WHO of you, Vasus, saveth? who protecteth? O Heaven and Earth and Aditi, preserve us, Varuṇa., Mitra, from the stronger mortal. Gods, which of you at sacrifice giveth comfort?

translations.griffith: WHO of you, Vasus, saveth? who protecteth? O Heaven and Earth and Aditi, preserve us, Varuṇa., Mitra, from the stronger mortal. Gods, which of you at sacrifice giveth comfort?

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ये धामा॑नि पू॒र्व्याण्यर्चा॒न्वि यदु॒च्छान्वि॑यो॒तारो॒ अमू॑राः वि॒धा॒तारो॒ वि ते द॑धु॒रज॑स्रा ऋ॒तधी॑तयो रुरुचन्त द॒स्माः
stanzas.transliteration: prá yé dhā́māni pūrvyā́ṇy árcān ví yád uchā́n viyotā́ro ámūrāḥ vidhātā́ro ví té dadhur ájasrāḥ- r̥tádhītayo rurucanta dasmā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: They who with laud extol the ancient statutes, when they shine forth infallible dividers, Have ordered as perpetual Ordainers, and beamed as holy-thoughted WonderWorkers.

translations.griffith: They who with laud extol the ancient statutes, when they shine forth infallible dividers, Have ordered as perpetual Ordainers, and beamed as holy-thoughted WonderWorkers.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र प॒स्त्या॒३॒॑मदि॑तिं॒ सिन्धु॑म॒र्कैः स्व॒स्तिमी॑ळे स॒ख्याय॑ दे॒वीम् उ॒भे यथा॑ नो॒ अह॑नी नि॒पात॑ उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ करता॒मद॑ब्धे
stanzas.transliteration: prá pastyā̀m áditiṃ síndhum arkaíḥ svastím īḷe sakhyā́ya devī́m ubhé yáthā no áhanī nipā́taḥ- uṣā́sānáktā karatām ádabdhe
stanzas.translation: The Housewife Goddess, Aditi, and Sindhu, the Goddess Svasti I implore for friendship: And may the unobstructed Night and Morning both, day and night, provide for our protection.

translations.griffith: The Housewife Goddess, Aditi, and Sindhu, the Goddess Svasti I implore for friendship: And may the unobstructed Night and Morning both, day and night, provide for our protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: व्य॑र्य॒मा वरु॑णश्चेति॒ पन्था॑मि॒षस्पतिः॑ सुवि॒तं गा॒तुम॒ग्निः इन्द्रा॑विष्णू नृ॒वदु॒ षु स्तवा॑ना॒ शर्म॑ नो यन्त॒मम॑व॒द्वरू॑थम्
stanzas.transliteration: vy àryamā́ váruṇaś ceti pánthām iṣás pátiḥ suvitáṃ gātúm agníḥ índrāviṣṇū nr̥vád u ṣú stávānā śárma no yantam ámavad várūtham
stanzas.translation: Aryaman, Varuṇa have disclosed the pathway, Agni as Lord of Strength the road to welfare. Lauded in manly mode may Indra-Vishṇu grant us their powerful defence and shelter.

translations.griffith: Aryaman, Varuṇa have disclosed the pathway, Agni as Lord of Strength the road to welfare. Lauded in manly mode may Indra-Vishṇu grant us their powerful defence and shelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ पर्व॑तस्य म॒रुता॒मवां॑सि दे॒वस्य॑ त्रा॒तुर॑व्रि॒ भग॑स्य पात्पति॒र्जन्या॒दंह॑सो नो मि॒त्रो मि॒त्रिया॑दु॒त न॑ उरुष्येत्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ párvatasya marútām ávāṃsi devásya trātúr avri bhágasya pā́t pátir jányād áṃhaso no mitró mitríyād utá na uruṣyet
stanzas.translation: I have besought the favourof the Maruts, of Parvata, of Bhaga God who rescues. From trouble caused by man the Lord preserve us; from woe sent by his friend let Mitra save us.

translations.griffith: I have besought the favourof the Maruts, of Parvata, of Bhaga God who rescues. From trouble caused by man the Lord preserve us; from woe sent by his friend let Mitra save us.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू रो॑दसी॒ अहि॑ना बु॒ध्न्ये॑न स्तुवी॒त दे॑वी॒ अप्ये॑भिरि॒ष्टैः स॒मु॒द्रं न सं॒चर॑णे सनि॒ष्यवो॑ घ॒र्मस्व॑रसो न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ अप॑ व्रन्
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ rodasī áhinā budhnyèna stuvītá devī ápyebhir iṣṭaíḥ samudráṃ ná saṃcáraṇe saniṣyávaḥ gharmásvaraso nadyò ápa vran
stanzas.translation: Agree, through these our watery oblations, Goddesses, Heaven and Earth, with Ahibudhnya. As if to win the sea, the Gharma-heaters have opened, as they come anear, the rivers.

translations.griffith: Agree, through these our watery oblations, Goddesses, Heaven and Earth, with Ahibudhnya. As if to win the sea, the Gharma-heaters have opened, as they come anear, the rivers.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वैर्नो॑ दे॒व्यदि॑ति॒र्नि पा॑तु दे॒वस्त्रा॒ता त्रा॑यता॒मप्र॑युच्छन् न॒हि मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य धा॒सिमर्हा॑मसि प्र॒मियं॒ सान्व॒ग्नेः
stanzas.transliteration: devaír no devy áditir ní pātu devás trātā́ trāyatām áprayuchan nahí mitrásya váruṇasya dhāsím árhāmasi pramíyaṃ sā́nv agnéḥ
stanzas.translation: May Goddess Aditi with Gods defend us, save us the saviour God with care unceasing. We dare not stint the sacred food of Mitra and Varuṇa upon the back of Agni.

translations.griffith: May Goddess Aditi with Gods defend us, save us the saviour God with care unceasing. We dare not stint the sacred food of Mitra and Varuṇa upon the back of Agni.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निरी॑शे वस॒व्य॑स्या॒ग्निर्म॒हः सौभ॑गस्य तान्य॒स्मभ्यं॑ रासते
stanzas.transliteration: agnír īśe vasavyàsya- -agnír maháḥ saúbhagasya tā́ny asmábhyaṃ rāsate
stanzas.translation: Agni is Sovran Lord of wealth, Agni of great prosperity: May he bestow these gifts on us.

translations.griffith: Agni is Sovran Lord of wealth, Agni of great prosperity: May he bestow these gifts on us.

stanzas.sanskrit: उषो॑ मघो॒न्या व॑ह॒ सूनृ॑ते॒ वार्या॑ पु॒रु अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ वाजिनीवति
stanzas.transliteration: úṣo maghony ā́ vaha sū́nr̥te vā́ryā purú -asmábhyaṃ vājinīvati
stanzas.translation: Hither to us, rich pleasant Dawn, bring many things to be desired, Thou who hast ample store of wealth.

translations.griffith: Hither to us, rich pleasant Dawn, bring many things to be desired, Thou who hast ample store of wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: तत्सु नः॑ सवि॒ता भगो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा इन्द्रो॑ नो॒ राध॒सा ग॑मत्
stanzas.transliteration: tát sú naḥ savitā́ bhágo váruṇo mitró aryamā́ índro no rā́dhasā́ gamat
stanzas.translation: So then may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Indra, with bounty come to us.

translations.griffith: So then may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Indra, with bounty come to us.
