stanzas.sanskrit: म॒ही द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी इ॒ह ज्येष्ठे॑ रु॒चा भ॑वतां शु॒चय॑द्भिर॒र्कैः यत्सीं॒ वरि॑ष्ठे बृह॒ती वि॑मि॒न्वन्रु॒वद्धो॒क्षा प॑प्रथा॒नेभि॒रेवैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mahī́ dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ihá jyéṣṭhe rucā́ bhavatāṃ śucáyadbhir arkaíḥ yát sīṃ váriṣṭhe br̥hatī́ viminván ruvád dhokṣā́ paprathānébhir évaiḥ
stanzas.translation: MAY mighty Heaven and Earth, most meet for honour, be present here with light and gleaming splendours; When, fixing them apart, vast, most extensive, the Steer roars loudly in far-reaching courses.

translations.griffith: MAY mighty Heaven and Earth, most meet for honour, be present here with light and gleaming splendours; When, fixing them apart, vast, most extensive, the Steer roars loudly in far-reaching courses.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वी दे॒वेभि॑र्यज॒ते यज॑त्रै॒रमि॑नती तस्थतुरु॒क्षमा॑णे ऋ॒ताव॑री अ॒द्रुहा॑ दे॒वपु॑त्रे य॒ज्ञस्य॑ ने॒त्री शु॒चय॑द्भिर॒र्कैः
stanzas.transliteration: devī́ devébhir yajaté yájatrair áminatī tasthatur ukṣámāṇe r̥tā́varī adrúhā deváputre yajñásya netrī́ śucáyadbhir arkaíḥ
stanzas.translation: The Goddesses with Gods, holy with holy, the Two stand pouring out their rain, exhaustless: Faithful and guileless, having Gods for children, leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.

translations.griffith: The Goddesses with Gods, holy with holy, the Two stand pouring out their rain, exhaustless: Faithful and guileless, having Gods for children, leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इत्स्वपा॒ भुव॑नेष्वास॒ य इ॒मे द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ज॒जान॑ उ॒र्वी ग॑भी॒रे रज॑सी सु॒मेके॑ अवं॒शे धीरः॒ शच्या॒ समै॑रत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá ít svápā bhúvaneṣv āsa yá imé dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ jajā́na -urvī́ gabhīré rájasī suméke avaṃśé dhī́raḥ śácyā sám airat
stanzas.translation: Sure in the worlds he was a skilful Craftsman, he who produced these Twain the Earth and Heaven. Wise, with his power he brought both realms, together spacious and deep, wellfashioned, unsupported.

translations.griffith: Sure in the worlds he was a skilful Craftsman, he who produced these Twain the Earth and Heaven. Wise, with his power he brought both realms, together spacious and deep, wellfashioned, unsupported.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू रो॑दसी बृ॒हद्भि॑र्नो॒ वरू॑थैः॒ पत्नी॑वद्भिरि॒षय॑न्ती स॒जोषाः॑ उ॒रू॒ची विश्वे॑ यज॒ते नि पा॑तं धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ rodasī br̥hádbhir no várūthaiḥ pátnīvadbhir iṣáyantī sajóṣāḥ urūcī́ víśve yajaté ní pātaṃ dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: O Heaven and Earth, with one accord promoting, with high protection as of Queens, our welfare, Far-reaching, universal, holy, guard us. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

translations.griffith: O Heaven and Earth, with one accord promoting, with high protection as of Queens, our welfare, Far-reaching, universal, holy, guard us. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वां॒ महि॒ द्यवी॑ अ॒भ्युप॑स्तुतिं भरामहे शुची॒ उप॒ प्रश॑स्तये
stanzas.transliteration: prá vām máhi dyávī abhí- úpastutim bharāmahe śúcī úpa práśastaye
stanzas.translation: To both of you, O Heaven and Earth, we bring our lofty song of praise, Pure Ones! to glorify you both.

translations.griffith: To both of you, O Heaven and Earth, we bring our lofty song of praise, Pure Ones! to glorify you both.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒ना॒ने त॒न्वा॑ मि॒थः स्वेन॒ दक्षे॑ण राजथः ऊ॒ह्याथे॑ स॒नादृ॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: punāné tanvā̀ mitháḥ svéna dákṣeṇa rājathaḥ ūhyā́the sanā́d r̥tám
stanzas.translation: Ye sanctify each other's form, by your own proper might ye rule, And from of old observe the Law.

translations.griffith: Ye sanctify each other's form, by your own proper might ye rule, And from of old observe the Law.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒ही मि॒त्रस्य॑ साधथ॒स्तर॑न्ती॒ पिप्र॑ती ऋ॒तम् परि॑ य॒ज्ञं नि षे॑दथुः
stanzas.transliteration: mahī́ mitrásya sādhathas tárantī pípratī r̥tám pári yajñáṃ ní ṣedathuḥ
stanzas.translation: Furthering and fulfilling, ye, O Mighty, perfect Mitra's Law. Ye sit around our sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Furthering and fulfilling, ye, O Mighty, perfect Mitra's Law. Ye sit around our sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्षेत्र॑स्य॒ पति॑ना व॒यं हि॒तेने॑व जयामसि गामश्वं॑ पोषयि॒त्न्वा स नो॑ मृळाती॒दृशे॑
stanzas.transliteration: kṣétrasya pátinā vayáṃ hiténeva jayāmasi gā́m áśvam poṣayitnv~ā́ sá no mr̥ḷātīdŕ̥śe
stanzas.translation: WE through the Master of the Field, even as through a friend, obtain What nourisheth our kine and steeds. In such may he be good to us.

translations.griffith: WE through the Master of the Field, even as through a friend, obtain What nourisheth our kine and steeds. In such may he be good to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्षेत्र॑स्य पते॒ मधु॑मन्तमू॒र्मिं धे॒नुरि॑व॒ पयो॑ अ॒स्मासु॑ धुक्ष्व म॒धु॒श्चुतं॑ घृ॒तमि॑व॒ सुपू॑तमृ॒तस्य॑ नः॒ पत॑यो मृळयन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: kṣétrasya pate mádhumantam ūrmíṃ dhenúr iva páyo asmā́su dhukṣva madhuścútaṃ ghr̥tám iva súpūtam r̥tásya naḥ pátayo mr̥ḷayantu
stanzas.translation: As the cow yieldeth milk, pour for us freely, Lord of the Field, the wave that beareth sweetness, Distilling meath, well-purified like butter, and let the. Lords of holy Law be gracious.

translations.griffith: As the cow yieldeth milk, pour for us freely, Lord of the Field, the wave that beareth sweetness, Distilling meath, well-purified like butter, and let the. Lords of holy Law be gracious.

stanzas.sanskrit: मधु॑मती॒रोष॑धी॒र्द्याव॒ आपो॒ मधु॑मन्नो भवत्व॒न्तरि॑क्षम् क्षेत्र॑स्य॒ पति॒र्मधु॑मान्नो अ॒स्त्वरि॑ष्यन्तो॒ अन्वे॑नं चरेम
stanzas.transliteration: mádhumatīr óṣadhīr dyā́va ā́po mádhuman no bhavatv antárikṣam kṣétrasya pátir mádhumān no astu- áriṣyanto ánv enaṃ carema
stanzas.translation: Sweet be the plants for us. the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region. May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.

translations.griffith: Sweet be the plants for us. the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region. May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं वा॒हाः शु॒नं नरः॑ शु॒नं कृ॑षतु॒ लाङ्ग॑लम् शु॒नं व॑र॒त्रा ब॑ध्यन्तां शु॒नमष्ट्रा॒मुदि॑ङ्गय
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ vāhā́ḥ śunáṃ náraḥ śunáṃ kr̥ṣatu lā́ṅgalam śunáṃ varatrā́ badhyantāṃ śunám áṣṭrām úd iṅgaya
stanzas.translation: Happily work our steers and men, may the plough furrow happily. Happily be the traces bound; happily may he ply the goad.

translations.griffith: Happily work our steers and men, may the plough furrow happily. Happily be the traces bound; happily may he ply the goad.

stanzas.sanskrit: शुना॑सीरावि॒मां वाचं॑ जुषेथां॒ यद्दि॒वि च॒क्रथुः॒ पयः॑ तेने॒मामुप॑ सिञ्चतम्
stanzas.transliteration: śúnāsīrāv imā́ṃ vā́caṃ juṣethāṃ yád diví cakráthuḥ páyaḥ ténemā́m úpa siñcatam
stanzas.translation: Ṣuna and Sîra, welcome ye this laud, and with the milk which ye have made in heaven Bedew ye both this earth of ours.

translations.griffith: Ṣuna and Sîra, welcome ye this laud, and with the milk which ye have made in heaven Bedew ye both this earth of ours.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वाची॑ सुभगे भव॒ सीते॒ वन्दा॑महे त्वा यथा॑ नः सु॒भगास॑सि॒ यथा॑ नः सु॒फलास॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: arvā́cī subhage bhava sī́te vándāmahe tvā yáthā naḥ subhágā́sasi yáthā naḥ suphálā́sasi
stanzas.translation: Auspicious Sita, come thou near: we venerate and worship thee That thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.

translations.griffith: Auspicious Sita, come thou near: we venerate and worship thee That thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रः॒ सीतां॒ नि गृ॑ह्णातु॒ तां पू॒षानु॑ यच्छतु सा नः॒ पय॑स्वती दुहा॒मुत्त॑रामुत्तरां॒ समा॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: índraḥ sī́tāṃ ní gr̥hṇātu tā́m pūṣā́nu yachatu sā́ naḥ páyasvatī duhām úttarām-uttarāṃ sámām
stanzas.translation: May Indra press the furrow down, may Pûshan guide its course aright. May she, as rich in milk, be drained for us through each succeeding year.

translations.griffith: May Indra press the furrow down, may Pûshan guide its course aright. May she, as rich in milk, be drained for us through each succeeding year.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं नः॒ फाला॒ वि कृ॑षन्तु॒ भूमिं॑ शु॒नं की॒नाशा॑ अ॒भि य॑न्तु वा॒हैः शु॒नं प॒र्जन्यो॒ मधु॑ना॒ पयो॑भिः॒ शुना॑सीरा शु॒नम॒स्मासु॑ धत्तम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ naḥ phā́lā ví kr̥ṣantu bhū́miṃ śunáṃ kīnā́śā abhí yantu vāhaíḥ śunám parjányo mádhunā páyobhiḥ śúnāsīrā śunám asmā́su dhattam
stanzas.translation: Happily let the shares turn up the ploughland, happily go the ploughers with the oxen. With meath and milk Parjanya make us happy. Grant us prosperity, Ṣuna and Sîra.

translations.griffith: Happily let the shares turn up the ploughland, happily go the ploughers with the oxen. With meath and milk Parjanya make us happy. Grant us prosperity, Ṣuna and Sîra.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मु॒द्रादू॒र्मिर्मधु॑माँ॒ उदा॑र॒दुपां॒शुना॒ सम॑मृत॒त्वमा॑नट् घृ॒तस्य॒ नाम॒ गुह्यं॒ यदस्ति॑ जि॒ह्वा दे॒वाना॑म॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: samudrā́d ūrmír mádhumām̐ úd ārad úpāṃśúnā sám amr̥tatvám ānaṭ ghr̥tásya nā́ma gúhyaṃ yád ásti jihvā́ devā́nām amŕ̥tasya nā́bhiḥ
stanzas.translation: FORTH from the ocean sprang the wave of sweetness: together with the stalk it turned to Amrit, That which is holy oil's mysterious title: but the Gods' tongue is truly Amrit's centre.

translations.griffith: FORTH from the ocean sprang the wave of sweetness: together with the stalk it turned to Amrit, That which is holy oil's mysterious title: but the Gods' tongue is truly Amrit's centre.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं नाम॒ प्र ब्र॑वामा घृ॒तस्या॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे धा॑रयामा॒ नमो॑भिः उप॑ ब्र॒ह्मा शृ॑णवच्छ॒स्यमा॑नं॒ चतुः॑शृङ्गोऽवमीद्गौ॒र ए॒तत्
stanzas.transliteration: vayáṃ nā́ma prá bravāmā ghr̥tásya- -asmín yajñé dhārayāmā námobhiḥ úpa brahmā́ śr̥ṇavac chasyámānaṃ cátuḥśr̥ṅgo 'vamīd gaurá etát
stanzas.translation: Let us declare aloud the name of Ghr̥ita, and at this sacrifice hold it up with homage. So let the Brahman hear the praise we utter. This hath the four-horned Buffalo emitted.

translations.griffith: Let us declare aloud the name of Ghr̥ita, and at this sacrifice hold it up with homage. So let the Brahman hear the praise we utter. This hath the four-horned Buffalo emitted.

stanzas.sanskrit: च॒त्वारि॒ शृङ्गा॒ त्रयो॑ अस्य॒ पादा॒ द्वे शी॒र्षे स॒प्त हस्ता॑सो अस्य त्रिधा॑ ब॒द्धो वृ॑ष॒भो रो॑रवीति म॒हो दे॒वो मर्त्याँ॒ आ वि॑वेश
stanzas.transliteration: catvā́ri śŕ̥ṅgā tráyo asya pā́dāḥ- dvé śīrṣé saptá hástāso asya trídhā baddhó vr̥ṣabhó roravīti mahó devó mártyām̐ ā́ viveśa
stanzas.translation: Four are his horns, three are the feet that bear him; his heads are two, his hands are seven in number. Bound with a triple bond the Steer roars loudly: the mighty God hath entered in to mortals.

translations.griffith: Four are his horns, three are the feet that bear him; his heads are two, his hands are seven in number. Bound with a triple bond the Steer roars loudly: the mighty God hath entered in to mortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रिधा॑ हि॒तं प॒णिभि॑र्गु॒ह्यमा॑नं॒ गवि॑ दे॒वासो॑ घृ॒तमन्व॑विन्दन् इन्द्र॒ एकं॒ सूर्य॒ एकं॑ जजान वे॒नादेकं॑ स्व॒धया॒ निष्ट॑तक्षुः
stanzas.transliteration: trídhā hitám paṇíbhir guhyámānaṃ gávi devā́so ghr̥tám ánv avindan índra ékaṃ sū́rya ékaṃ jajāna venā́d ékaṃ svadháyā níṣ ṭatakṣuḥ
stanzas.translation: That oil in triple shape the Gods discovered laid down within the Cow, concealed by Paṇis. Indra produced one shape, Sûrya another: by their own power they formed the third from Vena.

translations.griffith: That oil in triple shape the Gods discovered laid down within the Cow, concealed by Paṇis. Indra produced one shape, Sûrya another: by their own power they formed the third from Vena.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ता अ॑र्षन्ति॒ हृद्या॑त्समु॒द्राच्छ॒तव्र॑जा रि॒पुणा॒ नाव॒चक्षे॑ घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॑ अ॒भि चा॑कशीमि हिर॒ण्ययो॑ वेत॒सो मध्य॑ आसाम्
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ arṣanti hŕ̥dyāt samudrā́c -śatávrajā ripúṇā nā́vacákṣe ghr̥tásya dhā́rā abhí cākaśīmi hiraṇyáyo vetasó mádhya āsām
stanzas.translation: From inmost reservoir in countless channels flow down these rivers which the foe beholds not. I look upon the streams of oil descending, and lo! the Golden Reed is there among them.

translations.griffith: From inmost reservoir in countless channels flow down these rivers which the foe beholds not. I look upon the streams of oil descending, and lo! the Golden Reed is there among them.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒म्यक्स्र॑वन्ति स॒रितो॒ न धेना॑ अ॒न्तर्हृ॒दा मन॑सा पू॒यमा॑नाः ए॒ते अ॑र्षन्त्यू॒र्मयो॑ घृ॒तस्य॑ मृ॒गा इ॑व क्षिप॒णोरीष॑माणाः
stanzas.transliteration: samyák sravanti saríto ná dhénāḥ- antár hr̥dā́ mánasā pūyámānāḥ eté arṣanty ūrmáyo ghr̥tásya mr̥gā́ iva kṣipaṇór ī́ṣamāṇāḥ
stanzas.translation: Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit. The streams of holy oil pour swiftly downward like the wild beasts that fly before the bowman.

translations.griffith: Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit. The streams of holy oil pour swiftly downward like the wild beasts that fly before the bowman.

stanzas.sanskrit: सिन्धो॑रिव प्राध्व॒ने शू॑घ॒नासो॒ वात॑प्रमियः पतयन्ति य॒ह्वाः घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॑ अरु॒षो न वा॒जी काष्ठा॑ भि॒न्दन्नू॒र्मिभिः॒ पिन्व॑मानः
stanzas.transliteration: síndhor iva prādhvané śūghanā́so vā́tapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvā́ḥ ghr̥tásya dhā́rā aruṣó ná vājī́ kā́ṣṭhā bhindánn ūrmíbhiḥ pínvamānaḥ
stanzas.translation: As rushing down the rapids of a river, flow swifter than the wind the vigorous currents, The streams of oil in swelling fluctuation like a red courser bursting through the fences.

translations.griffith: As rushing down the rapids of a river, flow swifter than the wind the vigorous currents, The streams of oil in swelling fluctuation like a red courser bursting through the fences.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि प्र॑वन्त॒ सम॑नेव॒ योषाः॑ कल्या॒ण्य१॒॑ः स्मय॑मानासो अ॒ग्निम् घृ॒तस्य॒ धाराः॑ स॒मिधो॑ नसन्त॒ ता जु॑षा॒णो ह॑र्यति जा॒तवे॑दाः
stanzas.transliteration: abhí pravanta sámaneva yóṣāḥ kalyāṇyàḥ smáyamānāso agním ghr̥tásya dhā́rāḥ samídho nasanta tā́ juṣāṇó haryati jātávedāḥ
stanzas.translation: Like women at a gathering fair to look on and gently smiling, they incline to Agni. The streams of holy oil attain the fuel, and Jâtavedas joyfully receives them.

translations.griffith: Like women at a gathering fair to look on and gently smiling, they incline to Agni. The streams of holy oil attain the fuel, and Jâtavedas joyfully receives them.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒न्या॑ इव वह॒तुमेत॒वा उ॑ अ॒ञ्ज्य॑ञ्जा॒ना अ॒भि चा॑कशीमि यत्र॒ सोमः॑ सू॒यते॒ यत्र॑ य॒ज्ञो घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॑ अ॒भि तत्प॑वन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: kanyā̀ iva vahatúm étavā́~u añjy àñjānā́ abhí cākaśīmi yátra sómaḥ sūyáte yátra yajñó ghr̥tásya dhā́rā abhí tát pavante
stanzas.translation: As maidens dock themselves with gay adornment to join the bridal feast, I now behold them. Where Soma flows and sacrifice is ready, thither the streams of holy oil are running.

translations.griffith: As maidens dock themselves with gay adornment to join the bridal feast, I now behold them. Where Soma flows and sacrifice is ready, thither the streams of holy oil are running.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भ्य॑र्षत सुष्टु॒तिं गव्य॑मा॒जिम॒स्मासु॑ भ॒द्रा द्रवि॑णानि धत्त इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं न॑यत दे॒वता॑ नो घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॒ मधु॑मत्पवन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: abhy àrṣata suṣṭutíṃ gávyam ājím asmā́su bhadrā́ dráviṇāni dhatta imáṃ yajñáṃ nayata devátā no ghr̥tásya dhā́rā mádhumat pavante
stanzas.translation: Send to our eulogy a herd of cattle bestow upon us excellent possessions. Bear to the Gods the sacrifice we offer the streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness.

translations.griffith: Send to our eulogy a herd of cattle bestow upon us excellent possessions. Bear to the Gods the sacrifice we offer the streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness.

stanzas.sanskrit: धाम॑न्ते॒ विश्वं॒ भुव॑न॒मधि॑ श्रि॒तम॒न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे हृ॒द्य१॒॑न्तरायु॑षि अ॒पामनी॑के समि॒थे य आभृ॑त॒स्तम॑श्याम॒ मधु॑मन्तं त ऊ॒र्मिम्
stanzas.transliteration: dhā́man te víśvam bhúvanam ádhi śritám antáḥ samudré hr̥dy àntár ā́yuṣi apā́m ánīke samithé yá ā́bhr̥tas tám aśyāma mádhumantaṃ ta ūrmím
stanzas.translation: The universe depends upon thy power and might within the sea, within the heart, within all life. May we attain that sweetly-flavoured wave of thine, brought, at its gathering, o'er the surfaceof the floods.

translations.griffith: The universe depends upon thy power and might within the sea, within the heart, within all life. May we attain that sweetly-flavoured wave of thine, brought, at its gathering, o'er the surfaceof the floods.
